Hebrew: <big>בְּ</big>רֵאשִׁ֖ית בָּרָ֣א אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֵ֥ת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֵ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: When God began to create heaven and earth—
Transliteration: <big>ve</big>reshiyt vara Elohim et hashamayiim veet haarets

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֗רֶץ הָיְתָ֥ה תֹ֙הוּ֙ וָבֹ֔הוּ וְחֹ֖שֶׁךְ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י תְה֑וֹם וְר֣וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים מְרַחֶ֖פֶת עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: the earth being unformed and void, with darkness over the surface of the deep and a wind from God sweeping over the water—
Transliteration: vehaarets hayetah tohu vavohu vechoshekhe al-feney tehvom verucha Elohim merachefet al-feney hamayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֖ים יְהִ֣י א֑וֹר וַֽיְהִי־אֽוֹר׃
Translated: God said, “Let there be light”; and there was light.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim yehiy vor vayehiy-vor

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧רְא אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָא֖וֹר כִּי־ט֑וֹב וַיַּבְדֵּ֣ל אֱלֹהִ֔ים בֵּ֥ין הָא֖וֹר וּבֵ֥ין הַחֹֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated: God saw that the light was good, and God separated the light from the darkness.
Transliteration: vayare Elohim et-havor khiy-tvov vayavedel Elohim veyn havor uveyn hachoshekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ לָאוֹר֙ י֔וֹם וְלַחֹ֖שֶׁךְ קָ֣רָא לָ֑יְלָה וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: God called the light Day and called the darkness Night. And there was evening and there was morning, a first day.
Transliteration: vayikera Elohim lavor yvom velachoshekhe kara layelah vayehiy-erev vayehiy-voker yvom echad {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים יְהִ֥י רָקִ֖יעַ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַמָּ֑יִם וִיהִ֣י מַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין מַ֖יִם לָמָֽיִם׃
Translated: God said, “Let there be an expanse in the midst of the water, that it may separate water from water.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim yehiy rakiya vetvokhe hamayiim viyhiy mavediyl veyn mayiim lamayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִים֮ אֶת־הָרָקִ֒יעַ֒ וַיַּבְדֵּ֗ל בֵּ֤ין הַמַּ֙יִם֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ מִתַּ֣חַת לָרָקִ֔יעַ וּבֵ֣ין הַמַּ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר מֵעַ֣ל לָרָקִ֑יעַ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
Translated: God made the expanse, and it separated the water which was below the expanse from the water which was above the expanse. And it was so.
Transliteration: vayaash Elohim et-harakiya vayavedel veyn hamayiim asher mitachat larakiya uveyn hamayiim asher meal larakiya vayehiy-khen

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים לָֽרָקִ֖יעַ שָׁמָ֑יִם וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם שֵׁנִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: God called the expanse Sky. And there was evening and there was morning, a second day.
Transliteration: vayikera Elohim larakiya shamayiim vayehiy-erev vayehiy-voker yvom sheniy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִקָּו֨וּ הַמַּ֜יִם מִתַּ֤חַת הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ אֶל־מָק֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד וְתֵרָאֶ֖ה הַיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
Translated: God said, “Let the water below the sky be gathered into one area, that the dry land may appear.” And it was so.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim yikavu hamayiim mitachat hashamayiim el-makvom echad veteraeh hayavashah vayehiy-khen

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> לַיַּבָּשָׁה֙ אֶ֔רֶץ וּלְמִקְוֵ֥ה הַמַּ֖יִם קָרָ֣א יַמִּ֑ים וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
Translated: God called the dry land Earth and called the gathering of waters Seas. And God saw that this was good.
Transliteration: vayikera Elohim <small></small> layavashah erets ulemikeveh hamayiim kara yamiym vayare Elohim khiy-tvov

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים תַּֽדְשֵׁ֤א הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ דֶּ֗שֶׁא עֵ֚שֶׂב מַזְרִ֣יעַ זֶ֔רַע עֵ֣ץ פְּרִ֞י עֹ֤שֶׂה פְּרִי֙ לְמִינ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר זַרְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
Translated: And God said, “Let the earth sprout vegetation: seed-bearing plants, fruit trees of every kind on earth that bear fruit with the seed in it.” And it was so.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim tadeshe haarets deshe eshev mazeriya zera ets feriy osheh feriy lemiynvo asher zarevo-vvo al-haarets vayehiy-khen

Hebrew: וַתּוֹצֵ֨א הָאָ֜רֶץ דֶּ֠שֶׁא עֵ֣שֶׂב מַזְרִ֤יעַ זֶ֙רַע֙ לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וְעֵ֧ץ עֹֽשֶׂה־פְּרִ֛י אֲשֶׁ֥ר זַרְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
Translated: The earth brought forth vegetation: seed-bearing plants of every kind, and trees of every kind bearing fruit with the seed in it. And God saw that this was good.
Transliteration: vatvotse haarets deshe eshev mazeriya zera lemiynehu veets osheh-feriy asher zarevo-vvo lemiynehu vayare Elohim khiy-tvov

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם שְׁלִישִֽׁי׃ {פ}
Translated: And there was evening and there was morning, a third day.
Transliteration: vayehiy-erev vayehiy-voker yvom sheliyshiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים יְהִ֤י מְאֹרֹת֙ בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם לְהַבְדִּ֕יל בֵּ֥ין הַיּ֖וֹם וּבֵ֣ין הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְהָי֤וּ לְאֹתֹת֙ וּלְמ֣וֹעֲדִ֔ים וּלְיָמִ֖ים וְשָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to separate day from night; they shall serve as signs for the set times—the days and the years;
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim yehiy meorot virekiya hashamayiim lehavediyl veyn hayyvom uveyn halayelah vehayu leotot ulemvoadiym uleyamiym veshaniym

Hebrew: וְהָי֤וּ לִמְאוֹרֹת֙ בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם לְהָאִ֖יר עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
Translated: and they shall serve as lights in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth.” And it was so.
Transliteration: vehayu limevorot virekiya hashamayiim lehaiyr al-haarets vayehiy-khen

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־שְׁנֵ֥י הַמְּאֹרֹ֖ת הַגְּדֹלִ֑ים אֶת־הַמָּא֤וֹר הַגָּדֹל֙ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת הַיּ֔וֹם וְאֶת־הַמָּא֤וֹר הַקָּטֹן֙ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת הַלַּ֔יְלָה וְאֵ֖ת הַכּוֹכָבִֽים׃
Translated: God made the two great lights, the greater light to dominate the day and the lesser light to dominate the night, and the stars.
Transliteration: vayaash Elohim et-sheney hameorot hagedoliym et-hamavor hagadol lememeshelet hayyvom veet-hamavor hakaton lememeshelet halayelah veet hakhvokhaviym

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בִּרְקִ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם לְהָאִ֖יר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And God set them in the expanse of the sky to shine upon the earth,
Transliteration: vayiten otam Elohim virekiya hashamayiim lehaiyr al-haarets

Hebrew: וְלִמְשֹׁל֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם וּבַלַּ֔יְלָה וּֽלְהַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין הָא֖וֹר וּבֵ֣ין הַחֹ֑שֶׁךְ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
Translated: to dominate the day and the night, and to separate light from darkness. And God saw that this was good.
Transliteration: velimeshol vayyvom uvalayelah ulehavediyl veyn havor uveyn hachoshekhe vayare Elohim khiy-tvov

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם רְבִיעִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: And there was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
Transliteration: vayehiy-erev vayehiy-voker yvom reviyiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים יִשְׁרְצ֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם שֶׁ֖רֶץ נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֑ה וְעוֹף֙ יְעוֹפֵ֣ף עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ עַל־פְּנֵ֖י רְקִ֥יעַ הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: God said, “Let the waters bring forth swarms of living creatures, and birds that fly above the earth across the expanse of the sky.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim yisheretsu hamayiim sherets nefesh chayah vevof yevofef al-haarets al-feney rekiya hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרָ֣א אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־הַתַּנִּינִ֖ם הַגְּדֹלִ֑ים וְאֵ֣ת כׇּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּ֣ה <small>׀</small> הָֽרֹמֶ֡שֶׂת אֲשֶׁר֩ שָׁרְצ֨וּ הַמַּ֜יִם לְמִֽינֵהֶ֗ם וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־ע֤וֹף כָּנָף֙ לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
Translated: God created the great sea monsters, and all the living creatures of every kind that creep, which the waters brought forth in swarms, and all the winged birds of every kind. And God saw that this was good.
Transliteration: vayivera Elohim et-hataniynim hagedoliym veet khׇl-nefesh hachayah <small></small> haromeshet asher sharetsu hamayiim lemiynehem veet khׇl-vof khanaf lemiynehu vayare Elohim khiy-tvov

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ אֹתָ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר פְּר֣וּ וּרְב֗וּ וּמִלְא֤וּ אֶת־הַמַּ֙יִם֙ בַּיַּמִּ֔ים וְהָע֖וֹף יִ֥רֶב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: God blessed them, saying, “Be fertile and increase, fill the waters in the seas, and let the birds increase on the earth.”
Transliteration: vayevarekhe otam Elohim lemor feru urevu umileu et-hamayiim vayamiym vehavof yirev vaarets

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם חֲמִישִֽׁי׃ {פ}
Translated: And there was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.
Transliteration: vayehiy-erev vayehiy-voker yvom chamiyshiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים תּוֹצֵ֨א הָאָ֜רֶץ נֶ֤פֶשׁ חַיָּה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ בְּהֵמָ֥ה וָרֶ֛מֶשׂ וְחַֽיְתוֹ־אֶ֖רֶץ לְמִינָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
Translated: God said, “Let the earth bring forth every kind of living creature: cattle, creeping things, and wild beasts of every kind.” And it was so.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim tvotse haarets nefesh chayah lemiynah vehemah varemesh vechayetvo-erets lemiynah vayehiy-khen

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ אֱלֹהִים֩ אֶת־חַיַּ֨ת הָאָ֜רֶץ לְמִינָ֗הּ וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־רֶ֥מֶשׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֖ה לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וַיַּ֥רְא אֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
Translated: God made wild beasts of every kind and cattle of every kind, and all kinds of creeping things of the earth. And God saw that this was good.
Transliteration: vayaash Elohim et-chayat haarets lemiynah veet-havehemah lemiynah veet khׇl-remesh haadamah lemiynehu vayare Elohim khiy-tvov

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֔ים נַֽעֲשֶׂ֥ה אָדָ֛ם בְּצַלְמֵ֖נוּ כִּדְמוּתֵ֑נוּ וְיִרְדּוּ֩ בִדְגַ֨ת הַיָּ֜ם וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וּבַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּבְכׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּבְכׇל־הָרֶ֖מֶשׂ הָֽרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And God said, “Let us make humankind in our image, after our likeness. They shall rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the cattle, the whole earth, and all the creeping things that creep on earth.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim naasheh adam vetsalemenu khidemutenu veyiredu videgat hayam uvevof hashamayiim uvavehemah uvekhׇl-haarets uvekhׇl-haremesh haromesh al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> אֶת־הָֽאָדָם֙ בְּצַלְמ֔וֹ בְּצֶ֥לֶם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בָּרָ֣א אֹת֑וֹ זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה בָּרָ֥א אֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
And God created humankind in the divine image,
creating it in the image of God—
creating them male and female.
Transliteration: vayivera Elohim <small></small> et-haadam vetsalemvo vetselem Elohim vara otvo zakhar unekevah vara otam

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָם֮ אֱלֹהִים֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לָהֶ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֛וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכִבְשֻׁ֑הָ וּרְד֞וּ בִּדְגַ֤ת הַיָּם֙ וּבְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּבְכׇל־חַיָּ֖ה הָֽרֹמֶ֥שֶׂת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: God blessed them and God said to them, “Be fertile and increase, fill the earth and master it; and rule the fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, and all the living things that creep on earth.”
Transliteration: vayevarekhe otam Elohim vayomer lahem Elohim feru urevu umileu et-haarets vekhiveshuha uredu videgat hayam uvevof hashamayiim uvekhׇl-chayah haromeshet al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים הִנֵּה֩ נָתַ֨תִּי לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב ׀ זֹרֵ֣עַ זֶ֗רַע אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָעֵ֛ץ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ פְרִי־עֵ֖ץ זֹרֵ֣עַ זָ֑רַע לָכֶ֥ם יִֽהְיֶ֖ה לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated: God said, “See, I give you every seed-bearing plant that is upon all the earth, and every tree that has seed-bearing fruit; they shall be yours for food.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim hineh natatiy lakhem et-khׇl-eshev zorea zera asher al-feney khׇl-haarets veet-khׇl-haets asher-vvo feriy-ets zorea zara lakhem yiheyeh leׇkhelah

Hebrew: וּֽלְכׇל־חַיַּ֣ת הָ֠אָ֠רֶץ וּלְכׇל־ע֨וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם וּלְכֹ֣ל ׀ רוֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֔ה אֶת־כׇּל־יֶ֥רֶק עֵ֖שֶׂב לְאׇכְלָ֑ה וַֽיְהִי־כֵֽן׃
Translated: And to all the animals on land, to all the birds of the sky, and to everything that creeps on earth, in which there is the breath of life, [I give] all the green plants for food.” And it was so.
Transliteration: ulekhׇl-chayat haarets ulekhׇl-vof hashamayiim ulekhol rvomesh al-haarets asher-vvo nefesh chayah et-khׇl-yerek eshev leׇkhelah vayehiy-khen

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וְהִנֵּה־ט֖וֹב מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי־עֶ֥רֶב וַֽיְהִי־בֹ֖קֶר י֥וֹם הַשִּׁשִּֽׁי׃ {פ}
Translated: And God saw all that had been made, and found it very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
Transliteration: vayare Elohim et-khׇl-asher ashah vehineh-tvov meod vayehiy-erev vayehiy-voker yvom hashishiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיְכֻלּ֛וּ הַשָּׁמַ֥יִם וְהָאָ֖רֶץ וְכׇל־צְבָאָֽם׃
Translated: The heaven and the earth were finished, and all their array.
Transliteration: vayekhulu hashamayiim vehaarets vekhׇl-tsevaam

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֤ל אֱלֹהִים֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מְלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה וַיִּשְׁבֹּת֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִכׇּל־מְלַאכְתּ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: On the seventh day God finished the work that had been undertaken: [God] ceased on the seventh day from doing any of the work.
Transliteration: vayekhal Elohim vayyvom hasheviyiy melakhetvo asher ashah vayishevot vayyvom hasheviyiy mikhׇl-melakhetvo asher ashah

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֤רֶךְ אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־י֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י וַיְקַדֵּ֖שׁ אֹת֑וֹ כִּ֣י ב֤וֹ שָׁבַת֙ מִכׇּל־מְלַאכְתּ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־בָּרָ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: And God blessed the seventh day and declared it holy—having ceased on it from all the work of creation that God had done.
Transliteration: vayevarekhe Elohim et-yvom hasheviyiy vayekadesh otvo khiy vvo shavat mikhׇl-melakhetvo asher-vara Elohim laashvot {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה תוֹלְד֧וֹת הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם וְהָאָ֖רֶץ בְּ<small>הִ</small>בָּֽרְאָ֑ם בְּי֗וֹם עֲשׂ֛וֹת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶ֥רֶץ וְשָׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: Such is the story of heaven and earth when they were created. When God יהוה made earth and heaven—
Transliteration: eleh tvoledvot hashamayiim vehaarets ve<small>hi</small>vaream veyvom ashvot yehovah Elohim erets veshamayiim

Hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ שִׂ֣יחַ הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה טֶ֚רֶם יִֽהְיֶ֣ה בָאָ֔רֶץ וְכׇל־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה טֶ֣רֶם יִצְמָ֑ח כִּי֩ לֹ֨א הִמְטִ֜יר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאָדָ֣ם אַ֔יִן לַֽעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: when no shrub of the field was yet on earth and no grasses of the field had yet sprouted, because God יהוה had not sent rain upon the earth and there were no human beings to till the soil,
Transliteration: vekhol shiycha hashadeh terem yiheyeh vaarets vekhׇl-eshev hashadeh terem yitsemach khiy lo himetiyr yehovah Elohim al-haarets veadam ayiin laavod et-haadamah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖ד יַֽעֲלֶ֣ה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁקָ֖ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: but a flow would well up from the ground and water the whole surface of the earth—
Transliteration: veed yaaleh min-haarets vehishekah et-khׇl-feney haadamah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩יצֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֗ם עָפָר֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה וַיִּפַּ֥ח בְּאַפָּ֖יו נִשְׁמַ֣ת חַיִּ֑ים וַיְהִ֥י הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְנֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּֽה׃
Translated: God יהוה formed the Human from the soil’s humus, blowing into his nostrils the breath of life: the Human became a living being.
Transliteration: vayiytser yehovah Elohim et-haadam afar min-haadamah vayifach veafayv nishemat chayiym vayehiy haadam lenefesh chayah

Hebrew: וַיִּטַּ֞ע יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים גַּן־בְּעֵ֖דֶן מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַיָּ֣שֶׂם שָׁ֔ם אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָצָֽר׃
Translated: God יהוה planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and placed there the Human who had been fashioned.
Transliteration: vayita yehovah Elohim gan-veeden mikedem vayashem sham et-haadam asher yatsar

Hebrew: וַיַּצְמַ֞ח יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה כׇּל־עֵ֛ץ נֶחְמָ֥ד לְמַרְאֶ֖ה וְט֣וֹב לְמַאֲכָ֑ל וְעֵ֤ץ הַֽחַיִּים֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַגָּ֔ן וְעֵ֕ץ הַדַּ֖עַת ט֥וֹב וָרָֽע׃
Translated: And from the ground God יהוה caused to grow every tree that was pleasing to the sight and good for food, with the tree of life in the middle of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and bad.
Transliteration: vayatsemach yehovah Elohim min-haadamah khׇl-ets nechemad lemareeh vetvov lemaakhal veets hachayiym vetvokhe hagan veets hadaat tvov vara

Hebrew: וְנָהָר֙ יֹצֵ֣א מֵעֵ֔דֶן לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת אֶת־הַגָּ֑ן וּמִשָּׁם֙ יִפָּרֵ֔ד וְהָיָ֖ה לְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה רָאשִֽׁים׃
Translated: A river issues from Eden to water the garden, and it then divides and becomes four branches.
Transliteration: venahar yotse meeden lehashekvot et-hagan umisham yifared vehayah learevaah rashiym

Hebrew: שֵׁ֥ם הָֽאֶחָ֖ד פִּישׁ֑וֹן ה֣וּא הַסֹּבֵ֗ב אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽחֲוִילָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֖ם הַזָּהָֽב׃
Translated: The name of the first is Pishon, the one that winds through the whole land of Havilah, where the gold is.
Transliteration: shem haechad fiyshvon hu hasovev et khׇl-erets hachaviylah asher-sham hazahav

Hebrew: וּֽזְהַ֛ב הָאָ֥רֶץ הַהִ֖וא ט֑וֹב שָׁ֥ם הַבְּדֹ֖לַח וְאֶ֥בֶן הַשֹּֽׁהַם׃
Translated: (The gold of that land is good; bdellium is there, and lapis lazuli. )
Transliteration: uzehav haarets hahiv tvov sham havedolach veeven hashoham

Hebrew: וְשֵֽׁם־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַשֵּׁנִ֖י גִּיח֑וֹן ה֣וּא הַסּוֹבֵ֔ב אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ כּֽוּשׁ׃
Translated: The name of the second river is Gihon, the one that winds through the whole land of Cush.
Transliteration: veshem-hanahar hasheniy giychvon hu hasvovev et khׇl-erets khush

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֨ם הַנָּהָ֤ר הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ חִדֶּ֔קֶל ה֥וּא הַֽהֹלֵ֖ךְ קִדְמַ֣ת אַשּׁ֑וּר וְהַנָּהָ֥ר הָֽרְבִיעִ֖י ה֥וּא פְרָֽת׃
Translated: The name of the third river is Tigris, the one that flows east of Asshur. And the fourth river is the Euphrates.
Transliteration: veshem hanahar hasheliyshiy chidekel hu haholekhe kidemat ashur vehanahar hareviyiy hu ferat

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֛ח יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּנִּחֵ֣הוּ בְגַן־עֵ֔דֶן לְעׇבְדָ֖הּ וּלְשׇׁמְרָֽהּ׃
Translated: God יהוה settled the Human in the garden of Eden, to till it and tend it.
Transliteration: vayikach yehovah Elohim et-haadam vayanichehu vegan-eden leׇvedah uleshׇmerah

Hebrew: וַיְצַו֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים עַל־הָֽאָדָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר מִכֹּ֥ל עֵֽץ־הַגָּ֖ן אָכֹ֥ל תֹּאכֵֽל׃
Translated: And God יהוה commanded the Human, saying, “Of every tree of the garden you are free to eat;
Transliteration: vayetsav yehovah Elohim al-haadam lemor mikhol ets-hagan akhol tokhel

Hebrew: וּמֵעֵ֗ץ הַדַּ֙עַת֙ ט֣וֹב וָרָ֔ע לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כִּ֗י בְּי֛וֹם אֲכׇלְךָ֥ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מ֥וֹת תָּמֽוּת׃
Translated: but as for the tree of knowledge of good and bad, you must not eat of it; for as soon as you eat of it, you shall die.”
Transliteration: umeets hadaat tvov vara lo tokhal mimenu khiy veyvom akhׇlekha mimenu mvot tamut

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹא־ט֛וֹב הֱי֥וֹת הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְבַדּ֑וֹ אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לּ֥וֹ עֵ֖זֶר כְּנֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: God יהוה said, “It is not good for the Human to be alone; I will make a fitting counterpart for him.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah Elohim lo-tvov heyvot haadam levadvo eesheh-lvo ezer khenegedvo

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩צֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָ֗ה כׇּל־חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיָּבֵא֙ אֶל־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם לִרְא֖וֹת מַה־יִּקְרָא־ל֑וֹ וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִקְרָא־ל֧וֹ הָֽאָדָ֛ם נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה ה֥וּא שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated: And God יהוה formed out of the earth all the wild beasts and all the birds of the sky, and brought them to the Human to see what he would call them; and whatever the Human called each living creature, that would be its name.
Transliteration: vayitser yehovah Elohim min-haadamah khׇl-chayat hashadeh veet khׇl-vof hashamayiim vayave el-haadam lirevot mah-yikera-lvo vekhol asher yikera-lvo haadam nefesh chayah hu shemvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א הָֽאָדָ֜ם שֵׁמ֗וֹת לְכׇל־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּלְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּלְכֹ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּלְאָדָ֕ם לֹֽא־מָצָ֥א עֵ֖זֶר כְּנֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And the Human gave names to all the cattle and to the birds of the sky and to all the wild beasts; but no fitting counterpart for a human being was found.
Transliteration: vayikera haadam shemvot lekhׇl-havehemah ulevof hashamayiim ulekhol chayat hashadeh uleadam lo-matsa ezer khenegedvo

Hebrew: וַיַּפֵּל֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> תַּרְדֵּמָ֛ה עַל־הָאָדָ֖ם וַיִּישָׁ֑ן וַיִּקַּ֗ח אַחַת֙ מִצַּלְעֹתָ֔יו וַיִּסְגֹּ֥ר בָּשָׂ֖ר תַּחְתֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated: So God יהוה cast a deep sleep upon the Human; and, while he slept, [God] took one of his sides and closed up the flesh at that site.
Transliteration: vayafel yehovah Elohim <small></small> taredemah al-haadam vayiyshan vayikach achat mitsaleotayv vayisegor vashar tachetenah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֶֽת־הַצֵּלָ֛ע אֲשֶׁר־לָקַ֥ח מִן־הָֽאָדָ֖ם לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיְבִאֶ֖הָ אֶל־הָֽאָדָֽם׃
Translated: And God יהוה fashioned the side that had been taken from the Human into a woman, bringing her to the Human.
Transliteration: vayiven yehovah Elohim <small></small> et-hatsela asher-lakach min-haadam leishah vayevieha el-haadam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ הָֽאָדָם֒ זֹ֣את הַפַּ֗עַם עֶ֚צֶם מֵֽעֲצָמַ֔י וּבָשָׂ֖ר מִבְּשָׂרִ֑י לְזֹאת֙ יִקָּרֵ֣א אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּ֥י מֵאִ֖ישׁ לֻֽקְחָה־זֹּֽאת׃
Translated:
Then the Human said,
“This one at last
Is bone of my bones
And flesh of my flesh.
This one shall be called Woman,
For from a Human was she taken.”
Transliteration: vayomer haadam zot hafaam etsem meatsamay uvashar miveshariy lezot yikare ishah khiy meiysh lukechah-zot

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ יַֽעֲזׇב־אִ֔ישׁ אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶת־אִמּ֑וֹ וְדָבַ֣ק בְּאִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וְהָי֖וּ לְבָשָׂ֥ר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Hence a man leaves his father and mother and clings to his wife, so that they become one flesh.
Transliteration: al-khen yaazׇv-iysh et-aviyv veet-imvo vedavak veishetvo vehayu levashar echad

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֤וּ שְׁנֵיהֶם֙ עֲרוּמִּ֔ים הָֽאָדָ֖ם וְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֖א יִתְבֹּשָֽׁשׁוּ׃
Translated: The two of them were naked, the Human and his wife, yet they felt no shame.
Transliteration: vayiheyu sheneyhem arumiym haadam veishetvo velo yitevoshashu

Hebrew: וְהַנָּחָשׁ֙ הָיָ֣ה עָר֔וּם מִכֹּל֙ חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה אַ֚ף כִּֽי־אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּ֖ל עֵ֥ץ הַגָּֽן׃
Translated: Now the serpent was the shrewdest of all the wild beasts that God יהוה had made. It said to the woman, “Did God really say: You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?”
Transliteration: vehanachash hayah arum mikhol chayat hashadeh asher ashah yehovah Elohim vayomer el-haishah af khiy-amar Elohim lo tokhelu mikhol ets hagan

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר הָֽאִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־הַנָּחָ֑שׁ מִפְּרִ֥י עֵֽץ־הַגָּ֖ן נֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated: The woman replied to the serpent, “We may eat of the fruit of the other trees of the garden.
Transliteration: vatomer haishah el-hanachash miferiy ets-hagan nokhel

Hebrew: וּמִפְּרִ֣י הָעֵץ֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּתוֹךְ־הַגָּן֒ אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים לֹ֤א תֹֽאכְלוּ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְלֹ֥א תִגְּע֖וּ בּ֑וֹ פֶּן־תְּמֻתֽוּן׃
Translated: It is only about fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden that God said: ‘You shall not eat of it or touch it, lest you die.’”
Transliteration: umiferiy haets asher vetvokhe-hagan amar Elohim lo tokhelu mimenu velo tigeu vvo fen-temutun

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַנָּחָ֖שׁ אֶל־הָֽאִשָּׁ֑ה לֹֽא־מ֖וֹת תְּמֻתֽוּן׃
Translated: And the serpent said to the woman, “You are not going to die,
Transliteration: vayomer hanachash el-haishah lo-mvot temutun

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יֹדֵ֣עַ אֱלֹהִ֔ים כִּ֗י בְּיוֹם֙ אֲכׇלְכֶ֣ם מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְנִפְקְח֖וּ עֵֽינֵיכֶ֑ם וִהְיִיתֶם֙ כֵּֽאלֹהִ֔ים יֹדְעֵ֖י ט֥וֹב וָרָֽע׃
Translated: but God knows that as soon as you eat of it your eyes will be opened and you will be like divine beings who know good and bad.”
Transliteration: khiy yodea Elohim khiy veyvom akhׇlekhem mimenu venifekechu eyneykhem viheyiytem khelohiym yodeey tvov vara

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא הָֽאִשָּׁ֡ה כִּ֣י טוֹב֩ הָעֵ֨ץ לְמַאֲכָ֜ל וְכִ֧י תַֽאֲוָה־ה֣וּא לָעֵינַ֗יִם וְנֶחְמָ֤ד הָעֵץ֙ לְהַשְׂכִּ֔יל וַתִּקַּ֥ח מִפִּרְי֖וֹ וַתֹּאכַ֑ל וַתִּתֵּ֧ן גַּם־לְאִישָׁ֛הּ עִמָּ֖הּ וַיֹּאכַֽל׃
Translated: When the woman saw that the tree was good for eating and a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was desirable as a source of wisdom, she took of its fruit and ate. She also gave some to her husband, and he ate.
Transliteration: vatere haishah khiy tvov haets lemaakhal vekhiy taavah-hu laeynayiim venechemad haets lehashekhiyl vatikach mifireyvo vatokhal vatiten gam-leiyshah imah vayokhal

Hebrew: וַתִּפָּקַ֙חְנָה֙ עֵינֵ֣י שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּ֣דְע֔וּ כִּ֥י עֵֽירֻמִּ֖ם הֵ֑ם וַֽיִּתְפְּרוּ֙ עֲלֵ֣ה תְאֵנָ֔ה וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם חֲגֹרֹֽת׃
Translated: Then the eyes of both of them were opened and they perceived that they were naked; and they sewed together fig leaves and made themselves loincloths.
Transliteration: vatifakachenah eyney sheneyhem vayedeu khiy eyrumim hem vayiteferu aleh teenah vayaashu lahem chagorot

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֞וּ אֶת־ק֨וֹל יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים מִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּגָּ֖ן לְר֣וּחַ הַיּ֑וֹם וַיִּתְחַבֵּ֨א הָֽאָדָ֜ם וְאִשְׁתּ֗וֹ מִפְּנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים בְּת֖וֹךְ עֵ֥ץ הַגָּֽן׃
Translated: They heard the sound of God יהוה moving about in the garden at the breezy time of day; and the Human and his wife hid from God יהוה among the trees of the garden.
Transliteration: vayishemeu et-kvol yehovah Elohim mitehalekhe vagan lerucha hayyvom vayitechave haadam veishetvo mifeney yehovah Elohim vetvokhe ets hagan

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ אַיֶּֽכָּה׃
Translated: God יהוה called out to the Human and said to him, “Where are you?”
Transliteration: vayikera yehovah Elohim el-haadam vayomer lvo ayekhah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֶת־קֹלְךָ֥ שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בַּגָּ֑ן וָאִירָ֛א כִּֽי־עֵירֹ֥ם אָנֹ֖כִי וָאֵחָבֵֽא׃
Translated: He replied, “I heard the sound of You in the garden, and I was afraid because I was naked, so I hid.”
Transliteration: vayomer et-kolekha shamaetiy vagan vaiyra khiy-eyrom anokhiy vaechave

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֚י הִגִּ֣יד לְךָ֔ כִּ֥י עֵירֹ֖ם אָ֑תָּה הֲמִן־הָעֵ֗ץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר צִוִּיתִ֛יךָ לְבִלְתִּ֥י אֲכׇל־מִמֶּ֖נּוּ אָכָֽלְתָּ׃
Translated: “Who told you that you were naked? Did you eat of the tree from which I had forbidden you to eat?”
Transliteration: vayomer miy higiyd lekha khiy eyrom atah hamin-haets asher tsiviytiykha leviletiy akhׇl-mimenu akhaleta

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הָֽאָדָ֑ם הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תָּה עִמָּדִ֔י הִ֛וא נָֽתְנָה־לִּ֥י מִן־הָעֵ֖ץ וָאֹכֵֽל׃
Translated: The Human said, “The woman You put at my side—she gave me of the tree, and I ate.”
Transliteration: vayomer haadam haishah asher natatah imadiy hiv natenah-liy min-haets vaokhel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהִ֛ים לָאִשָּׁ֖ה מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֑ית וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה הַנָּחָ֥שׁ הִשִּׁיאַ֖נִי וָאֹכֵֽל׃
Translated: And God יהוה said to the woman, “What is this you have done!” The woman replied, “The serpent duped me, and I ate.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah Elohim laishah mah-zot ashiyt vatomer haishah hanachash hishiyaniy vaokhel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֶֽל־הַנָּחָשׁ֮ כִּ֣י עָשִׂ֣יתָ זֹּאת֒ אָר֤וּר אַתָּה֙ מִכׇּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה וּמִכֹּ֖ל חַיַּ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה עַל־גְּחֹנְךָ֣ תֵלֵ֔ךְ וְעָפָ֥ר תֹּאכַ֖ל כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Then God יהוה said to the serpent,
“Because you did this,
More cursed shall you be
Than all cattle
And all the wild beasts:
On your belly shall you crawl
And dirt shall you eat
All the days of your life.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah Elohim <small></small> el-hanachash khiy ashiyta zot arur atah mikhׇl-havehemah umikhol chayat hashadeh al-gechonekha telekhe veafar tokhal khׇl-yemey chayeykha

Hebrew: וְאֵיבָ֣ה ׀ אָשִׁ֗ית בֵּֽינְךָ֙ וּבֵ֣ין הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ וּבֵ֣ין זַרְעָ֑הּ ה֚וּא יְשׁוּפְךָ֣ רֹ֔אשׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה תְּשׁוּפֶ֥נּוּ עָקֵֽב׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will put enmity
Between you and the woman,
And between your offspring and hers;
They shall strike at your head,
And you shall strike at their heel.”
Transliteration: veeyvah ashiyt veynekha uveyn haishah uveyn zareakha uveyn zareah hu yeshufekha rosh veatah teshufenu akev {s}

Hebrew: אֶֽל־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה אָמַ֗ר הַרְבָּ֤ה אַרְבֶּה֙ עִצְּבוֹנֵ֣ךְ וְהֵֽרֹנֵ֔ךְ בְּעֶ֖צֶב תֵּֽלְדִ֣י בָנִ֑ים וְאֶל־אִישֵׁךְ֙ תְּשׁ֣וּקָתֵ֔ךְ וְה֖וּא יִמְשׇׁל־בָּֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
And to the woman [God] said,
“I will greatly expand
Your hard labor—and your pregnancies;
In hardship shall you bear children.
Yet your urge shall be for your husband,
And he shall rule over you.”
Transliteration: el-haishah amar harevah areveh itsevvonekhe veheronekhe veetsev telediy vaniym veel-iyshekhe teshukatekhe vehu yimeshׇl-vakhe {s}

Hebrew: וּלְאָדָ֣ם אָמַ֗ר כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֘עְתָּ֮ לְק֣וֹל אִשְׁתֶּ֒ךָ֒ וַתֹּ֙אכַל֙ מִן־הָעֵ֔ץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר צִוִּיתִ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֲרוּרָ֤ה הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ בַּֽעֲבוּרֶ֔ךָ בְּעִצָּבוֹן֙ תֹּֽאכְלֶ֔נָּה כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated:
To Adam [God] said, “Because you did as your wife said and ate of the tree about which I commanded you, ‘You shall not eat of it,’
Cursed be the ground because of you;
By hard labor shall you eat of it
All the days of your life:
Transliteration: uleadam amar khiy-shamaeta lekvol ishetekha vatokhal min-haets asher tsiviytiykha lemor lo tokhal mimenu arurah haadamah vaavurekha veitsavvon tokhelenah khol yemey chayeykha

Hebrew: וְק֥וֹץ וְדַרְדַּ֖ר תַּצְמִ֣יחַֽ לָ֑ךְ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ אֶת־עֵ֥שֶׂב הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated:
Thorns and thistles shall it sprout for you.
But your food shall be the grasses of the field;
Transliteration: vekvots vedaredar tatsemiycha lakhe veakhaleta et-eshev hashadeh

Hebrew: בְּזֵעַ֤ת אַפֶּ֙יךָ֙ תֹּ֣אכַל לֶ֔חֶם עַ֤ד שֽׁוּבְךָ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה כִּ֥י מִמֶּ֖נָּה לֻקָּ֑חְתָּ כִּֽי־עָפָ֣ר אַ֔תָּה וְאֶל־עָפָ֖ר תָּשֽׁוּב׃
Translated:
By the sweat of your brow
Shall you get bread to eat,
Until you return to the ground—
For from it you were taken.
For dust you are,
And to dust you shall return.”
Transliteration: vezeat afeykha tokhal lechem ad shuvekha el-haadamah khiy mimenah lukacheta khiy-afar atah veel-afar tashuv

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א הָֽאָדָ֛ם שֵׁ֥ם אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ חַוָּ֑ה כִּ֛י הִ֥וא הָֽיְתָ֖ה אֵ֥ם כׇּל־חָֽי׃
Translated: The Human named his wife Eve, because she was the mother of all the living.
Transliteration: vayikera haadam shem ishetvo chavah khiy hiv hayetah em khׇl-chay

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַשׂ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים לְאָדָ֧ם וּלְאִשְׁתּ֛וֹ כׇּתְנ֥וֹת ע֖וֹר וַיַּלְבִּשֵֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: And God יהוה made garments of skins for Adam and his wife, and clothed them.
Transliteration: vayaash yehovah Elohim leadam uleishetvo khׇtenvot vor vayalevishem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים הֵ֤ן הָֽאָדָם֙ הָיָה֙ כְּאַחַ֣ד מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לָדַ֖עַת ט֣וֹב וָרָ֑ע וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ פֶּן־יִשְׁלַ֣ח יָד֗וֹ וְלָקַח֙ גַּ֚ם מֵעֵ֣ץ הַֽחַיִּ֔ים וְאָכַ֖ל וָחַ֥י לְעֹלָֽם׃
Translated: And God יהוה said, “Now that humankind has become like any of us, knowing good and bad, what if one should stretch out a hand and take also from the tree of life and eat, and live forever!”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah Elohim hen haadam hayah kheachad mimenu ladaat tvov vara veatah fen-yishelach yadvo velakach gam meets hachayiym veakhal vachay leolam

Hebrew: וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֛הוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִגַּן־עֵ֑דֶן לַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֻקַּ֖ח מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: So God יהוה banished humankind from the garden of Eden, to till the humus from which it was taken:
Transliteration: vayeshalechehu yehovah Elohim migan-eden laavod et-haadamah asher lukach misham

Hebrew: וַיְגָ֖רֶשׁ אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֑ם וַיַּשְׁכֵּן֩ מִקֶּ֨דֶם לְגַן־עֵ֜דֶן אֶת־הַכְּרֻבִ֗ים וְאֵ֨ת לַ֤הַט הַחֶ֙רֶב֙ הַמִּתְהַפֶּ֔כֶת לִשְׁמֹ֕ר אֶת־דֶּ֖רֶךְ עֵ֥ץ הַֽחַיִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: it was driven out; and east of the garden of Eden were stationed the cherubim and the fiery ever-turning sword, to guard the way to the tree of life.
Transliteration: vayegaresh et-haadam vayashekhen mikedem legan-eden et-hakheruviym veet lahat hacherev hamitehafekhet lishemor et-derekhe ets hachayiym {s}

Hebrew: וְהָ֣אָדָ֔ם יָדַ֖ע אֶת־חַוָּ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וַתַּ֙הַר֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד אֶת־קַ֔יִן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר קָנִ֥יתִי אִ֖ישׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Now the Human knew his wife Eve, and she conceived and bore Cain, saying, “I have gained a person with the help of יהוה.”
Transliteration: vehaadam yada et-chavah ishetvo vatahar vateled et-kayiin vatomer kaniytiy iysh et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣סֶף לָלֶ֔דֶת אֶת־אָחִ֖יו אֶת־הָ֑בֶל וַֽיְהִי־הֶ֙בֶל֙ רֹ֣עֵה צֹ֔אן וְקַ֕יִן הָיָ֖ה עֹבֵ֥ד אֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: She then bore his brother Abel. Abel became a keeper of sheep, and Cain became a tiller of the soil.
Transliteration: vatosef laledet et-achiyv et-havel vayehiy-hevel roeh tson vekayiin hayah oved adamah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֖י מִקֵּ֣ץ יָמִ֑ים וַיָּבֵ֨א קַ֜יִן מִפְּרִ֧י הָֽאֲדָמָ֛ה מִנְחָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the course of time, Cain brought an offering to יהוה from the fruit of the soil;
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets yamiym vayave kayiin miferiy haadamah minechah layhovah

Hebrew: וְהֶ֨בֶל הֵבִ֥יא גַם־ה֛וּא מִבְּכֹר֥וֹת צֹאנ֖וֹ וּמֵֽחֶלְבֵהֶ֑ן וַיִּ֣שַׁע יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־הֶ֖בֶל וְאֶל־מִנְחָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: and Abel, for his part, brought the choicest of the firstlings of his flock. יהוה paid heed to Abel and his offering,
Transliteration: vehevel heviy gam-hu mivekhorvot tsonvo umechelevehen vayisha yehovah el-hevel veel-minechatvo

Hebrew: וְאֶל־קַ֥יִן וְאֶל־מִנְחָת֖וֹ לֹ֣א שָׁעָ֑ה וַיִּ֤חַר לְקַ֙יִן֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ פָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: but to Cain and his offering [God] paid no heed. Cain was much distressed and his face fell.
Transliteration: veel-kayiin veel-minechatvo lo shaah vayichar lekayiin meod vayifelu fanayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־קָ֑יִן לָ֚מָּה חָ֣רָה לָ֔ךְ וְלָ֖מָּה נָפְל֥וּ פָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
And יהוה said to Cain,
“Why are you distressed,
And why is your face fallen?
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-kayiin lamah charah lakhe velamah nafelu faneykha

Hebrew: הֲל֤וֹא אִם־תֵּיטִיב֙ שְׂאֵ֔ת וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א תֵיטִ֔יב לַפֶּ֖תַח חַטָּ֣את רֹבֵ֑ץ וְאֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ תְּשׁ֣וּקָת֔וֹ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּמְשׇׁל־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Surely, if you do right,
There is uplift.
But if you do not do right
Sin couches at the door;
Its urge is toward you,
Yet you can be its master.”
Transliteration: halvo im-teytiyv sheet veim lo teytiyv lafetach chatat rovets veeleykha teshukatvo veatah timeshׇl-vvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר קַ֖יִן אֶל־הֶ֣בֶל אָחִ֑יו וַֽיְהִי֙ בִּהְיוֹתָ֣ם בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיָּ֥קׇם קַ֛יִן אֶל־הֶ֥בֶל אָחִ֖יו וַיַּהַרְגֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: Cain said to his brother Abel … and when they were in the field, Cain set upon his brother Abel and killed him.
Transliteration: vayomer kayiin el-hevel achiyv vayehiy viheyvotam vashadeh vayakׇm kayiin el-hevel achiyv vayaharegehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־קַ֔יִן אֵ֖י הֶ֣בֶל אָחִ֑יךָ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי הֲשֹׁמֵ֥ר אָחִ֖י אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: יהוה said to Cain, “Where is your brother Abel?” And he said, “I do not know. Am I my brother’s keeper?”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-kayiin ey hevel achiykha vayomer lo yadaetiy hashomer achiy anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָ ק֚וֹל דְּמֵ֣י אָחִ֔יךָ צֹעֲקִ֥ים אֵלַ֖י מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: “What have you done? Hark, your brother’s blood cries out to Me from the ground!
Transliteration: vayomer meh ashiyta kvol demey achiykha tsoakiym elay min-haadamah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה אָר֣וּר אָ֑תָּה מִן־הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּצְתָ֣ה אֶת־פִּ֔יהָ לָקַ֛חַת אֶת־דְּמֵ֥י אָחִ֖יךָ מִיָּדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Therefore, you shall be more cursed than the ground, which opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.
Transliteration: veatah arur atah min-haadamah asher fatsetah et-fiyha lakachat et-demey achiykha miyadekha

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה לֹֽא־תֹסֵ֥ף תֵּת־כֹּחָ֖הּ לָ֑ךְ נָ֥ע וָנָ֖ד תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה בָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: If you till the soil, it shall no longer yield its strength to you. You shall become a ceaseless wanderer on earth.”
Transliteration: khiy taavod et-haadamah lo-tosef tet-khochah lakhe na vanad tiheyeh vaarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר קַ֖יִן אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה גָּד֥וֹל עֲוֺנִ֖י מִנְּשֹֽׂא׃
Translated: Cain said to יהוה, “My punishment is too great to bear!
Transliteration: vayomer kayiin el-yehovah gadvol avoniy minesho

Hebrew: הֵן֩ גֵּרַ֨שְׁתָּ אֹתִ֜י הַיּ֗וֹם מֵעַל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה וּמִפָּנֶ֖יךָ אֶסָּתֵ֑ר וְהָיִ֜יתִי נָ֤ע וָנָד֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וְהָיָ֥ה כׇל־מֹצְאִ֖י יַֽהַרְגֵֽנִי׃
Translated: Since You have banished me this day from the soil, and I must avoid Your presence and become a restless wanderer on earth—anyone who meets me may kill me!”
Transliteration: hen gerasheta otiy hayyvom meal feney haadamah umifaneykha esater vehayiytiy na vanad vaarets vehayah khׇl-motseiy yaharegeniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ יְהֹוָ֗ה לָכֵן֙ כׇּל־הֹרֵ֣ג קַ֔יִן שִׁבְעָתַ֖יִם יֻקָּ֑ם וַיָּ֨שֶׂם יְהֹוָ֤ה לְקַ֙יִן֙ א֔וֹת לְבִלְתִּ֥י הַכּוֹת־אֹת֖וֹ כׇּל־מֹצְאֽוֹ׃
Translated: יהוה said to him, “I promise, if anyone kills Cain, sevenfold vengeance shall be exacted.” And יהוה put a mark on Cain, lest anyone who met him should kill him.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo yehovah lakhen khׇl-horeg kayiin shiveatayiim yukam vayashem yehovah lekayiin vot leviletiy hakhvot-otvo khׇl-motsevo

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥צֵא קַ֖יִן מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־נ֖וֹד קִדְמַת־עֵֽדֶן׃
Translated: Cain left the presence of יהוה and settled in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
Transliteration: vayetse kayiin milifeney yehovah vayeshev veerets-nvod kidemat-eden

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤דַע קַ֙יִן֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד אֶת־חֲנ֑וֹךְ וַֽיְהִי֙ בֹּ֣נֶה עִ֔יר וַיִּקְרָא֙ שֵׁ֣ם הָעִ֔יר כְּשֵׁ֖ם בְּנ֥וֹ חֲנֽוֹךְ׃
Translated: Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch. And he then founded a city, and named the city after his son Enoch.
Transliteration: vayeda kayiin et-ishetvo vatahar vateled et-chanvokhe vayehiy voneh iyr vayikera shem haiyr kheshem venvo chanvokhe

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּלֵ֤ד לַֽחֲנוֹךְ֙ אֶת־עִירָ֔ד וְעִירָ֕ד יָלַ֖ד אֶת־מְחֽוּיָאֵ֑ל וּמְחִיָּיאֵ֗ל יָלַד֙ אֶת־מְת֣וּשָׁאֵ֔ל וּמְתוּשָׁאֵ֖ל יָלַ֥ד אֶת־לָֽמֶךְ׃
Translated: To Enoch was born Irad, and Irad begot Mehujael, and Mehujael begot Methusael, and Methusael begot Lamech.
Transliteration: vayivaled lachanvokhe et-iyrad veiyrad yalad et-mechuyael umechiyayel yalad et-metushael umetushael yalad et-lamekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֥וֹ לֶ֖מֶךְ שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשִׁ֑ים שֵׁ֤ם הָֽאַחַת֙ עָדָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖ית צִלָּֽה׃
Translated: Lamech took to himself two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other was Zillah.
Transliteration: vayikach-lvo lemekhe shetey nashiym shem haachat adah veshem hasheniyt tsilah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֥לֶד עָדָ֖ה אֶת־יָבָ֑ל ה֣וּא הָיָ֔ה אֲבִ֕י יֹשֵׁ֥ב אֹ֖הֶל וּמִקְנֶֽה׃
Translated: Adah bore Jabal; he was the ancestor of those who dwell in tents and amidst herds.
Transliteration: vateled adah et-yaval hu hayah aviy yoshev ohel umikeneh

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו יוּבָ֑ל ה֣וּא הָיָ֔ה אֲבִ֕י כׇּל־תֹּפֵ֥שׂ כִּנּ֖וֹר וְעוּגָֽב׃
Translated: And the name of his brother was Jubal; he was the ancestor of all who play the lyre and the pipe.
Transliteration: veshem achiyv yuval hu hayah aviy khׇl-tofesh khinvor veugav

Hebrew: וְצִלָּ֣ה גַם־הִ֗וא יָֽלְדָה֙ אֶת־תּ֣וּבַל קַ֔יִן לֹטֵ֕שׁ כׇּל־חֹרֵ֥שׁ נְחֹ֖שֶׁת וּבַרְזֶ֑ל וַֽאֲח֥וֹת תּֽוּבַל־קַ֖יִן נַֽעֲמָֽה׃
Translated: As for Zillah, she bore Tubal-cain, who forged all implements of copper and iron. And the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
Transliteration: vetsilah gam-hiv yaledah et-tuval kayiin lotesh khׇl-choresh nechoshet uvarezel vaachvot tuval-kayiin naamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לֶ֜מֶךְ לְנָשָׁ֗יו עָדָ֤ה וְצִלָּה֙ שְׁמַ֣עַן קוֹלִ֔י נְשֵׁ֣י לֶ֔מֶךְ הַאְזֵ֖נָּה אִמְרָתִ֑י כִּ֣י אִ֤ישׁ הָרַ֙גְתִּי֙ לְפִצְעִ֔י וְיֶ֖לֶד לְחַבֻּרָתִֽי׃
Translated:
And Lamech said to his wives,
“Adah and Zillah, hear my voice;
O wives of Lamech, give ear to my speech.
I have slain a person for wounding me,
And a lad for bruising me.
Transliteration: vayomer lemekhe lenashayv adah vetsilah shemaan kvoliy neshey lemekhe haezenah imeratiy khiy iysh haragetiy lefitseiy veyeled lechavuratiy

Hebrew: כִּ֥י שִׁבְעָתַ֖יִם יֻקַּם־קָ֑יִן וְלֶ֖מֶךְ שִׁבְעִ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃
Translated:
If Cain is avenged sevenfold,
Then Lamech seventy-sevenfold.”
Transliteration: khiy shiveatayiim yukam-kayiin velemekhe shiveiym veshiveah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨דַע אָדָ֥ם עוֹד֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵׁ֑ת כִּ֣י שָֽׁת־לִ֤י אֱלֹהִים֙ זֶ֣רַע אַחֵ֔ר תַּ֣חַת הֶ֔בֶל כִּ֥י הֲרָג֖וֹ קָֽיִן׃
Translated: Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son and named him Seth, meaning, “God has provided me with another offspring in place of Abel,” for Cain had killed him.
Transliteration: vayeda adam vod et-ishetvo vateled ven vatikera et-shemvo shet khiy shat-liy Elohim zera acher tachat hevel khiy haragvo kayiin

Hebrew: וּלְשֵׁ֤ת גַּם־הוּא֙ יֻלַּד־בֵּ֔ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱנ֑וֹשׁ אָ֣ז הוּחַ֔ל לִקְרֹ֖א בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And to Seth, in turn, a son was born, and he named him Enosh. It was then that יהוה began to be invoked by name.
Transliteration: uleshet gam-hu yulad-ven vayikera et-shemvo envosh az huchal likero veshem yehovah {s}

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה סֵ֔פֶר תּוֹלְדֹ֖ת אָדָ֑ם בְּי֗וֹם בְּרֹ֤א אֱלֹהִים֙ אָדָ֔ם בִּדְמ֥וּת אֱלֹהִ֖ים עָשָׂ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: This is the record of Adam’s line.—When God created humankind, it was made in the likeness of God;
Transliteration: zeh sefer tvoledot adam veyvom vero Elohim adam videmut Elohim ashah otvo

Hebrew: זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה בְּרָאָ֑ם וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹתָ֗ם וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶת־שְׁמָם֙ אָדָ֔ם בְּי֖וֹם הִבָּֽרְאָֽם׃
Translated: male and female were they created. And when they were created, [God] blessed them and called them Humankind. —
Transliteration: zakhar unekevah veraam vayevarekhe otam vayikera et-shemam adam veyvom hivaream

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י אָדָ֗ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וּמְאַת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בִּדְמוּת֖וֹ כְּצַלְמ֑וֹ וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵֽׁת׃
Translated: When Adam had lived 130 years, he begot a son in his likeness after his image, and he named him Seth.
Transliteration: vayechiy adam sheloshiym umeat shanah vayyvoled videmutvo khetsalemvo vayikera et-shemvo shet

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֣וּ יְמֵי־אָדָ֗ם אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שֵׁ֔ת שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵאֹ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Seth, Adam lived 800 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayiheyu yemey-adam acharey hvoliydvo et-shet shemoneh meot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֞וּ כׇּל־יְמֵ֤י אָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁר־חַ֔י תְּשַׁ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days that Adam lived came to 930 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey adam asher-chay tesha mevot shanah usheloshiym shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֕ת חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־אֱנֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated: When Seth had lived 105 years, he begot Enosh.
Transliteration: vayechiy-shet chamesh shaniym umeat shanah vayyvoled et-envosh

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֗ת אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־אֱנ֔וֹשׁ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Enosh, Seth lived 807 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy-shet acharey hvoliydvo et-envosh sheva shaniym ushemoneh mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵי־שֵׁ֔ת שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Seth came to 912 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey-shet sheteym eshereh shanah utesha mevot shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֥י אֱנ֖וֹשׁ תִּשְׁעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־קֵינָֽן׃
Translated: When Enosh had lived 90 years, he begot Kenan.
Transliteration: vayechiy envosh tisheiym shanah vayyvoled et-keynan

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י אֱנ֗וֹשׁ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־קֵינָ֔ן חֲמֵ֤שׁ עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Kenan, Enosh lived 815 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy envosh acharey hvoliydvo et-keynan chamesh eshereh shanah ushemoneh mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י אֱנ֔וֹשׁ חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Enosh came to 905 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey envosh chamesh shaniym utesha mevot shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֥י קֵינָ֖ן שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־מַֽהֲלַלְאֵֽל׃
Translated: When Kenan had lived 70 years, he begot Mahalalel.
Transliteration: vayechiy keynan shiveiym shanah vayyvoled et-mahalaleel

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י קֵינָ֗ן אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Mahalalel, Kenan lived 840 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy keynan acharey hvoliydvo et-mahalaleel arevaiym shanah ushemoneh mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י קֵינָ֔ן עֶ֣שֶׂר שָׁנִ֔ים וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Kenan came to 910 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey keynan esher shaniym utesha mevot shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וְשִׁשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־יָֽרֶד׃
Translated: When Mahalalel had lived 65 years, he begot Jared.
Transliteration: vayechiy mahalaleel chamesh shaniym veshishiym shanah vayyvoled et-yared

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י מַֽהֲלַלְאֵ֗ל אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־יֶ֔רֶד שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Jared, Mahalalel lived 830 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy mahalaleel acharey hvoliydvo et-yered sheloshiym shanah ushemoneh mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י מַהֲלַלְאֵ֔ל חָמֵ֤שׁ וְתִשְׁעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Mahalalel came to 895 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey mahalaleel chamesh vetisheiym shanah ushemoneh mevot shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־יֶ֕רֶד שְׁתַּ֧יִם וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־חֲנֽוֹךְ׃
Translated: When Jared had lived 162 years, he begot Enoch.
Transliteration: vayechiy-yered shetayiim veshishiym shanah umeat shanah vayyvoled et-chanvokhe

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־יֶ֗רֶד אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־חֲנ֔וֹךְ שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Enoch, Jared lived 800 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy-yered acharey hvoliydvo et-chanvokhe shemoneh mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵי־יֶ֔רֶד שְׁתַּ֤יִם וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Jared came to 962 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey-yered shetayiim veshishiym shanah utesha mevot shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י חֲנ֔וֹךְ חָמֵ֥שׁ וְשִׁשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־מְתוּשָֽׁלַח׃
Translated: When Enoch had lived 65 years, he begot Methuselah.
Transliteration: vayechiy chanvokhe chamesh veshishiym shanah vayyvoled et-metushalach

Hebrew: וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֨ךְ חֲנ֜וֹךְ אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֗ים אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Methuselah, Enoch walked with God 300 years; and he begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayitehalekhe chanvokhe et-haElohimm acharey hvoliydvo et-metushelach shelosh mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חֲנ֑וֹךְ חָמֵ֤שׁ וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: All the days of Enoch came to 365 years.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-yemey chanvokhe chamesh veshishiym shanah ushelosh mevot shanah

Hebrew: וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ חֲנ֖וֹךְ אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְאֵינֶ֕נּוּ כִּֽי־לָקַ֥ח אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Enoch walked with God; then he was no more, for God took him.
Transliteration: vayitehalekhe chanvokhe et-haElohimm veeynenu khiy-lakach otvo Elohim {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח שֶׁ֧בַע וּשְׁמֹנִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־לָֽמֶךְ׃
Translated: When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he begot Lamech.
Transliteration: vayechiy metushelach sheva ushemoniym shanah umeat shanah vayyvoled et-lamekhe

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֗לַח אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־לֶ֔מֶךְ שְׁתַּ֤יִם וּשְׁמוֹנִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Lamech, Methuselah lived 782 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy metushelach acharey hvoliydvo et-lemekhe shetayiim ushemvoniym shanah usheva mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י מְתוּשֶׁ֔לַח תֵּ֤שַׁע וְשִׁשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּתְשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Methuselah came to 969 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey metushelach tesha veshishiym shanah utesha mevot shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־לֶ֕מֶךְ שְׁתַּ֧יִם וּשְׁמֹנִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד בֵּֽן׃
Translated: When Lamech had lived 182 years, he begot a son.
Transliteration: vayechiy-lemekhe shetayiim ushemoniym shanah umeat shanah vayyvoled ven

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אֶת־שְׁמ֛וֹ נֹ֖חַ לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֞֠ה יְנַחֲמֵ֤נוּ מִֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֙נוּ֙ וּמֵעִצְּב֣וֹן יָדֵ֔ינוּ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽרְרָ֖הּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And he named him Noah, saying, “This one will provide us relief from our work and from the toil of our hands, out of the very soil which יהוה placed under a curse.”
Transliteration: vayikera et-shemvo nocha lemor zeh yenachamenu mimaashenu umeitsevvon yadeynu min-haadamah asher ererah yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־לֶ֗מֶךְ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־נֹ֔חַ חָמֵ֤שׁ וְתִשְׁעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֹ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After the birth of Noah, Lamech lived 595 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy-lemekhe acharey hvoliydvo et-nocha chamesh vetisheiym shanah vachamesh meot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כׇּל־יְמֵי־לֶ֔מֶךְ שֶׁ֤בַע וְשִׁבְעִים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the days of Lamech came to 777 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-yemey-lemekhe sheva veshiveiym shanah usheva mevot shanah vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־נֹ֕חַ בֶּן־חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֣וֹלֶד נֹ֔חַ אֶת־שֵׁ֖ם אֶת־חָ֥ם וְאֶת־יָֽפֶת׃
Translated: When Noah had lived 500 years, Noah begot Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
Transliteration: vayehiy-nocha ven-chamesh mevot shanah vayyvoled nocha et-shem et-cham veet-yafet

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־הֵחֵ֣ל הָֽאָדָ֔ם לָרֹ֖ב עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה וּבָנ֖וֹת יֻלְּד֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: When humankind began to increase on earth and daughters were born to them,
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-hechel haadam larov al-feney haadamah uvanvot yuledu lahem

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ בְנֵי־הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֥י טֹבֹ֖ת הֵ֑נָּה וַיִּקְח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ נָשִׁ֔ים מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּחָֽרוּ׃
Translated: the [males among the] divine beings saw how pleasing the human women were and took wives from among those who delighted them.—
Transliteration: vayireu veney-haElohim et-venvot haadam khiy tovot henah vayikechu lahem nashiym mikhol asher vacharu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹֽא־יָד֨וֹן רוּחִ֤י בָֽאָדָם֙ לְעֹלָ֔ם בְּשַׁגַּ֖ם ה֣וּא בָשָׂ֑ר וְהָי֣וּ יָמָ֔יו מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: יהוה said, “My breath shall not abide in humankind forever, since it too is flesh; let the days allowed them be one hundred and twenty years.”—
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah lo-yadvon ruchiy vaadam leolam veshagam hu vashar vehayu yamayv meah veesheriym shanah

Hebrew: הַנְּפִלִ֞ים הָי֣וּ בָאָ֘רֶץ֮ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵם֒ וְגַ֣ם אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבֹ֜אוּ בְּנֵ֤י הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־בְּנ֣וֹת הָֽאָדָ֔ם וְיָלְד֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם הֵ֧מָּה הַגִּבֹּרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר מֵעוֹלָ֖ם אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַשֵּֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: It was then, and later too, that the Nephilim appeared on earth—when divine beings cohabited with the human women, who bore them offspring. Such were the heroes of old, the men of renown.
Transliteration: hanefiliym hayu vaarets vayamiym hahem vegam acharey-khen asher yavou veney haElohim el-venvot haadam veyaledu lahem hemah hagivoriym asher mevolam aneshey hashem {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י רַבָּ֛ה רָעַ֥ת הָאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְכׇל־יֵ֙צֶר֙ מַחְשְׁבֹ֣ת לִבּ֔וֹ רַ֥ק רַ֖ע כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: יהוה saw how great was human wickedness on earth—how every plan devised by the human mind was nothing but evil all the time.
Transliteration: vayare yehovah khiy ravah raat haadam vaarets vekhׇl-eitser macheshevot livvo rak ra khׇl-hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּתְעַצֵּ֖ב אֶל־לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And יהוה regretted having made humankind on earth. With a sorrowful heart,
Transliteration: vayinachem yehovah khiy-ashah et-haadam vaarets vayiteatsev el-livvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶמְחֶ֨ה אֶת־הָאָדָ֤ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּרָ֙אתִי֙ מֵעַל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה מֵֽאָדָם֙ עַד־בְּהֵמָ֔ה עַד־רֶ֖מֶשׂ וְעַד־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כִּ֥י נִחַ֖מְתִּי כִּ֥י עֲשִׂיתִֽם׃
Translated: יהוה said, “I will blot out from the earth humankind whom I created—humans together with beasts, creeping things, and birds of the sky; for I regret that I made them.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah emecheh et-haadam asher-varatiy meal feney haadamah meadam ad-vehemah ad-remesh vead-vof hashamayiim khiy nichametiy khiy ashiytim

Hebrew: וְנֹ֕חַ מָ֥צָא חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But Noah found favor with יהוה.
Transliteration: venocha matsa chen veeyney yehovah {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת נֹ֔חַ נֹ֗חַ אִ֥ישׁ צַדִּ֛יק תָּמִ֥ים הָיָ֖ה בְּדֹֽרֹתָ֑יו אֶת־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֖ים הִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־נֹֽחַ׃
Translated: This is the line of Noah.—Noah was a righteous man; he was blameless in his age; Noah walked with God.—
Transliteration: eleh tvoledot nocha nocha iysh tsadiyk tamiym hayah vedorotayv et-haElohimm hitehalekhe-nocha

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹלֶד נֹ֖חַ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים אֶת־שֵׁ֖ם אֶת־חָ֥ם וְאֶת־יָֽפֶת׃
Translated: Noah begot three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
Transliteration: vayyvoled nocha sheloshah vaniym et-shem et-cham veet-yafet

Hebrew: וַתִּשָּׁחֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ לִפְנֵ֣י הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַתִּמָּלֵ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ חָמָֽס׃
Translated: The earth became corrupt before God; the earth was filled with lawlessness.
Transliteration: vatishachet haarets lifeney haElohimm vatimale haarets chamas

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧רְא אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְהִנֵּ֣ה נִשְׁחָ֑תָה כִּֽי־הִשְׁחִ֧ית כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֛ר אֶת־דַּרְכּ֖וֹ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: When God saw how corrupt the earth was, for all flesh had corrupted its ways on earth,
Transliteration: vayare Elohim et-haarets vehineh nishechatah khiy-hishechiyt khׇl-vashar et-darekhvo al-haarets {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים לְנֹ֗חַ קֵ֤ץ כׇּל־בָּשָׂר֙ בָּ֣א לְפָנַ֔י כִּֽי־מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֛רֶץ חָמָ֖ס מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְהִנְנִ֥י מַשְׁחִיתָ֖ם אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: God said to Noah, “I have decided to put an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with lawlessness because of them: I am about to destroy them with the earth.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim lenocha kets khׇl-vashar va lefanay khiy-maleah haarets chamas mifeneyhem vehineniy mashechiytam et-haarets

Hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ תֵּבַ֣ת עֲצֵי־גֹ֔פֶר קִנִּ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֶת־הַתֵּבָ֑ה וְכָֽפַרְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛הּ מִבַּ֥יִת וּמִח֖וּץ בַּכֹּֽפֶר׃
Translated: Make yourself an ark of gopher wood; make it an ark with compartments, and cover it inside and out with pitch.
Transliteration: asheh lekha tevat atsey-gofer kiniym taasheh et-hatevah vekhafareta otah mivayiit umichuts vakhofer

Hebrew: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּֽעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֹתָ֑הּ שְׁלֹ֧שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אַמָּ֗ה אֹ֚רֶךְ הַתֵּבָ֔ה חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים אַמָּה֙ רׇחְבָּ֔הּ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אַמָּ֖ה קוֹמָתָֽהּ׃
Translated: This is how you shall make it: the length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.
Transliteration: vezeh asher taasheh otah shelosh mevot amah orekhe hatevah chamishiym amah rׇchevah usheloshiym amah kvomatah

Hebrew: צֹ֣הַר ׀ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לַתֵּבָ֗ה וְאֶל־אַמָּה֙ תְּכַלֶּ֣נָּה מִלְמַ֔עְלָה וּפֶ֥תַח הַתֵּבָ֖ה בְּצִדָּ֣הּ תָּשִׂ֑ים תַּחְתִּיִּ֛ם שְׁנִיִּ֥ם וּשְׁלִשִׁ֖ים תַּֽעֲשֶֽׂהָ׃
Translated: Make an opening for daylight in the ark, and terminate it within a cubit of the top. Put the entrance to the ark in its side; make it with bottom, second, and third decks.
Transliteration: tsohar taasheh latevah veel-amah tekhalenah milemaelah ufetach hatevah vetsidah tashiym tachetiyim sheniyim ushelishiym taasheha

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא אֶת־הַמַּבּ֥וּל מַ֙יִם֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לְשַׁחֵ֣ת כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁר־בּוֹ֙ ר֣וּחַ חַיִּ֔ים מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־בָּאָ֖רֶץ יִגְוָֽע׃
Translated: “For My part, I am about to bring the Flood—waters upon the earth—to destroy all flesh under the sky in which there is breath of life; everything on earth shall perish.
Transliteration: vaaniy hineniy meviy et-hamavul mayiim al-haarets leshachet khׇl-vashar asher-vvo rucha chayiym mitachat hashamayiim khol asher-vaarets yigeva

Hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֥י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וּבָאתָ֙ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֔ה אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֛יךָ וְאִשְׁתְּךָ֥ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנֶ֖יךָ אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated: But I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall enter the ark, with your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives.
Transliteration: vahakimotiy et-veriytiy itakhe uvata el-hatevah atah uvaneykha veishetekha uneshey-vaneykha itakhe

Hebrew: וּמִכׇּל־הָ֠חַ֠י מִֽכׇּל־בָּשָׂ֞ר שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל תָּבִ֥יא אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֖ה לְהַחֲיֹ֣ת אִתָּ֑ךְ זָכָ֥ר וּנְקֵבָ֖ה יִֽהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: And of all that lives, of all flesh, you shall take two of each into the ark to keep alive with you; they shall be male and female.
Transliteration: umikhׇl-hachay mikhׇl-vashar shenayiim mikhol taviy el-hatevah lehachayot itakhe zakhar unekevah yiheyu

Hebrew: מֵהָע֣וֹף לְמִינֵ֗הוּ וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ מִכֹּ֛ל רֶ֥מֶשׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֖ה לְמִינֵ֑הוּ שְׁנַ֧יִם מִכֹּ֛ל יָבֹ֥אוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ לְהַֽחֲיֽוֹת׃
Translated: From birds of every kind, cattle of every kind, every kind of creeping thing on earth, two of each shall come to you to stay alive.
Transliteration: mehavof lemiynehu umin-havehemah lemiynah mikhol remesh haadamah lemiynehu shenayiim mikhol yavou eleykha lehachayvot

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה קַח־לְךָ֗ מִכׇּל־מַֽאֲכָל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵֽאָכֵ֔ל וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֛ וְלָהֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָֽה׃
Translated: For your part, take of everything that is eaten and store it away, to serve as food for you and for them.”
Transliteration: veatah kach-lekha mikhׇl-maakhal asher eiakhel veasafeta eleykha vehayah lekha velahem leׇkhelah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ נֹ֑חַ כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: Noah did so; just as God commanded him, so he did.
Transliteration: vayaash nocha khekhol asher tsivah otvo Elohim khen ashah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ לְנֹ֔חַ בֹּֽא־אַתָּ֥ה וְכׇל־בֵּיתְךָ֖ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה כִּֽי־אֹתְךָ֥ רָאִ֛יתִי צַדִּ֥יק לְפָנַ֖י בַּדּ֥וֹר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Noah, “Go into the ark, with all your household, for you alone have I found righteous before Me in this generation.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah lenocha vo-atah vekhׇl-veytekha el-hatevah khiy-otekha raiytiy tsadiyk lefanay vadvor hazeh

Hebrew: מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הַבְּהֵמָ֣ה הַטְּהוֹרָ֗ה תִּֽקַּח־לְךָ֛ שִׁבְעָ֥ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ וְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֡ה אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹ֣א טְהֹרָ֥ה הִ֛וא שְׁנַ֖יִם אִ֥ישׁ וְאִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Of every pure animal you shall take seven pairs, males and their mates, and of every animal that is not pure, two, a male and its mate;
Transliteration: mikhol havehemah hatehvorah tikach-lekha shiveah shiveah iysh veishetvo umin-havehemah asher lo tehorah hiv shenayiim iysh veishetvo

Hebrew: גַּ֣ם מֵע֧וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם שִׁבְעָ֥ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה זָכָ֣ר וּנְקֵבָ֑ה לְחַיּ֥וֹת זֶ֖רַע עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: of the birds of the sky also, seven pairs, male and female, to keep seed alive upon all the earth.
Transliteration: gam mevof hashamayiim shiveah shiveah zakhar unekevah lechayyvot zera al-feney khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: כִּי֩ לְיָמִ֨ים ע֜וֹד שִׁבְעָ֗ה אָֽנֹכִי֙ מַמְטִ֣יר עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָ֑יְלָה וּמָחִ֗יתִי אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַיְקוּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתִי מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: For in seven days’ time I will make it rain upon the earth, forty days and forty nights, and I will blot out from the earth all existence that I created.”
Transliteration: khiy leyamiym vod shiveah anokhiy mametiyr al-haarets arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah umachiytiy et-khׇl-hayekum asher ashiytiy meal feney haadamah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ נֹ֑חַ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And Noah did just as יהוה commanded him.
Transliteration: vayaash nocha khekhol asher-tsivahu yehovah

Hebrew: וְנֹ֕חַ בֶּן־שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וְהַמַּבּ֣וּל הָיָ֔ה מַ֖יִם עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Noah was six hundred years old when the Flood came, waters upon the earth.
Transliteration: venocha ven-shesh mevot shanah vehamavul hayah mayiim al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣בֹא נֹ֗חַ וּ֠בָנָ֠יו וְאִשְׁתּ֧וֹ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֛יו אִתּ֖וֹ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה מִפְּנֵ֖י מֵ֥י הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
Translated: Noah, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, went into the ark because of the waters of the Flood.
Transliteration: vayavo nocha uvanayv veishetvo uneshey-vanayv itvo el-hatevah mifeney mey hamavul

Hebrew: מִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ הַטְּהוֹרָ֔ה וּמִ֨ן־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵינֶ֖נָּה טְהֹרָ֑ה וּמִ֨ן־הָע֔וֹף וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־רֹמֵ֖שׂ עַל־הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: Of the pure animals, of the animals that are not pure, of the birds, and of everything that creeps on the ground,
Transliteration: min-havehemah hatehvorah umin-havehemah asher eynenah tehorah umin-havof vekhol asher-romesh al-haadamah

Hebrew: שְׁנַ֨יִם שְׁנַ֜יִם בָּ֧אוּ אֶל־נֹ֛חַ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֖ה זָכָ֣ר וּנְקֵבָ֑ה כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־נֹֽחַ׃
Translated: two of each, male and female, came to Noah into the ark, as God had commanded Noah.
Transliteration: shenayiim shenayiim vau el-nocha el-hatevah zakhar unekevah khaasher tsivah Elohim et-nocha

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י לְשִׁבְעַ֣ת הַיָּמִ֑ים וּמֵ֣י הַמַּבּ֔וּל הָי֖וּ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And on the seventh day the waters of the Flood came upon the earth.
Transliteration: vayehiy leshiveat hayamiym umey hamavul hayu al-haarets

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֨ת שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֤וֹת שָׁנָה֙ לְחַיֵּי־נֹ֔חַ בַּחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָֽה־עָשָׂ֥ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה נִבְקְעוּ֙ כׇּֽל־מַעְיְנֹת֙ תְּה֣וֹם רַבָּ֔ה וַאֲרֻבֹּ֥ת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם נִפְתָּֽחוּ׃
Translated:
In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day
All the fountains of the great deep burst apart,
And the floodgates of the sky broke open.
Transliteration: vishenat shesh-mevot shanah lechayey-nocha vachodesh hasheniy veshiveah-ashar yvom lachodesh vayyvom hazeh nivekeu khׇl-maeyenot tehvom ravah vaaruvot hashamayiim nifetachu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י הַגֶּ֖שֶׁם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: (The rain fell on the earth forty days and forty nights.)
Transliteration: vayehiy hageshem al-haarets arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah

Hebrew: בְּעֶ֨צֶם הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ בָּ֣א נֹ֔חַ וְשֵׁם־וְחָ֥ם וָיֶ֖פֶת בְּנֵי־נֹ֑חַ וְאֵ֣שֶׁת נֹ֗חַ וּשְׁלֹ֧שֶׁת נְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֛יו אִתָּ֖ם אֶל־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
Translated: That same day Noah and Noah’s sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth, went into the ark, with Noah’s wife and the three wives of his sons—
Transliteration: veetsem hayyvom hazeh va nocha veshem-vecham vayefet veney-nocha veeshet nocha usheloshet neshey-vanayv itam el-hatevah

Hebrew: הֵ֜מָּה וְכׇל־הַֽחַיָּ֣ה לְמִינָ֗הּ וְכׇל־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ לְמִינָ֔הּ וְכׇל־הָרֶ֛מֶשׂ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וְכׇל־הָע֣וֹף לְמִינֵ֔הוּ כֹּ֖ל צִפּ֥וֹר כׇּל־כָּנָֽף׃
Translated: they and all beasts of every kind, all cattle of every kind, all creatures of every kind that creep on the earth, and all birds of every kind, every bird, every winged thing.
Transliteration: hemah vekhׇl-hachayah lemiynah vekhׇl-havehemah lemiynah vekhׇl-haremesh haromesh al-haarets lemiynehu vekhׇl-havof lemiynehu khol tsifvor khׇl-khanaf

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־נֹ֖חַ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֑ה שְׁנַ֤יִם שְׁנַ֙יִם֙ מִכׇּל־הַבָּשָׂ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ ר֥וּחַ חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: They came to Noah into the ark, two each of all flesh in which there was breath of life.
Transliteration: vayavou el-nocha el-hatevah shenayiim shenayiim mikhׇl-havashar asher-vvo rucha chayiym

Hebrew: וְהַבָּאִ֗ים זָכָ֨ר וּנְקֵבָ֤ה מִכׇּל־בָּשָׂר֙ בָּ֔אוּ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּסְגֹּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּֽעֲדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Thus they that entered comprised male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him. And יהוה shut him in.
Transliteration: vehavaiym zakhar unekevah mikhׇl-vashar vau khaasher tsivah otvo Elohim vayisegor yehovah vaadvo

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֧י הַמַּבּ֛וּל אַרְבָּעִ֥ים י֖וֹם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּרְבּ֣וּ הַמַּ֗יִם וַיִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־הַתֵּבָ֔ה וַתָּ֖רׇם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: The Flood continued forty days on the earth, and the waters increased and raised the ark so that it rose above the earth.
Transliteration: vayehiy hamavul arevaiym yvom al-haarets vayirevu hamayiim vayisheu et-hatevah vatarׇm meal haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּגְבְּר֥וּ הַמַּ֛יִם וַיִּרְבּ֥וּ מְאֹ֖ד עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ הַתֵּבָ֖ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: The waters swelled and increased greatly upon the earth, and the ark drifted upon the waters.
Transliteration: vayigeveru hamayiim vayirevu meod al-haarets vatelekhe hatevah al-feney hamayiim

Hebrew: וְהַמַּ֗יִם גָּ֥בְר֛וּ מְאֹ֥ד מְאֹ֖ד עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיְכֻסּ֗וּ כׇּל־הֶֽהָרִים֙ הַגְּבֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: When the waters had swelled much more upon the earth, all the highest mountains everywhere under the sky were covered.
Transliteration: vehamayiim gaveru meod meod al-haarets vayekhusu khׇl-hehariym hagevohiym asher-tachat khׇl-hashamayiim

Hebrew: חֲמֵ֨שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה אַמָּה֙ מִלְמַ֔עְלָה גָּבְר֖וּ הַמָּ֑יִם וַיְכֻסּ֖וּ הֶהָרִֽים׃
Translated: Fifteen cubits higher did the waters swell, as the mountains were covered.
Transliteration: chamesh eshereh amah milemaelah gaveru hamayiim vayekhusu hehariym

Hebrew: וַיִּגְוַ֞ע כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֣ר ׀ הָרֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ בָּע֤וֹף וּבַבְּהֵמָה֙ וּבַ֣חַיָּ֔ה וּבְכׇל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכֹ֖ל הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: And all flesh that stirred on earth perished—birds, cattle, beasts, and all the things that swarmed upon the earth, and all humankind.
Transliteration: vayigeva khׇl-vashar haromesh al-haarets vavof uvavehemah uvachayah uvekhׇl-hasherets hashorets al-haarets vekhol haadam

Hebrew: כֹּ֡ל אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁמַת־ר֨וּחַ חַיִּ֜ים בְּאַפָּ֗יו מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֶּחָֽרָבָ֖ה מֵֽתוּ׃
Translated: All in whose nostrils was the merest breath of life, all that was on dry land, died.
Transliteration: khol asher nishemat-rucha chayiym veafayv mikhol asher vecharavah metu

Hebrew: וַיִּ֜מַח אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַיְק֣וּם ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֲדָמָ֗ה מֵאָדָ֤ם עַד־בְּהֵמָה֙ עַד־רֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ וְעַד־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיִּמָּח֖וּ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּשָּׁ֧אֶר אַךְ־נֹ֛חַ וַֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בַּתֵּבָֽה׃
Translated: All existence on earth was blotted out—humans, cattle, creeping things, and birds of the sky; they were blotted out from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those with him in the ark.
Transliteration: vayimach et-khׇl-hayekum asher al-feney haadamah meadam ad-vehemah ad-remesh vead-vof hashamayiim vayimachu min-haarets vayishaer akhe-nocha vaasher itvo vatevah

Hebrew: וַיִּגְבְּר֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת יֽוֹם׃
Translated: And when the waters had swelled on the earth one hundred and fifty days,
Transliteration: vayigeveru hamayiim al-haarets chamishiym umeat yvom

Hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֤ר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־נֹ֔חַ וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַֽחַיָּה֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בַּתֵּבָ֑ה וַיַּעֲבֵ֨ר אֱלֹהִ֥ים ר֙וּחַ֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיָּשֹׁ֖כּוּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: God remembered Noah and all the beasts and all the cattle that were with him in the ark, and God caused a wind to blow across the earth, and the waters subsided.
Transliteration: vayizekhor Elohim et-nocha veet khׇl-hachayah veet-khׇl-havehemah asher itvo vatevah vayaaver Elohim rucha al-haarets vayashokhu hamayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּסָּֽכְרוּ֙ מַעְיְנֹ֣ת תְּה֔וֹם וַֽאֲרֻבֹּ֖ת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיִּכָּלֵ֥א הַגֶּ֖שֶׁם מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: The fountains of the deep and the floodgates of the sky were stopped up, and the rain from the sky was held back;
Transliteration: vayisakheru maeyenot tehvom vaaruvot hashamayiim vayikhale hageshem min-hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֧בוּ הַמַּ֛יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָ֖רֶץ הָל֣וֹךְ וָשׁ֑וֹב וַיַּחְסְר֣וּ הַמַּ֔יִם מִקְצֵ֕ה חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת יֽוֹם׃
Translated: the waters then receded steadily from the earth. At the end of one hundred and fifty days the waters diminished,
Transliteration: vayashuvu hamayiim meal haarets halvokhe vashvov vayacheseru hamayiim miketseh chamishiym umeat yvom

Hebrew: וַתָּ֤נַח הַתֵּבָה֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָה־עָשָׂ֥ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ עַ֖ל הָרֵ֥י אֲרָרָֽט׃
Translated: so that in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
Transliteration: vatanach hatevah vachodesh hasheviyiy veshiveah-ashar yvom lachodesh al harey ararat

Hebrew: וְהַמַּ֗יִם הָיוּ֙ הָל֣וֹךְ וְחָס֔וֹר עַ֖ד הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽעֲשִׂירִ֑י בָּֽעֲשִׂירִי֙ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ נִרְא֖וּ רָאשֵׁ֥י הֶֽהָרִֽים׃
Translated: The waters went on diminishing until the tenth month; in the tenth month, on the first of the month, the tops of the mountains became visible.
Transliteration: vehamayiim hayu halvokhe vechasvor ad hachodesh haashiyriy vaashiyriy veechad lachodesh nireu rashey hehariym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֑וֹם וַיִּפְתַּ֣ח נֹ֔חַ אֶת־חַלּ֥וֹן הַתֵּבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: At the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets arevaiym yvom vayifetach nocha et-chalvon hatevah asher ashah

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֖ח אֶת־הָֽעֹרֵ֑ב וַיֵּצֵ֤א יָצוֹא֙ וָשׁ֔וֹב עַד־יְבֹ֥שֶׁת הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: and sent out the raven; it went to and fro until the waters had dried up from the earth.
Transliteration: vayeshalach et-haorev vayetse yatsvo vashvov ad-yevoshet hamayiim meal haarets

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֖ה מֵאִתּ֑וֹ לִרְאוֹת֙ הֲקַ֣לּוּ הַמַּ֔יִם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: Then he sent out the dove to see whether the waters had decreased from the surface of the ground.
Transliteration: vayeshalach et-hayyvonah meitvo lirevot hakalu hamayiim meal feney haadamah

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־מָצְאָה֩ הַיּוֹנָ֨ה מָנ֜וֹחַ לְכַף־רַגְלָ֗הּ וַתָּ֤שׇׁב אֵלָיו֙ אֶל־הַתֵּבָ֔ה כִּי־מַ֖יִם עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָדוֹ֙ וַיִּקָּחֶ֔הָ וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתָ֛הּ אֵלָ֖יו אֶל־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
Translated: But the dove could not find a resting place for its foot, and returned to him to the ark, for there was water over all the earth. So putting out his hand, he took it into the ark with him.
Transliteration: velo-matseah hayyvonah manvocha lekhaf-ragelah vatashׇv elayv el-hatevah khiy-mayiim al-feney khׇl-haarets vayishelach yadvo vayikacheha vayave otah elayv el-hatevah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣חֶל ע֔וֹד שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֛סֶף שַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֖ה מִן־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
Translated: He waited another seven days, and again sent out the dove from the ark.
Transliteration: vayachel vod shiveat yamiym acheriym vayosef shalach et-hayyvonah min-hatevah

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֨א אֵלָ֤יו הַיּוֹנָה֙ לְעֵ֣ת עֶ֔רֶב וְהִנֵּ֥ה עֲלֵה־זַ֖יִת טָרָ֣ף בְּפִ֑יהָ וַיֵּ֣דַע נֹ֔חַ כִּי־קַ֥לּוּ הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֥ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: The dove came back to him toward evening, and there in its bill was a plucked-off olive leaf! Then Noah knew that the waters had decreased on the earth.
Transliteration: vatavo elayv hayyvonah leet erev vehineh aleh-zayiit taraf vefiyha vayeda nocha khiy-kalu hamayiim meal haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּיָּ֣חֶל ע֔וֹד שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וַיְשַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הַיּוֹנָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יָסְפָ֥ה שׁוּב־אֵלָ֖יו עֽוֹד׃
Translated: He waited still another seven days and sent the dove forth; and it did not return to him any more.
Transliteration: vayiyachel vod shiveat yamiym acheriym vayeshalach et-hayyvonah velo-yasefah shuv-elayv vod

Hebrew: וַ֠יְהִ֠י בְּאַחַ֨ת וְשֵׁשׁ־מֵא֜וֹת שָׁנָ֗ה בָּֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֔דֶשׁ חָֽרְב֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּ֤סַר נֹ֙חַ֙ אֶת־מִכְסֵ֣ה הַתֵּבָ֔ה וַיַּ֕רְא וְהִנֵּ֥ה חָֽרְב֖וּ פְּנֵ֥י הָֽאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: In the six hundred and first year, in the first month, on the first of the month, the waters began to dry from the earth; and when Noah removed the covering of the ark, he saw that the surface of the ground was drying.
Transliteration: vayehiy veachat veshesh-mevot shanah varishvon veechad lachodesh charevu hamayiim meal haarets vayasar nocha et-mikheseh hatevah vayare vehineh charevu feney haadamah

Hebrew: וּבַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י בְּשִׁבְעָ֧ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ יָבְשָׁ֖ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: And in the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.
Transliteration: uvachodesh hasheniy veshiveah veesheriym yvom lachodesh yaveshah haarets {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־נֹ֥חַ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: God spoke to Noah, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver Elohim el-nocha lemor

Hebrew: צֵ֖א מִן־הַתֵּבָ֑ה אַתָּ֕ה וְאִשְׁתְּךָ֛ וּבָנֶ֥יךָ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנֶ֖יךָ אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated: “Come out of the ark, together with your wife, your sons, and your sons’ wives.
Transliteration: tse min-hatevah atah veishetekha uvaneykha uneshey-vaneykha itakhe

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַחַיָּ֨ה אֲשֶֽׁר־אִתְּךָ֜ מִכׇּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר בָּע֧וֹף וּבַבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּבְכׇל־הָרֶ֛מֶשׂ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ (הוצא) [הַיְצֵ֣א] אִתָּ֑ךְ וְשָֽׁרְצ֣וּ בָאָ֔רֶץ וּפָר֥וּ וְרָב֖וּ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Bring out with you every living thing of all flesh that is with you: birds, animals, and everything that creeps on earth; and let them swarm on the earth and be fertile and increase on earth.”
Transliteration: khׇl-hachayah asher-itekha mikhׇl-vashar vavof uvavehemah uvekhׇl-haremesh haromesh al-haarets (hvts) [hayetse] itakhe vesharetsu vaarets ufaru veravu al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖צֵא־נֹ֑חַ וּבָנָ֛יו וְאִשְׁתּ֥וֹ וּנְשֵֽׁי־בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Noah came out, together with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives.
Transliteration: vayetse-nocha uvanayv veishetvo uneshey-vanayv itvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַֽחַיָּ֗ה כׇּל־הָרֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ וְכׇל־הָע֔וֹף כֹּ֖ל רוֹמֵ֣שׂ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם יָצְא֖וּ מִן־הַתֵּבָֽה׃
Translated: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, everything that stirs on earth came out of the ark by families.
Transliteration: khׇl-hachayah khׇl-haremesh vekhׇl-havof khol rvomesh al-haarets lemishefechoteyhem yatseu min-hatevah

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן נֹ֛חַ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֞ח מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הַבְּהֵמָ֣ה הַטְּהֹרָ֗ה וּמִכֹּל֙ הָע֣וֹף הַטָּה֔וֹר וַיַּ֥עַל עֹלֹ֖ת בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Then Noah built an altar to יהוה and, taking of every pure animal and of every pure bird, he offered burnt offerings on the altar.
Transliteration: vayiven nocha mizevecha layhovah vayikach mikhol havehemah hatehorah umikhol havof hatahvor vayaal olot vamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣רַח יְהֹוָה֮ אֶת־רֵ֣יחַ הַנִּיחֹ֒חַ֒ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־לִבּ֗וֹ לֹֽא־אֹ֠סִ֠ף לְקַלֵּ֨ל ע֤וֹד אֶת־הָֽאֲדָמָה֙ בַּעֲב֣וּר הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֠י יֵ֣צֶר לֵ֧ב הָאָדָ֛ם רַ֖ע מִנְּעֻרָ֑יו וְלֹֽא־אֹסִ֥ף ע֛וֹד לְהַכּ֥וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־חַ֖י כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
Translated: יהוה smelled the pleasing odor, and יהוה resolved: “Never again will I doom the earth because of humankind, since the devisings of the human mind are evil from youth; nor will I ever again destroy every living being, as I have done.
Transliteration: vayarach yehovah et-reycha haniychocha vayomer yehovah el-livvo lo-osif lekalel vod et-haadamah vaavur haadam khiy eitser lev haadam ra mineurayv velo-osif vod lehakhvot et-khׇl-chay khaasher ashiytiy

Hebrew: עֹ֖ד כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ זֶ֡רַע וְ֠קָצִ֠יר וְקֹ֨ר וָחֹ֜ם וְקַ֧יִץ וָחֹ֛רֶף וְי֥וֹם וָלַ֖יְלָה לֹ֥א יִשְׁבֹּֽתוּ׃
Translated:
So long as the earth endures,
Seedtime and harvest,
Cold and heat,
Summer and winter,
Day and night
Shall not cease.”
Transliteration: od khׇl-yemey haarets zera vekatsiyr vekor vachom vekayiits vachoref veyvom valayelah lo yishevotu

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶת־נֹ֖חַ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֧אמֶר לָהֶ֛ם פְּר֥וּ וּרְב֖וּ וּמִלְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fertile and increase, and fill the earth.
Transliteration: vayevarekhe Elohim et-nocha veet-vanayv vayomer lahem feru urevu umileu et-haarets

Hebrew: וּמוֹרַאֲכֶ֤ם וְחִתְּכֶם֙ יִֽהְיֶ֔ה עַ֚ל כׇּל־חַיַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּרְמֹ֧שׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֛ה וּֽבְכׇל־דְּגֵ֥י הַיָּ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶ֥ם נִתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: The fear and the dread of you shall be upon all the beasts of the earth and upon all the birds of the sky—everything with which the earth is astir—and upon all the fish of the sea; they are given into your hand.
Transliteration: umvoraakhem vechitekhem yiheyeh al khׇl-chayat haarets veal khׇl-vof hashamayiim vekhol asher tiremosh haadamah uvekhׇl-degey hayam veyedekhem nitanu

Hebrew: כׇּל־רֶ֙מֶשׂ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוּא־חַ֔י לָכֶ֥ם יִהְיֶ֖ה לְאׇכְלָ֑ה כְּיֶ֣רֶק עֵ֔שֶׂב נָתַ֥תִּי לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־כֹּֽל׃
Translated: Every creature that lives shall be yours to eat; as with the green grasses, I give you all these.
Transliteration: khׇl-remesh asher hu-chay lakhem yiheyeh leׇkhelah kheyerek eshev natatiy lakhem et-khol

Hebrew: אַךְ־בָּשָׂ֕ר בְּנַפְשׁ֥וֹ דָמ֖וֹ לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: You must not, however, eat flesh with its life-blood in it.
Transliteration: akhe-vashar venafeshvo damvo lo tokhelu

Hebrew: וְאַ֨ךְ אֶת־דִּמְכֶ֤ם לְנַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶם֙ אֶדְרֹ֔שׁ מִיַּ֥ד כׇּל־חַיָּ֖ה אֶדְרְשֶׁ֑נּוּ וּמִיַּ֣ד הָֽאָדָ֗ם מִיַּד֙ אִ֣ישׁ אָחִ֔יו אֶדְרֹ֖שׁ אֶת־נֶ֥פֶשׁ הָֽאָדָֽם׃
Translated: But for your own life-blood I will require a reckoning: I will require it of every beast; of humankind, too, will I require a reckoning for human life, of everyone for each other!
Transliteration: veakhe et-dimekhem lenafeshoteykhem ederosh miyad khׇl-chayah edereshenu umiyad haadam miyad iysh achiyv ederosh et-nefesh haadam

Hebrew: שֹׁפֵךְ֙ דַּ֣ם הָֽאָדָ֔ם בָּֽאָדָ֖ם דָּמ֣וֹ יִשָּׁפֵ֑ךְ כִּ֚י בְּצֶ֣לֶם אֱלֹהִ֔ים עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated:
Whoever sheds human blood,
By human [hands] shall that one’s blood be shed;
For in the image of God
Was humankind made.
Transliteration: shofekhe dam haadam vaadam damvo yishafekhe khiy vetselem Elohim ashah et-haadam

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֖ם פְּר֣וּ וּרְב֑וּ שִׁרְצ֥וּ בָאָ֖רֶץ וּרְבוּ־בָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Be fertile, then, and increase; abound on the earth and increase on it.”
Transliteration: veatem feru urevu shiretsu vaarets urevu-vah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־נֹ֔חַ וְאֶל־בָּנָ֥יו אִתּ֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And God said to Noah and to his sons with him,
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-nocha veel-vanayv itvo lemor

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֕י הִנְנִ֥י מֵקִ֛ים אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְאֶֽת־זַרְעֲכֶ֖ם אַֽחֲרֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: “I now establish My covenant with you and your offspring to come,
Transliteration: vaaniy hineniy mekiym et-veriytiy itekhem veet-zareakhem achareykhem

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־נֶ֤פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֔ם בָּע֧וֹף בַּבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּֽבְכׇל־חַיַּ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ אִתְּכֶ֑ם מִכֹּל֙ יֹצְאֵ֣י הַתֵּבָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל חַיַּ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: and with every living thing that is with you—birds, cattle, and every wild beast as well—all that have come out of the ark, every living thing on earth.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-nefesh hachayah asher itekhem vavof vavehemah uvekhׇl-chayat haarets itekhem mikhol yotseey hatevah lekhol chayat haarets

Hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֤י אֶת־בְּרִיתִי֙ אִתְּכֶ֔ם וְלֹֽא־יִכָּרֵ֧ת כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֛ר ע֖וֹד מִמֵּ֣י הַמַּבּ֑וּל וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה ע֛וֹד מַבּ֖וּל לְשַׁחֵ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: I will maintain My covenant with you: never again shall all flesh be cut off by the waters of a flood, and never again shall there be a flood to destroy the earth.”
Transliteration: vahakimotiy et-veriytiy itekhem velo-yikharet khׇl-vashar vod mimey hamavul velo-yiheyeh vod mavul leshachet haarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים זֹ֤את אֽוֹת־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֣י נֹתֵ֗ן בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֛ין כׇּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֑ם לְדֹרֹ֖ת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: God further said, “This is the sign that I set for the covenant between Me and you, and every living creature with you, for all ages to come.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim zot vot-haveriyt asher-aniy noten veyniy uveyneykhem uveyn khׇl-nefesh chayah asher itekhem ledorot volam
