Hebrew: אֶת־קַשְׁתִּ֕י נָתַ֖תִּי בֶּֽעָנָ֑ן וְהָֽיְתָה֙ לְא֣וֹת בְּרִ֔ית בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵ֥ין הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: I have set My bow in the clouds, and it shall serve as a sign of the covenant between Me and the earth.
Transliteration: et-kashetiy natatiy veanan vehayetah levot veriyt veyniy uveyn haarets

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה בְּעַֽנְנִ֥י עָנָ֖ן עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְנִרְאֲתָ֥ה הַקֶּ֖שֶׁת בֶּעָנָֽן׃
Translated: When I bring clouds over the earth, and the bow appears in the clouds,
Transliteration: vehayah veaneniy anan al-haarets venireatah hakeshet veanan

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתִּ֣י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֤ר בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֛ין כׇּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ חַיָּ֖ה בְּכׇל־בָּשָׂ֑ר וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֨ה ע֤וֹד הַמַּ֙יִם֙ לְמַבּ֔וּל לְשַׁחֵ֖ת כׇּל־בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated: I will remember My covenant between Me and you and every living creature among all flesh, so that the waters shall never again become a flood to destroy all flesh.
Transliteration: vezakharetiy et-veriytiy asher veyniy uveyneykhem uveyn khׇl-nefesh chayah vekhׇl-vashar velo-yiheyeh vod hamayiim lemavul leshachet khׇl-vashar

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה הַקֶּ֖שֶׁת בֶּֽעָנָ֑ן וּרְאִיתִ֗יהָ לִזְכֹּר֙ בְּרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֔ם בֵּ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֔ים וּבֵין֙ כׇּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ חַיָּ֔ה בְּכׇל־בָּשָׂ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: When the bow is in the clouds, I will see it and remember the everlasting covenant between God and all living creatures, all flesh that is on earth.
Transliteration: vehayetah hakeshet veanan ureiytiyha lizekhor veriyt volam veyn Elohim uveyn khׇl-nefesh chayah vekhׇl-vashar asher al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־נֹ֑חַ זֹ֤את אֽוֹת־הַבְּרִית֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲקִמֹ֔תִי בֵּינִ֕י וּבֵ֥ין כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: That,” God said to Noah, “shall be the sign of the covenant that I have established between Me and all flesh that is on earth.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-nocha zot vot-haveriyt asher hakimotiy veyniy uveyn khׇl-vashar asher al-haarets {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֣וּ בְנֵי־נֹ֗חַ הַיֹּֽצְאִים֙ מִן־הַתֵּבָ֔ה שֵׁ֖ם וְחָ֣ם וָיָ֑פֶת וְחָ֕ם ה֖וּא אֲבִ֥י כְנָֽעַן׃
Translated: The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth—Ham being the father of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-nocha hayotseiym min-hatevah shem vecham vayafet vecham hu aviy khenaan

Hebrew: שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵי־נֹ֑חַ וּמֵאֵ֖לֶּה נָֽפְצָ֥ה כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these the whole world branched out.
Transliteration: sheloshah eleh veney-nocha umeeleh nafetsah khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥חֶל נֹ֖חַ אִ֣ישׁ הָֽאֲדָמָ֑ה וַיִּטַּ֖ע כָּֽרֶם׃
Translated: Noah, the tiller of the soil, was the first to plant a vineyard.
Transliteration: vayachel nocha iysh haadamah vayita kharem

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שְׁתְּ מִן־הַיַּ֖יִן וַיִּשְׁכָּ֑ר וַיִּתְגַּ֖ל בְּת֥וֹךְ אׇהֳלֹֽה׃
Translated: He drank of the wine and became drunk, and he uncovered himself within his tent.
Transliteration: vayeshete min-hayayiin vayishekhar vayitegal vetvokhe ׇholoh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗רְא חָ֚ם אֲבִ֣י כְנַ֔עַן אֵ֖ת עֶרְוַ֣ת אָבִ֑יו וַיַּגֵּ֥ד לִשְׁנֵֽי־אֶחָ֖יו בַּחֽוּץ׃
Translated: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father’s nakedness and told his two brothers outside.
Transliteration: vayare cham aviy khenaan et erevat aviyv vayaged lisheney-echayv vachuts

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ שֵׁ֨ם וָיֶ֜פֶת אֶת־הַשִּׂמְלָ֗ה וַיָּשִׂ֙ימוּ֙ עַל־שְׁכֶ֣ם שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ אֲחֹ֣רַנִּ֔ית וַיְכַסּ֕וּ אֵ֖ת עֶרְוַ֣ת אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וּפְנֵיהֶם֙ אֲחֹ֣רַנִּ֔ית וְעֶרְוַ֥ת אֲבִיהֶ֖ם לֹ֥א רָאֽוּ׃
Translated: But Shem and Japheth took a cloth, placed it against both their backs and, walking backward, they covered their father’s nakedness; their faces were turned the other way, so that they did not see their father’s nakedness.
Transliteration: vayikach shem vayefet et-hashimelah vayashiymu al-shekhem sheneyhem vayelekhu achoraniyt vayekhasu et erevat aviyhem ufeneyhem achoraniyt veerevat aviyhem lo rau

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥יקֶץ נֹ֖חַ מִיֵּינ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֕דַע אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥שָׂה ל֖וֹ בְּנ֥וֹ הַקָּטָֽן׃
Translated: When Noah woke up from his wine and learned what his youngest son had done to him,
Transliteration: vayiykets nocha miyeynvo vayeda et asher-ashah lvo venvo hakatan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָר֣וּר כְּנָ֑עַן עֶ֥בֶד עֲבָדִ֖ים יִֽהְיֶ֥ה לְאֶחָֽיו׃
Translated:
he said,
“Cursed be Canaan;
The lowest of slaves
Shall he be to his brothers.”
Transliteration: vayomer arur khenaan eved avadiym yiheyeh leechayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹ֣הֵי שֵׁ֑ם וִיהִ֥י כְנַ֖עַן עֶ֥בֶד לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
And he said,
“Blessed be יהוה,
The God of Shem;
Let Canaan be a slave to them.
Transliteration: vayomer varukhe yehovah elohey shem viyhiy khenaan eved lamvo

Hebrew: יַ֤פְתְּ אֱלֹהִים֙ לְיֶ֔פֶת וְיִשְׁכֹּ֖ן בְּאׇֽהֳלֵי־שֵׁ֑ם וִיהִ֥י כְנַ֖עַן עֶ֥בֶד לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
May God enlarge Japheth,
And let him dwell in the tents of Shem;
And let Canaan be a slave to them.”
Transliteration: yafete Elohim leyefet veyishekhon veׇholey-shem viyhiy khenaan eved lamvo

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־נֹ֖חַ אַחַ֣ר הַמַּבּ֑וּל שְׁלֹ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַֽחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Noah lived after the Flood 350 years.
Transliteration: vayechiy-nocha achar hamavul shelosh mevot shanah vachamishiym shanah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־יְמֵי־נֹ֔חַ תְּשַׁ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: And all the days of Noah came to 950 years; then he died.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-yemey-nocha tesha mevot shanah vachamishiym shanah vayamot {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת בְּנֵי־נֹ֔חַ שֵׁ֖ם חָ֣ם וָיָ֑פֶת וַיִּוָּלְד֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם בָּנִ֖ים אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
Translated: These are the lines of Shem, Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah: sons were born to them after the Flood.
Transliteration: veeleh tvoledot veney-nocha shem cham vayafet vayivaledu lahem vaniym achar hamavul

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יֶ֔פֶת גֹּ֣מֶר וּמָג֔וֹג וּמָדַ֖י וְיָוָ֣ן וְתֻבָ֑ל וּמֶ֖שֶׁךְ וְתִירָֽס׃
Translated: The descendants of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
Transliteration: veney yefet gomer umagvog umaday veyavan vetuval umeshekhe vetiyras

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י גֹּ֑מֶר אַשְׁכְּנַ֥ז וְרִיפַ֖ת וְתֹגַרְמָֽה׃
Translated: The descendants of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
Transliteration: uveney gomer ashekhenaz veriyfat vetogaremah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יָוָ֖ן אֱלִישָׁ֣ה וְתַרְשִׁ֑ישׁ כִּתִּ֖ים וְדֹדָנִֽים׃
Translated: The descendants of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, the Kittim and the Dodanim.
Transliteration: uveney yavan eliyshah vetareshiysh khitiym vedodaniym

Hebrew: מֵ֠אֵ֠לֶּה נִפְרְד֞וּ אִיֵּ֤י הַגּוֹיִם֙ בְּאַרְצֹתָ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ לִלְשֹׁנ֑וֹ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: From these the maritime nations branched out. [These are the descendants of Japheth] by their lands—each with its language—their clans and their nations.
Transliteration: meeleh niferedu iyey hagvoyim vearetsotam iysh lileshonvo lemishefechotam vegvoeihem

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י חָ֑ם כּ֥וּשׁ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם וּפ֥וּט וּכְנָֽעַן׃
Translated: The descendants of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Transliteration: uveney cham khush umitserayiim ufut ukhenaan

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י כ֔וּשׁ סְבָא֙ וַֽחֲוִילָ֔ה וְסַבְתָּ֥ה וְרַעְמָ֖ה וְסַבְתְּכָ֑א וּבְנֵ֥י רַעְמָ֖ה שְׁבָ֥א וּדְדָֽן׃
Translated: The descendants of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The descendants of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
Transliteration: uveney khush seva vachaviylah vesavetah veraemah vesavetekha uveney raemah sheva udedan

Hebrew: וְכ֖וּשׁ יָלַ֣ד אֶת־נִמְרֹ֑ד ה֣וּא הֵחֵ֔ל לִֽהְי֥וֹת גִּבֹּ֖ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Cush also begot Nimrod, who was the first mighty figure on earth.
Transliteration: vekhush yalad et-nimerod hu hechel liheyvot givor vaarets

Hebrew: הֽוּא־הָיָ֥ה גִבֹּֽר־צַ֖יִד לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֙ יֵֽאָמַ֔ר כְּנִמְרֹ֛ד גִּבּ֥וֹר צַ֖יִד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He was a mighty hunter by the grace of יהוה; hence the saying, “Like Nimrod a mighty hunter by the grace of יהוה.”
Transliteration: hu-hayah givor-tsayiid lifeney yehovah al-khen eiamar khenimerod givvor tsayiid lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י רֵאשִׁ֤ית מַמְלַכְתּוֹ֙ בָּבֶ֔ל וְאֶ֖רֶךְ וְאַכַּ֣ד וְכַלְנֵ֑ה בְּאֶ֖רֶץ שִׁנְעָֽר׃
Translated: The mainstays of his kingdom were Babylon, Erech, Accad, and Calneh in the land of Shinar.
Transliteration: vatehiy reshiyt mamelakhetvo vavel veerekhe veakhad vekhaleneh veerets shinear

Hebrew: מִן־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַהִ֖וא יָצָ֣א אַשּׁ֑וּר וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ אֶת־נִ֣ינְוֵ֔ה וְאֶת־רְחֹבֹ֥ת עִ֖יר וְאֶת־כָּֽלַח׃
Translated: From that land Asshur went forth and built Nineveh, Rehoboth-ir, Calah,
Transliteration: min-haarets hahiv yatsa ashur vayiven et-niyneveh veet-rechovot iyr veet-khalach

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־רֶ֔סֶן בֵּ֥ין נִֽינְוֵ֖ה וּבֵ֣ין כָּ֑לַח הִ֖וא הָעִ֥יר הַגְּדֹלָֽה׃
Translated: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah, that is the great city.
Transliteration: veet-resen veyn niyneveh uveyn khalach hiv haiyr hagedolah

Hebrew: וּמִצְרַ֡יִם יָלַ֞ד אֶת־לוּדִ֧ים וְאֶת־עֲנָמִ֛ים וְאֶת־לְהָבִ֖ים וְאֶת־נַפְתֻּחִֽים׃
Translated: And Mizraim begot the Ludim, the Anamim, the Lehabim, the Naphtuhim,
Transliteration: umitserayiim yalad et-ludiym veet-anamiym veet-lehaviym veet-nafetuchiym

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־פַּתְרֻסִ֞ים וְאֶת־כַּסְלֻחִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצְא֥וּ מִשָּׁ֛ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וְאֶת־כַּפְתֹּרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the Pathrusim, the Casluhim, and the Caphtorim, whence the Philistines came forth.
Transliteration: veet-faterusiym veet-khaseluchiym asher yatseu misham felishetiym veet-khafetoriym {s}

Hebrew: וּכְנַ֗עַן יָלַ֛ד אֶת־צִידֹ֥ן בְּכֹר֖וֹ וְאֶת־חֵֽת׃
Translated: Canaan begot Sidon, his first-born, and Heth;
Transliteration: ukhenaan yalad et-tsiydon vekhorvo veet-chet

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִי֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י וְאֵ֖ת הַגִּרְגָּשִֽׁי׃
Translated: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
Transliteration: veet-hayevusiy veet-haemoriy veet hagiregashiy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַֽחִוִּ֥י וְאֶת־הַֽעַרְקִ֖י וְאֶת־הַסִּינִֽי׃
Translated: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
Transliteration: veet-hachiviy veet-haarekiy veet-hasiyniy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָֽאַרְוָדִ֥י וְאֶת־הַצְּמָרִ֖י וְאֶת־הַֽחֲמָתִ֑י וְאַחַ֣ר נָפֹ֔צוּ מִשְׁפְּח֖וֹת הַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽי׃
Translated: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the clans of the Canaanites spread out.
Transliteration: veet-haarevadiy veet-hatsemariy veet-hachamatiy veachar nafotsu mishefechvot hakhenaaniy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י גְּב֤וּל הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ מִצִּידֹ֔ן בֹּאֲכָ֥ה גְרָ֖רָה עַד־עַזָּ֑ה בֹּאֲכָ֞ה סְדֹ֧מָה וַעֲמֹרָ֛ה וְאַדְמָ֥ה וּצְבֹיִ֖ם עַד־לָֽשַׁע׃
Translated: (The [original] Canaanite territory extended from Sidon as far as Gerar, near Gaza, and as far as Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, near Lasha.)
Transliteration: vayehiy gevul hakhenaaniy mitsiydon voakhah gerarah ad-azah voakhah sedomah vaamorah veademah utsevoyim ad-lasha

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־חָ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לִלְשֹֽׁנֹתָ֑ם בְּאַרְצֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: These are the descendants of Ham, according to their clans and languages, by their lands and nations.
Transliteration: eleh veney-cham lemishefechotam lileshonotam vearetsotam vegvoeihem {s}

Hebrew: וּלְשֵׁ֥ם יֻלַּ֖ד גַּם־ה֑וּא אֲבִי֙ כׇּל־בְּנֵי־עֵ֔בֶר אֲחִ֖י יֶ֥פֶת הַגָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: Sons were also born to Shem, ancestor of all the descendants of Eber and older brother of Japheth.
Transliteration: uleshem yulad gam-hu aviy khׇl-veney-ever achiy yefet hagadvol

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י שֵׁ֖ם עֵילָ֣ם וְאַשּׁ֑וּר וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד וְל֥וּד וַֽאֲרָֽם׃
Translated: The descendants of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.
Transliteration: veney shem eylam veashur vearefakheshad velud vaaram

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י אֲרָ֑ם ע֥וּץ וְח֖וּל וְגֶ֥תֶר וָמַֽשׁ׃
Translated: The descendants of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
Transliteration: uveney aram uts vechul vegeter vamash

Hebrew: וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד יָלַ֣ד אֶת־שָׁ֑לַח וְשֶׁ֖לַח יָלַ֥ד אֶת־עֵֽבֶר׃
Translated: Arpachshad begot Shelah, and Shelah begot Eber.
Transliteration: vearefakheshad yalad et-shalach veshelach yalad et-ever

Hebrew: וּלְעֵ֥בֶר יֻלַּ֖ד שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים שֵׁ֣ם הָֽאֶחָ֞ד פֶּ֗לֶג כִּ֤י בְיָמָיו֙ נִפְלְגָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו יׇקְטָֽן׃
Translated: Two sons were born to Eber: the name of the first was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided; and the name of his brother was Joktan.
Transliteration: uleever yulad sheney vaniym shem haechad feleg khiy veyamayv nifelegah haarets veshem achiyv yׇketan

Hebrew: וְיׇקְטָ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־אַלְמוֹדָ֖ד וְאֶת־שָׁ֑לֶף וְאֶת־חֲצַרְמָ֖וֶת וְאֶת־יָֽרַח׃
Translated: Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Transliteration: veyׇketan yalad et-alemvodad veet-shalef veet-chatsaremavet veet-yarach

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הֲדוֹרָ֥ם וְאֶת־אוּזָ֖ל וְאֶת־דִּקְלָֽה׃
Translated: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Transliteration: veet-hadvoram veet-uzal veet-dikelah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עוֹבָ֥ל וְאֶת־אֲבִֽימָאֵ֖ל וְאֶת־שְׁבָֽא׃
Translated: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
Transliteration: veet-voval veet-aviymael veet-sheva

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אוֹפִ֥ר וְאֶת־חֲוִילָ֖ה וְאֶת־יוֹבָ֑ב כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י יׇקְטָֽן׃
Translated: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the descendants of Joktan.
Transliteration: veet-vofir veet-chaviylah veet-yvovav khׇl-eleh veney yׇketan

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י מוֹשָׁבָ֖ם מִמֵּשָׁ֑א בֹּאֲכָ֥ה סְפָ֖רָה הַ֥ר הַקֶּֽדֶם׃
Translated: Their settlements extended from Mesha as far as Sephar, the hill country to the east.
Transliteration: vayehiy mvoshavam mimesha voakhah sefarah har hakedem

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־שֵׁ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לִלְשֹׁנֹתָ֑ם בְּאַרְצֹתָ֖ם לְגוֹיֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: These are the descendants of Shem according to their clans and languages, by their lands, according to their nations.
Transliteration: eleh veney-shem lemishefechotam lileshonotam vearetsotam legvoeihem

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֧ת בְּנֵי־נֹ֛חַ לְתוֹלְדֹתָ֖ם בְּגוֹיֵהֶ֑ם וּמֵאֵ֜לֶּה נִפְרְד֧וּ הַגּוֹיִ֛ם בָּאָ֖רֶץ אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃ {פ}
Translated: These are the groupings of Noah’s descendants, according to their origins, by their nations; and from these the nations branched out over the earth after the Flood.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot veney-nocha letvoledotam vegvoeihem umeeleh niferedu hagvoyim vaarets achar hamavul {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י כׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ שָׂפָ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת וּדְבָרִ֖ים אֲחָדִֽים׃
Translated: Everyone on earth had the same language and the same words.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-haarets shafah echat udevariym achadiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י בְּנׇסְעָ֣ם מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַֽיִּמְצְא֥וּ בִקְעָ֛ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ שִׁנְעָ֖ר וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: And as they migrated from the east, they came upon a valley in the land of Shinar and settled there.
Transliteration: vayehiy venׇseam mikedem vayimetseu vikeah veerets shinear vayeshevu sham

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵ֗הוּ הָ֚בָה נִלְבְּנָ֣ה לְבֵנִ֔ים וְנִשְׂרְפָ֖ה לִשְׂרֵפָ֑ה וַתְּהִ֨י לָהֶ֤ם הַלְּבֵנָה֙ לְאָ֔בֶן וְהַ֣חֵמָ֔ר הָיָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לַחֹֽמֶר׃
Translated: They said to one another, “Come, let us make bricks and burn them hard.”—Brick served them as stone, and bitumen served them as mortar.—
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh el-reehu havah nilevenah leveniym venisherefah lisherefah vatehiy lahem halevenah leaven vehachemar hayah lahem lachomer

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ הָ֣בָה ׀ נִבְנֶה־לָּ֣נוּ עִ֗יר וּמִגְדָּל֙ וְרֹאשׁ֣וֹ בַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנַֽעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֖נוּ שֵׁ֑ם פֶּן־נָפ֖וּץ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And they said, “Come, let us build us a city, and a tower with its top in the sky, to make a name for ourselves; else we shall be scattered all over the world.”
Transliteration: vayomeru havah niveneh-lanu iyr umigedal veroshvo vashamayiim venaasheh-lanu shem fen-nafuts al-feney khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣רֶד יְהֹוָ֔ה לִרְאֹ֥ת אֶת־הָעִ֖יר וְאֶת־הַמִּגְדָּ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: יהוה came down to look at the city and tower that humanity had built,
Transliteration: vayered yehovah lireot et-haiyr veet-hamigedal asher vanu veney haadam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה הֵ֣ן עַ֤ם אֶחָד֙ וְשָׂפָ֤ה אַחַת֙ לְכֻלָּ֔ם וְזֶ֖ה הַחִלָּ֣ם לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת וְעַתָּה֙ לֹֽא־יִבָּצֵ֣ר מֵהֶ֔ם כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָזְמ֖וּ לַֽעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated: and יהוה said, “If, as one people with one language for all, this is how they have begun to act, then nothing that they may propose to do will be out of their reach.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah hen am echad veshafah achat lekhulam vezeh hachilam laashvot veatah lo-yivatser mehem khol asher yazemu laashvot

Hebrew: הָ֚בָה נֵֽרְדָ֔ה וְנָבְלָ֥ה שָׁ֖ם שְׂפָתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ שְׂפַ֥ת רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: Let us, then, go down and confound their speech there, so that they shall not understand one another’s speech.”
Transliteration: havah neredah venavelah sham shefatam asher lo yishemeu iysh shefat reehu

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨פֶץ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֹתָ֛ם מִשָּׁ֖ם עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיַּחְדְּל֖וּ לִבְנֹ֥ת הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: Thus יהוה scattered them from there over the face of the whole earth; and they stopped building the city.
Transliteration: vayafets yehovah otam misham al-feney khׇl-haarets vayachedelu livenot haiyr

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֞ן קָרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ בָּבֶ֔ל כִּי־שָׁ֛ם בָּלַ֥ל יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׂפַ֣ת כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וּמִשָּׁם֙ הֱפִיצָ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־פְּנֵ֖י כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: That is why it was called Babel, because there יהוה confounded the speech of the whole earth; and from there יהוה scattered them over the face of the whole earth.
Transliteration: al-khen kara shemah vavel khiy-sham valal yehovah shefat khׇl-haarets umisham hefiytsam yehovah al-feney khׇl-haarets {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת שֵׁ֔ם שֵׁ֚ם בֶּן־מְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֔ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־אַרְפַּכְשָׁ֑ד שְׁנָתַ֖יִם אַחַ֥ר הַמַּבּֽוּל׃
Translated: This is the line of Shem. Shem was 100 years old when he begot Arpachshad, two years after the Flood.
Transliteration: eleh tvoledot shem shem ven-meat shanah vayyvoled et-arefakheshad shenatayiim achar hamavul

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֵׁ֗ם אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־אַרְפַּכְשָׁ֔ד חֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Arpachshad, Shem lived 500 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy-shem acharey hvoliydvo et-arefakheshad chamesh mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֣ד חַ֔י חָמֵ֥שׁ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־שָֽׁלַח׃
Translated: When Arpachshad had lived 35 years, he begot Shelah.
Transliteration: vearefakheshad chay chamesh usheloshiym shanah vayyvoled et-shalach

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י אַרְפַּכְשַׁ֗ד אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שֶׁ֔לַח שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Shelah, Arpachshad lived 403 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy arefakheshad acharey hvoliydvo et-shelach shalosh shaniym veareva mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וְשֶׁ֥לַח חַ֖י שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־עֵֽבֶר׃
Translated: When Shelah had lived 30 years, he begot Eber.
Transliteration: veshelach chay sheloshiym shanah vayyvoled et-ever

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־שֶׁ֗לַח אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־עֵ֔בֶר שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Eber, Shelah lived 403 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy-shelach acharey hvoliydvo et-ever shalosh shaniym veareva mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־עֵ֕בֶר אַרְבַּ֥ע וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־פָּֽלֶג׃
Translated: When Eber had lived 34 years, he begot Peleg.
Transliteration: vayechiy-ever areva usheloshiym shanah vayyvoled et-faleg

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־עֵ֗בֶר אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־פֶּ֔לֶג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Peleg, Eber lived 430 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy-ever acharey hvoliydvo et-feleg sheloshiym shanah veareva mevot shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־פֶ֖לֶג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־רְעֽוּ׃
Translated: When Peleg had lived 30 years, he begot Reu.
Transliteration: vayechiy-feleg sheloshiym shanah vayyvoled et-reu

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־פֶ֗לֶג אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־רְע֔וּ תֵּ֥שַׁע שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Reu, Peleg lived 209 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy-feleg acharey hvoliydvo et-reu tesha shaniym umatayiim shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י רְע֔וּ שְׁתַּ֥יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־שְׂרֽוּג׃
Translated: When Reu had lived 32 years, he begot Serug.
Transliteration: vayechiy reu shetayiim usheloshiym shanah vayyvoled et-sherug

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י רְע֗וּ אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־שְׂר֔וּג שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Serug, Reu lived 207 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy reu acharey hvoliydvo et-sherug sheva shaniym umatayiim shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֥י שְׂר֖וּג שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־נָחֽוֹר׃
Translated: When Serug had lived 30 years, he begot Nahor.
Transliteration: vayechiy sherug sheloshiym shanah vayyvoled et-nachvor

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י שְׂר֗וּג אַחֲרֵ֛י הוֹלִיד֥וֹ אֶת־נָח֖וֹר מָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Nahor, Serug lived 200 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy sherug acharey hvoliydvo et-nachvor matayiim shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י נָח֔וֹר תֵּ֥שַׁע וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֖וֹלֶד אֶת־תָּֽרַח׃
Translated: When Nahor had lived 29 years, he begot Terah.
Transliteration: vayechiy nachvor tesha veesheriym shanah vayyvoled et-tarach

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֣י נָח֗וֹר אַחֲרֵי֙ הוֹלִיד֣וֹ אֶת־תֶּ֔רַח תְּשַֽׁע־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה וּמְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֥וֹלֶד בָּנִ֖ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: After the birth of Terah, Nahor lived 119 years and begot sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayechiy nachvor acharey hvoliydvo et-terach tesha-eshereh shanah umeat shanah vayyvoled vaniym uvanvot {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְחִי־תֶ֖רַח שִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיּ֙וֹלֶד֙ אֶת־אַבְרָ֔ם אֶת־נָח֖וֹר וְאֶת־הָרָֽן׃
Translated: When Terah had lived 70 years, he begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
Transliteration: vayechiy-terach shiveiym shanah vayyvoled et-averam et-nachvor veet-haran

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ תּוֹלְדֹ֣ת תֶּ֔רַח תֶּ֚רַח הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־אַבְרָ֔ם אֶת־נָח֖וֹר וְאֶת־הָרָ֑ן וְהָרָ֖ן הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־לֽוֹט׃
Translated: Now this is the line of Terah: Terah begot Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begot Lot.
Transliteration: veeleh tvoledot terach terach hvoliyd et-averam et-nachvor veet-haran veharan hvoliyd et-lvot

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת הָרָ֔ן עַל־פְּנֵ֖י תֶּ֣רַח אָבִ֑יו בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מוֹלַדְתּ֖וֹ בְּא֥וּר כַּשְׂדִּֽים׃
Translated: Haran died in the lifetime of his father Terah, in his native land, Ur of the Chaldeans.
Transliteration: vayamׇt haran al-feney terach aviyv veerets mvoladetvo veur khashediym

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָ֧ם וְנָח֛וֹר לָהֶ֖ם נָשִׁ֑ים שֵׁ֤ם אֵֽשֶׁת־אַבְרָם֙ שָׂרָ֔י וְשֵׁ֤ם אֵֽשֶׁת־נָחוֹר֙ מִלְכָּ֔ה בַּת־הָרָ֥ן אֲבִֽי־מִלְכָּ֖ה וַֽאֲבִ֥י יִסְכָּֽה׃
Translated: Abram and Nahor took wives for themselves, the name of Abram’s wife being Sarai and that of Nahor’s wife Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah and Iscah.
Transliteration: vayikach averam venachvor lahem nashiym shem eshet-averam sharay veshem eshet-nachvor milekhah vat-haran aviy-milekhah vaaviy yisekhah

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֥י שָׂרַ֖י עֲקָרָ֑ה אֵ֥ין לָ֖הּ וָלָֽד׃
Translated: Now Sarai was barren, she had no child.
Transliteration: vatehiy sharay akarah eyn lah valad

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח תֶּ֜רַח אֶת־אַבְרָ֣ם בְּנ֗וֹ וְאֶת־ל֤וֹט בֶּן־הָרָן֙ בֶּן־בְּנ֔וֹ וְאֵת֙ שָׂרַ֣י כַּלָּת֔וֹ אֵ֖שֶׁת אַבְרָ֣ם בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּצְא֨וּ אִתָּ֜ם מֵא֣וּר כַּשְׂדִּ֗ים לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ עַד־חָרָ֖ן וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot the son of Haran, and his daughter-in-law Sarai, the wife of his son Abram, and they set out together from Ur of the Chaldeans for the land of Canaan; but when they had come as far as Haran, they settled there.
Transliteration: vayikach terach et-averam venvo veet-lvot ven-haran ven-venvo veet sharay khalatvo eshet averam venvo vayetseu itam meur khashediym lalekhet aretsah khenaan vayavou ad-charan vayeshevu sham

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ יְמֵי־תֶ֔רַח חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים וּמָאתַ֣יִם שָׁנָ֑ה וַיָּ֥מׇת תֶּ֖רַח בְּחָרָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: The days of Terah came to 205 years; and Terah died in Haran.
Transliteration: vayiheyu yemey-terach chamesh shaniym umatayiim shanah vayamׇt terach vecharan {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם לֶךְ־לְךָ֛ מֵאַרְצְךָ֥ וּמִמּֽוֹלַדְתְּךָ֖ וּמִבֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַרְאֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Abram, “Go forth from your native land and from your father’s house to the land that I will show you.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-averam lekhe-lekha mearetsekha umimvoladetekha umiveyt aviykha el-haarets asher areekha

Hebrew: וְאֶֽעֶשְׂךָ֙ לְג֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל וַאֲבָ֣רֶכְךָ֔ וַאֲגַדְּלָ֖ה שְׁמֶ֑ךָ וֶהְיֵ֖ה בְּרָכָֽה׃
Translated:
I will make of you a great nation,
And I will bless you;
I will make your name great,
And you shall be a blessing.
Transliteration: veeeshekha legvoy gadvol vaavarekhekha vaagadelah shemekha veheeih verakhah

Hebrew: וַאֲבָֽרְכָה֙ מְבָ֣רְכֶ֔יךָ וּמְקַלֶּלְךָ֖ אָאֹ֑ר וְנִבְרְכ֣וּ בְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated:
I will bless those who bless you
And curse the one who curses you;
And all the families of the earth
Shall bless themselves by you.”
Transliteration: vaavarekhah mevarekheykha umekalelekha aor veniverekhu vekha khol mishefechot haadamah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אַבְרָ֗ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ אִתּ֖וֹ ל֑וֹט וְאַבְרָ֗ם בֶּן־חָמֵ֤שׁ שָׁנִים֙ וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּצֵאת֖וֹ מֵחָרָֽן׃
Translated: Abram went forth as יהוה had commanded him, and Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he left Haran.
Transliteration: vayelekhe averam khaasher diver elayv yehovah vayelekhe itvo lvot veaveram ven-chamesh shaniym veshiveiym shanah vetsetvo mecharan

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אַבְרָם֩ אֶת־שָׂרַ֨י אִשְׁתּ֜וֹ וְאֶת־ל֣וֹט בֶּן־אָחִ֗יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־רְכוּשָׁם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָכָ֔שׁוּ וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֣וּ בְחָרָ֑ן וַיֵּצְא֗וּ לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: Abram took his wife Sarai and his brother’s son Lot, and all the wealth that they had amassed, and the persons that they had acquired in Haran; and they set out for the land of Canaan. When they arrived in the land of Canaan,
Transliteration: vayikach averam et-sharay ishetvo veet-lvot ven-achiyv veet-khׇl-rekhusham asher rakhashu veet-hanefesh asher-ashu vecharan vayetseu lalekhet aretsah khenaan vayavou aretsah khenaan

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר אַבְרָם֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ עַ֚ד מְק֣וֹם שְׁכֶ֔ם עַ֖ד אֵל֣וֹן מוֹרֶ֑ה וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י אָ֥ז בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Abram passed through the land as far as the site of Shechem, at the terebinth of Moreh. The Canaanites were then in the land.
Transliteration: vayaavor averam vaarets ad mekvom shekhem ad elvon mvoreh vehakhenaaniy az vaarets

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לְזַ֨רְעֲךָ֔ אֶתֵּ֖ן אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את וַיִּ֤בֶן שָׁם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לַיהֹוָ֖ה הַנִּרְאֶ֥ה אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: יהוה appeared to Abram and said, “I will assign this land to your offspring.” And he built an altar there to יהוה who had appeared to him.
Transliteration: vayera yehovah el-averam vayomer lezareakha eten et-haarets hazot vayiven sham mizevecha layhovah hanireeh elayv

Hebrew: וַיַּעְתֵּ֨ק מִשָּׁ֜ם הָהָ֗רָה מִקֶּ֛דֶם לְבֵֽית־אֵ֖ל וַיֵּ֣ט אׇהֳלֹ֑ה בֵּֽית־אֵ֤ל מִיָּם֙ וְהָעַ֣י מִקֶּ֔דֶם וַיִּֽבֶן־שָׁ֤ם מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּקְרָ֖א בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: From there he moved on to the hill country east of Bethel and pitched his tent, with Bethel on the west and Ai on the east; and he built there an altar to יהוה and invoked יהוה by name.
Transliteration: vayaetek misham haharah mikedem leveyt-el vayet ׇholoh veyt-el miyam vehaay mikedem vayiven-sham mizevecha layhovah vayikera veshem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֣ע אַבְרָ֔ם הָל֥וֹךְ וְנָס֖וֹעַ הַנֶּֽגְבָּה׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Abram journeyed by stages toward the Negeb.
Transliteration: vayisa averam halvokhe venasvoa hanegevah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י רָעָ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ וַיֵּ֨רֶד אַבְרָ֤ם מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ לָג֣וּר שָׁ֔ם כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: There was a famine in the land, and Abram went down to Egypt to sojourn there, for the famine was severe in the land.
Transliteration: vayehiy raav vaarets vayered averam mitserayemah lagur sham khiy-khaved haraav vaarets

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִקְרִ֖יב לָב֣וֹא מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־שָׂרַ֣י אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ הִנֵּה־נָ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֛י אִשָּׁ֥ה יְפַת־מַרְאֶ֖ה אָֽתְּ׃
Translated: As he was about to enter Egypt, he said to his wife Sarai, “I know what a beautiful woman you are.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher hikeriyv lavvo mitserayemah vayomer el-sharay ishetvo hineh-na yadaetiy khiy ishah yefat-mareeh ate

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־יִרְא֤וּ אֹתָךְ֙ הַמִּצְרִ֔ים וְאָמְר֖וּ אִשְׁתּ֣וֹ זֹ֑את וְהָרְג֥וּ אֹתִ֖י וְאֹתָ֥ךְ יְחַיּֽוּ׃
Translated: If the Egyptians see you, and think, ‘She is his wife,’ they will kill me and let you live.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yireu otakhe hamitseriym veameru ishetvo zot veharegu otiy veotakhe yechayyu

Hebrew: אִמְרִי־נָ֖א אֲחֹ֣תִי אָ֑תְּ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִֽיטַב־לִ֣י בַעֲבוּרֵ֔ךְ וְחָיְתָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י בִּגְלָלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Please say that you are my sister, that it may go well with me because of you, and that I may remain alive thanks to you.”
Transliteration: imeriy-na achotiy ate lemaan yiytav-liy vaavurekhe vechayetah nafeshiy vigelalekhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כְּב֥וֹא אַבְרָ֖ם מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיִּרְא֤וּ הַמִּצְרִים֙ אֶת־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־יָפָ֥ה הִ֖וא מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: When Abram entered Egypt, the Egyptians saw how very beautiful the woman was.
Transliteration: vayehiy khevvo averam mitserayemah vayireu hamitseriym et-haishah khiy-yafah hiv meod

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֹתָהּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַיְהַֽלְל֥וּ אֹתָ֖הּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַתֻּקַּ֥ח הָאִשָּׁ֖ה בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Pharaoh’s courtiers saw her and praised her to Pharaoh, and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s palace.
Transliteration: vayireu otah sharey fareoh vayehalelu otah el-fareoh vatukach haishah veyt fareoh

Hebrew: וּלְאַבְרָ֥ם הֵיטִ֖יב בַּעֲבוּרָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־ל֤וֹ צֹאן־וּבָקָר֙ וַחֲמֹרִ֔ים וַעֲבָדִים֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וַאֲתֹנֹ֖ת וּגְמַלִּֽים׃
Translated: And because of her, it went well with Abram; he acquired sheep, oxen, asses, male and female slaves, she-asses, and camels.
Transliteration: uleaveram heytiyv vaavurah vayehiy-lvo tson-uvakar vachamoriym vaavadiym ushefachot vaatonot ugemaliym

Hebrew: וַיְנַגַּ֨ע יְהֹוָ֧ה <small>׀</small> אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֛ה נְגָעִ֥ים גְּדֹלִ֖ים וְאֶת־בֵּית֑וֹ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר שָׂרַ֖י אֵ֥שֶׁת אַבְרָֽם׃
Translated: But יהוה afflicted Pharaoh and his household with mighty plagues on account of Sarai, the wife of Abram.
Transliteration: vayenaga yehovah <small></small> et-fareoh negaiym gedoliym veet-veytvo al-devar sharay eshet averam

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א פַרְעֹה֙ לְאַבְרָ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מַה־זֹּ֖את עָשִׂ֣יתָ לִּ֑י לָ֚מָּה לֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֔י כִּ֥י אִשְׁתְּךָ֖ הִֽוא׃
Translated: Pharaoh sent for Abram and said, “What is this you have done to me! Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?
Transliteration: vayikera fareoh leaveram vayomer mah-zot ashiyta liy lamah lo-higadeta liy khiy ishetekha hiv

Hebrew: לָמָ֤ה אָמַ֙רְתָּ֙ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֔וא וָאֶקַּ֥ח אֹתָ֛הּ לִ֖י לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנֵּ֥ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֖ קַ֥ח וָלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her as my wife? Now, here is your wife; take her and begone!”
Transliteration: lamah amareta achotiy hiv vaekach otah liy leishah veatah hineh ishetekha kach valekhe

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו עָלָ֛יו פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Pharaoh put agents in charge of him, and they sent him off with his wife and all that he possessed.
Transliteration: vayetsav alayv fareoh anashiym vayeshalechu otvo veet-ishetvo veet-khׇl-asher-lvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַל֩ אַבְרָ֨ם מִמִּצְרַ֜יִם ה֠וּא וְאִשְׁתּ֧וֹ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ וְל֥וֹט עִמּ֖וֹ הַנֶּֽגְבָּה׃
Translated: From Egypt, Abram went up into the Negeb, with his wife and all that he possessed, together with Lot.
Transliteration: vayaal averam mimitserayiim hu veishetvo vekhׇl-asher-lvo velvot imvo hanegevah

Hebrew: וְאַבְרָ֖ם כָּבֵ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד בַּמִּקְנֶ֕ה בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וּבַזָּהָֽב׃
Translated: Now Abram was very rich in cattle, silver, and gold.
Transliteration: veaveram khaved meod vamikeneh vakhesef uvazahav

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְמַסָּעָ֔יו מִנֶּ֖גֶב וְעַד־בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל עַד־הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁר־הָ֨יָה שָׁ֤ם אׇֽהֳלֹה֙ בַּתְּחִלָּ֔ה בֵּ֥ין בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל וּבֵ֥ין הָעָֽי׃
Translated: And he proceeded by stages from the Negeb as far as Bethel, to the place where his tent had been formerly, between Bethel and Ai,
Transliteration: vayelekhe lemasaayv minegev vead-veyt-el ad-hamakvom asher-hayah sham ׇholoh vatechilah veyn veyt-el uveyn haay

Hebrew: אֶל־מְקוֹם֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥שָׂה שָׁ֖ם בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֥א שָׁ֛ם אַבְרָ֖ם בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the site of the altar that he had built there at first; and there Abram invoked יהוה by name.
Transliteration: el-mekvom hamizevecha asher-ashah sham varishonah vayikera sham averam veshem yehovah

Hebrew: וְגַ֨ם־לְל֔וֹט הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ אֶת־אַבְרָ֑ם הָיָ֥ה צֹאן־וּבָקָ֖ר וְאֹהָלִֽים׃
Translated: Lot, who went with Abram, also had flocks and herds and tents,
Transliteration: vegam-lelvot haholekhe et-averam hayah tson-uvakar veohaliym

Hebrew: וְלֹא־נָשָׂ֥א אֹתָ֛ם הָאָ֖רֶץ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת יַחְדָּ֑ו כִּֽי־הָיָ֤ה רְכוּשָׁם֙ רָ֔ב וְלֹ֥א יָֽכְל֖וּ לָשֶׁ֥בֶת יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated: so that the land could not support them staying together; for their possessions were so great that they could not remain together.
Transliteration: velo-nasha otam haarets lashevet yachedav khiy-hayah rekhusham rav velo yakhelu lashevet yachedav

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־רִ֗יב בֵּ֚ין רֹעֵ֣י מִקְנֵֽה־אַבְרָ֔ם וּבֵ֖ין רֹעֵ֣י מִקְנֵה־ל֑וֹט וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י אָ֖ז יֹשֵׁ֥ב בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And there was quarreling between the herders of Abram’s cattle and those of Lot’s cattle.—The Canaanites and Perizzites were then dwelling in the land.—
Transliteration: vayehiy-riyv veyn roey mikeneh-averam uveyn roey mikeneh-lvot vehakhenaaniy vehaferiziy az yoshev vaarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָ֜ם אֶל־ל֗וֹט אַל־נָ֨א תְהִ֤י מְרִיבָה֙ בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֔ךָ וּבֵ֥ין רֹעַ֖י וּבֵ֣ין רֹעֶ֑יךָ כִּֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֥ים אַחִ֖ים אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated: Abram said to Lot, “Let there be no strife between you and me, between my herders and yours, for we are kin.
Transliteration: vayomer averam el-lvot al-na tehiy meriyvah veyniy uveynekha uveyn roay uveyn roeykha khiy-anashiym achiym anachenu

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֤א כׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ הִפָּ֥רֶד נָ֖א מֵעָלָ֑י אִם־הַשְּׂמֹ֣אל וְאֵימִ֔נָה וְאִם־הַיָּמִ֖ין וְאַשְׂמְאִֽילָה׃
Translated: Is not the whole land before you? Let us separate: if you go north, I will go south; and if you go south, I will go north.”
Transliteration: halo khׇl-haarets lefaneykha hifared na mealay im-hashemol veeyminah veim-hayamiyn veashemeiylah

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂא־ל֣וֹט אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־כׇּל־כִּכַּ֣ר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן כִּ֥י כֻלָּ֖הּ מַשְׁקֶ֑ה לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ שַׁחֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־סְדֹם֙ וְאֶת־עֲמֹרָ֔ה כְּגַן־יְהֹוָה֙ כְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בֹּאֲכָ֖ה צֹֽעַר׃
Translated: Lot looked about him and saw how well watered was the whole plain of the Jordan, all of it—this was before יהוה had destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah—all the way to Zoar, like the garden of יהוה, like the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayisha-lvot et-eynayv vayare et-khׇl-khikhar hayareden khiy khulah mashekeh lifeney shachet yehovah et-sedom veet-amorah khegan-yehovah kheerets mitserayiim voakhah tsoar

Hebrew: וַיִּבְחַר־ל֣וֹ ל֗וֹט אֵ֚ת כׇּל־כִּכַּ֣ר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיִּסַּ֥ע ל֖וֹט מִקֶּ֑דֶם וַיִּפָּ֣רְד֔וּ אִ֖ישׁ מֵעַ֥ל אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: So Lot chose for himself the whole plain of the Jordan, and Lot journeyed eastward. Thus they parted from each other;
Transliteration: vayivechar-lvo lvot et khׇl-khikhar hayareden vayisa lvot mikedem vayifaredu iysh meal achiyv

Hebrew: אַבְרָ֖ם יָשַׁ֣ב בְּאֶֽרֶץ־כְּנָ֑עַן וְל֗וֹט יָשַׁב֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הַכִּכָּ֔ר וַיֶּאֱהַ֖ל עַד־סְדֹֽם׃
Translated: Abram remained in the land of Canaan, while Lot settled in the cities of the Plain, pitching his tents near Sodom.
Transliteration: averam yashav veerets-khenaan velvot yashav vearey hakhikhar vayeehal ad-sedom

Hebrew: וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י סְדֹ֔ם רָעִ֖ים וְחַטָּאִ֑ים לַיהֹוָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Now the inhabitants of Sodom were very wicked sinners against יהוה.
Transliteration: veaneshey sedom raiym vechataiym layhovah meod

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֞ה אָמַ֣ר אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם אַחֲרֵי֙ הִפָּֽרֶד־ל֣וֹט מֵֽעִמּ֔וֹ שָׂ֣א נָ֤א עֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ וּרְאֵ֔ה מִן־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֣ה שָׁ֑ם צָפֹ֥נָה וָנֶ֖גְבָּה וָקֵ֥דְמָה וָיָֽמָּה׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Abram, after Lot had parted from him, “Raise your eyes and look out from where you are, to the north and south, to the east and west,
Transliteration: vayhovah amar el-averam acharey hifared-lvot meimvo sha na eyneykha ureeh min-hamakvom asher-atah sham tsafonah vanegevah vakedemah vayamah

Hebrew: כִּ֧י אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה לְךָ֣ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: for I give all the land that you see to you and your offspring forever.
Transliteration: khiy et-khׇl-haarets asher-atah roeh lekha etenenah ulezareakha ad-volam

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֖ כַּעֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ אִם־יוּכַ֣ל אִ֗ישׁ לִמְנוֹת֙ אֶת־עֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ גַּֽם־זַרְעֲךָ֖ יִמָּנֶֽה׃
Translated: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if one can count the dust of the earth, then your offspring too can be counted.
Transliteration: veshametiy et-zareakha khaafar haarets asher im-yukhal iysh limenvot et-afar haarets gam-zareakha yimaneh

Hebrew: ק֚וּם הִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ בָּאָ֔רֶץ לְאׇרְכָּ֖הּ וּלְרׇחְבָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י לְךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: Up, walk about the land, through its length and its breadth, for I give it to you.”
Transliteration: kum hitehalekhe vaarets leׇrekhah ulerׇchevah khiy lekha etenenah

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֣ל אַבְרָ֗ם וַיָּבֹ֛א וַיֵּ֛שֶׁב בְּאֵלֹנֵ֥י מַמְרֵ֖א אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן וַיִּֽבֶן־שָׁ֥ם מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And Abram moved his tent, and came to dwell at the terebinths of Mamre, which are in Hebron; and he built an altar there to יהוה.
Transliteration: vayeehal averam vayavo vayeshev veeloney mamere asher vechevervon vayiven-sham mizevecha layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּימֵי֙ אַמְרָפֶ֣ל מֶֽלֶךְ־שִׁנְעָ֔ר אַרְי֖וֹךְ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֶלָּסָ֑ר כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֙מֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֵילָ֔ם וְתִדְעָ֖ל מֶ֥לֶךְ גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: Now, when King Amraphel of Shinar, King Arioch of Ellasar, King Chedorlaomer of Elam, and King Tidal of Goiim
Transliteration: vayehiy viymey amerafel melekhe-shinear areyvokhe melekhe elasar khedׇrelaomer melekhe eylam vetideal melekhe gvoyim

Hebrew: עָשׂ֣וּ מִלְחָמָ֗ה אֶת־בֶּ֙רַע֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ סְדֹ֔ם וְאֶת־בִּרְשַׁ֖ע מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמֹרָ֑ה שִׁנְאָ֣ב ׀ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַדְמָ֗ה וְשֶׁמְאֵ֙בֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ (צביים) [צְבוֹיִ֔ם] וּמֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּ֖לַע הִיא־צֹֽעַר׃
Translated: made war on King Bera of Sodom, King Birsha of Gomorrah, King Shinab of Admah, King Shemeber of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar,
Transliteration: ashu milechamah et-vera melekhe sedom veet-viresha melekhe amorah shineav melekhe ademah veshemeever melekhe (tsvyym) [tsevvoyim] umelekhe vela hiy-tsoar

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ חָֽבְר֔וּ אֶל־עֵ֖מֶק הַשִּׂדִּ֑ים ה֖וּא יָ֥ם הַמֶּֽלַח׃
Translated: all the latter joined forces at the Valley of Siddim, now the Dead Sea.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh chaveru el-emek hashidiym hu yam hamelach

Hebrew: שְׁתֵּ֤ים עֶשְׂרֵה֙ שָׁנָ֔ה עָבְד֖וּ אֶת־כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֑מֶר וּשְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה שָׁנָ֖ה מָרָֽדוּ׃
Translated: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
Transliteration: sheteym eshereh shanah avedu et-khedׇrelaomer ushelosh-eshereh shanah maradu

Hebrew: וּבְאַרְבַּע֩ עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה שָׁנָ֜ה בָּ֣א כְדׇרְלָעֹ֗מֶר וְהַמְּלָכִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וַיַּכּ֤וּ אֶת־רְפָאִים֙ בְּעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת קַרְנַ֔יִם וְאֶת־הַזּוּזִ֖ים בְּהָ֑ם וְאֵת֙ הָֽאֵימִ֔ים בְּשָׁוֵ֖ה קִרְיָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him came and defeated the Rephaim at Ashteroth-karnaim, the Zuzim at Ham, the Emim at Shaveh-kiriathaim,
Transliteration: uveareva eshereh shanah va khedׇrelaomer vehamelakhiym asher itvo vayakhu et-refaiym veasheterot karenayiim veet-hazuziym veham veet haeymiym veshaveh kireyatayiim

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחֹרִ֖י בְּהַרְרָ֣ם שֵׂעִ֑יר עַ֚ד אֵ֣יל פָּארָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: and the Horites in their hill country of Seir as far as El-paran, which is by the wilderness.
Transliteration: veet-hachoriy vehareram sheiyr ad eyl faran asher al-hamidevar

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּשֻׁ֠בוּ וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ אֶל־עֵ֤ין מִשְׁפָּט֙ הִ֣וא קָדֵ֔שׁ וַיַּכּ֕וּ אֶֽת־כׇּל־שְׂדֵ֖ה הָעֲמָלֵקִ֑י וְגַם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בְּחַֽצְצֹ֥ן תָּמָֽר׃
Translated: On their way back they came to En-mishpat, which is Kadesh, and subdued all the territory of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites who dwelt in Hazazon-tamar.
Transliteration: vayashuvu vayavou el-eyn mishefat hiv kadesh vayakhu et-khׇl-shedeh haamalekiy vegam et-haemoriy hayoshev vechatsetson tamar

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֜ם וּמֶ֣לֶךְ עֲמֹרָ֗ה וּמֶ֤לֶךְ אַדְמָה֙ וּמֶ֣לֶךְ (צביים) [צְבוֹיִ֔ם] וּמֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּ֖לַע הִוא־צֹ֑עַר וַיַּֽעַרְכ֤וּ אִתָּם֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּעֵ֖מֶק הַשִּׂדִּֽים׃
Translated: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar, went forth and engaged them in battle in the Valley of Siddim:
Transliteration: vayetse melekhe-sedom umelekhe amorah umelekhe ademah umelekhe (tsvyym) [tsevvoyim] umelekhe vela hiv-tsoar vayaarekhu itam milechamah veemek hashidiym

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֜מֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ עֵילָ֗ם וְתִדְעָל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ גּוֹיִ֔ם וְאַמְרָפֶל֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ שִׁנְעָ֔ר וְאַרְי֖וֹךְ מֶ֣לֶךְ אֶלָּסָ֑ר אַרְבָּעָ֥ה מְלָכִ֖ים אֶת־הַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: King Chedorlaomer of Elam, King Tidal of Goiim, King Amraphel of Shinar, and King Arioch of Ellasar—four kings against those five.
Transliteration: et khedׇrelaomer melekhe eylam vetideal melekhe gvoyim veamerafel melekhe shinear veareyvokhe melekhe elasar arevaah melakhiym et-hachamishah

Hebrew: וְעֵ֣מֶק הַשִּׂדִּ֗ים בֶּֽאֱרֹ֤ת בֶּאֱרֹת֙ חֵמָ֔ר וַיָּנֻ֛סוּ מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֥ם וַעֲמֹרָ֖ה וַיִּפְּלוּ־שָׁ֑מָּה וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֖ים הֶ֥רָה נָּֽסוּ׃
Translated: Now the Valley of Siddim was dotted with bitumen pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah, in their flight, threw themselves into them, while the rest escaped to the hill country.
Transliteration: veemek hashidiym veerot veerot chemar vayanusu melekhe-sedom vaamorah vayifelu-shamah vehanisheariym herah nasu

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּקְח֠וּ אֶת־כׇּל־רְכֻ֨שׁ סְדֹ֧ם וַעֲמֹרָ֛ה וְאֶת־כׇּל־אׇכְלָ֖ם וַיֵּלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: [The invaders] seized all the wealth of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their provisions, and went their way.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-khׇl-rekhush sedom vaamorah veet-khׇl-ׇkhelam vayelekhu

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֨וּ אֶת־ל֧וֹט וְאֶת־רְכֻשׁ֛וֹ בֶּן־אֲחִ֥י אַבְרָ֖ם וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וְה֥וּא יֹשֵׁ֖ב בִּסְדֹֽם׃
Translated: They also took Lot, the son of Abram’s brother, and his possessions, and departed; for he had settled in Sodom.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-lvot veet-rekhushvo ven-achiy averam vayelekhu vehu yoshev visedom

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ הַפָּלִ֔יט וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְאַבְרָ֣ם הָעִבְרִ֑י וְהוּא֩ שֹׁכֵ֨ן בְּאֵֽלֹנֵ֜י מַמְרֵ֣א הָאֱמֹרִ֗י אֲחִ֤י אֶשְׁכֹּל֙ וַאֲחִ֣י עָנֵ֔ר וְהֵ֖ם בַּעֲלֵ֥י בְרִית־אַבְרָֽם׃
Translated: A fugitive brought the news to Abram the Hebrew, who was dwelling at the terebinths of Mamre the Amorite, kinsman of Eshkol and Aner, these being Abram’s allies.
Transliteration: vayavo hafaliyt vayaged leaveram haiveriy vehu shokhen veeloney mamere haemoriy achiy eshekhol vaachiy aner vehem vaaley veriyt-averam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אַבְרָ֔ם כִּ֥י נִשְׁבָּ֖ה אָחִ֑יו וַיָּ֨רֶק אֶת־חֲנִיכָ֜יו יְלִידֵ֣י בֵית֗וֹ שְׁמֹנָ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת וַיִּרְדֹּ֖ף עַד־דָּֽן׃
Translated: When Abram heard that his kinsman’s [household] had been taken captive, he mustered his retainers, born into his household, numbering three hundred and eighteen, and went in pursuit as far as Dan.
Transliteration: vayishema averam khiy nishevah achiyv vayarek et-chaniykhayv yeliydey veytvo shemonah ashar ushelosh mevot vayiredof ad-dan

Hebrew: וַיֵּחָלֵ֨ק עֲלֵיהֶ֧ם <small>׀</small> לַ֛יְלָה ה֥וּא וַעֲבָדָ֖יו וַיַּכֵּ֑ם וַֽיִּרְדְּפֵם֙ עַד־חוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִשְּׂמֹ֖אל לְדַמָּֽשֶׂק׃
Translated: At night, he and his servants deployed against them and defeated them; and he pursued them as far as Hobah, which is north of Damascus.
Transliteration: vayechalek aleyhem <small></small> layelah hu vaavadayv vayakhem vayiredefem ad-chvovah asher mishemol ledamashek

Hebrew: וַיָּ֕שֶׁב אֵ֖ת כׇּל־הָרְכֻ֑שׁ וְגַם֩ אֶת־ל֨וֹט אָחִ֤יו וּרְכֻשׁוֹ֙ הֵשִׁ֔יב וְגַ֥ם אֶת־הַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְאֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He brought back all the possessions; he also brought back his kinsman Lot and his possessions, and the women and the rest of the people.
Transliteration: vayashev et khׇl-harekhush vegam et-lvot achiyv urekhushvo heshiyv vegam et-hanashiym veet-haam

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹם֮ לִקְרָאתוֹ֒ אַחֲרֵ֣י שׁוּב֗וֹ מֵֽהַכּוֹת֙ אֶת־כְּדׇרְלָעֹ֔מֶר וְאֶת־הַמְּלָכִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ אֶל־עֵ֣מֶק שָׁוֵ֔ה ה֖וּא עֵ֥מֶק הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: When he returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings with him, the king of Sodom came out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh, which is the Valley of the King.
Transliteration: vayetse melekhe-sedom likeratvo acharey shuvvo mehakhvot et-khedׇrelaomer veet-hamelakhiym asher itvo el-emek shaveh hu emek hamelekhe

Hebrew: וּמַלְכִּי־צֶ֙דֶק֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ שָׁלֵ֔ם הוֹצִ֖יא לֶ֣חֶם וָיָ֑יִן וְה֥וּא כֹהֵ֖ן לְאֵ֥ל עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated: And King Melchizedek of Salem brought out bread and wine; he was a priest of God Most High.
Transliteration: umalekhiy-tsedek melekhe shalem hvotsiy lechem vayayiin vehu khohen leel eleyvon

Hebrew: וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖הוּ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר בָּר֤וּךְ אַבְרָם֙ לְאֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן קֹנֵ֖ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
He blessed him, saying,
“Blessed be Abram of God Most High,
Creator of heaven and earth.
Transliteration: vayevarekhehu vayomar varukhe averam leel eleyvon koneh shamayiim vaarets

Hebrew: וּבָרוּךְ֙ אֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־מִגֵּ֥ן צָרֶ֖יךָ בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֥וֹ מַעֲשֵׂ֖ר מִכֹּֽל׃
Translated:
And blessed be God Most High,
Who has delivered your foes into your hand.” And [Abram] gave him a tenth of everything.
Transliteration: uvarukhe el eleyvon asher-migen tsareykha veyadekha vayiten-lvo maasher mikhol

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֶֽלֶךְ־סְדֹ֖ם אֶל־אַבְרָ֑ם תֶּן־לִ֣י הַנֶּ֔פֶשׁ וְהָרְכֻ֖שׁ קַֽח־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Then the king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the persons, and take the possessions for yourself.”
Transliteration: vayomer melekhe-sedom el-averam ten-liy hanefesh veharekhush kach-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַבְרָ֖ם אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ סְדֹ֑ם הֲרִמֹ֨תִי יָדִ֤י אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ אֵ֣ל עֶלְי֔וֹן קֹנֵ֖ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I swear to יהוה, God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth:
Transliteration: vayomer averam el-melekhe sedom harimotiy yadiy el-yehovah el eleyvon koneh shamayiim vaarets

Hebrew: אִם־מִחוּט֙ וְעַ֣ד שְׂרֽוֹךְ־נַ֔עַל וְאִם־אֶקַּ֖ח מִכׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לָ֑ךְ וְלֹ֣א תֹאמַ֔ר אֲנִ֖י הֶעֱשַׁ֥רְתִּי אֶת־אַבְרָֽם׃
Translated: I will not take so much as a thread or a sandal strap of what is yours; you shall not say, ‘It is I who made Abram rich.’
Transliteration: im-michut vead shervokhe-naal veim-ekach mikhׇl-asher-lakhe velo tomar aniy heesharetiy et-averam

Hebrew: בִּלְעָדַ֗י רַ֚ק אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽכְל֣וּ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְחֵ֙לֶק֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלְכ֖וּ אִתִּ֑י עָנֵר֙ אֶשְׁכֹּ֣ל וּמַמְרֵ֔א הֵ֖ם יִקְח֥וּ חֶלְקָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: For me, nothing but what my servants have used up; as for the share of the parties who went with me—Aner, Eshkol, and Mamre—let them take their share.”
Transliteration: vileaday rak asher akhelu haneariym vechelek haanashiym asher halekhu itiy aner eshekhol umamere hem yikechu chelekam {s}

Hebrew: אַחַ֣ר ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה הָיָ֤ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־אַבְרָ֔ם בַּֽמַּחֲזֶ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אַל־תִּירָ֣א אַבְרָ֗ם אָנֹכִי֙ מָגֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ שְׂכָרְךָ֖ הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated:
Some time later, the word of יהוה came to Abram in a vision:
“Fear not, Abram,
I am a shield to you;
Your reward shall be very great.”
Transliteration: achar hadevariym haeleh hayah devar-yehovah el-averam vamachazeh lemor al-tiyra averam anokhiy magen lakhe shekharekha hareveh meod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָ֗ם אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ מַה־תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י הוֹלֵ֣ךְ עֲרִירִ֑י וּבֶן־מֶ֣שֶׁק בֵּיתִ֔י ה֖וּא דַּמֶּ֥שֶׂק אֱלִיעֶֽזֶר׃
Translated: But Abram said, “O lord יהוה, what can You give me, seeing that I shall die childless, and the one in charge of my household is Dammesek Eliezer!”
Transliteration: vayomer averam adonay yehovih mah-titen-liy veanokhiy hvolekhe ariyriy uven-meshek veytiy hu dameshek eliyezer

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָ֔ם הֵ֣ן לִ֔י לֹ֥א נָתַ֖תָּה זָ֑רַע וְהִנֵּ֥ה בֶן־בֵּיתִ֖י יוֹרֵ֥שׁ אֹתִֽי׃
Translated: Abram said further, “Since You have granted me no offspring, my steward will be my heir.”
Transliteration: vayomer averam hen liy lo natatah zara vehineh ven-veytiy yvoresh otiy

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה דְבַר־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֥א יִֽירָשְׁךָ֖ זֶ֑ה כִּי־אִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵצֵ֣א מִמֵּעֶ֔יךָ ה֖וּא יִֽירָשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: The word of יהוה came to him in reply, “That one shall not be your heir; none but your very own issue shall be your heir.”
Transliteration: vehineh devar-yehovah elayv lemor lo yiyrashekha zeh khiy-im asher eitse mimeeykha hu yiyrashekha

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א אֹת֜וֹ הַח֗וּצָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַבֶּט־נָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֗יְמָה וּסְפֹר֙ הַכּ֣וֹכָבִ֔ים אִם־תּוּכַ֖ל לִסְפֹּ֣ר אֹתָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ כֹּ֥ה יִהְיֶ֖ה זַרְעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: [Then in the vision, God] took him outside and said, “Look toward heaven and count the stars, if you are able to count them”—continuing, “So shall your offspring be.”
Transliteration: vayyvotse otvo hachutsah vayomer havet-na hashamayemah usefor hakhvokhaviym im-tukhal lisefor otam vayomer lvo khoh yiheyeh zareekha

Hebrew: וְהֶאֱמִ֖ן בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶ֥הָ לּ֖וֹ צְדָקָֽה׃
Translated: And he put his trust in יהוה, who reckoned it to his merit.
Transliteration: veheemin vayhovah vayachesheveha lvo tsedakah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵאתִ֙יךָ֙ מֵא֣וּר כַּשְׂדִּ֔ים לָ֧תֶת לְךָ֛ אֶת־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּ֖את לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Then [God] said to him, “I am יהוה who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to assign this land to you as a possession.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv aniy yehovah asher hvotsetiykha meur khashediym latet lekha et-haarets hazot lerishetah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה בַּמָּ֥ה אֵדַ֖ע כִּ֥י אִֽירָשֶֽׁנָּה׃
Translated: And he said, “O lord יהוה, how shall I know that I am to possess it?”
Transliteration: vayomar adonay yehovih vamah eda khiy iyrashenah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו קְחָ֥ה לִי֙ עֶגְלָ֣ה מְשֻׁלֶּ֔שֶׁת וְעֵ֥ז מְשֻׁלֶּ֖שֶׁת וְאַ֣יִל מְשֻׁלָּ֑שׁ וְתֹ֖ר וְגוֹזָֽל׃
Translated: Came the reply, “Bring Me a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young bird.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv kechah liy egelah meshuleshet veez meshuleshet veayiil meshulash vetor vegvozal

Hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֗לֶּה וַיְבַתֵּ֤ר אֹתָם֙ בַּתָּ֔וֶךְ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אִישׁ־בִּתְר֖וֹ לִקְרַ֣את רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְאֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֖ר לֹ֥א בָתָֽר׃
Translated: He brought all these and cut them in two, placing each half opposite the other; but he did not cut up the bird.
Transliteration: vayikach-lvo et-khׇl-eleh vayevater otam vatavekhe vayiten iysh-vitervo likerat reehu veet-hatsifor lo vatar

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥רֶד הָעַ֖יִט עַל־הַפְּגָרִ֑ים וַיַּשֵּׁ֥ב אֹתָ֖ם אַבְרָֽם׃
Translated: Birds of prey came down upon the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
Transliteration: vayered haayiit al-hafegariym vayashev otam averam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ לָב֔וֹא וְתַרְדֵּמָ֖ה נָפְלָ֣ה עַל־אַבְרָ֑ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵימָ֛ה חֲשֵׁכָ֥ה גְדֹלָ֖ה נֹפֶ֥לֶת עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: As the sun was about to set, a deep sleep fell upon Abram, and a great dark dread descended upon him.
Transliteration: vayehiy hashemesh lavvo vetaredemah nafelah al-averam vehineh eymah chashekhah gedolah nofelet alayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאַבְרָ֗ם יָדֹ֨עַ תֵּדַ֜ע כִּי־גֵ֣ר ׀ יִהְיֶ֣ה זַרְעֲךָ֗ בְּאֶ֙רֶץ֙ לֹ֣א לָהֶ֔ם וַעֲבָד֖וּם וְעִנּ֣וּ אֹתָ֑ם אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: And [God] said to Abram, “Know well that your offspring shall be strangers in a land not theirs, and they shall be enslaved and oppressed four hundred years;
Transliteration: vayomer leaveram yadoa teda khiy-ger yiheyeh zareakha veerets lo lahem vaavadum veinu otam areva mevot shanah

Hebrew: וְגַ֧ם אֶת־הַגּ֛וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲבֹ֖דוּ דָּ֣ן אָנֹ֑כִי וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֥ן יֵצְא֖וּ בִּרְכֻ֥שׁ גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: but I will execute judgment on the nation they shall serve, and in the end they shall go free with great wealth.
Transliteration: vegam et-hagvoy asher yaavodu dan anokhiy veacharey-khen eitseu virekhush gadvol

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֛ה תָּב֥וֹא אֶל־אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם תִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּשֵׂיבָ֥ה טוֹבָֽה׃
Translated:
As for you,
You shall go to your ancestors in peace;
You shall be buried at a ripe old age.
Transliteration: veatah tavvo el-avoteykha veshalvom tikaver vesheyvah tvovah

Hebrew: וְד֥וֹר רְבִיעִ֖י יָשׁ֣וּבוּ הֵ֑נָּה כִּ֧י לֹא־שָׁלֵ֛ם עֲוֺ֥ן הָאֱמֹרִ֖י עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: And they shall return here in the fourth generation, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”
Transliteration: vedvor reviyiy yashuvu henah khiy lo-shalem avon haemoriy ad-henah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ בָּ֔אָה וַעֲלָטָ֖ה הָיָ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֨ה תַנּ֤וּר עָשָׁן֙ וְלַפִּ֣יד אֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָבַ֔ר בֵּ֖ין הַגְּזָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: When the sun set and it was very dark, there appeared a smoking oven, and a flaming torch which passed between those pieces.
Transliteration: vayehiy hashemesh vaah vaalatah hayah vehineh tanur ashan velafiyd esh asher avar veyn hagezariym haeleh

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא כָּרַ֧ת יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־אַבְרָ֖ם בְּרִ֣ית לֵאמֹ֑ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֗ נָתַ֙תִּי֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את מִנְּהַ֣ר מִצְרַ֔יִם עַד־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַגָּדֹ֖ל נְהַר־פְּרָֽת׃
Translated: On that day יהוה made a covenant with Abram: “To your offspring I assign this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates—
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu kharat yehovah et-averam veriyt lemor lezareakha natatiy et-haarets hazot minehar mitserayiim ad-hanahar hagadol nehar-ferat

Hebrew: אֶת־הַקֵּינִי֙ וְאֶת־הַקְּנִזִּ֔י וְאֵ֖ת הַקַּדְמֹנִֽי׃
Translated: the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,
Transliteration: et-hakeyniy veet-hakeniziy veet hakademoniy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֥י וְאֶת־הַפְּרִזִּ֖י וְאֶת־הָרְפָאִֽים׃
Translated: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
Transliteration: veet-hachitiy veet-haferiziy veet-harefaiym

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ וְאֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וְאֶת־הַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֖י וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”
Transliteration: veet-haemoriy veet-hakhenaaniy veet-hagiregashiy veet-hayevusiy {s}

Hebrew: וְשָׂרַי֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת אַבְרָ֔ם לֹ֥א יָלְדָ֖ה ל֑וֹ וְלָ֛הּ שִׁפְחָ֥ה מִצְרִ֖ית וּשְׁמָ֥הּ הָגָֽר׃
Translated: Sarai, Abram’s wife, had borne him no children. She had an Egyptian maidservant whose name was Hagar.
Transliteration: vesharay eshet averam lo yaledah lvo velah shifechah mitseriyt ushemah hagar

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר שָׂרַ֜י אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם הִנֵּה־נָ֞א עֲצָרַ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ מִלֶּ֔דֶת בֹּא־נָא֙ אֶל־שִׁפְחָתִ֔י אוּלַ֥י אִבָּנֶ֖ה מִמֶּ֑נָּה וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אַבְרָ֖ם לְק֥וֹל שָׂרָֽי׃
Translated: And Sarai said to Abram, “Look, יהוה has kept me from bearing. Consort with my maid; perhaps I shall have a child through her.” And Abram heeded Sarai’s request.
Transliteration: vatomer sharay el-averam hineh-na atsaraniy yehovah miledet vo-na el-shifechatiy ulay ivaneh mimenah vayishema averam lekvol sharay

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֞ח שָׂרַ֣י אֵֽשֶׁת־אַבְרָ֗ם אֶת־הָגָ֤ר הַמִּצְרִית֙ שִׁפְחָתָ֔הּ מִקֵּץ֙ עֶ֣שֶׂר שָׁנִ֔ים לְשֶׁ֥בֶת אַבְרָ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַתִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛הּ לְאַבְרָ֥ם אִישָׁ֖הּ ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: So Sarai, Abram’s wife, took her maid, Hagar the Egyptian—after Abram had dwelt in the land of Canaan ten years—and gave her to her husband Abram as concubine.
Transliteration: vatikach sharay eshet-averam et-hagar hamitseriyt shifechatah mikets esher shaniym leshevet averam veerets khenaan vatiten otah leaveram iyshah lvo leishah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־הָגָ֖ר וַתַּ֑הַר וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י הָרָ֔תָה וַתֵּקַ֥ל גְּבִרְתָּ֖הּ בְּעֵינֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: He cohabited with Hagar and she conceived; and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was lowered in her esteem.
Transliteration: vayavo el-hagar vatahar vatere khiy haratah vatekal geviretah veeyneyha

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר שָׂרַ֣י אֶל־אַבְרָם֮ חֲמָסִ֣י עָלֶ֒יךָ֒ אָנֹכִ֗י נָתַ֤תִּי שִׁפְחָתִי֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ כִּ֣י הָרָ֔תָה וָאֵקַ֖ל בְּעֵינֶ֑יהָ יִשְׁפֹּ֥ט יְהֹוָ֖ה בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽיׄךָ׃
Translated: And Sarai said to Abram, “The wrong done me is your fault! I myself put my maid in your bosom; now that she sees that she is pregnant, I am lowered in her esteem. יהוה decide between you and me!”
Transliteration: vatomer sharay el-averam chamasiy aleykha anokhiy natatiy shifechatiy vecheykekha vatere khiy haratah vaekal veeyneyha yishefot yehovah veyniy uveyneykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָ֜ם אֶל־שָׂרַ֗י הִנֵּ֤ה שִׁפְחָתֵךְ֙ בְּיָדֵ֔ךְ עֲשִׂי־לָ֖הּ הַטּ֣וֹב בְּעֵינָ֑יִךְ וַתְּעַנֶּ֣הָ שָׂרַ֔י וַתִּבְרַ֖ח מִפָּנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Abram said to Sarai, “Your maid is in your hands. Deal with her as you think right.” Then Sarai treated her harshly, and she ran away from her.
Transliteration: vayomer averam el-sharay hineh shifechatekhe veyadekhe ashiy-lah hatvov veeynayiikhe vateaneha sharay vativerach mifaneyha

Hebrew: וַֽיִּמְצָאָ֞הּ מַלְאַ֧ךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה עַל־עֵ֥ין הַמַּ֖יִם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר עַל־הָעַ֖יִן בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ שֽׁוּר׃
Translated: A messenger of יהוה found her by a spring of water in the wilderness, the spring on the road to Shur,
Transliteration: vayimetsaah maleakhe yehovah al-eyn hamayiim vamidevar al-haayiin vederekhe shur

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר הָגָ֞ר שִׁפְחַ֥ת שָׂרַ֛י אֵֽי־מִזֶּ֥ה בָ֖את וְאָ֣נָה תֵלֵ֑כִי וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מִפְּנֵי֙ שָׂרַ֣י גְּבִרְתִּ֔י אָנֹכִ֖י בֹּרַֽחַת׃
Translated: and said, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from, and where are you going?” And she said, “I am running away from my mistress Sarai.”
Transliteration: vayomar hagar shifechat sharay ey-mizeh vat veanah telekhiy vatomer mifeney sharay geviretiy anokhiy vorachat

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה שׁ֖וּבִי אֶל־גְּבִרְתֵּ֑ךְ וְהִתְעַנִּ֖י תַּ֥חַת יָדֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: And the messenger of יהוה said to her, “Go back to your mistress, and submit to her harsh treatment.”
Transliteration: vayomer lah maleakhe yehovah shuviy el-geviretekhe vehiteaniy tachat yadeyha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה הַרְבָּ֥ה אַרְבֶּ֖ה אֶת־זַרְעֵ֑ךְ וְלֹ֥א יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
Translated:
And the messenger of יהוה said to her,
“I will greatly increase your offspring,
And they shall be too many to count.”
Transliteration: vayomer lah maleakhe yehovah harevah areveh et-zareekhe velo yisafer merov

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהּ֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה הִנָּ֥ךְ הָרָ֖ה וְיֹלַ֣דְתְּ בֵּ֑ן וְקָרָ֤את שְׁמוֹ֙ יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־עׇנְיֵֽךְ׃
Translated:
The messenger of יהוה said to her further,
“Behold, you are pregnant
And shall bear a son;
You shall call him Ishmael,
For יהוה has paid heed to your suffering.
Transliteration: vayomer lah maleakhe yehovah hinakhe harah veyoladete ven vekarat shemvo yishemael khiy-shama yehovah el-ׇneeikhe

Hebrew: וְה֤וּא יִהְיֶה֙ פֶּ֣רֶא אָדָ֔ם יָד֣וֹ בַכֹּ֔ל וְיַ֥ד כֹּ֖ל בּ֑וֹ וְעַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־אֶחָ֖יו יִשְׁכֹּֽן׃
Translated:
He shall be a wild ass of a person;
His hand against everyone,
And everyone’s hand against him;
He shall dwell alongside of all his kin.”
Transliteration: vehu yiheyeh fere adam yadvo vakhol veyad khol vvo veal-feney khׇl-echayv yishekhon

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֤א שֵׁם־יְהֹוָה֙ הַדֹּבֵ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יהָ אַתָּ֖ה אֵ֣ל רֳאִ֑י כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֗ה הֲגַ֥ם הֲלֹ֛ם רָאִ֖יתִי אַחֲרֵ֥י רֹאִֽי׃
Translated: And she called יהוה who spoke to her, “You Are El-roi,” by which she meant, “Have I not gone on seeing after my being seen!”
Transliteration: vatikera shem-yehovah hadover eleyha atah el roiy khiy amerah hagam halom raiytiy acharey roiy

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ קָרָ֣א לַבְּאֵ֔ר בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִ֑י הִנֵּ֥ה בֵין־קָדֵ֖שׁ וּבֵ֥ין בָּֽרֶד׃
Translated: Therefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi; it is between Kadesh and Bered.—
Transliteration: al-khen kara laveer veer lachay roiy hineh veyn-kadesh uveyn vared

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֧לֶד הָגָ֛ר לְאַבְרָ֖ם בֵּ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְרָ֧ם שֶׁם־בְּנ֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה הָגָ֖ר יִשְׁמָעֵֽאל׃
Translated: Hagar bore a son to Abram, and Abram gave the son that Hagar bore him the name Ishmael.
Transliteration: vateled hagar leaveram ven vayikera averam shem-venvo asher-yaledah hagar yishemael

Hebrew: וְאַבְרָ֕ם בֶּן־שְׁמֹנִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים בְּלֶֽדֶת־הָגָ֥ר אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל לְאַבְרָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
Transliteration: veaveram ven-shemoniym shanah veshesh shaniym veledet-hagar et-yishemael leaveram {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אַבְרָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְתֵ֣שַׁע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיֵּרָ֨א יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־אַבְרָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֲנִי־אֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֔י הִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ לְפָנַ֖י וֶהְיֵ֥ה תָמִֽים׃
Translated: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, יהוה appeared to Abram and said to him, “I am El Shaddai. Walk in My ways and be blameless.
Transliteration: vayehiy averam ven-tisheiym shanah vetesha shaniym vayera yehovah el-averam vayomer elayv aniy-el shaday hitehalekhe lefanay veheeih tamiym

Hebrew: וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה בְרִיתִ֖י בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ וְאַרְבֶּ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ בִּמְאֹ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and I will make you exceedingly numerous.”
Transliteration: veetenah veriytiy veyniy uveynekha veareveh votekha vimeod meod

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל אַבְרָ֖ם עַל־פָּנָ֑יו וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֛וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Abram threw himself on his face; and God spoke to him further,
Transliteration: vayifol averam al-fanayv vayedaver itvo Elohim lemor

Hebrew: אֲנִ֕י הִנֵּ֥ה בְרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וְהָיִ֕יתָ לְאַ֖ב הֲמ֥וֹן גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: “As for Me, this is My covenant with you: You shall be the father of a multitude of nations.
Transliteration: aniy hineh veriytiy itakhe vehayiyta leav hamvon gvoyim

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִקָּרֵ֥א ע֛וֹד אֶת־שִׁמְךָ֖ אַבְרָ֑ם וְהָיָ֤ה שִׁמְךָ֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם כִּ֛י אַב־הֲמ֥וֹן גּוֹיִ֖ם נְתַתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated: And you shall no longer be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham, for I make you the father of a multitude of nations.
Transliteration: velo-yikare vod et-shimekha averam vehayah shimekha averaham khiy av-hamvon gvoyim netatiykha

Hebrew: וְהִפְרֵתִ֤י אֹֽתְךָ֙ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֔ד וּנְתַתִּ֖יךָ לְגוֹיִ֑ם וּמְלָכִ֖ים מִמְּךָ֥ יֵצֵֽאוּ׃
Translated: I will make you exceedingly fertile, and make nations of you; and kings shall come forth from you.
Transliteration: vehiferetiy otekha vimeod meod unetatiykha legvoyim umelakhiym mimekha eitseu

Hebrew: וַהֲקִמֹתִ֨י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֜י בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֗ךָ וּבֵ֨ין זַרְעֲךָ֧ אַחֲרֶ֛יךָ לְדֹרֹתָ֖ם לִבְרִ֣ית עוֹלָ֑ם לִהְי֤וֹת לְךָ֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: I will maintain My covenant between Me and you, and your offspring to come, as an everlasting covenant throughout the ages, to be God to you and to your offspring to come.
Transliteration: vahakimotiy et-veriytiy veyniy uveynekha uveyn zareakha achareykha ledorotam liveriyt volam liheyvot lekha lelohiym ulezareakha achareykha

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְ֠ךָ֠ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֨ אַחֲרֶ֜יךָ אֵ֣ת ׀ אֶ֣רֶץ מְגֻרֶ֗יךָ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן לַאֲחֻזַּ֖ת עוֹלָ֑ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: I assign the land you sojourn in to you and your offspring to come, all the land of Canaan, as an everlasting holding. I will be their God.”
Transliteration: venatatiy lekha ulezareakha achareykha et erets megureykha et khׇl-erets khenaan laachuzat volam vehayiytiy lahem lelohiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם וְאַתָּ֖ה אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֣י תִשְׁמֹ֑ר אַתָּ֛ה וְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אַֽחֲרֶ֖יךָ לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
Translated: God further said to Abraham, “As for you, you and your offspring to come throughout the ages shall keep My covenant.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-averaham veatah et-veriytiy tishemor atah vezareakha achareykha ledorotam

Hebrew: זֹ֣את בְּרִיתִ֞י אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁמְר֗וּ בֵּינִי֙ וּבֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וּבֵ֥ין זַרְעֲךָ֖ אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ הִמּ֥וֹל לָכֶ֖ם כׇּל־זָכָֽר׃
Translated: Such shall be the covenant between Me and you and your offspring to follow which you shall keep: every male among you shall be circumcised.
Transliteration: zot veriytiy asher tishemeru veyniy uveyneykhem uveyn zareakha achareykha himvol lakhem khׇl-zakhar

Hebrew: וּנְמַלְתֶּ֕ם אֵ֖ת בְּשַׂ֣ר עׇרְלַתְכֶ֑ם וְהָיָה֙ לְא֣וֹת בְּרִ֔ית בֵּינִ֖י וּבֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and that shall be the sign of the covenant between Me and you.
Transliteration: unemaletem et veshar ׇrelatekhem vehayah levot veriyt veyniy uveyneykhem

Hebrew: וּבֶן־שְׁמֹנַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים יִמּ֥וֹל לָכֶ֛ם כׇּל־זָכָ֖ר לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם יְלִ֣יד בָּ֔יִת וּמִקְנַת־כֶּ֙סֶף֙ מִכֹּ֣ל בֶּן־נֵכָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹ֥א מִֽזַּרְעֲךָ֖ הֽוּא׃
Translated: And throughout the generations, every male among you shall be circumcised at the age of eight days. As for the homeborn slave and the one bought from an outsider who is not of your offspring,
Transliteration: uven-shemonat yamiym yimvol lakhem khׇl-zakhar ledoroteykhem yeliyd vayiit umikenat-khesef mikhol ven-nekhar asher lo mizareakha hu

Hebrew: הִמּ֧וֹל <small>׀</small> יִמּ֛וֹל יְלִ֥יד בֵּֽיתְךָ֖ וּמִקְנַ֣ת כַּסְפֶּ֑ךָ וְהָיְתָ֧ה בְרִיתִ֛י בִּבְשַׂרְכֶ֖ם לִבְרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: they must be circumcised, homeborn and purchased alike. Thus shall My covenant be marked in your flesh as an everlasting pact.
Transliteration: himvol <small></small> yimvol yeliyd veytekha umikenat khasefekha vehayetah veriytiy vivesharekhem liveriyt volam

Hebrew: וְעָרֵ֣ל ׀ זָכָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִמּוֹל֙ אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר עׇרְלָת֔וֹ וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּ֑יהָ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י הֵפַֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: And if any male who is uncircumcised fails to circumcise the flesh of his foreskin, that person shall be cut off from kin; he has broken My covenant.”
Transliteration: vearel zakhar asher lo-yimvol et-veshar ׇrelatvo venikheretah hanefesh hahiv meameyha et-veriytiy hefar {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם שָׂרַ֣י אִשְׁתְּךָ֔ לֹא־תִקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמָ֖הּ שָׂרָ֑י כִּ֥י שָׂרָ֖ה שְׁמָֽהּ׃
Translated: And God said to Abraham, “As for your wife Sarai, you shall not call her Sarai, but her name shall be Sarah.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-averaham sharay ishetekha lo-tikera et-shemah sharay khiy sharah shemah

Hebrew: וּבֵרַכְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔הּ וְגַ֨ם נָתַ֧תִּי מִמֶּ֛נָּה לְךָ֖ בֵּ֑ן וּבֵֽרַכְתִּ֙יהָ֙ וְהָֽיְתָ֣ה לְגוֹיִ֔ם מַלְכֵ֥י עַמִּ֖ים מִמֶּ֥נָּה יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: I will bless her; indeed, I will give you a son by her. I will bless her so that she shall give rise to nations; rulers of peoples shall issue from her.”
Transliteration: uverakhetiy otah vegam natatiy mimenah lekha ven uverakhetiyha vehayetah legvoyim malekhey amiym mimenah yiheyu

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֧ל אַבְרָהָ֛ם עַל־פָּנָ֖יו וַיִּצְחָ֑ק וַיֹּ֣אמֶר בְּלִבּ֗וֹ הַלְּבֶ֤ן מֵאָֽה־שָׁנָה֙ יִוָּלֵ֔ד וְאִ֨ם־שָׂרָ֔ה הֲבַת־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תֵּלֵֽד׃
Translated: Abraham threw himself on his face and laughed, as he said to himself, “Can a child be born to a man a hundred years old, or can Sarah bear a child at ninety?”
Transliteration: vayifol averaham al-fanayv vayitsechak vayomer velivvo haleven meah-shanah yivaled veim-sharah havat-tisheiym shanah teled

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶל־הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים ל֥וּ יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל יִחְיֶ֥ה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And Abraham said to God, “O that Ishmael might live by Your favor!”
Transliteration: vayomer averaham el-haElohimm lu yishemael yicheyeh lefaneykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲבָל֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֗ יֹלֶ֤דֶת לְךָ֙ בֵּ֔ן וְקָרָ֥אתָ אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יִצְחָ֑ק וַהֲקִמֹתִ֨י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֥י אִתּ֛וֹ לִבְרִ֥ית עוֹלָ֖ם לְזַרְע֥וֹ אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: God said, “Nevertheless, Sarah your wife shall bear you a son, and you shall name him Isaac; and I will maintain My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his offspring to come.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim aval sharah ishetekha yoledet lekha ven vekarata et-shemvo yitsechak vahakimotiy et-veriytiy itvo liveriyt volam lezarevo acharayv

Hebrew: וּֽלְיִשְׁמָעֵאל֮ שְׁמַעְתִּ֒יךָ֒ הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ בֵּרַ֣כְתִּי אֹת֗וֹ וְהִפְרֵיתִ֥י אֹת֛וֹ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֥י אֹת֖וֹ בִּמְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֤ר נְשִׂיאִם֙ יוֹלִ֔יד וּנְתַתִּ֖יו לְג֥וֹי גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: As for Ishmael, I have heeded you. I hereby bless him. I will make him fertile and exceedingly numerous. He shall be the father of twelve chieftains, and I will make of him a great nation.
Transliteration: uleyishemael shemaetiykha hineh verakhetiy otvo vehifereytiy otvo vehireveytiy otvo vimeod meod sheneym-ashar neshiyim yvoliyd unetatiyv legvoy gadvol

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אָקִ֣ים אֶת־יִצְחָ֑ק אֲשֶׁר֩ תֵּלֵ֨ד לְךָ֤ שָׂרָה֙ לַמּוֹעֵ֣ד הַזֶּ֔ה בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הָאַחֶֽרֶת׃
Translated: But My covenant I will maintain with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you at this season next year.”
Transliteration: veet-veriytiy akiym et-yitsechak asher teled lekha sharah lamvoed hazeh vashanah haacheret

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֖ל לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ וַיַּ֣עַל אֱלֹהִ֔ים מֵעַ֖ל אַבְרָהָֽם׃
Translated: Done speaking with him, God was gone from Abraham.
Transliteration: vayekhal ledaver itvo vayaal Elohim meal averaham

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בְּנ֗וֹ וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־יְלִידֵ֤י בֵיתוֹ֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־מִקְנַ֣ת כַּסְפּ֔וֹ כׇּל־זָכָ֕ר בְּאַנְשֵׁ֖י בֵּ֣ית אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיָּ֜מׇל אֶת־בְּשַׂ֣ר עׇרְלָתָ֗ם בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Then Abraham took his son Ishmael, and all his homeborn slaves and all those he had bought, every male in Abraham’s household, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins on that very day, as God had spoken to him.
Transliteration: vayikach averaham et-yishemael venvo veet khׇl-yeliydey veytvo veet khׇl-mikenat khasefvo khׇl-zakhar veaneshey veyt averaham vayamׇl et-veshar ׇrelatam veetsem hayyvom hazeh khaasher diver itvo Elohim

Hebrew: וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם בֶּן־תִּשְׁעִ֥ים וָתֵ֖שַׁע שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִמֹּל֖וֹ בְּשַׂ֥ר עׇרְלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin,
Transliteration: veaveraham ven-tisheiym vatesha shanah vehimolvo veshar ׇrelatvo

Hebrew: וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל בְּנ֔וֹ בֶּן־שְׁלֹ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִ֨מֹּל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת בְּשַׂ֥ר עׇרְלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: and his son Ishmael was thirteen years old when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
Transliteration: veyishemael venvo ven-shelosh eshereh shanah vehimolvo et veshar ׇrelatvo

Hebrew: בְּעֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה נִמּ֖וֹל אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Thus Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised on that very day;
Transliteration: veetsem hayyvom hazeh nimvol averaham veyishemael venvo

Hebrew: וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֤י בֵיתוֹ֙ יְלִ֣יד בָּ֔יִת וּמִקְנַת־כֶּ֖סֶף מֵאֵ֣ת בֶּן־נֵכָ֑ר נִמֹּ֖לוּ אִתּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: and all [men of] his household, his homeborn slaves and those that had been bought from outsiders, were circumcised with him.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-aneshey veytvo yeliyd vayiit umikenat-khesef meet ven-nekhar nimolu itvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֤א אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּאֵלֹנֵ֖י מַמְרֵ֑א וְה֛וּא יֹשֵׁ֥ב פֶּֽתַח־הָאֹ֖הֶל כְּחֹ֥ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: יהוה appeared to him by the terebinths of Mamre; he was sitting at the entrance of the tent as the day grew hot.
Transliteration: vayera elayv yehovah veeloney mamere vehu yoshev fetach-haohel khechom hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֤א עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּה֙ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֔ים נִצָּבִ֖ים עָלָ֑יו וַיַּ֗רְא וַיָּ֤רׇץ לִקְרָאתָם֙ מִפֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֔הֶל וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: Looking up, he saw three figures standing near him. Perceiving this, he ran from the entrance of the tent to greet them and, bowing to the ground,
Transliteration: vayisha eynayv vayare vehineh sheloshah anashiym nitsaviym alayv vayare vayarׇts likeratam mifetach haohel vayishetachu aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנָ֗י אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ אַל־נָ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר מֵעַ֥ל עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: he said, “My lords! If it please you, do not go on past your servant.
Transliteration: vayomar adonay im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha al-na taavor meal avedekha

Hebrew: יֻקַּֽח־נָ֣א מְעַט־מַ֔יִם וְרַחֲצ֖וּ רַגְלֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִֽשָּׁעֲנ֖וּ תַּ֥חַת הָעֵֽץ׃
Translated: Let a little water be brought; bathe your feet and recline under the tree.
Transliteration: yukach-na meat-mayiim verachatsu rageleykhem vehishaanu tachat haets

Hebrew: וְאֶקְחָ֨ה פַת־לֶ֜חֶם וְסַעֲד֤וּ לִבְּכֶם֙ אַחַ֣ר תַּעֲבֹ֔רוּ כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן עֲבַרְתֶּ֖ם עַֽל־עַבְדְּכֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ כֵּ֥ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated: And let me fetch a morsel of bread that you may refresh yourselves; then go on—seeing that you have come your servant’s way.” They replied, “Do as you have said.”
Transliteration: veekechah fat-lechem vesaadu livekhem achar taavoru khiy-al-khen avaretem al-avedekhem vayomeru khen taasheh khaasher divareta

Hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֧ר אַבְרָהָ֛ם הָאֹ֖הֱלָה אֶל־שָׂרָ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מַהֲרִ֞י שְׁלֹ֤שׁ סְאִים֙ קֶ֣מַח סֹ֔לֶת ל֖וּשִׁי וַעֲשִׂ֥י עֻגֽוֹת׃
Translated: Abraham hastened into the tent to Sarah, and said, “Quick, three seahs of choice flour! Knead and make cakes!”
Transliteration: vayemaher averaham haohelah el-sharah vayomer mahariy shelosh seiym kemach solet lushiy vaashiy ugvot

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הַבָּקָ֖ר רָ֣ץ אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיִּקַּ֨ח בֶּן־בָּקָ֜ר רַ֤ךְ וָטוֹב֙ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־הַנַּ֔עַר וַיְמַהֵ֖ר לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then Abraham ran to the herd, took a calf, tender and choice, and gave it to a servant-boy, who hastened to prepare it.
Transliteration: veel-havakar rats averaham vayikach ven-vakar rakhe vatvov vayiten el-hanaar vayemaher laashvot otvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח חֶמְאָ֜ה וְחָלָ֗ב וּבֶן־הַבָּקָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וְהֽוּא־עֹמֵ֧ד עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם תַּ֥חַת הָעֵ֖ץ וַיֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: He took curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared and set these before them; and he waited on them under the tree as they ate.
Transliteration: vayikach chemeah vechalav uven-havakar asher ashah vayiten lifeneyhem vehu-omed aleyhem tachat haets vayokhelu

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵׄלָ֔יׄוׄ אַיֵּ֖ה שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּ֥ה בָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: They said to him, “Where is your wife Sarah?” And he replied, “There, in the tent.”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv ayeh sharah ishetekha vayomer hineh vaohel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר שׁ֣וֹב אָשׁ֤וּב אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ כָּעֵ֣ת חַיָּ֔ה וְהִנֵּה־בֵ֖ן לְשָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וְשָׂרָ֥ה שֹׁמַ֛עַת פֶּ֥תַח הָאֹ֖הֶל וְה֥וּא אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: Then one said, “I will return to you next year, and your wife Sarah shall have a son!” Sarah was listening at the entrance of the tent, which was behind him.
Transliteration: vayomer shvov ashuv eleykha khaet chayah vehineh-ven lesharah ishetekha vesharah shomaat fetach haohel vehu acharayv

Hebrew: וְאַבְרָהָ֤ם וְשָׂרָה֙ זְקֵנִ֔ים בָּאִ֖ים בַּיָּמִ֑ים חָדַל֙ לִהְי֣וֹת לְשָׂרָ֔ה אֹ֖רַח כַּנָּשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years; Sarah had stopped having her periods.
Transliteration: veaveraham vesharah zekeniym vaiym vayamiym chadal liheyvot lesharah orach khanashiym

Hebrew: וַתִּצְחַ֥ק שָׂרָ֖ה בְּקִרְבָּ֣הּ לֵאמֹ֑ר אַחֲרֵ֤י בְלֹתִי֙ הָֽיְתָה־לִּ֣י עֶדְנָ֔ה וַֽאדֹנִ֖י זָקֵֽן׃
Translated: And Sarah laughed to herself, saying, “Now that I’ve lost the ability, am I to have enjoyment—with my husband so old?”
Transliteration: vatitsechak sharah vekirevah lemor acharey velotiy hayetah-liy edenah vadoniy zaken

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם לָ֣מָּה זֶּה֩ צָחֲקָ֨ה שָׂרָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר הַאַ֥ף אֻמְנָ֛ם אֵלֵ֖ד וַאֲנִ֥י זָקַֽנְתִּי׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh, saying, ‘Shall I in truth bear a child, old as I am?’
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-averaham lamah zeh tsachakah sharah lemor haaf umenam eled vaaniy zakanetiy

Hebrew: הֲיִפָּלֵ֥א מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה דָּבָ֑ר לַמּוֹעֵ֞ד אָשׁ֥וּב אֵלֶ֛יךָ כָּעֵ֥ת חַיָּ֖ה וּלְשָׂרָ֥ה בֵֽן׃
Translated: Is anything too wondrous for יהוה ? I will return to you at the same season next year, and Sarah shall have a son.”
Transliteration: hayifale meyehovah davar lamvoed ashuv eleykha khaet chayah ulesharah ven

Hebrew: וַתְּכַחֵ֨שׁ שָׂרָ֧ה <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֛ר לֹ֥א צָחַ֖קְתִּי כִּ֣י <small>׀</small> יָרֵ֑אָה וַיֹּ֥אמֶֽר <small>׀</small> לֹ֖א כִּ֥י צָחָֽקְתְּ׃
Translated: Sarah lied, saying, “I did not laugh,” for she was frightened. Came the reply, “You did laugh.”
Transliteration: vatekhachesh sharah <small></small> lemor lo tsachaketiy khiy <small></small> yareah vayomer <small></small> lo khiy tsachakete

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֤מוּ מִשָּׁם֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיַּשְׁקִ֖פוּ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י סְדֹ֑ם וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם הֹלֵ֥ךְ עִמָּ֖ם לְשַׁלְּחָֽם׃
Translated: The agents set out from there and looked down toward Sodom, Abraham walking with them to see them off.
Transliteration: vayakumu misham haanashiym vayashekifu al-feney sedom veaveraham holekhe imam leshalecham

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אָמָ֑ר הַֽמְכַסֶּ֤ה אֲנִי֙ מֵֽאַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֲנִ֥י עֹשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Now יהוה had said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do,
Transliteration: vayhovah amar hamekhaseh aniy meaveraham asher aniy osheh

Hebrew: וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם הָי֧וֹ יִֽהְיֶ֛ה לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל וְעָצ֑וּם וְנִ֨בְרְכוּ־ב֔וֹ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: since Abraham is to become a great and populous nation and all the nations of the earth are to bless themselves by him?
Transliteration: veaveraham hayvo yiheyeh legvoy gadvol veatsum veniverekhu-vvo khol gvoeiy haarets

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יְדַעְתִּ֗יו לְמַ֩עַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצַוֶּ֜ה אֶת־בָּנָ֤יו וְאֶת־בֵּיתוֹ֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וְשָֽׁמְרוּ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת צְדָקָ֖ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט לְמַ֗עַן הָבִ֤יא יְהֹוָה֙ עַל־אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֖ר עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: For I have singled him out, that he may instruct his children and his posterity to keep the way of יהוה by doing what is just and right, in order that יהוה may bring about for Abraham what has been promised him.”
Transliteration: khiy yedaetiyv lemaan asher yetsaveh et-vanayv veet-veytvo acharayv veshameru derekhe yehovah laashvot tsedakah umishefat lemaan haviy yehovah al-averaham et asher-diver alayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה זַעֲקַ֛ת סְדֹ֥ם וַעֲמֹרָ֖ה כִּי־רָ֑בָּה וְחַ֨טָּאתָ֔ם כִּ֥י כָבְדָ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Then יהוה said, “The outrage of Sodom and Gomorrah is so great, and their sin so grave!
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah zaakat sedom vaamorah khiy-ravah vechatatam khiy khavedah meod

Hebrew: אֵֽרְדָה־נָּ֣א וְאֶרְאֶ֔ה הַכְּצַעֲקָתָ֛הּ הַבָּ֥אָה אֵלַ֖י עָשׂ֣וּ <small>׀</small> כָּלָ֑ה וְאִם־לֹ֖א אֵדָֽעָה׃
Translated: I will go down to see whether they have acted altogether according to the outcry that has reached Me; if not, I will take note.”
Transliteration: eredah-na veereeh hakhetsaakatah havaah elay ashu <small></small> khalah veim-lo edaah

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֤וּ מִשָּׁם֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ סְדֹ֑מָה וְאַ֨בְרָהָ֔ם עוֹדֶ֥נּוּ עֹמֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The agents went on from there to Sodom, while Abraham remained standing before יהוה.
Transliteration: vayifenu misham haanashiym vayelekhu sedomah veaveraham vodenu omed lifeney yehovah
