Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֥שׁ אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַאַ֣ף תִּסְפֶּ֔ה צַדִּ֖יק עִם־רָשָֽׁע׃
Translated: Abraham came forward and said, “Will You sweep away the innocent along with the guilty?
Transliteration: vayigash averaham vayomar haaf tisefeh tsadiyk im-rasha

Hebrew: אוּלַ֥י יֵ֛שׁ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים צַדִּיקִ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר הַאַ֤ף תִּסְפֶּה֙ וְלֹא־תִשָּׂ֣א לַמָּק֔וֹם לְמַ֛עַן חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים הַצַּדִּיקִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃
Translated: What if there should be fifty innocent within the city; will You then wipe out the place and not forgive it for the sake of the innocent fifty who are in it?
Transliteration: ulay eish chamishiym tsadiykim vetvokhe haiyr haaf tisefeh velo-tisha lamakvom lemaan chamishiym hatsadiykim asher vekirevah

Hebrew: חָלִ֨לָה לְּךָ֜ מֵעֲשֹׂ֣ת ׀ כַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה לְהָמִ֤ית צַדִּיק֙ עִם־רָשָׁ֔ע וְהָיָ֥ה כַצַּדִּ֖יק כָּרָשָׁ֑ע חָלִ֣לָה לָּ֔ךְ הֲשֹׁפֵט֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ לֹ֥א יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: Far be it from You to do such a thing, to bring death upon the innocent as well as the guilty, so that innocent and guilty fare alike. Far be it from You! Shall not the Judge of all the earth deal justly?”
Transliteration: chalilah lekha meashot khadavar hazeh lehamiyt tsadiyk im-rasha vehayah khatsadiyk kharasha chalilah lakhe hashofet khׇl-haarets lo yaasheh mishefat

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־אֶמְצָ֥א בִסְדֹ֛ם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים צַדִּיקִ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעִ֑יר וְנָשָׂ֥אתִי לְכׇל־הַמָּק֖וֹם בַּעֲבוּרָֽם׃
Translated: And יהוה answered, “If I find within the city of Sodom fifty innocent ones, I will forgive the whole place for their sake.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah im-emetsa visedom chamishiym tsadiykim vetvokhe haiyr venashatiy lekhׇl-hamakvom vaavuram

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הִנֵּה־נָ֤א הוֹאַ֙לְתִּי֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔י וְאָנֹכִ֖י עָפָ֥ר וָאֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: Abraham spoke up, saying, “Here I venture to speak to my lord, I who am but dust and ashes:
Transliteration: vayaan averaham vayomar hineh-na hvoaletiy ledaver el-adonay veanokhiy afar vaefer

Hebrew: א֠וּלַ֠י יַחְסְר֞וּן חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים הַצַּדִּיקִם֙ חֲמִשָּׁ֔ה הֲתַשְׁחִ֥ית בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֖ה אֶת־כׇּל־הָעִ֑יר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית אִם־אֶמְצָ֣א שָׁ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֖ים וַחֲמִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: What if the fifty innocent should lack five? Will You destroy the whole city for want of the five?” “I will not destroy if I find forty-five there.”
Transliteration: ulay yacheserun chamishiym hatsadiykim chamishah hatashechiyt vachamishah et-khׇl-haiyr vayomer lo ashechiyt im-emetsa sham arevaiym vachamishah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨סֶף ע֜וֹד לְדַבֵּ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם אַרְבָּעִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֔ה בַּעֲב֖וּר הָאַרְבָּעִֽים׃
Translated: But he spoke up again, and said, “What if forty should be found there?” “I will not do it, for the sake of the forty.”
Transliteration: vayosef vod ledaver elayv vayomar ulay yimatseun sham arevaiym vayomer lo eesheh vaavur haarevaiym

Hebrew: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר אַל־נָ֞א יִ֤חַר לַֽאדֹנָי֙ וַאֲדַבֵּ֔רָה אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֔ה אִם־אֶמְצָ֥א שָׁ֖ם שְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
Translated: And he said, “Let not my lord be angry if I go on: What if thirty should be found there?” “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”
Transliteration: vayomer al-na yichar ladonay vaadaverah ulay yimatseun sham sheloshiym vayomer lo eesheh im-emetsa sham sheloshiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּֽה־נָ֤א הוֹאַ֙לְתִּי֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֔י אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם עֶשְׂרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית בַּעֲב֖וּר הָֽעֶשְׂרִֽים׃
Translated: And he said, “I venture again to speak to my lord: What if twenty should be found there?” “I will not destroy, for the sake of the twenty.”
Transliteration: vayomer hineh-na hvoaletiy ledaver el-adonay ulay yimatseun sham esheriym vayomer lo ashechiyt vaavur haesheriym

Hebrew: וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר אַל־נָ֞א יִ֤חַר לַֽאדֹנָי֙ וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה אַךְ־הַפַּ֔עַם אוּלַ֛י יִמָּצְא֥וּן שָׁ֖ם עֲשָׂרָ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אַשְׁחִ֔ית בַּעֲב֖וּר הָעֲשָׂרָֽה׃
Translated: And he said, “Let not my lord be angry if I speak but this last time: What if ten should be found there?” “I will not destroy, for the sake of the ten.”
Transliteration: vayomer al-na yichar ladonay vaadaverah akhe-hafaam ulay yimatseun sham asharah vayomer lo ashechiyt vaavur haasharah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר כִּלָּ֔ה לְדַבֵּ֖ר אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְאַבְרָהָ֖ם שָׁ֥ב לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Having finished speaking to Abraham, יהוה departed; and Abraham returned to his place.
Transliteration: vayelekhe yehovah khaasher khilah ledaver el-averaham veaveraham shav limekomvo

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠אוּ שְׁנֵ֨י הַמַּלְאָכִ֤ים סְדֹ֙מָה֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב וְל֖וֹט יֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּשַֽׁעַר־סְדֹ֑ם וַיַּרְא־לוֹט֙ וַיָּ֣קׇם לִקְרָאתָ֔ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ אַפַּ֖יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: The two messengers arrived in Sodom in the evening, as Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he rose to greet them and, bowing low with his face to the ground,
Transliteration: vayavou sheney hamaleakhiym sedomah vaerev velvot yoshev veshaar-sedom vayare-lvot vayakׇm likeratam vayishetachu afayiim aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר הִנֶּ֣ה נָּא־אֲדֹנַ֗י ס֣וּרוּ נָ֠א אֶל־בֵּ֨ית עַבְדְּכֶ֤ם וְלִ֙ינוּ֙ וְרַחֲצ֣וּ רַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהִשְׁכַּמְתֶּ֖ם וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֣ם לְדַרְכְּכֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לֹּ֔א כִּ֥י בָרְח֖וֹב נָלִֽין׃
Translated: he said, “Please, my lords, turn aside to your servant’s house to spend the night, and bathe your feet; then you may be on your way early.” But they said, “No, we will spend the night in the square.”
Transliteration: vayomer hineh na-adonay suru na el-veyt avedekhem veliynu verachatsu rageleykhem vehishekhametem vahalakhetem ledarekhekhem vayomeru lo khiy varechvov naliyn

Hebrew: וַיִּפְצַר־בָּ֣ם מְאֹ֔ד וַיָּסֻ֣רוּ אֵלָ֔יו וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לָהֶם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וּמַצּ֥וֹת אָפָ֖ה וַיֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: But he urged them strongly, so they turned his way and entered his house. He prepared a feast for them and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
Transliteration: vayifetsar-vam meod vayasuru elayv vayavou el-veytvo vayaash lahem misheteh umatsvot afah vayokhelu

Hebrew: טֶ֘רֶם֮ יִשְׁכָּ֒בוּ֒ וְאַנְשֵׁ֨י הָעִ֜יר אַנְשֵׁ֤י סְדֹם֙ נָסַ֣בּוּ עַל־הַבַּ֔יִת מִנַּ֖עַר וְעַד־זָקֵ֑ן כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם מִקָּצֶֽה׃
Translated: They had not yet lain down, when the town council [and] the militia of Sodom —insignificant and influential alike, the whole assembly without exception—gathered about the house.
Transliteration: terem yishekhavu veaneshey haiyr aneshey sedom nasavu al-havayiit minaar vead-zaken khׇl-haam mikatseh

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ אֶל־לוֹט֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֔וֹ אַיֵּ֧ה הָאֲנָשִׁ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥אוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ הַלָּ֑יְלָה הוֹצִיאֵ֣ם אֵלֵ֔ינוּ וְנֵדְעָ֖ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And they shouted to Lot and said to him, “Where are the ones who came to you tonight? Bring them out to us, that we may be intimate with them.”
Transliteration: vayikereu el-lvot vayomeru lvo ayeh haanashiym asher-vau eleykha halayelah hvotsiyem eleynu venedeah otam

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֧א אֲלֵהֶ֛ם ל֖וֹט הַפֶּ֑תְחָה וְהַדֶּ֖לֶת סָגַ֥ר אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: So Lot went out to them to the entrance, shut the door behind him,
Transliteration: vayetse alehem lvot hafetechah vehadelet sagar acharayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אַל־נָ֥א אַחַ֖י תָּרֵֽעוּ׃
Translated: and said, “I beg you, my friends, do not commit such a wrong.
Transliteration: vayomar al-na achay tareu

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֨א לִ֜י שְׁתֵּ֣י בָנ֗וֹת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יָדְעוּ֙ אִ֔ישׁ אוֹצִֽיאָה־נָּ֤א אֶתְהֶן֙ אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וַעֲשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֔ן כַּטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם רַ֠ק לָֽאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָאֵל֙ אַל־תַּעֲשׂ֣וּ דָבָ֔ר כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן בָּ֖אוּ בְּצֵ֥ל קֹרָתִֽי׃
Translated: Look, I have two daughters who have not known a man. Let me bring them out to you, and you may do to them as you please; but do not do anything to the others, since they have come under the shelter of my roof.”
Transliteration: hineh-na liy shetey vanvot asher lo-yadeu iysh votsiyah-na etehen aleykhem vaashu lahen khatvov veeyneykhem rak laanashiym hael al-taashu davar khiy-al-khen vau vetsel koratiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ ׀ גֶּשׁ־הָ֗לְאָה וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ הָאֶחָ֤ד בָּֽא־לָגוּר֙ וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֣ט שָׁפ֔וֹט עַתָּ֕ה נָרַ֥ע לְךָ֖ מֵהֶ֑ם וַיִּפְצְר֨וּ בָאִ֤ישׁ בְּלוֹט֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַֽיִּגְּשׁ֖וּ לִשְׁבֹּ֥ר הַדָּֽלֶת׃
Translated: But they said, “Stand back! The fellow,” they said, “came here as an alien, and already he acts the ruler! Now we will deal worse with you than with them.” And they pressed hard against that householder —against Lot—and moved forward to break the door.
Transliteration: vayomeru gesh-haleah vayomeru haechad va-lagur vayishefot shafvot atah nara lekha mehem vayifetseru vaiysh velvot meod vayigeshu lishevor hadalet

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֶת־יָדָ֔ם וַיָּבִ֧יאוּ אֶת־ל֛וֹט אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַבָּ֑יְתָה וְאֶת־הַדֶּ֖לֶת סָגָֽרוּ׃
Translated: But the agents stretched out their hands and pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.
Transliteration: vayishelechu haanashiym et-yadam vayaviyu et-lvot aleyhem havayetah veet-hadelet sagaru

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֞ים אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֣תַח הַבַּ֗יִת הִכּוּ֙ בַּסַּנְוֵרִ֔ים מִקָּטֹ֖ן וְעַד־גָּד֑וֹל וַיִּלְא֖וּ לִמְצֹ֥א הַפָּֽתַח׃
Translated: And the people who were at the entrance of the house, low and high alike, they struck with blinding light, so that they were helpless to find the entrance.
Transliteration: veet-haanashiym asher-fetach havayiit hikhu vasaneveriym mikaton vead-gadvol vayileu limetso hafatach

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים אֶל־ל֗וֹט עֹ֚ד מִֽי־לְךָ֣ פֹ֔ה חָתָן֙ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יךָ וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֖ בָּעִ֑יר הוֹצֵ֖א מִן־הַמָּקֽוֹם׃
Translated: Then the agents said to Lot, “Whom else have you here? Sons-in-law, your sons and daughters, or anyone else that you have in the city—bring them out of the place.
Transliteration: vayomeru haanashiym el-lvot od miy-lekha foh chatan uvaneykha uvenoteykha vekhol asher-lekha vaiyr hvotse min-hamakvom

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מַשְׁחִתִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ אֶת־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־גָדְלָ֤ה צַעֲקָתָם֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֥נוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה לְשַׁחֲתָֽהּ׃
Translated: For we are about to destroy this place; because the outcry against them before יהוה has become so great that יהוה has sent us to destroy it.”
Transliteration: khiy-mashechitiym anachenu et-hamakvom hazeh khiy-gadelah tsaakatam et-feney yehovah vayeshalechenu yehovah leshachatah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א ל֜וֹט וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר ׀ אֶל־חֲתָנָ֣יו ׀ לֹקְחֵ֣י בְנֹתָ֗יו וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ ק֤וּמוּ צְּאוּ֙ מִן־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה כִּֽי־מַשְׁחִ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הָעִ֑יר וַיְהִ֥י כִמְצַחֵ֖ק בְּעֵינֵ֥י חֲתָנָֽיו׃
Translated: So Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who had married his daughters, and said, “Up, get out of this place, for יהוה is about to destroy the city.” But he seemed to his sons-in-law as one who jests.
Transliteration: vayetse lvot vayedaver el-chatanayv lokechey venotayv vayomer kumu tseu min-hamakvom hazeh khiy-mashechiyt yehovah et-haiyr vayehiy khimetsachek veeyney chatanayv

Hebrew: וּכְמוֹ֙ הַשַּׁ֣חַר עָלָ֔ה וַיָּאִ֥יצוּ הַמַּלְאָכִ֖ים בְּל֣וֹט לֵאמֹ֑ר קוּם֩ קַ֨ח אֶֽת־אִשְׁתְּךָ֜ וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֤י בְנֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַנִּמְצָאֹ֔ת פֶּן־תִּסָּפֶ֖ה בַּעֲוֺ֥ן הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: As dawn broke, the messengers urged Lot on, saying, “Up, take your wife and your two remaining daughters, lest you be swept away because of the iniquity of the city.”
Transliteration: ukhemvo hashachar alah vayaiytsu hamaleakhiym velvot lemor kum kach et-ishetekha veet-shetey venoteykha hanimetsaot fen-tisafeh vaavon haiyr

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְמַהְמָ֓הּ ׀ וַיַּחֲזִ֨יקוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים בְּיָד֣וֹ וּבְיַד־אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ וּבְיַד֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י בְנֹתָ֔יו בְּחֶמְלַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלָ֑יו וַיֹּצִאֻ֥הוּ וַיַּנִּחֻ֖הוּ מִח֥וּץ לָעִֽיר׃
Translated: Still he delayed. So the agents seized his hand, and the hands of his wife and his two daughters—in יהוה’s mercy on him—and brought him out and left him outside the city.
Transliteration: vayitemahemah vayachaziyku haanashiym veyadvo uveyad-ishetvo uveyad shetey venotayv vechemelat yehovah alayv vayotsiuhu vayanichuhu michuts laiyr

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כְהוֹצִיאָ֨ם אֹתָ֜ם הַח֗וּצָה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הִמָּלֵ֣ט עַל־נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ אַל־תַּבִּ֣יט אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ וְאַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֖ד בְּכׇל־הַכִּכָּ֑ר הָהָ֥רָה הִמָּלֵ֖ט פֶּן־תִּסָּפֶֽה׃
Translated: When they had brought them outside, one said, “Flee for your life! Do not look behind you, nor stop anywhere in the Plain; flee to the hills, lest you be swept away.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khehvotsiyam otam hachutsah vayomer himalet al-nafeshekha al-taviyt achareykha veal-taamod vekhׇl-hakhikhar haharah himalet fen-tisafeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹט אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אַל־נָ֖א אֲדֹנָֽי׃
Translated: But Lot said to them, “Oh no, my lord!
Transliteration: vayomer lvot alehem al-na adonay

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֠א מָצָ֨א עַבְדְּךָ֣ חֵן֮ בְּעֵינֶ֒יךָ֒ וַתַּגְדֵּ֣ל חַסְדְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ עִמָּדִ֔י לְהַחֲי֖וֹת אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֑י וְאָנֹכִ֗י לֹ֤א אוּכַל֙ לְהִמָּלֵ֣ט הָהָ֔רָה פֶּן־תִּדְבָּקַ֥נִי הָרָעָ֖ה וָמַֽתִּי׃
Translated: You have been so gracious to your servant, and have already shown me so much kindness in order to save my life; but I cannot flee to the hills, lest the disaster overtake me and I die.
Transliteration: hineh-na matsa avedekha chen veeyneykha vatagedel chasedekha asher ashiyta imadiy lehachayvot et-nafeshiy veanokhiy lo ukhal lehimalet haharah fen-tidevakaniy haraah vamatiy

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־נָ֠א הָעִ֨יר הַזֹּ֧את קְרֹבָ֛ה לָנ֥וּס שָׁ֖מָּה וְהִ֣וא מִצְעָ֑ר אִמָּלְטָ֨ה נָּ֜א שָׁ֗מָּה הֲלֹ֥א מִצְעָ֛ר הִ֖וא וּתְחִ֥י נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated: Look, that town there is near enough to flee to; it is such a little place! Let me flee there—it is such a little place—and let my life be saved.”
Transliteration: hineh-na haiyr hazot kerovah lanus shamah vehiv mitsear imaletah na shamah halo mitsear hiv utechiy nafeshiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּה֙ נָשָׂ֣אתִי פָנֶ֔יךָ גַּ֖ם לַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה לְבִלְתִּ֛י הׇפְכִּ֥י אֶת־הָעִ֖יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated: He replied, “Very well, I will grant you this favor too, and I will not annihilate the town of which you have spoken.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv hineh nashatiy faneykha gam ladavar hazeh leviletiy hׇfekhiy et-haiyr asher divareta

Hebrew: מַהֵר֙ הִמָּלֵ֣ט שָׁ֔מָּה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א אוּכַל֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת דָּבָ֔ר עַד־בֹּאֲךָ֖ שָׁ֑מָּה עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרָ֥א שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר צֽוֹעַר׃
Translated: Hurry, flee there, for I cannot do anything until you arrive there.” Hence the town came to be called Zoar.
Transliteration: maher himalet shamah khiy lo ukhal laashvot davar ad-voakha shamah al-khen kara shem-haiyr tsvoar

Hebrew: הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ יָצָ֣א עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְל֖וֹט בָּ֥א צֹֽעֲרָה׃
Translated: As the sun rose upon the earth and Lot entered Zoar,
Transliteration: hashemesh yatsa al-haarets velvot va tsoarah

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֗ה הִמְטִ֧יר עַל־סְדֹ֛ם וְעַל־עֲמֹרָ֖ה גׇּפְרִ֣ית וָאֵ֑שׁ מֵאֵ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: יהוה rained upon Sodom and Gomorrah sulfurous fire from יהוה out of heaven—
Transliteration: vayhovah himetiyr al-sedom veal-amorah gׇferiyt vaesh meet yehovah min-hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַֽיַּהֲפֹךְ֙ אֶת־הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔ל וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הַכִּכָּ֑ר וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הֶעָרִ֔ים וְצֶ֖מַח הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: annihilating those cities and the entire Plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities and the vegetation of the ground.
Transliteration: vayahafokhe et-heariym hael veet khׇl-hakhikhar veet khׇl-yoshevey heariym vetsemach haadamah

Hebrew: וַתַּבֵּ֥ט אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מֵאַחֲרָ֑יו וַתְּהִ֖י נְצִ֥יב מֶֽלַח׃
Translated: Lot’s wife looked back, and she thereupon turned into a pillar of salt.
Transliteration: vatavet ishetvo meacharayv vatehiy netsiyv melach

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֥ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם בַּבֹּ֑קֶר אֶ֨ל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר־עָ֥מַד שָׁ֖ם אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Next morning, Abraham hurried to the place where he had stood before יהוה,
Transliteration: vayashekhem averaham vavoker el-hamakvom asher-amad sham et-feney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁקֵ֗ף עַל־פְּנֵ֤י סְדֹם֙ וַעֲמֹרָ֔ה וְעַֽל־כׇּל־פְּנֵ֖י אֶ֣רֶץ הַכִּכָּ֑ר וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה עָלָה֙ קִיטֹ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ כְּקִיטֹ֖ר הַכִּבְשָֽׁן׃
Translated: and, looking down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and all the land of the Plain, he saw the smoke of the land rising like the smoke of a kiln.
Transliteration: vayashekef al-feney sedom vaamorah veal-khׇl-feney erets hakhikhar vayare vehineh alah kiytor haarets khekiytor hakhiveshan

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁחֵ֤ת אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־עָרֵ֣י הַכִּכָּ֔ר וַיִּזְכֹּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיְשַׁלַּ֤ח אֶת־לוֹט֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַהֲפֵכָ֔ה בַּהֲפֹךְ֙ אֶת־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יָשַׁ֥ב בָּהֵ֖ן לֽוֹט׃
Translated: Thus it was that, when God destroyed the cities of the Plain and annihilated the cities where Lot dwelt, God was mindful of Abraham and removed Lot from the midst of the upheaval.
Transliteration: vayehiy veshachet Elohim et-arey hakhikhar vayizekhor Elohim et-averaham vayeshalach et-lvot mitvokhe hahafekhah vahafokhe et-heariym asher-yashav vahen lvot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַל֩ ל֨וֹט מִצּ֜וֹעַר וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב בָּהָ֗ר וּשְׁתֵּ֤י בְנֹתָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י יָרֵ֖א לָשֶׁ֣בֶת בְּצ֑וֹעַר וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בַּמְּעָרָ֔ה ה֖וּא וּשְׁתֵּ֥י בְנֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: Lot went up from Zoar and settled in the hill country with his two daughters, for he was afraid to dwell in Zoar; and he and his two daughters lived in a cave.
Transliteration: vayaal lvot mitsvoar vayeshev vahar ushetey venotayv imvo khiy yare lashevet vetsvoar vayeshev vamearah hu ushetey venotayv

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֧אמֶר הַבְּכִירָ֛ה אֶל־הַצְּעִירָ֖ה אָבִ֣ינוּ זָקֵ֑ן וְאִ֨ישׁ אֵ֤ין בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ לָב֣וֹא עָלֵ֔ינוּ כְּדֶ֖רֶךְ כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And the older one said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is not a man on earth to consort with us in the way of all the world.
Transliteration: vatomer havekhiyrah el-hatseiyrah aviynu zaken veiysh eyn vaarets lavvo aleynu khederekhe khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: לְכָ֨ה נַשְׁקֶ֧ה אֶת־אָבִ֛ינוּ יַ֖יִן וְנִשְׁכְּבָ֣ה עִמּ֑וֹ וּנְחַיֶּ֥ה מֵאָבִ֖ינוּ זָֽרַע׃
Translated: Come, let us make our father drink wine, and let us lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”
Transliteration: lekhah nashekeh et-aviynu yayiin venishekhevah imvo unechayeh meaviynu zara

Hebrew: וַתַּשְׁקֶ֧יןָ אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֛ן יַ֖יִן בַּלַּ֣יְלָה ה֑וּא וַתָּבֹ֤א הַבְּכִירָה֙ וַתִּשְׁכַּ֣ב אֶת־אָבִ֔יהָ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע בְּשִׁכְבָ֖הּ וּבְקוּׄמָֽהּ׃
Translated: That night they made their father drink wine, and the older one went in and lay with her father; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.
Transliteration: vatashekeyna et-aviyhen yayiin valayelah hu vatavo havekhiyrah vatishekhav et-aviyha velo-yada veshikhevah uvekumah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַתֹּ֤אמֶר הַבְּכִירָה֙ אֶל־הַצְּעִירָ֔ה הֵן־שָׁכַ֥בְתִּי אֶ֖מֶשׁ אֶת־אָבִ֑י נַשְׁקֶ֨נּוּ יַ֜יִן גַּם־הַלַּ֗יְלָה וּבֹ֙אִי֙ שִׁכְבִ֣י עִמּ֔וֹ וּנְחַיֶּ֥ה מֵאָבִ֖ינוּ זָֽרַע׃
Translated: The next day the older one said to the younger, “See, I lay with Father last night; let us make him drink wine tonight also, and you go and lie with him, that we may maintain life through our father.”
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vatomer havekhiyrah el-hatseiyrah hen-shakhavetiy emesh et-aviy nashekenu yayiin gam-halayelah uvoiy shikheviy imvo unechayeh meaviynu zara

Hebrew: וַתַּשְׁקֶ֜יןָ גַּ֣ם בַּלַּ֧יְלָה הַה֛וּא אֶת־אֲבִיהֶ֖ן יָ֑יִן וַתָּ֤קׇם הַצְּעִירָה֙ וַתִּשְׁכַּ֣ב עִמּ֔וֹ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע בְּשִׁכְבָ֖הּ וּבְקֻמָֽהּ׃
Translated: That night also they made their father drink wine, and the younger one went and lay with him; he did not know when she lay down or when she rose.
Transliteration: vatashekeyna gam valayelah hahu et-aviyhen yayiin vatakׇm hatseiyrah vatishekhav imvo velo-yada veshikhevah uvekumah

Hebrew: וַֽתַּהֲרֶ֛יןָ שְׁתֵּ֥י בְנֽוֹת־ל֖וֹט מֵאֲבִיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Thus the two daughters of Lot became pregnant by their father.
Transliteration: vatahareyna shetey venvot-lvot meaviyhen

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤לֶד הַבְּכִירָה֙ בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ מוֹאָ֑ב ה֥וּא אֲבִֽי־מוֹאָ֖ב עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: The older one bore a son and named him Moab; he is the father of the Moabites of today.
Transliteration: vateled havekhiyrah ven vatikera shemvo mvoav hu aviy-mvoav ad-hayyvom

Hebrew: וְהַצְּעִירָ֤ה גַם־הִוא֙ יָ֣לְדָה בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ בֶּן־עַמִּ֑י ה֛וּא אֲבִ֥י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: And the younger also bore a son, and she called him Ben-ammi; he is the father of the Ammonites of today.
Transliteration: vehatseiyrah gam-hiv yaledah ven vatikera shemvo ven-amiy hu aviy veney-amvon ad-hayyvom {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֨ע מִשָּׁ֤ם אַבְרָהָם֙ אַ֣רְצָה הַנֶּ֔גֶב וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בֵּין־קָדֵ֖שׁ וּבֵ֣ין שׁ֑וּר וַיָּ֖גׇר בִּגְרָֽר׃
Translated: Abraham journeyed from there to the region of the Negeb and settled between Kadesh and Shur. While he was sojourning in Gerar,
Transliteration: vayisa misham averaham aretsah hanegev vayeshev veyn-kadesh uveyn shur vayagׇr vigerar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶל־שָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ גְּרָ֔ר וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־שָׂרָֽה׃
Translated: Abraham said of Sarah his wife, “She is my sister.” So King Abimelech of Gerar had Sarah brought to him.
Transliteration: vayomer averaham el-sharah ishetvo achotiy hiv vayishelach aviymelekhe melekhe gerar vayikach et-sharah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ בַּחֲל֣וֹם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הִנְּךָ֥ מֵת֙ עַל־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־לָקַ֔חְתָּ וְהִ֖וא בְּעֻ֥לַת בָּֽעַל׃
Translated: But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, “You are to die because of the woman that you have taken, for she is a married woman.”
Transliteration: vayavo Elohim el-aviymelekhe vachalvom halayelah vayomer lvo hinekha met al-haishah asher-lakacheta vehiv veulat vaal

Hebrew: וַאֲבִימֶ֕לֶךְ לֹ֥א קָרַ֖ב אֵלֶ֑יהָ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֲדֹנָ֕י הֲג֥וֹי גַּם־צַדִּ֖יק תַּהֲרֹֽג׃
Translated: Now Abimelech had not approached her. He said, “O lord, will You slay people even though innocent?
Transliteration: vaaviymelekhe lo karav eleyha vayomar adonay hagvoy gam-tsadiyk taharog

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֨א ה֤וּא אָֽמַר־לִי֙ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֔וא וְהִֽיא־גַם־הִ֥וא אָֽמְרָ֖ה אָחִ֣י ה֑וּא בְּתׇם־לְבָבִ֛י וּבְנִקְיֹ֥ן כַּפַּ֖י עָשִׂ֥יתִי זֹֽאת׃
Translated: He himself said to me, ‘She is my sister’! And she also said, ‘He is my brother.’ When I did this, my heart was blameless and my hands were clean.”
Transliteration: halo hu amar-liy achotiy hiv vehiy-gam-hiv amerah achiy hu vetׇm-levaviy uvenikeyon khafay ashiytiy zot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אֵלָ֨יו הָֽאֱלֹהִ֜ים בַּחֲלֹ֗ם גַּ֣ם אָנֹכִ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ כִּ֤י בְתׇם־לְבָבְךָ֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ זֹּ֔את וָאֶחְשֹׂ֧ךְ גַּם־אָנֹכִ֛י אֽוֹתְךָ֖ מֵחֲטוֹ־לִ֑י עַל־כֵּ֥ן לֹא־נְתַתִּ֖יךָ לִנְגֹּ֥עַ אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: And God said to him in the dream, “I knew that you did this with a blameless heart, and so I kept you from sinning against Me. That was why I did not let you touch her.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv haElohimm vachalom gam anokhiy yadaetiy khiy vetׇm-levavekha ashiyta zot vaecheshokhe gam-anokhiy votekha mechatvo-liy al-khen lo-netatiykha linegoa eleyha

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הָשֵׁ֤ב אֵֽשֶׁת־הָאִישׁ֙ כִּֽי־נָבִ֣יא ה֔וּא וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֥ל בַּֽעַדְךָ֖ וֶֽחְיֵ֑ה וְאִם־אֵֽינְךָ֣ מֵשִׁ֔יב דַּ֚ע כִּי־מ֣וֹת תָּמ֔וּת אַתָּ֖ה וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Therefore, restore the man’s wife—since he is a prophet, he will intercede for you—to save your life. If you fail to restore her, know that you shall die, you and all that are yours.”
Transliteration: veatah hashev eshet-haiysh khiy-naviy hu veyitefalel vaadekha vecheeih veim-eynekha meshiyv da khiy-mvot tamut atah vekhׇl-asher-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּקְרָא֙ לְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֔יו וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Early next morning, Abimelech called his servants and told them all that had happened; and they were greatly frightened.
Transliteration: vayashekhem aviymelekhe vavoker vayikera lekhׇl-avadayv vayedaver et-khׇl-hadevariym haeleh veׇzeneyhem vayiyreu haanashiym meod

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ לְאַבְרָהָ֗ם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֜וֹ מֶֽה־עָשִׂ֤יתָ לָּ֙נוּ֙ וּמֶֽה־חָטָ֣אתִי לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־הֵבֵ֧אתָ עָלַ֛י וְעַל־מַמְלַכְתִּ֖י חֲטָאָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֑ה מַעֲשִׂים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יֵֽעָשׂ֔וּ עָשִׂ֖יתָ עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Then Abimelech summoned Abraham and said to him, “What have you done to us? What wrong have I done that you should bring so great a guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done to me things that ought not to be done.
Transliteration: vayikera aviymelekhe leaveraham vayomer lvo meh-ashiyta lanu umeh-chatatiy lakhe khiy-heveta alay veal-mamelakhetiy chataah gedolah maashiym asher lo-eiashu ashiyta imadiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם מָ֣ה רָאִ֔יתָ כִּ֥י עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: What, then,” Abimelech demanded of Abraham, “was your purpose in doing this thing?”
Transliteration: vayomer aviymelekhe el-averaham mah raiyta khiy ashiyta et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם כִּ֣י אָמַ֗רְתִּי רַ֚ק אֵין־יִרְאַ֣ת אֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַהֲרָג֖וּנִי עַל־דְּבַ֥ר אִשְׁתִּֽי׃
Translated: “I thought,” said Abraham, “surely there is no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.
Transliteration: vayomer averaham khiy amaretiy rak eyn-yireat Elohim vamakvom hazeh vaharaguniy al-devar ishetiy

Hebrew: וְגַם־אׇמְנָ֗ה אֲחֹתִ֤י בַת־אָבִי֙ הִ֔וא אַ֖ךְ לֹ֣א בַת־אִמִּ֑י וַתְּהִי־לִ֖י לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: And besides, she is in truth my sister, my father’s daughter though not my mother’s; and she became my wife.
Transliteration: vegam-ׇmenah achotiy vat-aviy hiv akhe lo vat-imiy vatehiy-liy leishah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר הִתְע֣וּ אֹתִ֗י אֱלֹהִים֮ מִבֵּ֣ית אָבִי֒ וָאֹמַ֣ר לָ֔הּ זֶ֣ה חַסְדֵּ֔ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשִׂ֖י עִמָּדִ֑י אֶ֤ל כׇּל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָב֣וֹא שָׁ֔מָּה אִמְרִי־לִ֖י אָחִ֥י הֽוּא׃
Translated: So when God made me wander from my father’s house, I said to her, ‘Let this be the kindness that you shall do me: whatever place we come to, say there of me: He is my brother.’”
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher hiteu otiy Elohim miveyt aviy vaomar lah zeh chasedekhe asher taashiy imadiy el khׇl-hamakvom asher navvo shamah imeriy-liy achiy hu

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֗ר וַעֲבָדִים֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לְאַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיָּ֣שֶׁב ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת שָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Abimelech took sheep and oxen, and male and female slaves, and gave them to Abraham; and he restored his wife Sarah to him.
Transliteration: vayikach aviymelekhe tson uvakar vaavadiym ushefachot vayiten leaveraham vayashev lvo et sharah ishetvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ הִנֵּ֥ה אַרְצִ֖י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ בַּטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ שֵֽׁב׃
Translated: And Abimelech said, “Here, my land is before you; settle wherever you please.”
Transliteration: vayomer aviymelekhe hineh aretsiy lefaneykha vatvov veeyneykha shev

Hebrew: וּלְשָׂרָ֣ה אָמַ֗ר הִנֵּ֨ה נָתַ֜תִּי אֶ֤לֶף כֶּ֙סֶף֙ לְאָחִ֔יךְ הִנֵּ֤ה הוּא־לָךְ֙ כְּס֣וּת עֵינַ֔יִם לְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתָּ֑ךְ וְאֵ֥ת כֹּ֖ל וְנֹכָֽחַת׃
Translated: And to Sarah he said, “I herewith give your brother a thousand pieces of silver; this will serve you as vindication before all who are with you, and you are cleared before everyone.”
Transliteration: ulesharah amar hineh natatiy elef khesef leachiykhe hineh hu-lakhe khesut eynayiim lekhol asher itakhe veet khol venokhachat

Hebrew: וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּרְפָּ֨א אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֧לֶךְ וְאֶת־אִשְׁתּ֛וֹ וְאַמְהֹתָ֖יו וַיֵּלֵֽדוּ׃
Translated: Abraham then prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his slave girls, so that they bore children;
Transliteration: vayitefalel averaham el-haElohim vayirefa Elohim et-aviymelekhe veet-ishetvo veamehotayv vayeledu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עָצֹ֤ר עָצַר֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּעַ֥ד כׇּל־רֶ֖חֶם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר שָׂרָ֖ה אֵ֥שֶׁת אַבְרָהָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: for יהוה had closed fast every womb of the household of Abimelech because of Sarah, the wife of Abraham.
Transliteration: khiy-atsor atsar yehovah vead khׇl-rechem leveyt aviymelekhe al-devar sharah eshet averaham {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֛ה פָּקַ֥ד אֶת־שָׂרָ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמָ֑ר וַיַּ֧עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֛ה לְשָׂרָ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: יהוה took note of Sarah as promised, and יהוה did for Sarah what had been announced.
Transliteration: vayhovah fakad et-sharah khaasher amar vayaash yehovah lesharah khaasher diver

Hebrew: וַתַּ֩הַר֩ וַתֵּ֨לֶד שָׂרָ֧ה לְאַבְרָהָ֛ם בֵּ֖ן לִזְקֻנָ֑יו לַמּוֹעֵ֕ד אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the set time of which God had spoken.
Transliteration: vatahar vateled sharah leaveraham ven lizekunayv lamvoed asher-diver otvo Elohim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶֽת־שֶׁם־בְּנ֧וֹ הַנּֽוֹלַד־ל֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָה־לּ֥וֹ שָׂרָ֖ה יִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: Abraham gave his newborn son, whom Sarah had borne him, the name of Isaac.
Transliteration: vayikera averaham et-shem-venvo hanvolad-lvo asher-yaledah-lvo sharah yitsechak

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤מׇל אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ בֶּן־שְׁמֹנַ֖ת יָמִ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: And when his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God had commanded him.
Transliteration: vayamׇl averaham et-yitsechak venvo ven-shemonat yamiym khaasher tsivah otvo Elohim

Hebrew: וְאַבְרָהָ֖ם בֶּן־מְאַ֣ת שָׁנָ֑ה בְּהִוָּ֣לֶד ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת יִצְחָ֥ק בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
Transliteration: veaveraham ven-meat shanah vehivaled lvo et yitsechak venvo

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר שָׂרָ֔ה צְחֹ֕ק עָ֥שָׂה לִ֖י אֱלֹהִ֑ים כׇּל־הַשֹּׁמֵ֖עַ יִֽצְחַק־לִֽי׃
Translated: Sarah said, “God has brought me laughter; everyone who hears will laugh with me.”
Transliteration: vatomer sharah tsechok ashah liy Elohim khׇl-hashomea yitsechak-liy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֗אמֶר מִ֤י מִלֵּל֙ לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם הֵינִ֥יקָה בָנִ֖ים שָׂרָ֑ה כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי בֵ֖ן לִזְקֻנָֽיו׃
Translated:
And she added,
“Who would have said to Abraham
That Sarah would suckle children!
Yet I have borne a son in his old age.”
Transliteration: vatomer miy milel leaveraham heyniykah vaniym sharah khiy-yaladetiy ven lizekunayv

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּ֥ל הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַיִּגָּמַ֑ל וַיַּ֤עַשׂ אַבְרָהָם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֣ה גָד֔וֹל בְּי֖וֹם הִגָּמֵ֥ל אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: The child grew up and was weaned, and Abraham held a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.
Transliteration: vayigedal hayeled vayigamal vayaash averaham misheteh gadvol veyvom higamel et-yitsechak

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֨רֶא שָׂרָ֜ה אֶֽת־בֶּן־הָגָ֧ר הַמִּצְרִ֛ית אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם מְצַחֵֽק׃
Translated: Sarah saw the son whom Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham playing.
Transliteration: vatere sharah et-ven-hagar hamitseriyt asher-yaledah leaveraham metsachek

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם גָּרֵ֛שׁ הָאָמָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את וְאֶת־בְּנָ֑הּ כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יִירַשׁ֙ בֶּן־הָאָמָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את עִם־בְּנִ֖י עִם־יִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: She said to Abraham, “Cast out that slave-woman and her son, for the son of that slave shall not share in the inheritance with my son Isaac.”
Transliteration: vatomer leaveraham garesh haamah hazot veet-venah khiy lo yiyrash ven-haamah hazot im-veniy im-yitsechak

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧רַע הַדָּבָ֛ר מְאֹ֖ד בְּעֵינֵ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם עַ֖ל אוֹדֹ֥ת בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The matter distressed Abraham greatly, for it concerned a son of his.
Transliteration: vayera hadavar meod veeyney averaham al vodot venvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֗ם אַל־יֵרַ֤ע בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ עַל־הַנַּ֣עַר וְעַל־אֲמָתֶ֔ךָ כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תֹּאמַ֥ר אֵלֶ֛יךָ שָׂרָ֖ה שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלָ֑הּ כִּ֣י בְיִצְחָ֔ק יִקָּרֵ֥א לְךָ֖ זָֽרַע׃
Translated: But God said to Abraham, “Do not be distressed over the boy or your slave; whatever Sarah tells you, do as she says, for it is through Isaac that offspring shall be continued for you.
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-averaham al-eira veeyneykha al-hanaar veal-amatekha khol asher tomar eleykha sharah shema vekolah khiy veyitsechak yikare lekha zara

Hebrew: וְגַ֥ם אֶת־בֶּן־הָאָמָ֖ה לְג֣וֹי אֲשִׂימֶ֑נּוּ כִּ֥י זַרְעֲךָ֖ הֽוּא׃
Translated: As for the son of the slave-woman, I will make a nation of him, too, for he is your seed.”
Transliteration: vegam et-ven-haamah legvoy ashiymenu khiy zareakha hu

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֣ם אַבְרָהָ֣ם <small>׀</small> בַּבֹּ֡קֶר וַיִּֽקַּֽח־לֶ֩חֶם֩ וְחֵ֨מַת מַ֜יִם וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶל־הָ֠גָ֠ר שָׂ֧ם עַל־שִׁכְמָ֛הּ וְאֶת־הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֶ֑הָ וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ וַתֵּ֔תַע בְּמִדְבַּ֖ר בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: Early next morning Abraham took some bread and a skin of water, and gave them to Hagar. He placed them over her shoulder, together with the child, and sent her away. And she wandered about in the wilderness of Beer-sheba.
Transliteration: vayashekhem averaham <small></small> vavoker vayikach-lechem vechemat mayiim vayiten el-hagar sham al-shikhemah veet-hayeled vayeshalecheha vatelekhe vateta vemidevar veer shava

Hebrew: וַיִּכְל֥וּ הַמַּ֖יִם מִן־הַחֵ֑מֶת וַתַּשְׁלֵ֣ךְ אֶת־הַיֶּ֔לֶד תַּ֖חַת אַחַ֥ד הַשִּׂיחִֽם׃
Translated: When the water was gone from the skin, she left the child under one of the bushes,
Transliteration: vayikhelu hamayiim min-hachemet vatashelekhe et-hayeled tachat achad hashiychim

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֩לֶךְ֩ וַתֵּ֨שֶׁב לָ֜הּ מִנֶּ֗גֶד הַרְחֵק֙ כִּמְטַחֲוֵ֣י קֶ֔שֶׁת כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֔ה אַל־אֶרְאֶ֖ה בְּמ֣וֹת הַיָּ֑לֶד וַתֵּ֣שֶׁב מִנֶּ֔גֶד וַתִּשָּׂ֥א אֶת־קֹלָ֖הּ וַתֵּֽבְךְּ׃
Translated: and went and sat down at a distance, a bowshot away; for she thought, “Let me not look on as the child dies.” And sitting thus afar, she burst into tears.
Transliteration: vatelekhe vateshev lah mineged harechek khimetachavey keshet khiy amerah al-ereeh vemvot hayaled vateshev mineged vatisha et-kolah vatevekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אֱלֹהִים֮ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַנַּ֒עַר֒ וַיִּקְרָא֩ מַלְאַ֨ךְ אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> אֶל־הָגָר֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָ֖הּ מַה־לָּ֣ךְ הָגָ֑ר אַל־תִּ֣ירְאִ֔י כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֧ע אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־ק֥וֹל הַנַּ֖עַר בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הוּא־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: God heard the cry of the boy, and a messenger of God called to Hagar from heaven and said to her, “What troubles you, Hagar? Fear not, for God has heeded the cry of the boy where he is.
Transliteration: vayishema Elohim et-kvol hanaar vayikera maleakhe Elohim <small></small> el-hagar min-hashamayiim vayomer lah mah-lakhe hagar al-tiyreiy khiy-shama Elohim el-kvol hanaar vaasher hu-sham

Hebrew: ק֚וּמִי שְׂאִ֣י אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר וְהַחֲזִ֥יקִי אֶת־יָדֵ֖ךְ בּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל אֲשִׂימֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Come, lift up the boy and hold him by the hand, for I will make a great nation of him.”
Transliteration: kumiy sheiy et-hanaar vehachaziykiy et-yadekhe vvo khiy-legvoy gadvol ashiymenu

Hebrew: וַיִּפְקַ֤ח אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־עֵינֶ֔יהָ וַתֵּ֖רֶא בְּאֵ֣ר מָ֑יִם וַתֵּ֜לֶךְ וַתְּמַלֵּ֤א אֶת־הַחֵ֙מֶת֙ מַ֔יִם וַתַּ֖שְׁקְ אֶת־הַנָּֽעַר׃
Translated: Then God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water. She went and filled the skin with water, and let the boy drink.
Transliteration: vayifekach Elohim et-eyneyha vatere veer mayiim vatelekhe vatemale et-hachemet mayiim vatasheke et-hanaar

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֧י אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הַנַּ֖עַר וַיִּגְדָּ֑ל וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וַיְהִ֖י רֹבֶ֥ה קַשָּֽׁת׃
Translated: God was with the boy and he grew up; he dwelt in the wilderness and became skilled with a bow.
Transliteration: vayehiy Elohim et-hanaar vayigedal vayeshev vamidevar vayehiy roveh kashat

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר פָּארָ֑ן וַתִּֽקַּֽח־ל֥וֹ אִמּ֛וֹ אִשָּׁ֖ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: He lived in the wilderness of Paran; and his mother got a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayeshev vemidevar faran vatikach-lvo imvo ishah meerets mitserayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ וּפִיכֹל֙ שַׂר־צְבָא֔וֹ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר אֱלֹהִ֣ים עִמְּךָ֔ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: At that time Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything that you do.
Transliteration: vayehiy vaet hahiv vayomer aviymelekhe ufiykhol shar-tsevavo el-averaham lemor Elohim imekha vekhol asher-atah osheh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִשָּׁ֨בְעָה לִּ֤י בֵֽאלֹהִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה אִם־תִּשְׁקֹ֣ר לִ֔י וּלְנִינִ֖י וּלְנֶכְדִּ֑י כַּחֶ֜סֶד אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֤יתִי עִמְּךָ֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה עִמָּדִ֔י וְעִם־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־גַּ֥רְתָּה בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Therefore swear to me here by God that you will not deal falsely with me or with my kith and kin, but will deal with me and with the land in which you have sojourned as loyally as I have dealt with you.”
Transliteration: veatah hishaveah liy velohiym henah im-tishekor liy uleniyniy ulenekhediy khachesed asher-ashiytiy imekha taasheh imadiy veim-haarets asher-garetah vah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם אָנֹכִ֖י אִשָּׁבֵֽעַ׃
Translated: And Abraham said, “I swear it.”
Transliteration: vayomer averaham anokhiy ishavea

Hebrew: וְהוֹכִ֥חַ אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ עַל־אֹדוֹת֙ בְּאֵ֣ר הַמַּ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּזְל֖וּ עַבְדֵ֥י אֲבִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then Abraham reproached Abimelech for the well of water which the servants of Abimelech had seized.
Transliteration: vehvokhicha averaham et-aviymelekhe al-odvot veer hamayiim asher gazelu avedey aviymelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי מִ֥י עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְגַם־אַתָּ֞ה לֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֗י וְגַ֧ם אָנֹכִ֛י לֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖עְתִּי בִּלְתִּ֥י הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: But Abimelech said, “I do not know who did this; you did not tell me, nor have I heard of it until today.”
Transliteration: vayomer aviymelekhe lo yadaetiy miy ashah et-hadavar hazeh vegam-atah lo-higadeta liy vegam anokhiy lo shamaetiy viletiy hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח אַבְרָהָם֙ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֔ר וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לַאֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַיִּכְרְת֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם בְּרִֽית׃
Translated: Abraham took sheep and oxen and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a pact.
Transliteration: vayikach averaham tson uvakar vayiten laaviymelekhe vayikheretu sheneyhem veriyt

Hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֣ב אַבְרָהָ֗ם אֶת־שֶׁ֛בַע כִּבְשֹׂ֥ת הַצֹּ֖אן לְבַדְּהֶֽן׃
Translated: Abraham then set seven ewes of the flock by themselves,
Transliteration: vayatsev averaham et-sheva khiveshot hatson levadehen

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם מָ֣ה הֵ֗נָּה שֶׁ֤בַע כְּבָשֹׂת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִצַּ֖בְתָּ לְבַדָּֽנָה׃
Translated: and Abimelech said to Abraham, “What mean these seven ewes which you have set apart?”
Transliteration: vayomer aviymelekhe el-averaham mah henah sheva khevashot haeleh asher hitsaveta levadanah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֚י אֶת־שֶׁ֣בַע כְּבָשֹׂ֔ת תִּקַּ֖ח מִיָּדִ֑י בַּעֲבוּר֙ תִּֽהְיֶה־לִּ֣י לְעֵדָ֔ה כִּ֥י חָפַ֖רְתִּי אֶת־הַבְּאֵ֥ר הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: He replied, “You are to accept these seven ewes from me as proof that I dug this well.”
Transliteration: vayomer khiy et-sheva khevashot tikach miyadiy vaavur tiheyeh-liy leedah khiy chafaretiy et-haveer hazot

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֗ן קָרָ֛א לַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע כִּ֛י שָׁ֥ם נִשְׁבְּע֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Hence that place was called Beer-sheba, for there the two of them swore an oath.
Transliteration: al-khen kara lamakvom hahu veer shava khiy sham nisheveu sheneyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרְת֥וּ בְרִ֖ית בִּבְאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיָּ֣קׇם אֲבִימֶ֗לֶךְ וּפִיכֹל֙ שַׂר־צְבָא֔וֹ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: When they had concluded the pact at Beer-sheba, Abimelech and Phicol, chief of his troops, departed and returned to the land of the Philistines.
Transliteration: vayikheretu veriyt viveer shava vayakׇm aviymelekhe ufiykhol shar-tsevavo vayashuvu el-erets felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיִּטַּ֥ע אֶ֖שֶׁל בִּבְאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיִּ֨קְרָא־שָׁ֔ם בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵ֥ל עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: [Abraham] planted a tamarisk at Beer-sheba, and invoked there the name of יהוה, the Everlasting God.
Transliteration: vayita eshel viveer shava vayikera-sham veshem yehovah el volam

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧גׇר אַבְרָהָ֛ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: And Abraham resided in the land of the Philistines a long time.
Transliteration: vayagׇr averaham veerets felishetiym yamiym raviym {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְהָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים נִסָּ֖ה אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: Some time afterward, God put Abraham to the test, saying to him, “Abraham.” He answered, “Here I am.”
Transliteration: vayehiy achar hadevariym haeleh vehaElohimm nisah et-averaham vayomer elayv averaham vayomer hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר קַח־נָ֠א אֶת־בִּנְךָ֨ אֶת־יְחִֽידְךָ֤ אֲשֶׁר־אָהַ֙בְתָּ֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֔ק וְלֶ֨ךְ־לְךָ֔ אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ הַמֹּרִיָּ֑ה וְהַעֲלֵ֤הוּ שָׁם֙ לְעֹלָ֔ה עַ֚ל אַחַ֣ד הֶֽהָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: “Take your son, your favored one, Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the heights that I will point out to you.”
Transliteration: vayomer kach-na et-vinekha et-yechiydekha asher-ahaveta et-yitsechak velekhe-lekha el-erets hamoriyah vehaalehu sham leolah al achad hehariym asher omar eleykha

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם אַבְרָהָ֜ם בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַֽיַּחֲבֹשׁ֙ אֶת־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י נְעָרָיו֙ אִתּ֔וֹ וְאֵ֖ת יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֑וֹ וַיְבַקַּע֙ עֲצֵ֣י עֹלָ֔ה וַיָּ֣קׇם וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אָֽמַר־ל֥וֹ הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: So early next morning, Abraham saddled his ass and took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. He split the wood for the burnt offering, and he set out for the place of which God had told him.
Transliteration: vayashekhem averaham vavoker vayachavosh et-chamorvo vayikach et-sheney nearayv itvo veet yitsechak venvo vayevaka atsey olah vayakׇm vayelekhe el-hamakvom asher-amar-lvo haElohim

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַבְרָהָ֧ם אֶת־עֵינָ֛יו וַיַּ֥רְא אֶת־הַמָּק֖וֹם מֵרָחֹֽק׃
Translated: On the third day Abraham looked up and saw the place from afar.
Transliteration: vayyvom hasheliyshiy vayisha averaham et-eynayv vayare et-hamakvom merachok

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶל־נְעָרָ֗יו שְׁבוּ־לָכֶ֥ם פֹּה֙ עִֽם־הַחֲמ֔וֹר וַאֲנִ֣י וְהַנַּ֔עַר נֵלְכָ֖ה עַד־כֹּ֑ה וְנִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה וְנָשׁ֥וּבָה אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then Abraham said to his servants, “You stay here with the ass. The boy and I will go up there; we will worship and we will return to you.”
Transliteration: vayomer averaham el-nearayv shevu-lakhem foh im-hachamvor vaaniy vehanaar nelekhah ad-khoh venishetachaveh venashuvah aleykhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־עֲצֵ֣י הָעֹלָ֗ה וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ עַל־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח בְּיָד֔וֹ אֶת־הָאֵ֖שׁ וְאֶת־הַֽמַּאֲכֶ֑לֶת וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated: Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and put it on his son Isaac. He himself took the firestone and the knife; and the two walked off together.
Transliteration: vayikach averaham et-atsey haolah vayashem al-yitsechak venvo vayikach veyadvo et-haesh veet-hamaakhelet vayelekhu sheneyhem yachedav

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יִצְחָ֜ק אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֤ם אָבִיו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָבִ֔י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֶּ֣נִּֽי בְנִ֑י וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּ֤ה הָאֵשׁ֙ וְהָ֣עֵצִ֔ים וְאַיֵּ֥ה הַשֶּׂ֖ה לְעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Then Isaac said to his father Abraham, “Father!” And he answered, “Yes, my son.” And he said, “Here are the firestone and the wood; but where is the sheep for the burnt offering?”
Transliteration: vayomer yitsechak el-averaham aviyv vayomer aviy vayomer hineniy veniy vayomer hineh haesh vehaetsiym veayeh hasheh leolah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֱלֹהִ֞ים יִרְאֶה־לּ֥וֹ הַשֶּׂ֛ה לְעֹלָ֖ה בְּנִ֑י וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated: And Abraham said, “It is God who will see to the sheep for this burnt offering, my son.” And the two of them walked on together.
Transliteration: vayomer averaham Elohim yireeh-lvo hasheh leolah veniy vayelekhu sheneyhem yachedav

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ אֶֽל־הַמָּקוֹם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽמַר־ל֣וֹ הָאֱלֹהִים֒ וַיִּ֨בֶן שָׁ֤ם אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ אֶת־הָעֵצִ֑ים וַֽיַּעֲקֹד֙ אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֔וֹ וַיָּ֤שֶׂם אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ מִמַּ֖עַל לָעֵצִֽים׃
Translated: They arrived at the place of which God had told him. Abraham built an altar there; he laid out the wood; he bound his son Isaac; he laid him on the altar, on top of the wood.
Transliteration: vayavou el-hamakvom asher amar-lvo haElohim vayiven sham averaham et-hamizevecha vayaarokhe et-haetsiym vayaakod et-yitsechak venvo vayashem otvo al-hamizevecha mimaal laetsiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֖ח אֶת־הַֽמַּאֲכֶ֑לֶת לִשְׁחֹ֖ט אֶת־בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Abraham picked up the knife to slay his son.
Transliteration: vayishelach averaham et-yadvo vayikach et-hamaakhelet lishechot et-venvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֵלָ֜יו מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֣ם <small>׀</small> אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: Then a messenger of יהוה called to him from heaven: “Abraham! Abraham!” And he answered, “Here I am.”
Transliteration: vayikera elayv maleakhe yehovah min-hashamayiim vayomer averaham <small></small> averaham vayomer hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַל־תִּשְׁלַ֤ח יָֽדְךָ֙ אֶל־הַנַּ֔עַר וְאַל־תַּ֥עַשׂ ל֖וֹ מְא֑וּמָה כִּ֣י ׀ עַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־יְרֵ֤א אֱלֹהִים֙ אַ֔תָּה וְלֹ֥א חָשַׂ֛כְתָּ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֥ אֶת־יְחִידְךָ֖ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated: “Do not raise your hand against the boy, or do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your son, your favored one, from Me.”
Transliteration: vayomer al-tishelach yadekha el-hanaar veal-taash lvo meumah khiy atah yadaetiy khiy-yere Elohim atah velo chashakheta et-vinekha et-yechiydekha mimeniy

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ וְהִנֵּה־אַ֔יִל אַחַ֕ר נֶאֱחַ֥ז בַּסְּבַ֖ךְ בְּקַרְנָ֑יו וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ אַבְרָהָם֙ וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־הָאַ֔יִל וַיַּעֲלֵ֥הוּ לְעֹלָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: When Abraham looked up, his eye fell upon a ram, caught in the thicket by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram and offered it up as a burnt offering in place of his son.
Transliteration: vayisha averaham et-eynayv vayare vehineh-ayiil achar neechaz vasevakhe vekarenayv vayelekhe averaham vayikach et-haayiil vayaalehu leolah tachat venvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א אַבְרָהָ֛ם שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> יִרְאֶ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יֵאָמֵ֣ר הַיּ֔וֹם בְּהַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה יֵרָאֶֽה׃
Translated: And Abraham named that site Adonai-yireh, whence the present saying, “On the mount of יהוה there is vision.”
Transliteration: vayikera averaham shem-hamakvom hahu yehovah <small></small> yireeh asher eiamer hayyvom vehar yehovah eiraeh

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־אַבְרָהָ֑ם שֵׁנִ֖ית מִן־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: The messenger of יהוה called to Abraham a second time from heaven,
Transliteration: vayikera maleakhe yehovah el-averaham sheniyt min-hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בִּ֥י נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֗י יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וְלֹ֥א חָשַׂ֖כְתָּ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֥ אֶת־יְחִידֶֽךָ׃
Translated: and said, “By Myself I swear, יהוה declares: Because you have done this and have not withheld your son, your favored one,
Transliteration: vayomer viy nishevaetiy neum-yehovah khiy yaan asher ashiyta et-hadavar hazeh velo chashakheta et-vinekha et-yechiydekha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בָרֵ֣ךְ אֲבָרֶכְךָ֗ וְהַרְבָּ֨ה אַרְבֶּ֤ה אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְכַח֕וֹל אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־שְׂפַ֣ת הַיָּ֑ם וְיִרַ֣שׁ זַרְעֲךָ֔ אֵ֖ת שַׁ֥עַר אֹיְבָֽיו׃
Translated: I will bestow My blessing upon you and make your descendants as numerous as the stars of heaven and the sands on the seashore; and your descendants shall seize the gates of their foes.
Transliteration: khiy-varekhe avarekhekha veharevah areveh et-zareakha khekhvokhevey hashamayiim vekhachvol asher al-shefat hayam veyirash zareakha et shaar oyevayv

Hebrew: וְהִתְבָּרְכ֣וּ בְזַרְעֲךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ עֵ֕קֶב אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ בְּקֹלִֽי׃
Translated: All the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your descendants, because you have obeyed My command.”
Transliteration: vehitevarekhu vezareakha khol gvoeiy haarets ekev asher shamaeta vekoliy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב אַבְרָהָם֙ אֶל־נְעָרָ֔יו וַיָּקֻ֛מוּ וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ יַחְדָּ֖ו אֶל־בְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב אַבְרָהָ֖ם בִּבְאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃ {פ}
Translated: Abraham then returned to his servants, and they departed together for Beer-sheba; and Abraham stayed in Beer-sheba.
Transliteration: vayashׇv averaham el-nearayv vayakumu vayelekhu yachedav el-veer shava vayeshev averaham viveer shava {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר הִ֠נֵּ֠ה יָלְדָ֨ה מִלְכָּ֥ה גַם־הִ֛וא בָּנִ֖ים לְנָח֥וֹר אָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: Some time later, Abraham was told, “Milcah too has borne sons to your brother Nahor:
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey hadevariym haeleh vayugad leaveraham lemor hineh yaledah milekhah gam-hiv vaniym lenachvor achiykha

Hebrew: אֶת־ע֥וּץ בְּכֹר֖וֹ וְאֶת־בּ֣וּז אָחִ֑יו וְאֶת־קְמוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֥י אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: Uz the first-born, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram;
Transliteration: et-uts vekhorvo veet-vuz achiyv veet-kemuel aviy aram

Hebrew: וְאֶת־כֶּ֣שֶׂד וְאֶת־חֲז֔וֹ וְאֶת־פִּלְדָּ֖שׁ וְאֶת־יִדְלָ֑ף וְאֵ֖ת בְּתוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: and Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel”—
Transliteration: veet-kheshed veet-chazvo veet-filedash veet-yidelaf veet vetuel

Hebrew: וּבְתוּאֵ֖ל יָלַ֣ד אֶת־רִבְקָ֑ה שְׁמֹנָ֥ה אֵ֙לֶּה֙ יָלְדָ֣ה מִלְכָּ֔ה לְנָח֖וֹר אֲחִ֥י אַבְרָהָֽם׃
Translated: Bethuel being the father of Rebekah. These eight Milcah bore to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.
Transliteration: uvetuel yalad et-rivekah shemonah eleh yaledah milekhah lenachvor achiy averaham

Hebrew: וּפִֽילַגְשׁ֖וֹ וּשְׁמָ֣הּ רְאוּמָ֑ה וַתֵּ֤לֶד גַּם־הִוא֙ אֶת־טֶ֣בַח וְאֶת־גַּ֔חַם וְאֶת־תַּ֖חַשׁ וְאֶֽת־מַעֲכָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore [sons]—Tebah, Gaham, and Tahash—and [a daughter,] Maacah.
Transliteration: ufiylageshvo ushemah reumah vateled gam-hiv et-tevach veet-gacham veet-tachash veet-maakhah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּהְיוּ֙ חַיֵּ֣י שָׂרָ֔ה מֵאָ֥ה שָׁנָ֛ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים שְׁנֵ֖י חַיֵּ֥י שָׂרָֽה׃
Translated: Sarah’s lifetime—the span of Sarah’s life—came to one hundred and twenty-seven years.
Transliteration: vayiheyu chayey sharah meah shanah veesheriym shanah vesheva shaniym sheney chayey sharah

Hebrew: וַתָּ֣מׇת שָׂרָ֗ה בְּקִרְיַ֥ת אַרְבַּ֛ע הִ֥וא חֶבְר֖וֹן בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיָּבֹא֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם לִסְפֹּ֥ד לְשָׂרָ֖ה וְלִבְ<small>כֹּ</small>תָֽהּ׃
Translated: Sarah died in Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan; and Abraham proceeded to mourn for Sarah and to bewail her.
Transliteration: vatamׇt sharah vekireyat areva hiv chevervon veerets khenaan vayavo averaham lisefod lesharah velive<small>kho</small>tah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י מֵת֑וֹ וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶל־בְּנֵי־חֵ֖ת לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then Abraham rose from beside his dead, and spoke to the Hittites, saying,
Transliteration: vayakׇm averaham meal feney metvo vayedaver el-veney-chet lemor

Hebrew: גֵּר־וְתוֹשָׁ֥ב אָנֹכִ֖י עִמָּכֶ֑ם תְּנ֨וּ לִ֤י אֲחֻזַּת־קֶ֙בֶר֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה מֵתִ֖י מִלְּפָנָֽי׃
Translated: “I am a resident alien among you; sell me a burial site among you, that I may remove my dead for burial.”
Transliteration: ger-vetvoshav anokhiy imakhem tenu liy achuzat-kever imakhem veekeverah metiy milefanay

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֧וּ בְנֵי־חֵ֛ת אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And the Hittites replied to Abraham, saying to him,
Transliteration: vayaanu veney-chet et-averaham lemor lvo

Hebrew: שְׁמָעֵ֣נוּ ׀ אֲדֹנִ֗י נְשִׂ֨יא אֱלֹהִ֤ים אַתָּה֙ בְּתוֹכֵ֔נוּ בְּמִבְחַ֣ר קְבָרֵ֔ינוּ קְבֹ֖ר אֶת־מֵתֶ֑ךָ אִ֣ישׁ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ אֶת־קִבְר֛וֹ לֹֽא־יִכְלֶ֥ה מִמְּךָ֖ מִקְּבֹ֥ר מֵתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “Hear us, my lord: you are the elect of God among us. Bury your dead in the choicest of our burial places; none of us will withhold his burial place from you for burying your dead.”
Transliteration: shemaenu adoniy neshiy Elohim atah vetvokhenu vemivechar kevareynu kevor et-metekha iysh mimenu et-kivervo lo-yikheleh mimekha mikevor metekha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧קׇם אַבְרָהָ֛ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ לְעַם־הָאָ֖רֶץ לִבְנֵי־חֵֽת׃
Translated: Thereupon Abraham bowed low to the landowning citizens, the Hittites,
Transliteration: vayakׇm averaham vayishetachu leam-haarets liveney-chet

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתָּ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־יֵ֣שׁ אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁכֶ֗ם לִקְבֹּ֤ר אֶת־מֵתִי֙ מִלְּפָנַ֔י שְׁמָע֕וּנִי וּפִגְעוּ־לִ֖י בְּעֶפְר֥וֹן בֶּן־צֹֽחַר׃
Translated: and he said to them, “If it is your wish that I remove my dead for burial, you must agree to intercede for me with Ephron son of Zohar.
Transliteration: vayedaver itam lemor im-eish et-nafeshekhem likevor et-metiy milefanay shemauniy ufigeu-liy veefervon ven-tsochar

Hebrew: וְיִתֶּן־לִ֗י אֶת־מְעָרַ֤ת הַמַּכְפֵּלָה֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּקְצֵ֣ה שָׂדֵ֑הוּ בְּכֶ֨סֶף מָלֵ֜א יִתְּנֶ֥נָּה לִּ֛י בְּתוֹכְכֶ֖ם לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָֽבֶר׃
Translated: Let him sell me the cave of Machpelah that he owns, which is at the edge of his land. Let him sell it to me, at the full price, for a burial site in your midst.”
Transliteration: veyiten-liy et-mearat hamakhefelah asher-lvo asher viketseh shadehu vekhesef male yitenenah liy vetvokhekhem laachuzat-kaver

Hebrew: וְעֶפְר֥וֹן יֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּת֣וֹךְ בְּנֵי־חֵ֑ת וַיַּ֩עַן֩ עֶפְר֨וֹן הַחִתִּ֤י אֶת־אַבְרָהָם֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֔ת לְכֹ֛ל בָּאֵ֥י שַֽׁעַר־עִיר֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Ephron was present among the Hittites; so Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites, the assembly in his town’s gate, saying,
Transliteration: veefervon yoshev vetvokhe veney-chet vayaan efervon hachitiy et-averaham veׇzeney veney-chet lekhol vaey shaar-iyrvo lemor

Hebrew: לֹֽא־אֲדֹנִ֣י שְׁמָעֵ֔נִי הַשָּׂדֶה֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לָ֔ךְ וְהַמְּעָרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ לְךָ֣ נְתַתִּ֑יהָ לְעֵינֵ֧י בְנֵי־עַמִּ֛י נְתַתִּ֥יהָ לָּ֖ךְ קְבֹ֥ר מֵתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “No, my lord, hear me: I give you the field and I give you the cave that is in it; I give it to you in the presence of my people. Bury your dead.”
Transliteration: lo-adoniy shemaeniy hashadeh natatiy lakhe vehamearah asher-vvo lekha netatiyha leeyney veney-amiy netatiyha lakhe kevor metekha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁתַּ֙חוּ֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י עַ֥ם הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Then Abraham bowed low before the landowning citizens,
Transliteration: vayishetachu averaham lifeney am haarets

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־עֶפְר֜וֹן בְּאׇזְנֵ֤י עַם־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַ֛ךְ אִם־אַתָּ֥ה ל֖וּ שְׁמָעֵ֑נִי נָתַ֜תִּי כֶּ֤סֶף הַשָּׂדֶה֙ קַ֣ח מִמֶּ֔נִּי וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה אֶת־מֵתִ֖י שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: and spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the landowning citizens, saying, “If only you would hear me out! Let me pay the price of the land; accept it from me, that I may bury my dead there.”
Transliteration: vayedaver el-efervon veׇzeney am-haarets lemor akhe im-atah lu shemaeniy natatiy khesef hashadeh kach mimeniy veekeverah et-metiy shamah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן עֶפְר֛וֹן אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Ephron replied to Abraham, saying to him,
Transliteration: vayaan efervon et-averaham lemor lvo

Hebrew: אֲדֹנִ֣י שְׁמָעֵ֔נִי אֶ֩רֶץ֩ אַרְבַּ֨ע מֵאֹ֧ת שֶֽׁקֶל־כֶּ֛סֶף בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵֽינְךָ֖ מַה־הִ֑וא וְאֶת־מֵתְךָ֖ קְבֹֽר׃
Translated: “My lord, do hear me! A piece of land worth four hundred shekels of silver—what is that between you and me? Go and bury your dead.”
Transliteration: adoniy shemaeniy erets areva meot shekel-khesef veyniy uveynekha mah-hiv veet-metekha kevor

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע אַבְרָהָם֮ אֶל־עֶפְרוֹן֒ וַיִּשְׁקֹ֤ל אַבְרָהָם֙ לְעֶפְרֹ֔ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֕סֶף אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֑ת אַרְבַּ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ שֶׁ֣קֶל כֶּ֔סֶף עֹבֵ֖ר לַסֹּחֵֽר׃
Translated: Abraham accepted Ephron’s terms. Abraham paid out to Ephron the money that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites—four hundred shekels of silver at the going merchants’ rate.
Transliteration: vayishema averaham el-efervon vayishekol averaham leeferon et-hakhesef asher diver veׇzeney veney-chet areva mevot shekel khesef over lasocher

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ שְׂדֵ֣ה עֶפְר֗וֹן אֲשֶׁר֙ בַּמַּכְפֵּלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י מַמְרֵ֑א הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְהַמְּעָרָ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֔וֹ וְכׇל־הָעֵץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּכׇל־גְּבֻל֖וֹ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: So Ephron’s land in Machpelah, near Mamre—the field with its cave and all the trees anywhere within the confines of that field—passed
Transliteration: vayakׇm shedeh efervon asher vamakhefelah asher lifeney mamere hashadeh vehamearah asher-vvo vekhׇl-haets asher vashadeh asher vekhׇl-gevulvo saviyv

Hebrew: לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְמִקְנָ֖ה לְעֵינֵ֣י בְנֵי־חֵ֑ת בְּכֹ֖ל בָּאֵ֥י שַֽׁעַר־עִירֽוֹ׃
Translated: to Abraham as his possession, in the presence of the Hittites, of the assembly in his town’s gate.
Transliteration: leaveraham lemikenah leeyney veney-chet vekhol vaey shaar-iyrvo

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵן֩ קָבַ֨ר אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ אֶל־מְעָרַ֞ת שְׂדֵ֧ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֛ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵ֖א הִ֣וא חֶבְר֑וֹן בְּאֶ֖רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: And then Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave of the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre—now Hebron—in the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen kavar averaham et-sharah ishetvo el-mearat shedeh hamakhefelah al-feney mamere hiv chevervon veerets khenaan

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה וְהַמְּעָרָ֧ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֛וֹ לְאַבְרָהָ֖ם לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָ֑בֶר מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵי־חֵֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus the field with its cave passed from the Hittites to Abraham, as a burial site.
Transliteration: vayakׇm hashadeh vehamearah asher-vvo leaveraham laachuzat-kaver meet veney-chet {s}

Hebrew: וְאַבְרָהָ֣ם זָקֵ֔ן בָּ֖א בַּיָּמִ֑ים וַֽיהֹוָ֛ה בֵּרַ֥ךְ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֖ם בַּכֹּֽל׃
Translated: Abraham was now old, advanced in years, and יהוה had blessed Abraham in all things.
Transliteration: veaveraham zaken va vayamiym vayhovah verakhe et-averaham vakhol

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְרָהָ֗ם אֶל־עַבְדּוֹ֙ זְקַ֣ן בֵּית֔וֹ הַמֹּשֵׁ֖ל בְּכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ שִֽׂים־נָ֥א יָדְךָ֖ תַּ֥חַת יְרֵכִֽי׃
Translated: And Abraham said to the senior servant of his household, who had charge of all that he owned, “Put your hand under my thigh
Transliteration: vayomer averaham el-avedvo zekan veytvo hamoshel vekhׇl-asher-lvo shiym-na yadekha tachat yerekhiy

Hebrew: וְאַשְׁבִּ֣יעֲךָ֔ בַּֽיהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־תִקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִבְּנוֹת֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and I will make you swear by יהוה, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I dwell,
Transliteration: veasheviyakha vayhovah elohey hashamayiim velohey haarets asher lo-tikach ishah liveniy mivenvot hakhenaaniy asher anokhiy yvoshev vekirevvo

Hebrew: כִּ֧י אֶל־אַרְצִ֛י וְאֶל־מוֹלַדְתִּ֖י תֵּלֵ֑ךְ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֖ה לִבְנִ֥י לְיִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: but will go to the land of my birth and get a wife for my son Isaac.”
Transliteration: khiy el-aretsiy veel-mvoladetiy telekhe velakacheta ishah liveniy leyitsechak

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ הָעֶ֔בֶד אוּלַי֙ לֹא־תֹאבֶ֣ה הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה לָלֶ֥כֶת אַחֲרַ֖י אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את הֶֽהָשֵׁ֤ב אָשִׁיב֙ אֶת־בִּנְךָ֔ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יָצָ֥אתָ מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: And the servant said to him, “What if the woman does not consent to follow me to this land, shall I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv haeved ulay lo-toveh haishah lalekhet acharay el-haarets hazot hehashev ashiyv et-vinekha el-haarets asher-yatsata misham

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו אַבְרָהָ֑ם הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּן־תָּשִׁ֥יב אֶת־בְּנִ֖י שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Abraham answered him, “On no account must you take my son back there!
Transliteration: vayomer elayv averaham hishamer lekha fen-tashiyv et-veniy shamah

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֨ר לְקָחַ֜נִי מִבֵּ֣ית אָבִי֮ וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ מֽוֹלַדְתִּי֒ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּר־לִ֜י וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִֽשְׁבַּֽע־לִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַ֨רְעֲךָ֔ אֶתֵּ֖ן אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את ה֗וּא יִשְׁלַ֤ח מַלְאָכוֹ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֛ה לִבְנִ֖י מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: יהוה, the God of heaven—who took me from my father’s house and from my native land, who promised me on oath, saying, ‘I will assign this land to your offspring’—will send a messenger before you, and you will get a wife for my son from there.
Transliteration: yehovah elohey hashamayiim asher lekachaniy miveyt aviy umeerets mvoladetiy vaasher diver-liy vaasher nisheva-liy lemor lezareakha eten et-haarets hazot hu yishelach maleakhvo lefaneykha velakacheta ishah liveniy misham

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תֹאבֶ֤ה הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ וְנִקִּ֕יתָ מִשְּׁבֻעָתִ֖י זֹ֑את רַ֣ק אֶת־בְּנִ֔י לֹ֥א תָשֵׁ֖ב שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: And if the woman does not consent to follow you, you shall then be clear of this oath to me; but do not take my son back there.”
Transliteration: veim-lo toveh haishah lalekhet achareykha venikiyta mishevuatiy zot rak et-veniy lo tashev shamah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם הָעֶ֙בֶד֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ תַּ֛חַת יֶ֥רֶךְ אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֑יו וַיִּשָּׁ֣בַֽע ל֔וֹ עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: So the servant put his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and swore to him as bidden.
Transliteration: vayashem haeved et-yadvo tachat yerekhe averaham adonayv vayishava lvo al-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח הָ֠עֶ֠בֶד עֲשָׂרָ֨ה גְמַלִּ֜ים מִגְּמַלֵּ֤י אֲדֹנָיו֙ וַיֵּ֔לֶךְ וְכׇל־ט֥וּב אֲדֹנָ֖יו בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיָּ֗קׇם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־אֲרַ֥ם נַֽהֲרַ֖יִם אֶל־עִ֥יר נָחֽוֹר׃
Translated: Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and set out, taking with him all the bounty of his master; and he made his way to Aram-naharaim, to the city of Nahor.
Transliteration: vayikach haeved asharah gemaliym migemaley adonayv vayelekhe vekhׇl-tuv adonayv veyadvo vayakׇm vayelekhe el-aram naharayiim el-iyr nachvor

Hebrew: וַיַּבְרֵ֧ךְ הַגְּמַלִּ֛ים מִח֥וּץ לָעִ֖יר אֶל־בְּאֵ֣ר הַמָּ֑יִם לְעֵ֣ת עֶ֔רֶב לְעֵ֖ת צֵ֥את הַשֹּׁאֲבֹֽת׃
Translated: He made the camels kneel down by the well outside the city, at evening time, the time when women come out to draw water.
Transliteration: vayaverekhe hagemaliym michuts laiyr el-veer hamayiim leet erev leet tset hashoavot

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֓ר ׀ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם הַקְרֵה־נָ֥א לְפָנַ֖י הַיּ֑וֹם וַעֲשֵׂה־חֶ֕סֶד עִ֖ם אֲדֹנִ֥י אַבְרָהָֽם׃
Translated: And he said, “O יהוה, God of my master Abraham’s [house], grant me good fortune this day, and deal graciously with my master Abraham:
Transliteration: vayomar yehovah elohey adoniy averaham hakereh-na lefanay hayyvom vaasheh-chesed im adoniy averaham

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֵ֣ין הַמָּ֑יִם וּבְנוֹת֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י הָעִ֔יר יֹצְאֹ֖ת לִשְׁאֹ֥ב מָֽיִם׃
Translated: Here I stand by the spring as the daughters of the townspeople come out to draw water;
Transliteration: hineh anokhiy nitsav al-eyn hamayiim uvenvot aneshey haiyr yotseot lisheov mayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֹמַ֤ר אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ הַטִּי־נָ֤א כַדֵּךְ֙ וְאֶשְׁתֶּ֔ה וְאָמְרָ֣ה שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַם־גְּמַלֶּ֖יךָ אַשְׁקֶ֑ה אֹתָ֤הּ הֹכַ֙חְתָּ֙ לְעַבְדְּךָ֣ לְיִצְחָ֔ק וּבָ֣הּ אֵדַ֔ע כִּי־עָשִׂ֥יתָ חֶ֖סֶד עִם־אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: let the maiden to whom I say, ‘Please, lower your jar that I may drink,’ and who replies, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels’—let her be the one whom You have decreed for Your servant Isaac. Thereby shall I know that You have dealt graciously with my master.”
Transliteration: vehayah hanaara asher omar eleyha hatiy-na khadekhe veesheteh veamerah sheteh vegam-gemaleykha ashekeh otah hokhacheta leavedekha leyitsechak uvah eda khiy-ashiyta chesed im-adoniy

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ה֗וּא טֶ֘רֶם֮ כִּלָּ֣ה לְדַבֵּר֒ וְהִנֵּ֧ה רִבְקָ֣ה יֹצֵ֗את אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֻלְּדָה֙ לִבְתוּאֵ֣ל בֶּן־מִלְכָּ֔ה אֵ֥שֶׁת נָח֖וֹר אֲחִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם וְכַדָּ֖הּ עַל־שִׁכְמָֽהּ׃
Translated: He had scarcely finished speaking, when Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel, the son of Milcah the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor, came out with her jar on her shoulder.
Transliteration: vayehiy-hu terem khilah ledaver vehineh rivekah yotset asher yuledah livetuel ven-milekhah eshet nachvor achiy averaham vekhadah al-shikhemah

Hebrew: וְהַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ טֹבַ֤ת מַרְאֶה֙ מְאֹ֔ד בְּתוּלָ֕ה וְאִ֖ישׁ לֹ֣א יְדָעָ֑הּ וַתֵּ֣רֶד הָעַ֔יְנָה וַתְּמַלֵּ֥א כַדָּ֖הּ וַתָּֽעַל׃
Translated: The maiden was very beautiful—[and] a virgin, no man having known her. She went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came up.
Transliteration: vehanaara tovat mareeh meod vetulah veiysh lo yedaah vatered haayenah vatemale khadah vataal

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥רׇץ הָעֶ֖בֶד לִקְרָאתָ֑הּ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הַגְמִיאִ֥ינִי נָ֛א מְעַט־מַ֖יִם מִכַּדֵּֽךְ׃
Translated: The servant ran toward her and said, “Please, let me sip a little water from your jar.”
Transliteration: vayarׇts haeved likeratah vayomer hagemiyiyniy na meat-mayiim mikhadekhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֖אמֶר שְׁתֵ֣ה אֲדֹנִ֑י וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתֹּ֧רֶד כַּדָּ֛הּ עַל־יָדָ֖הּ וַתַּשְׁקֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: “Drink, my lord,” she said, and she quickly lowered her jar upon her hand and let him drink.
Transliteration: vatomer sheteh adoniy vatemaher vatored khadah al-yadah vatashekehu

Hebrew: וַתְּכַ֖ל לְהַשְׁקֹת֑וֹ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר גַּ֤ם לִגְמַלֶּ֙יךָ֙ אֶשְׁאָ֔ב עַ֥ד אִם־כִּלּ֖וּ לִשְׁתֹּֽת׃
Translated: When she had let him drink his fill, she said, “I will also draw for your camels, until they finish drinking.”
Transliteration: vatekhal lehashekotvo vatomer gam ligemaleykha esheav ad im-khilu lishetot

Hebrew: וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתְּעַ֤ר כַּדָּהּ֙ אֶל־הַשֹּׁ֔קֶת וַתָּ֥רׇץ ע֛וֹד אֶֽל־הַבְּאֵ֖ר לִשְׁאֹ֑ב וַתִּשְׁאַ֖ב לְכׇל־גְּמַלָּֽיו׃
Translated: Quickly emptying her jar into the trough, she ran back to the well to draw, and she drew for all his camels.
Transliteration: vatemaher vatear khadah el-hashoket vatarׇts vod el-haveer lisheov vatisheav lekhׇl-gemalayv

Hebrew: וְהָאִ֥ישׁ מִשְׁתָּאֵ֖ה לָ֑הּ מַחֲרִ֕ישׁ לָדַ֗עַת הַֽהִצְלִ֧יחַ יְהֹוָ֛ה דַּרְכּ֖וֹ אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translated: The man, meanwhile, stood gazing at her, silently wondering whether יהוה had made his errand successful or not.
Transliteration: vehaiysh mishetaeh lah machariysh ladaat hahitseliycha yehovah darekhvo im-lo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר כִּלּ֤וּ הַגְּמַלִּים֙ לִשְׁתּ֔וֹת וַיִּקַּ֤ח הָאִישׁ֙ נֶ֣זֶם זָהָ֔ב בֶּ֖קַע מִשְׁקָל֑וֹ וּשְׁנֵ֤י צְמִידִים֙ עַל־יָדֶ֔יהָ עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מִשְׁקָלָֽם׃
Translated: When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold nose-ring weighing a half-shekel, and two gold bands for her arms, ten shekels in weight.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher khilu hagemaliym lishetvot vayikach haiysh nezem zahav veka mishekalvo usheney tsemiydiym al-yadeyha asharah zahav mishekalam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ בַּת־מִ֣י אַ֔תְּ הַגִּ֥ידִי נָ֖א לִ֑י הֲיֵ֧שׁ בֵּית־אָבִ֛יךְ מָק֥וֹם לָ֖נוּ לָלִֽין׃
Translated: “Pray tell me,” he said, “whose daughter are you? Is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”
Transliteration: vayomer vat-miy ate hagiydiy na liy haeish veyt-aviykhe makvom lanu laliyn

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו בַּת־בְּתוּאֵ֖ל אָנֹ֑כִי בֶּן־מִלְכָּ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֖ה לְנָחֽוֹר׃
Translated: She replied, “I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.”
Transliteration: vatomer elayv vat-vetuel anokhiy ven-milekhah asher yaledah lenachvor

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו גַּם־תֶּ֥בֶן גַּם־מִסְפּ֖וֹא רַ֣ב עִמָּ֑נוּ גַּם־מָק֖וֹם לָלֽוּן׃
Translated: And she went on, “There is plenty of straw and feed at home, and also room to spend the night.”
Transliteration: vatomer elayv gam-teven gam-misefvo rav imanu gam-makvom lalun

Hebrew: וַיִּקֹּ֣ד הָאִ֔ישׁ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The man bowed low in homage to יהוה
Transliteration: vayikod haiysh vayishetachu layhovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹֽא־עָזַ֥ב חַסְדּ֛וֹ וַאֲמִתּ֖וֹ מֵעִ֣ם אֲדֹנִ֑י אָנֹכִ֗י בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ נָחַ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֔ה בֵּ֖ית אֲחֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: and said, “Blessed be יהוה, the God of my master Abraham’s [house], who has not withheld steadfast faithfulness from my master. For I have been guided on my errand by יהוה, to the house of my master’s kin.”
Transliteration: vayomer varukhe yehovah elohey adoniy averaham asher lo-azav chasedvo vaamitvo meim adoniy anokhiy vaderekhe nachaniy yehovah veyt achey adoniy

Hebrew: וַתָּ֙רׇץ֙ הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ וַתַּגֵּ֖ד לְבֵ֣ית אִמָּ֑הּ כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: The maiden ran and told all this to her mother’s household.
Transliteration: vatarׇts hanaara vataged leveyt imah khadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וּלְרִבְקָ֥ה אָ֖ח וּשְׁמ֣וֹ לָבָ֑ן וַיָּ֨רׇץ לָבָ֧ן אֶל־הָאִ֛ישׁ הַח֖וּצָה אֶל־הָעָֽיִן׃
Translated: Now Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban. Laban ran out to the man at the spring—
Transliteration: ulerivekah ach ushemvo lavan vayarׇts lavan el-haiysh hachutsah el-haayiin

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כִּרְאֹ֣ת אֶת־הַנֶּ֗זֶם וְֽאֶת־הַצְּמִדִים֮ עַל־יְדֵ֣י אֲחֹתוֹ֒ וּכְשׇׁמְע֗וֹ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֞י רִבְקָ֤ה אֲחֹתוֹ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּֽה־דִבֶּ֥ר אֵלַ֖י הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ וְהִנֵּ֛ה עֹמֵ֥ד עַל־הַגְּמַלִּ֖ים עַל־הָעָֽיִן׃
Translated: when he saw the nose-ring and the bands on his sister’s arms, and when he heard his sister Rebekah say, “Thus the man spoke to me.” He went up to the man, who was still standing beside the camels at the spring.
Transliteration: vayehiy khireot et-hanezem veet-hatsemidiym al-yedey achotvo ukheshׇmevo et-diverey rivekah achotvo lemor khoh-diver elay haiysh vayavo el-haiysh vehineh omed al-hagemaliym al-haayiin

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בּ֖וֹא בְּר֣וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה לָ֤מָּה תַעֲמֹד֙ בַּח֔וּץ וְאָנֹכִי֙ פִּנִּ֣יתִי הַבַּ֔יִת וּמָק֖וֹם לַגְּמַלִּֽים׃
Translated: “Come in, O blessed of יהוה,” he said, “why do you remain outside, when I have made ready the house and a place for the camels?”
Transliteration: vayomer vvo verukhe yehovah lamah taamod vachuts veanokhiy finiytiy havayiit umakvom lagemaliym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א הָאִישׁ֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַיְפַתַּ֖ח הַגְּמַלִּ֑ים וַיִּתֵּ֨ן תֶּ֤בֶן וּמִסְפּוֹא֙ לַגְּמַלִּ֔ים וּמַ֙יִם֙ לִרְחֹ֣ץ רַגְלָ֔יו וְרַגְלֵ֥י הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: So the man entered the house, and the camels were unloaded. The camels were given straw and feed, and water was brought to bathe his feet and the feet of the entourage under him.
Transliteration: vayavo haiysh havayetah vayefatach hagemaliym vayiten teven umisefvo lagemaliym umayiim lirechots ragelayv verageley haanashiym asher itvo

Hebrew: (ויישם) [וַיּוּשַׂ֤ם] לְפָנָיו֙ לֶאֱכֹ֔ל וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֹכַ֔ל עַ֥ד אִם־דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי דְּבָרָ֑י וַיֹּ֖אמֶר דַּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: But when food was set before him, he said, “I will not eat until I have told my tale.” He said, “Speak, then.”
Transliteration: (vyyshm) [vayyusham] lefanayv leekhol vayomer lo okhal ad im-divaretiy devaray vayomer daver

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: “I am Abraham’s servant,” he began.
Transliteration: vayomar eved averaham anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֞ה בֵּרַ֧ךְ אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֛י מְאֹ֖ד וַיִּגְדָּ֑ל וַיִּתֶּן־ל֞וֹ צֹ֤אן וּבָקָר֙ וְכֶ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב וַעֲבָדִם֙ וּשְׁפָחֹ֔ת וּגְמַלִּ֖ים וַחֲמֹרִֽים׃
Translated: “יהוה has greatly blessed my master, who has become rich—giving him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, male and female slaves, camels and asses.
Transliteration: vayhovah verakhe et-adoniy meod vayigedal vayiten-lvo tson uvakar vekhesef vezahav vaavadim ushefachot ugemaliym vachamoriym

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֡לֶד שָׂרָה֩ אֵ֨שֶׁת אֲדֹנִ֥י בֵן֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י אַחֲרֵ֖י זִקְנָתָ֑הּ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֖וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Sarah, my master’s wife, bore my master a son in her old age, and he has assigned to him everything he owns.
Transliteration: vateled sharah eshet adoniy ven ladoniy acharey zikenatah vayiten-lvo et-khׇl-asher-lvo

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁבִּעֵ֥נִי אֲדֹנִ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־תִקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִבְּנוֹת֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now my master made me swear, saying, ‘You shall not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose land I dwell;
Transliteration: vayashevieniy adoniy lemor lo-tikach ishah liveniy mivenvot hakhenaaniy asher anokhiy yoshev vearetsvo

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֧א אֶל־בֵּית־אָבִ֛י תֵּלֵ֖ךְ וְאֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתִּ֑י וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ אִשָּׁ֖ה לִבְנִֽי׃
Translated: but you shall go to my father’s house, to my kindred, and get a wife for my son.’
Transliteration: im-lo el-veyt-aviy telekhe veel-mishefachetiy velakacheta ishah liveniy

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֑י אֻלַ֛י לֹא־תֵלֵ֥ךְ הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אַחֲרָֽי׃
Translated: And I said to my master, ‘What if the woman does not follow me?’
Transliteration: vaomar el-adoniy ulay lo-telekhe haishah acharay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלָ֑י יְהֹוָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־הִתְהַלַּ֣כְתִּי לְפָנָ֗יו יִשְׁלַ֨ח מַלְאָכ֤וֹ אִתָּךְ֙ וְהִצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכֶּ֔ךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אִשָּׁה֙ לִבְנִ֔י מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתִּ֖י וּמִבֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
Translated: He replied to me, ‘יהוה, whose ways I have followed, will send a messenger with you and make your errand successful; and you will get a wife for my son from my kindred, from my father’s house.
Transliteration: vayomer elay yehovah asher-hitehalakhetiy lefanayv yishelach maleakhvo itakhe vehitseliycha darekhekha velakacheta ishah liveniy mimishefachetiy umiveyt aviy

Hebrew: אָ֤ז תִּנָּקֶה֙ מֵאָ֣לָתִ֔י כִּ֥י תָב֖וֹא אֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתִּ֑י וְאִם־לֹ֤א יִתְּנוּ֙ לָ֔ךְ וְהָיִ֥יתָ נָקִ֖י מֵאָלָתִֽי׃
Translated: Thus only shall you be freed from my adjuration: if, when you come to my kindred, they refuse you—only then shall you be freed from my adjuration.’
Transliteration: az tinakeh mealatiy khiy tavvo el-mishefachetiy veim-lo yitenu lakhe vehayiyta nakiy mealatiy

Hebrew: וָאָבֹ֥א הַיּ֖וֹם אֶל־הָעָ֑יִן וָאֹמַ֗ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אִם־יֶשְׁךָ־נָּא֙ מַצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י הֹלֵ֥ךְ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: “I came today to the spring, and I said: ‘O יהוה, God of my master Abraham’s [house], if You would indeed grant success to the errand on which I am engaged!
Transliteration: vaavo hayyvom el-haayiin vaomar yehovah elohey adoniy averaham im-yeshekha-na matseliycha darekhiy asher anokhiy holekhe aleyha

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֵ֣ין הַמָּ֑יִם וְהָיָ֤ה הָֽעַלְמָה֙ הַיֹּצֵ֣את לִשְׁאֹ֔ב וְאָמַרְתִּ֣י אֵלֶ֔יהָ הַשְׁקִֽינִי־נָ֥א מְעַט־מַ֖יִם מִכַּדֵּֽךְ׃
Translated: As I stand by the spring of water, let the young woman who comes out to draw and to whom I say, “Please, let me drink a little water from your jar,”
Transliteration: hineh anokhiy nitsav al-eyn hamayiim vehayah haalemah hayotset lisheov veamaretiy eleyha hashekiyniy-na meat-mayiim mikhadekhe

Hebrew: וְאָמְרָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ גַּם־אַתָּ֣ה שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַ֥ם לִגְמַלֶּ֖יךָ אֶשְׁאָ֑ב הִ֣וא הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הֹכִ֥יחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה לְבֶן־אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: and who answers, “You may drink, and I will also draw for your camels”—let her be the wife whom יהוה has decreed for my master’s son.’
Transliteration: veamerah elay gam-atah sheteh vegam ligemaleykha esheav hiv haishah asher-hokhiycha yehovah leven-adoniy

Hebrew: אֲנִי֩ טֶ֨רֶם אֲכַלֶּ֜ה לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־לִבִּ֗י וְהִנֵּ֨ה רִבְקָ֤ה יֹצֵאת֙ וְכַדָּ֣הּ עַל־שִׁכְמָ֔הּ וַתֵּ֥רֶד הָעַ֖יְנָה וַתִּשְׁאָ֑ב וָאֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יהָ הַשְׁקִ֥ינִי נָֽא׃
Translated: I had scarcely finished praying in my heart, when Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder, and went down to the spring and drew. And I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’
Transliteration: aniy terem akhaleh ledaver el-liviy vehineh rivekah yotset vekhadah al-shikhemah vatered haayenah vatisheav vaomar eleyha hashekiyniy na

Hebrew: וַתְּמַהֵ֗ר וַתּ֤וֹרֶד כַּדָּהּ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יהָ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁתֵ֔ה וְגַם־גְּמַלֶּ֖יךָ אַשְׁקֶ֑ה וָאֵ֕שְׁתְּ וְגַ֥ם הַגְּמַלִּ֖ים הִשְׁקָֽתָה׃
Translated: She quickly lowered her jar and said, ‘Drink, and I will also water your camels.’ So I drank, and she also watered the camels.
Transliteration: vatemaher vatvored khadah mealeyha vatomer sheteh vegam-gemaleykha ashekeh vaeshete vegam hagemaliym hishekatah

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁאַ֣ל אֹתָ֗הּ וָאֹמַר֮ בַּת־מִ֣י אַתְּ֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ בֶּן־נָח֔וֹר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָֽלְדָה־לּ֖וֹ מִלְכָּ֑ה וָאָשִׂ֤ם הַנֶּ֙זֶם֙ עַל־אַפָּ֔הּ וְהַצְּמִידִ֖ים עַל־יָדֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: I inquired of her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ And she said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel, son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ And I put the ring on her nose and the bands on her arms.
Transliteration: vaesheal otah vaomar vat-miy ate vatomer vat-vetuel ven-nachvor asher yaledah-lvo milekhah vaashim hanezem al-afah vehatsemiydiym al-yadeyha

Hebrew: וָאֶקֹּ֥ד וָֽאֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֖ה לַיהֹוָ֑ה וָאֲבָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִנְחַ֙נִי֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אֱמֶ֔ת לָקַ֛חַת אֶת־בַּת־אֲחִ֥י אֲדֹנִ֖י לִבְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then I bowed low in homage to יהוה and blessed יהוה, the God of my master Abraham’s [house], who led me on the right way to get the daughter of my master’s brother for his son.
Transliteration: vaekod vaeshetachaveh layhovah vaavarekhe et-yehovah elohey adoniy averaham asher hinechaniy vederekhe emet lakachat et-vat-achiy adoniy livenvo

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה אִם־יֶשְׁכֶ֨ם עֹשִׂ֜ים חֶ֧סֶד וֶֽאֱמֶ֛ת אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֖י הַגִּ֣ידוּ לִ֑י וְאִם־לֹ֕א הַגִּ֣ידוּ לִ֔י וְאֶפְנֶ֥ה עַל־יָמִ֖ין א֥וֹ עַל־שְׂמֹֽאל׃
Translated: And now, if you mean to treat my master with true kindness, tell me; and if not, tell me also, that I may turn right or left.”
Transliteration: veatah im-yeshekhem oshiym chesed veemet et-adoniy hagiydu liy veim-lo hagiydu liy veefeneh al-yamiyn vo al-shemol

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן לָבָ֤ן וּבְתוּאֵל֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה יָצָ֣א הַדָּבָ֑ר לֹ֥א נוּכַ֛ל דַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ רַ֥ע אוֹ־טֽוֹב׃
Translated: Then Laban and Bethuel answered, “The matter was decreed by יהוה; we cannot speak to you bad or good.
Transliteration: vayaan lavan uvetuel vayomeru meyehovah yatsa hadavar lo nukhal daver eleykha ra vo-tvov

Hebrew: הִנֵּֽה־רִבְקָ֥ה לְפָנֶ֖יךָ קַ֣ח וָלֵ֑ךְ וּתְהִ֤י אִשָּׁה֙ לְבֶן־אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Here is Rebekah before you; take her and go, and let her be a wife to your master’s son, as יהוה has spoken.”
Transliteration: hineh-rivekah lefaneykha kach valekhe utehiy ishah leven-adoneykha khaasher diver yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁמַ֛ע עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ אַ֖רְצָה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed low to the ground before יהוה.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher shama eved averaham et-divereyhem vayishetachu aretsah layhovah

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֨א הָעֶ֜בֶד כְּלֵי־כֶ֨סֶף וּכְלֵ֤י זָהָב֙ וּבְגָדִ֔ים וַיִּתֵּ֖ן לְרִבְקָ֑ה וּמִ֨גְדָּנֹ֔ת נָתַ֥ן לְאָחִ֖יהָ וּלְאִמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: The servant brought out objects of silver and gold, and garments, and gave them to Rebekah; and he gave presents to her brother and her mother.
Transliteration: vayyvotse haeved kheley-khesef ukheley zahav uvegadiym vayiten lerivekah umigedanot natan leachiyha uleimah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ וַיִּשְׁתּ֗וּ ה֛וּא וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֖וֹ וַיָּלִ֑ינוּ וַיָּק֣וּמוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שַׁלְּחֻ֥נִי לַֽאדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: Then he and the entourage under him ate and drank, and they spent the night. When they arose next morning, he said, “Give me leave to go to my master.”
Transliteration: vayokhelu vayishetu hu vehaanashiym asher-imvo vayaliynu vayakumu vavoker vayomer shalechuniy ladoniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אָחִ֙יהָ֙ וְאִמָּ֔הּ תֵּשֵׁ֨ב הַנַּעֲרָ֥ אִתָּ֛נוּ יָמִ֖ים א֣וֹ עָשׂ֑וֹר אַחַ֖ר תֵּלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: But her brother and her mother said, “Let the maiden remain with us some ten days; then you may go.”
Transliteration: vayomer achiyha veimah teshev hanaara itanu yamiym vo ashvor achar telekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אַל־תְּאַחֲר֣וּ אֹתִ֔י וַֽיהֹוָ֖ה הִצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכִּ֑י שַׁלְּח֕וּנִי וְאֵלְכָ֖ה לַֽאדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: He said to them, “Do not delay me, now that יהוה has made my errand successful. Give me leave that I may go to my master.”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem al-teacharu otiy vayhovah hitseliycha darekhiy shalechuniy veelekhah ladoniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ נִקְרָ֣א לַֽנַּעֲרָ֑ וְנִשְׁאֲלָ֖ה אֶת־פִּֽיהָ׃
Translated: And they said, “Let us call the girl and ask for her reply.”
Transliteration: vayomeru nikera lanaara venishealah et-fiyha

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ לְרִבְקָה֙ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יהָ הֲתֵלְכִ֖י עִם־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַזֶּ֑ה וַתֹּ֖אמֶר אֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: They called Rebekah and said to her, “Will you go with this man?” And she said, “I will.”
Transliteration: vayikereu lerivekah vayomeru eleyha hatelekhiy im-haiysh hazeh vatomer elekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֛וּ אֶת־רִבְקָ֥ה אֲחֹתָ֖ם וְאֶת־מֵנִקְתָּ֑הּ וְאֶת־עֶ֥בֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְאֶת־אֲנָשָֽׁיו׃
