Translated: So they sent off their sister Rebekah and her nurse along with Abraham’s servant and his entourage.
Transliteration: vayeshalechu et-rivekah achotam veet-meniketah veet-eved averaham veet-anashayv

Hebrew: וַיְבָרְכ֤וּ אֶת־רִבְקָה֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ לָ֔הּ אֲחֹתֵ֕נוּ אַ֥תְּ הֲיִ֖י לְאַלְפֵ֣י רְבָבָ֑ה וְיִירַ֣שׁ זַרְעֵ֔ךְ אֵ֖ת שַׁ֥עַר שֹׂנְאָֽיו׃
Translated:
And they blessed Rebekah and said to her,
“O sister!
May you grow
Into thousands of myriads;
May your descendants seize
The gates of their foes.”
Transliteration: vayevarekhu et-rivekah vayomeru lah achotenu ate hayiy lealefey revavah veyiyrash zareekhe et shaar shoneayv

Hebrew: וַתָּ֨קׇם רִבְקָ֜ה וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֗יהָ וַתִּרְכַּ֙בְנָה֙ עַל־הַגְּמַלִּ֔ים וַתֵּלַ֖כְנָה אַחֲרֵ֣י הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיִּקַּ֥ח הָעֶ֛בֶד אֶת־רִבְקָ֖ה וַיֵּלַֽךְ׃
Translated: Then Rebekah and her maids arose, mounted the camels, and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and went his way.
Transliteration: vatakׇm rivekah venaaroteyha vatirekhavenah al-hagemaliym vatelakhenah acharey haiysh vayikach haeved et-rivekah vayelakhe

Hebrew: וְיִצְחָק֙ בָּ֣א מִבּ֔וֹא בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִ֑י וְה֥וּא יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַנֶּֽגֶב׃
Translated: Isaac had just come back from the vicinity of Beer-lahai-roi, for he was settled in the region of the Negeb.
Transliteration: veyitsechak va mivvo veer lachay roiy vehu yvoshev veerets hanegev

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א יִצְחָ֛ק לָשׂ֥וּחַ בַּשָּׂדֶ֖ה לִפְנ֣וֹת עָ֑רֶב וַיִּשָּׂ֤א עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּ֥ה גְמַלִּ֖ים בָּאִֽים׃
Translated: And Isaac went out walking in the field toward evening and, looking up, he saw camels approaching.
Transliteration: vayetse yitsechak lashucha vashadeh lifenvot arev vayisha eynayv vayare vehineh gemaliym vaiym

Hebrew: וַתִּשָּׂ֤א רִבְקָה֙ אֶת־עֵינֶ֔יהָ וַתֵּ֖רֶא אֶת־יִצְחָ֑ק וַתִּפֹּ֖ל מֵעַ֥ל הַגָּמָֽל׃
Translated: Raising her eyes, Rebekah saw Isaac. She alighted from the camel
Transliteration: vatisha rivekah et-eyneyha vatere et-yitsechak vatifol meal hagamal

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־הָעֶ֗בֶד מִֽי־הָאִ֤ישׁ הַלָּזֶה֙ הַהֹלֵ֤ךְ בַּשָּׂדֶה֙ לִקְרָאתֵ֔נוּ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הָעֶ֖בֶד ה֣וּא אֲדֹנִ֑י וַתִּקַּ֥ח הַצָּעִ֖יף וַתִּתְכָּֽס׃
Translated: and said to the servant, “Who is that man walking in the field toward us?” And the servant said, “That is my master.” So she took her veil and covered herself.
Transliteration: vatomer el-haeved miy-haiysh halazeh haholekhe vashadeh likeratenu vayomer haeved hu adoniy vatikach hatsaiyf vatitekhas

Hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֥ר הָעֶ֖בֶד לְיִצְחָ֑ק אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: The servant told Isaac all the things that he had done.
Transliteration: vayesafer haeved leyitsechak et khׇl-hadevariym asher ashah

Hebrew: וַיְבִאֶ֣הָ יִצְחָ֗ק הָאֹ֙הֱלָה֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִמּ֔וֹ וַיִּקַּ֧ח אֶת־רִבְקָ֛ה וַתְּהִי־ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֖ה וַיֶּאֱהָבֶ֑הָ וַיִּנָּחֵ֥ם יִצְחָ֖ק אַחֲרֵ֥י אִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Isaac then brought her into the tent of his mother Sarah, and he took Rebekah as his wife. Isaac loved her, and thus found comfort after his mother’s death.
Transliteration: vayevieha yitsechak haohelah sharah imvo vayikach et-rivekah vatehiy-lvo leishah vayeehaveha vayinachem yitsechak acharey imvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧סֶף אַבְרָהָ֛ם וַיִּקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה וּשְׁמָ֥הּ קְטוּרָֽה׃
Translated: Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah.
Transliteration: vayosef averaham vayikach ishah ushemah keturah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֗וֹ אֶת־זִמְרָן֙ וְאֶת־יׇקְשָׁ֔ן וְאֶת־מְדָ֖ן וְאֶת־מִדְיָ֑ן וְאֶת־יִשְׁבָּ֖ק וְאֶת־שֽׁוּחַ׃
Translated: She bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
Transliteration: vateled lvo et-zimeran veet-yׇkeshan veet-medan veet-mideyan veet-yishevak veet-shucha

Hebrew: וְיׇקְשָׁ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־שְׁבָ֖א וְאֶת־דְּדָ֑ן וּבְנֵ֣י דְדָ֔ן הָי֛וּ אַשּׁוּרִ֥ם וּלְטוּשִׁ֖ם וּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
Translated: Jokshan begot Sheba and Dedan. The descendants of Dedan were the Asshurim, the Letushim, and the Leummim.
Transliteration: veyׇkeshan yalad et-sheva veet-dedan uveney dedan hayu ashurim uletushim uleumiym

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עֵיפָ֤ה וָעֵ֙פֶר֙ וַחֲנֹ֔ךְ וַאֲבִידָ֖ע וְאֶלְדָּעָ֑ה כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י קְטוּרָֽה׃
Translated: The descendants of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Enoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.
Transliteration: uveney mideyan eyfah vaefer vachanokhe vaaviyda veeledaah khׇl-eleh veney keturah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ לְיִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: Abraham willed all that he owned to Isaac;
Transliteration: vayiten averaham et-khׇl-asher-lvo leyitsechak

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֤י הַפִּֽילַגְשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאַבְרָהָ֔ם נָתַ֥ן אַבְרָהָ֖ם מַתָּנֹ֑ת וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֞ם מֵעַ֨ל יִצְחָ֤ק בְּנוֹ֙ בְּעוֹדֶ֣נּוּ חַ֔י קֵ֖דְמָה אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated: but to Abraham’s sons by concubines Abraham gave gifts while he was still living, and he sent them away from his son Isaac eastward, to the land of the East.
Transliteration: veliveney hafiylageshiym asher leaveraham natan averaham matanot vayeshalechem meal yitsechak venvo vevodenu chay kedemah el-erets kedem

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה יְמֵ֛י שְׁנֵֽי־חַיֵּ֥י אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֲשֶׁר־חָ֑י מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְחָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: This was the total span of Abraham’s life: one hundred and seventy-five years.
Transliteration: veeleh yemey sheney-chayey averaham asher-chay meat shanah veshiveiym shanah vechamesh shaniym

Hebrew: וַיִּגְוַ֨ע וַיָּ֧מׇת אַבְרָהָ֛ם בְּשֵׂיבָ֥ה טוֹבָ֖ה זָקֵ֣ן וְשָׂבֵ֑עַ וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
Translated: And Abraham breathed his last, dying at a good ripe age, old and contented; and he was gathered to his kin.
Transliteration: vayigeva vayamׇt averaham vesheyvah tvovah zaken veshavea vayeasef el-amayv

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ יִצְחָ֤ק וְיִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ בָּנָ֔יו אֶל־מְעָרַ֖ת הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֑ה אֶל־שְׂדֵ֞ה עֶפְרֹ֤ן בֶּן־צֹ֙חַר֙ הַֽחִתִּ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵֽא׃
Translated: His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite, facing Mamre,
Transliteration: vayikeveru otvo yitsechak veyishemael vanayv el-mearat hamakhefelah el-shedeh eferon ven-tsochar hachitiy asher al-feney mamere

Hebrew: הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־קָנָ֥ה אַבְרָהָ֖ם מֵאֵ֣ת בְּנֵי־חֵ֑ת שָׁ֛מָּה קֻבַּ֥ר אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְשָׂרָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites; there Abraham was buried, and Sarah his wife.
Transliteration: hashadeh asher-kanah averaham meet veney-chet shamah kuvar averaham vesharah ishetvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ מ֣וֹת אַבְרָהָ֔ם וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־יִצְחָ֣ק בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יִצְחָ֔ק עִם־בְּאֵ֥ר לַחַ֖י רֹאִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: After the death of Abraham, God blessed his son Isaac. And Isaac settled near Beer-lahai-roi.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey mvot averaham vayevarekhe Elohim et-yitsechak venvo vayeshev yitsechak im-veer lachay roiy {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְדֹ֥ת יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָלְדָ֜ה הָגָ֧ר הַמִּצְרִ֛ית שִׁפְחַ֥ת שָׂרָ֖ה לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
Translated: This is the line of Ishmael, Abraham’s son, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s slave, bore to Abraham.
Transliteration: veeleh toledot yishemael ven-averaham asher yaledah hagar hamitseriyt shifechat sharah leaveraham

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל בִּשְׁמֹתָ֖ם לְתוֹלְדֹתָ֑ם בְּכֹ֤ר יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ נְבָיֹ֔ת וְקֵדָ֥ר וְאַדְבְּאֵ֖ל וּמִבְשָֽׂם׃
Translated: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael, by their names, in the order of their birth: Nebaioth, the first-born of Ishmael, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot veney yishemael vishemotam letvoledotam vekhor yishemael nevayot vekedar veadeveel umivesham

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁמָ֥ע וְדוּמָ֖ה וּמַשָּֽׂא׃
Translated: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
Transliteration: umishema vedumah umasha

Hebrew: חֲדַ֣ד וְתֵימָ֔א יְט֥וּר נָפִ֖ישׁ וָקֵֽדְמָה׃
Translated: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedmah.
Transliteration: chadad veteyma yetur nafiysh vakedemah

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֞ם בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמֹתָ֔ם בְּחַצְרֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְטִֽירֹתָ֑ם שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר נְשִׂיאִ֖ם לְאֻמֹּתָֽם׃
Translated: These are the sons of Ishmael and these are their names by their villages and by their encampments: twelve chieftains of as many tribes.—
Transliteration: eleh hem veney yishemael veeleh shemotam vechatsereyhem uvetiyrotam sheneym-ashar neshiyim leumotam

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י יִשְׁמָעֵ֔אל מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֛ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וְשֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיִּגְוַ֣ע וַיָּ֔מׇת וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
Translated: These were the years of the life of Ishmael: one hundred and thirty-seven years; then he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his kin.—
Transliteration: veeleh sheney chayey yishemael meat shanah usheloshiym shanah vesheva shaniym vayigeva vayamׇt vayeasef el-amayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכְּנ֨וּ מֵֽחֲוִילָ֜ה עַד־שׁ֗וּר אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י מִצְרַ֔יִם בֹּאֲכָ֖ה אַשּׁ֑וּרָה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־אֶחָ֖יו נָפָֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: They dwelt from Havilah, by Shur, which is close to Egypt, all the way to Asshur; they camped alongside all their kin.
Transliteration: vayishekhenu mechaviylah ad-shur asher al-feney mitserayiim voakhah ashurah al-feney khׇl-echayv nafal {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֥ת יִצְחָ֖ק בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֑ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: This is the story of Isaac, son of Abraham. Abraham begot Isaac.
Transliteration: veeleh tvoledot yitsechak ven-averaham averaham hvoliyd et-yitsechak

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יִצְחָק֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּקַחְתּ֣וֹ אֶת־רִבְקָ֗ה בַּת־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י מִפַּדַּ֖ן אֲרָ֑ם אֲח֛וֹת לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: Isaac was forty years old when he took to wife Rebekah, daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, sister of Laban the Aramean.
Transliteration: vayehiy yitsechak ven-arevaiym shanah vekachetvo et-rivekah vat-vetuel haaramiy mifadan aram achvot lavan haaramiy lvo leishah

Hebrew: וַיֶּעְתַּ֨ר יִצְחָ֤ק לַֽיהֹוָה֙ לְנֹ֣כַח אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י עֲקָרָ֖ה הִ֑וא וַיֵּעָ֤תֶר לוֹ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתַּ֖הַר רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Isaac pleaded with יהוה on behalf of his wife, because she was barren; and יהוה responded to his plea, and his wife Rebekah conceived.
Transliteration: vayeetar yitsechak layhovah lenokhach ishetvo khiy akarah hiv vayeater lvo yehovah vatahar rivekah ishetvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְרֹֽצְצ֤וּ הַבָּנִים֙ בְּקִרְבָּ֔הּ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אִם־כֵּ֔ן לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה אָנֹ֑כִי וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ לִדְרֹ֥שׁ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But the children struggled in her womb, and she said, “If so, why do I exist?” She went to inquire of יהוה,
Transliteration: vayiterotsetsu havaniym vekirevah vatomer im-khen lamah zeh anokhiy vatelekhe liderosh et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה לָ֗הּ שְׁנֵ֤י (גיים) [גוֹיִם֙] בְּבִטְנֵ֔ךְ וּשְׁנֵ֣י לְאֻמִּ֔ים מִמֵּעַ֖יִךְ יִפָּרֵ֑דוּ וּלְאֹם֙ מִלְאֹ֣ם יֶֽאֱמָ֔ץ וְרַ֖ב יַעֲבֹ֥ד צָעִֽיר׃
Translated:
and יהוה answered her,
“Two nations are in your womb,
Two separate peoples shall issue from your body;
One people shall be mightier than the other,
And the older shall serve the younger.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah lah sheney (gyym) [gvoyim] vevitenekhe usheney leumiym mimeayiikhe yifaredu uleom mileom yeemats verav yaavod tsaiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלְא֥וּ יָמֶ֖יהָ לָלֶ֑דֶת וְהִנֵּ֥ה תוֹמִ֖ם בְּבִטְנָֽהּ׃
Translated: When her time to give birth was at hand, there were twins in her womb.
Transliteration: vayimeleu yameyha laledet vehineh tvomim vevitenah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָרִאשׁוֹן֙ אַדְמוֹנִ֔י כֻּלּ֖וֹ כְּאַדֶּ֣רֶת שֵׂעָ֑ר וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ שְׁמ֖וֹ עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: The first one emerged red, like a hairy mantle all over; so they named him Esau.
Transliteration: vayetse harishvon ademvoniy khulvo kheaderet shear vayikereu shemvo eshav

Hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן יָצָ֣א אָחִ֗יו וְיָד֤וֹ אֹחֶ֙זֶת֙ בַּעֲקֵ֣ב עֵשָׂ֔ו וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיִצְחָ֛ק בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּלֶ֥דֶת אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Then his brother emerged, holding on to the heel of Esau; so they named him Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when they were born.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen yatsa achiyv veyadvo ochezet vaakev eshav vayikera shemvo yaakov veyitsechak ven-shishiym shanah veledet otam

Hebrew: וַֽיִּגְדְּלוּ֙ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וַיְהִ֣י עֵשָׂ֗ו אִ֛ישׁ יֹדֵ֥עַ צַ֖יִד אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֶ֑ה וְיַעֲקֹב֙ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֔ם יֹשֵׁ֖ב אֹהָלִֽים׃
Translated: When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the outdoors; but Jacob became a mild man, raising livestock.
Transliteration: vayigedelu haneariym vayehiy eshav iysh yodea tsayiid iysh shadeh veyaakov iysh tam yoshev ohaliym

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יִצְחָ֛ק אֶת־עֵשָׂ֖ו כִּי־צַ֣יִד בְּפִ֑יו וְרִבְקָ֖ה אֹהֶ֥בֶת אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: Isaac favored Esau because he had a taste for game; but Rebekah favored Jacob.
Transliteration: vayeehav yitsechak et-eshav khiy-tsayiid vefiyv verivekah ohevet et-yaakov

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥זֶד יַעֲקֹ֖ב נָזִ֑יד וַיָּבֹ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו מִן־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְה֥וּא עָיֵֽף׃
Translated: Once when Jacob was cooking a stew, Esau came in from the open, famished.
Transliteration: vayazed yaakov naziyd vayavo eshav min-hashadeh vehu aeif

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַלְעִיטֵ֤נִי נָא֙ מִן־הָאָדֹ֤ם הָאָדֹם֙ הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֥י עָיֵ֖ף אָנֹ֑כִי עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: And Esau said to Jacob, “Give me some of that red stuff to gulp down, for I am famished”—which is why he was named Edom.
Transliteration: vayomer eshav el-yaakov haleiyteniy na min-haadom haadom hazeh khiy aeif anokhiy al-khen kara-shemvo edvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֑ב מִכְרָ֥ה כַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־בְּכֹרָתְךָ֖ לִֽי׃
Translated: Jacob said, “First sell me your birthright.”
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov mikherah khayyvom et-vekhoratekha liy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י הוֹלֵ֖ךְ לָמ֑וּת וְלָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה לִ֖י בְּכֹרָֽה׃
Translated: And Esau said, “I am at the point of death, so of what use is my birthright to me?”
Transliteration: vayomer eshav hineh anokhiy hvolekhe lamut velamah-zeh liy vekhorah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב הִשָּׁ֤בְעָה לִּי֙ כַּיּ֔וֹם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע ל֑וֹ וַיִּמְכֹּ֥ר אֶת־בְּכֹרָת֖וֹ לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: But Jacob said, “Swear to me first.” So he swore to him, and sold his birthright to Jacob.
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov hishaveah liy khayyvom vayishava lvo vayimekhor et-vekhoratvo leyaakov

Hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹ֞ב נָתַ֣ן לְעֵשָׂ֗ו לֶ֚חֶם וּנְזִ֣יד עֲדָשִׁ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אכַל וַיֵּ֔שְׁתְּ וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ וַיִּ֥בֶז עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶת־הַבְּכֹרָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Jacob then gave Esau bread and lentil stew; he ate and drank, and he rose and went away. Thus did Esau spurn the birthright.
Transliteration: veyaakov natan leeshav lechem uneziyd adashiym vayokhal vayeshete vayakׇm vayelakhe vayivez eshav et-havekhorah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י רָעָב֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ מִלְּבַד֙ הָרָעָ֣ב הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בִּימֵ֣י אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ יִצְחָ֛ק אֶל־אֲבִימֶ֥לֶךְ מֶֽלֶךְ־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים גְּרָֽרָה׃
Translated: There was a famine in the land—aside from the previous famine that had occurred in the days of Abraham—and Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, in Gerar.
Transliteration: vayehiy raav vaarets milevad haraav harishvon asher hayah viymey averaham vayelekhe yitsechak el-aviymelekhe melekhe-felishetiym gerarah

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֤א אֵלָיו֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אַל־תֵּרֵ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יְמָה שְׁכֹ֣ן בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֹמַ֥ר אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: יהוה had appeared to him and said, “Do not go down to Egypt; stay in the land which I point out to you.
Transliteration: vayera elayv yehovah vayomer al-tered mitserayemah shekhon vaarets asher omar eleykha

Hebrew: גּ֚וּר בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶֽהְיֶ֥ה עִמְּךָ֖ וַאֲבָרְכֶ֑ךָּ כִּֽי־לְךָ֣ וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֗ אֶתֵּן֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָֽאֲרָצֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔ל וַהֲקִֽמֹתִי֙ אֶת־הַשְּׁבֻעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם אָבִֽיךָ׃
Translated: Reside in this land, and I will be with you and bless you; I will assign all these lands to you and to your heirs, fulfilling the oath that I swore to your father Abraham.
Transliteration: gur vaarets hazot veeheyeh imekha vaavarekhekha khiy-lekha ulezareakha eten et-khׇl-haaratsot hael vahakimotiy et-hashevuah asher nishevaetiy leaveraham aviykha

Hebrew: וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנָתַתִּ֣י לְזַרְעֲךָ֔ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָאֲרָצֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑ל וְהִתְבָּרְכ֣וּ בְזַרְעֲךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: I will make your heirs as numerous as the stars of heaven, and assign to your heirs all these lands, so that all the nations of the earth shall bless themselves by your heirs—
Transliteration: vehireveytiy et-zareakha khekhvokhevey hashamayiim venatatiy lezareakha et khׇl-haaratsot hael vehitevarekhu vezareakha khol gvoeiy haarets

Hebrew: עֵ֕קֶב אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֥ע אַבְרָהָ֖ם בְּקֹלִ֑י וַיִּשְׁמֹר֙ מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֔י מִצְוֺתַ֖י חֻקּוֹתַ֥י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
Translated: inasmuch as Abraham obeyed Me and kept My charge: My commandments, My laws, and My teachings.”
Transliteration: ekev asher-shama averaham vekoliy vayishemor mishemaretiy mitsevotay chukvotay vetvorotay

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יִצְחָ֖ק בִּגְרָֽר׃
Translated: So Isaac stayed in Gerar.
Transliteration: vayeshev yitsechak vigerar

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁאֲל֞וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ לְאִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא כִּ֤י יָרֵא֙ לֵאמֹ֣ר אִשְׁתִּ֔י פֶּן־יַֽהַרְגֻ֜נִי אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ עַל־רִבְקָ֔ה כִּֽי־טוֹבַ֥ת מַרְאֶ֖ה הִֽוא׃
Translated: When the local leaders asked him about his wife, he said, “She is my sister,” for he was afraid to say “my wife,” thinking, “The local leaders might kill me on account of Rebekah, for she is beautiful.”
Transliteration: vayishealu aneshey hamakvom leishetvo vayomer achotiy hiv khiy yare lemor ishetiy fen-yahareguniy aneshey hamakvom al-rivekah khiy-tvovat mareeh hiv

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּ֣י אָֽרְכוּ־ל֥וֹ שָׁם֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וַיַּשְׁקֵ֗ף אֲבִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים בְּעַ֖ד הַֽחַלּ֑וֹן וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֤ה יִצְחָק֙ מְצַחֵ֔ק אֵ֖ת רִבְקָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When some time had passed, Abimelech king of the Philistines, looking out of the window, saw Isaac fondling his wife Rebekah.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy arekhu-lvo sham hayamiym vayashekef aviymelekhe melekhe felishetiym vead hachalvon vayare vehineh yitsechak metsachek et rivekah ishetvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אֲבִימֶ֜לֶךְ לְיִצְחָ֗ק וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַ֣ךְ הִנֵּ֤ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֙ הִ֔וא וְאֵ֥יךְ אָמַ֖רְתָּ אֲחֹ֣תִי הִ֑וא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ יִצְחָ֔ק כִּ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי פֶּן־אָמ֖וּת עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Abimelech sent for Isaac and said, “So she is your wife! Why then did you say: ‘She is my sister’?” Isaac said to him, “Because I thought I might lose my life on account of her.”
Transliteration: vayikera aviymelekhe leyitsechak vayomer akhe hineh ishetekha hiv veeykhe amareta achotiy hiv vayomer elayv yitsechak khiy amaretiy fen-amut aleyha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ מַה־זֹּ֖את עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֑נוּ כִּ֠מְעַ֠ט שָׁכַ֞ב אַחַ֤ד הָעָם֙ אֶת־אִשְׁתֶּ֔ךָ וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ עָלֵ֖ינוּ אָשָֽׁם׃
Translated: Abimelech said, “What have you done to us! One of the men might have lain with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”
Transliteration: vayomer aviymelekhe mah-zot ashiyta lanu khimeat shakhav achad haam et-ishetekha veheveta aleynu asham

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו אֲבִימֶ֔לֶךְ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר הַנֹּגֵ֜עַ בָּאִ֥ישׁ הַזֶּ֛ה וּבְאִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: Abimelech then charged all the people, saying, “Anyone who molests this man or his wife shall be put to death.”
Transliteration: vayetsav aviymelekhe et-khׇl-haam lemor hanogea vaiysh hazeh uveishetvo mvot yumat

Hebrew: וַיִּזְרַ֤ע יִצְחָק֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֔וא וַיִּמְצָ֛א בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַהִ֖וא מֵאָ֣ה שְׁעָרִ֑ים וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Isaac sowed in that land and reaped a hundredfold the same year. יהוה blessed him,
Transliteration: vayizera yitsechak vaarets hahiv vayimetsa vashanah hahiv meah sheariym vayevarekhehu yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּגְדַּ֖ל הָאִ֑ישׁ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ הָלוֹךְ֙ וְגָדֵ֔ל עַ֥ד כִּֽי־גָדַ֖ל מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: and the man grew richer and richer until he was very wealthy:
Transliteration: vayigedal haiysh vayelekhe halvokhe vegadel ad khiy-gadal meod

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־ל֤וֹ מִקְנֵה־צֹאן֙ וּמִקְנֵ֣ה בָקָ֔ר וַעֲבֻדָּ֖ה רַבָּ֑ה וַיְקַנְא֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: he acquired flocks and herds, and a large household, so that the Philistines envied him.
Transliteration: vayehiy-lvo mikeneh-tson umikeneh vakar vaavudah ravah vayekaneu otvo felishetiym

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַבְּאֵרֹ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָֽפְרוּ֙ עַבְדֵ֣י אָבִ֔יו בִּימֵ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֑יו סִתְּמ֣וּם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיְמַלְא֖וּם עָפָֽר׃
Translated: And the Philistines stopped up all the wells which his father’s servants had dug in the days of his father Abraham, filling them with earth.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haveerot asher chaferu avedey aviyv viymey averaham aviyv sitemum felishetiym vayemaleum afar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲבִימֶ֖לֶךְ אֶל־יִצְחָ֑ק לֵ֚ךְ מֵֽעִמָּ֔נוּ כִּֽי־עָצַ֥מְתָּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: And Abimelech said to Isaac, “Go away from us, for you have become far too big for us.”
Transliteration: vayomer aviymelekhe el-yitsechak lekhe meimanu khiy-atsameta mimenu meod

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ מִשָּׁ֖ם יִצְחָ֑ק וַיִּ֥חַן בְּנַֽחַל־גְּרָ֖ר וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב שָֽׁם׃
Translated: So Isaac departed from there and encamped in the wadi of Gerar, where he settled.
Transliteration: vayelekhe misham yitsechak vayichan venachal-gerar vayeshev sham

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨שׇׁב יִצְחָ֜ק וַיַּחְפֹּ֣ר ׀ אֶת־בְּאֵרֹ֣ת הַמַּ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָֽפְרוּ֙ בִּימֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֔יו וַיְסַתְּמ֣וּם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֖י מ֣וֹת אַבְרָהָ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֤א לָהֶן֙ שֵׁמ֔וֹת כַּשֵּׁמֹ֕ת אֲשֶׁר־קָרָ֥א לָהֶ֖ן אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Isaac dug anew the wells which had been dug in the days of his father Abraham and which the Philistines had stopped up after Abraham’s death; and he gave them the same names that his father had given them.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yitsechak vayachefor et-veerot hamayiim asher chaferu viymey averaham aviyv vayesatemum felishetiym acharey mvot averaham vayikera lahen shemvot khashemot asher-kara lahen aviyv

Hebrew: וַיַּחְפְּר֥וּ עַבְדֵֽי־יִצְחָ֖ק בַּנָּ֑חַל וַיִּ֨מְצְאוּ־שָׁ֔ם בְּאֵ֖ר מַ֥יִם חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: But when Isaac’s servants, digging in the wadi, found there a well of spring water,
Transliteration: vayacheferu avedey-yitsechak vanachal vayimetseu-sham veer mayiim chayiym

Hebrew: וַיָּרִ֜יבוּ רֹעֵ֣י גְרָ֗ר עִם־רֹעֵ֥י יִצְחָ֛ק לֵאמֹ֖ר לָ֣נוּ הַמָּ֑יִם וַיִּקְרָ֤א שֵֽׁם־הַבְּאֵר֙ עֵ֔שֶׂק כִּ֥י הִֽתְעַשְּׂק֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac’s herdsmen, saying, “The water is ours.” He named that well Esek, because they contended with him.
Transliteration: vayariyvu roey gerar im-roey yitsechak lemor lanu hamayiim vayikera shem-haveer eshek khiy hiteasheku imvo

Hebrew: וַֽיַּחְפְּרוּ֙ בְּאֵ֣ר אַחֶ֔רֶת וַיָּרִ֖יבוּ גַּם־עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמָ֖הּ שִׂטְנָֽה׃
Translated: And when they dug another well, they disputed over that one also; so he named it Sitnah.
Transliteration: vayacheferu veer acheret vayariyvu gam-aleyha vayikera shemah shitenah

Hebrew: וַיַּעְתֵּ֣ק מִשָּׁ֗ם וַיַּחְפֹּר֙ בְּאֵ֣ר אַחֶ֔רֶת וְלֹ֥א רָב֖וּ עָלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ רְחֹב֔וֹת וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־עַתָּ֞ה הִרְחִ֧יב יְהֹוָ֛ה לָ֖נוּ וּפָרִ֥ינוּ בָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: He moved from there and dug yet another well, and they did not quarrel over it; so he called it Rehoboth, saying, “Now at last יהוה has granted us ample space to increase in the land.”
Transliteration: vayaetek misham vayachefor veer acheret velo ravu aleyha vayikera shemah rechovvot vayomer khiy-atah hirechiyv yehovah lanu ufariynu vaarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מִשָּׁ֖ם בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: From there he went up to Beer-sheba.
Transliteration: vayaal misham veer shava

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֨א אֵלָ֤יו יְהֹוָה֙ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֔וּא וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֕י אֱלֹהֵ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֑יךָ אַל־תִּירָא֙ כִּֽי־אִתְּךָ֣ אָנֹ֔כִי וּבֵֽרַכְתִּ֙יךָ֙ וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֣י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֔ בַּעֲב֖וּר אַבְרָהָ֥ם עַבְדִּֽי׃
Translated: That night יהוה appeared to him and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham’s [house]. Fear not, for I am with you, and I will bless you and increase your offspring for the sake of My servant Abraham.”
Transliteration: vayera elayv yehovah valayelah hahu vayomer anokhiy elohey averaham aviykha al-tiyra khiy-itekha anokhiy uverakhetiykha vehireveytiy et-zareakha vaavur averaham avediy

Hebrew: וַיִּ֧בֶן שָׁ֣ם מִזְבֵּ֗חַ וַיִּקְרָא֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיֶּט־שָׁ֖ם אׇהֳל֑וֹ וַיִּכְרוּ־שָׁ֥ם עַבְדֵי־יִצְחָ֖ק בְּאֵֽר׃
Translated: So he built an altar there and invoked יהוה by name. Isaac pitched his tent there and his servants started digging a well.
Transliteration: vayiven sham mizevecha vayikera veshem yehovah vayet-sham ׇholvo vayikheru-sham avedey-yitsechak veer

Hebrew: וַאֲבִימֶ֕לֶךְ הָלַ֥ךְ אֵלָ֖יו מִגְּרָ֑ר וַאֲחֻזַּת֙ מֵֽרֵעֵ֔הוּ וּפִיכֹ֖ל שַׂר־צְבָאֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Abimelech came to him from Gerar, with Ahuzzath his councilor and Phicol chief of his troops.
Transliteration: vaaviymelekhe halakhe elayv migerar vaachuzat mereehu ufiykhol shar-tsevavo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ יִצְחָ֔ק מַדּ֖וּעַ בָּאתֶ֣ם אֵלָ֑י וְאַתֶּם֙ שְׂנֵאתֶ֣ם אֹתִ֔י וַתְּשַׁלְּח֖וּנִי מֵאִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: Isaac said to them, “Why have you come to me, seeing that you have been hostile to me and have driven me away from you?”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem yitsechak madua vatem elay veatem shenetem otiy vateshalechuniy meitekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ רָא֣וֹ רָאִ֘ינוּ֮ כִּֽי־הָיָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> עִמָּךְ֒ וַנֹּ֗אמֶר תְּהִ֨י נָ֥א אָלָ֛ה בֵּינוֹתֵ֖ינוּ בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ וְנִכְרְתָ֥ה בְרִ֖ית עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And they said, “We now see plainly that יהוה has been with you, and we thought: Let there be a sworn treaty between our two parties, between you and us. Let us make a pact with you
Transliteration: vayomeru ravo raiynu khiy-hayah yehovah <small></small> imakhe vanomer tehiy na alah veynvoteynu veyneynu uveynekha venikheretah veriyt imakhe

Hebrew: אִם־תַּעֲשֵׂ֨ה עִמָּ֜נוּ רָעָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א נְגַֽעֲנ֔וּךָ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשִׂ֤ינוּ עִמְּךָ֙ רַק־ט֔וֹב וַנְּשַׁלֵּֽחֲךָ֖ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם אַתָּ֥ה עַתָּ֖ה בְּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: that you will not do us harm, just as we have not molested you but have always dealt kindly with you and sent you away in peace. From now on, be you blessed of יהוה!”
Transliteration: im-taasheh imanu raah khaasher lo negaanukha vekhaasher ashiynu imekha rak-tvov vaneshalechakha veshalvom atah atah verukhe yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לָהֶם֙ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וַיֹּאכְל֖וּ וַיִּשְׁתּֽוּ׃
Translated: Then he made for them a feast, and they ate and drank.
Transliteration: vayaash lahem misheteh vayokhelu vayishetu

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣ימוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּשָּׁבְע֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ לְאָחִ֑יו וַיְשַׁלְּחֵ֣ם יִצְחָ֔ק וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ מֵאִתּ֖וֹ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Early in the morning, they exchanged oaths. Isaac then bade them farewell, and they departed from him in peace.
Transliteration: vayashekhiymu vavoker vayishaveu iysh leachiyv vayeshalechem yitsechak vayelekhu meitvo veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ עַבְדֵ֣י יִצְחָ֔ק וַיַּגִּ֣דוּ ל֔וֹ עַל־אֹד֥וֹת הַבְּאֵ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָפָ֑רוּ וַיֹּ֥אמְרוּ ל֖וֹ מָצָ֥אנוּ מָֽיִם׃
Translated: That same day Isaac’s servants came and told him about the well they had dug, and said to him, “We have found water!”
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hahu vayavou avedey yitsechak vayagidu lvo al-odvot haveer asher chafaru vayomeru lvo matsanu mayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ שִׁבְעָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֤ן שֵׁם־הָעִיר֙ בְּאֵ֣ר שֶׁ֔בַע עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: He named it Shibah; therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba to this day.
Transliteration: vayikera otah shiveah al-khen shem-haiyr veer sheva ad hayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י עֵשָׂו֙ בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וַיִּקַּ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ אֶת־יְהוּדִ֔ית בַּת־בְּאֵרִ֖י הַֽחִתִּ֑י וְאֶת־בָּ֣שְׂמַ֔ת בַּת־אֵילֹ֖ן הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
Translated: When Esau was forty years old, he took to wife Judith daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath daughter of Elon the Hittite;
Transliteration: vayehiy eshav ven-arevaiym shanah vayikach ishah et-yehudiyt vat-veeriy hachitiy veet-vashemat vat-eylon hachitiy

Hebrew: וַתִּהְיֶ֖יןָ מֹ֣רַת ר֑וּחַ לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּלְרִבְקָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and they were a source of bitterness to Isaac and Rebekah.
Transliteration: vatiheyeyna morat rucha leyitsechak ulerivekah {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּֽי־זָקֵ֣ן יִצְחָ֔ק וַתִּכְהֶ֥יןָ עֵינָ֖יו מֵרְאֹ֑ת וַיִּקְרָ֞א אֶת־עֵשָׂ֣ו ׀ בְּנ֣וֹ הַגָּדֹ֗ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ בְּנִ֔י וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: When Isaac was old and his eyes were too dim to see, he called his older son Esau and said to him, “My son.” He answered, “Here I am.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-zaken yitsechak vatikheheyna eynayv mereot vayikera et-eshav venvo hagadol vayomer elayv veniy vayomer elayv hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּה־נָ֖א זָקַ֑נְתִּי לֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְתִּי י֥וֹם מוֹתִֽי׃
Translated: And he said, “I am old now, and I do not know how soon I may die.
Transliteration: vayomer hineh-na zakanetiy lo yadaetiy yvom mvotiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ שָׂא־נָ֣א כֵלֶ֔יךָ תֶּלְיְךָ֖ וְקַשְׁתֶּ֑ךָ וְצֵא֙ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְצ֥וּדָה לִּ֖י (צידה) [צָֽיִד]׃
Translated: Take your gear, your quiver and bow, and go out into the open and hunt me some game.
Transliteration: veatah sha-na kheleykha teleyekha vekashetekha vetse hashadeh vetsudah liy (tsydh) [tsayiid]

Hebrew: וַעֲשֵׂה־לִ֨י מַטְעַמִּ֜ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהַ֛בְתִּי וְהָבִ֥יאָה לִּ֖י וְאֹכֵ֑לָה בַּעֲב֛וּר תְּבָרֶכְךָ֥ נַפְשִׁ֖י בְּטֶ֥רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Then prepare a dish for me such as I like, and bring it to me to eat, so that I may give you my innermost blessing before I die.”
Transliteration: vaasheh-liy mateamiym khaasher ahavetiy vehaviyah liy veokhelah vaavur tevarekhekha nafeshiy veterem amut

Hebrew: וְרִבְקָ֣ה שֹׁמַ֔עַת בְּדַבֵּ֣ר יִצְחָ֔ק אֶל־עֵשָׂ֖ו בְּנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ עֵשָׂו֙ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לָצ֥וּד צַ֖יִד לְהָבִֽיא׃
Translated: Rebekah had been listening as Isaac spoke to his son Esau. When Esau had gone out into the open to hunt game to bring home,
Transliteration: verivekah shomaat vedaver yitsechak el-eshav venvo vayelekhe eshav hashadeh latsud tsayiid lehaviy

Hebrew: וְרִבְקָה֙ אָֽמְרָ֔ה אֶל־יַעֲקֹ֥ב בְּנָ֖הּ לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֤ה שָׁמַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶת־אָבִ֔יךָ מְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶל־עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִ֖יךָ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “I overheard your father speaking to your brother Esau, saying,
Transliteration: verivekah amerah el-yaakov venah lemor hineh shamaetiy et-aviykha medaver el-eshav achiykha lemor

Hebrew: הָבִ֨יאָה לִּ֥י צַ֛יִד וַעֲשֵׂה־לִ֥י מַטְעַמִּ֖ים וְאֹכֵ֑לָה וַאֲבָרֶכְכָ֛ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹתִֽי׃
Translated: ‘Bring me some game and prepare a dish for me to eat, that I may bless you, with יהוה’s approval, before I die.’
Transliteration: haviyah liy tsayiid vaasheh-liy mateamiym veokhelah vaavarekhekhah lifeney yehovah lifeney mvotiy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֥ה בְנִ֖י שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֑י לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י מְצַוָּ֥ה אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: Now, my son, listen carefully as I instruct you.
Transliteration: veatah veniy shema vekoliy laasher aniy metsavah otakhe

Hebrew: לֶךְ־נָא֙ אֶל־הַצֹּ֔אן וְקַֽח־לִ֣י מִשָּׁ֗ם שְׁנֵ֛י גְּדָיֵ֥י עִזִּ֖ים טֹבִ֑ים וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂ֨ה אֹתָ֧ם מַטְעַמִּ֛ים לְאָבִ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהֵֽב׃
Translated: Go to the flock and fetch me two choice kids, and I will make of them a dish for your father, such as he likes.
Transliteration: lekhe-na el-hatson vekach-liy misham sheney gedaeiy iziym toviym veeesheh otam mateamiym leaviykha khaasher ahev

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתָ֥ לְאָבִ֖יךָ וְאָכָ֑ל בַּעֲבֻ֛ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְבָרֶכְךָ֖ לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then take it to your father to eat, in order that he may bless you before he dies.”
Transliteration: veheveta leaviykha veakhal vaavur asher yevarekhekha lifeney mvotvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־רִבְקָ֖ה אִמּ֑וֹ הֵ֣ן עֵשָׂ֤ו אָחִי֙ אִ֣ישׁ שָׂעִ֔ר וְאָנֹכִ֖י אִ֥ישׁ חָלָֽק׃
Translated: Jacob answered his mother Rebekah, “But my brother Esau is a hairy man and I am smooth-skinned.
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov el-rivekah imvo hen eshav achiy iysh shair veanokhiy iysh chalak

Hebrew: אוּלַ֤י יְמֻשֵּׁ֙נִי֙ אָבִ֔י וְהָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינָ֖יו כִּמְתַעְתֵּ֑עַ וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י עָלַ֛י קְלָלָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א בְרָכָֽה׃
Translated: If my father touches me, I shall appear to him as a trickster and bring upon myself a curse, not a blessing.”
Transliteration: ulay yemusheniy aviy vehayiytiy veeynayv khimetaetea vehevetiy alay kelalah velo verakhah

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אִמּ֔וֹ עָלַ֥י קִלְלָתְךָ֖ בְּנִ֑י אַ֛ךְ שְׁמַ֥ע בְּקֹלִ֖י וְלֵ֥ךְ קַֽח־לִֽי׃
Translated: But his mother said to him, “Your curse, my son, be upon me! Just do as I say and go fetch them for me.”
Transliteration: vatomer lvo imvo alay kilelatekha veniy akhe shema vekoliy velekhe kach-liy

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ וַיִּקַּ֔ח וַיָּבֵ֖א לְאִמּ֑וֹ וַתַּ֤עַשׂ אִמּוֹ֙ מַטְעַמִּ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָהֵ֥ב אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: He got them and brought them to his mother, and his mother prepared a dish such as his father liked.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vayikach vayave leimvo vataash imvo mateamiym khaasher ahev aviyv

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֣ח רִ֠בְקָ֠ה אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֨י עֵשָׂ֜ו בְּנָ֤הּ הַגָּדֹל֙ הַחֲמֻדֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתָּ֖הּ בַּבָּ֑יִת וַתַּלְבֵּ֥שׁ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּנָ֥הּ הַקָּטָֽן׃
Translated: Rebekah then took the best clothes of her older son Esau, which were there in the house, and had her younger son Jacob put them on;
Transliteration: vatikach rivekah et-vigedey eshav venah hagadol hachamudot asher itah vavayiit vatalevesh et-yaakov venah hakatan

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗ת עֹרֹת֙ גְּדָיֵ֣י הָֽעִזִּ֔ים הִלְבִּ֖ישָׁה עַל־יָדָ֑יו וְעַ֖ל חֶלְקַ֥ת צַוָּארָֽיו׃
Translated: and she covered his hands and the hairless part of his neck with the skins of the kids.
Transliteration: veet orot gedaeiy haiziym hileviyshah al-yadayv veal chelekat tsavarayv

Hebrew: וַתִּתֵּ֧ן אֶת־הַמַּטְעַמִּ֛ים וְאֶת־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑תָה בְּיַ֖ד יַעֲקֹ֥ב בְּנָֽהּ׃
Translated: Then she put in the hands of her son Jacob the dish and the bread that she had prepared.
Transliteration: vatiten et-hamateamiym veet-halechem asher ashatah veyad yaakov venah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־אָבִ֖יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָבִ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הִנֶּ֔נִּי מִ֥י אַתָּ֖ה בְּנִֽי׃
Translated: He went to his father and said, “Father.” And he said, “Yes, which of my sons are you?”
Transliteration: vayavo el-aviyv vayomer aviy vayomer hineniy miy atah veniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶל־אָבִ֗יו אָנֹכִי֙ עֵשָׂ֣ו בְּכֹרֶ֔ךָ עָשִׂ֕יתִי כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ אֵלָ֑י קֽוּם־נָ֣א שְׁבָ֗ה וְאׇכְלָה֙ מִצֵּידִ֔י בַּעֲב֖וּר תְּבָרְכַ֥נִּי נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau, your first-born; I have done as you told me. Pray sit up and eat of my game, that you may give me your innermost blessing.”
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov el-aviyv anokhiy eshav vekhorekha ashiytiy khaasher divareta elay kum-na shevah veׇkhelah mitseydiy vaavur tevarekhaniy nafeshekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִצְחָק֙ אֶל־בְּנ֔וֹ מַה־זֶּ֛ה מִהַ֥רְתָּ לִמְצֹ֖א בְּנִ֑י וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּ֥י הִקְרָ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: Isaac said to his son, “How did you succeed so quickly, my son?” And he said, “Because your God יהוה granted me good fortune.”
Transliteration: vayomer yitsechak el-venvo mah-zeh mihareta limetso veniy vayomer khiy hikerah yehovah eloheykha lefanay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִצְחָק֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב גְּשָׁה־נָּ֥א וַאֲמֻֽשְׁךָ֖ בְּנִ֑י הַֽאַתָּ֥ה זֶ֛ה בְּנִ֥י עֵשָׂ֖ו אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translated: Isaac said to Jacob, “Come closer that I may feel you, my son—whether you are really my son Esau or not.”
Transliteration: vayomer yitsechak el-yaakov geshah-na vaamushekha veniy haatah zeh veniy eshav im-lo

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֧שׁ יַעֲקֹ֛ב אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו וַיְמֻשֵּׁ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַקֹּל֙ ק֣וֹל יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְהַיָּדַ֖יִם יְדֵ֥י עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: So Jacob drew close to his father Isaac, who felt him and wondered. “The voice is the voice of Jacob, yet the hands are the hands of Esau.”
Transliteration: vayigash yaakov el-yitsechak aviyv vayemushehu vayomer hakol kvol yaakov vehayadayiim yedey eshav

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א הִכִּיר֔וֹ כִּֽי־הָי֣וּ יָדָ֗יו כִּידֵ֛י עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִ֖יו שְׂעִרֹ֑ת וַֽיְבָרְכֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: He did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like those of his brother Esau; and so he blessed him.
Transliteration: velo hikhiyrvo khiy-hayu yadayv khiydey eshav achiyv sheirot vayevarekhehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אַתָּ֥ה זֶ֖ה בְּנִ֣י עֵשָׂ֑ו וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָֽנִי׃
Translated: He asked, “Are you really my son Esau?” And when he said, “I am,”
Transliteration: vayomer atah zeh veniy eshav vayomer aniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הַגִּ֤שָׁה לִּי֙ וְאֹֽכְלָה֙ מִצֵּ֣יד בְּנִ֔י לְמַ֥עַן תְּבָֽרֶכְךָ֖ נַפְשִׁ֑י וַיַּגֶּשׁ־לוֹ֙ וַיֹּאכַ֔ל וַיָּ֧בֵא ל֦וֹ יַ֖יִן וַיֵּֽשְׁתְּ׃
Translated: he said, “Serve me and let me eat of my son’s game that I may give you my innermost blessing.” So he served him and he ate, and he brought him wine and he drank.
Transliteration: vayomer hagishah liy veokhelah mitseyd veniy lemaan tevarekhekha nafeshiy vayagesh-lvo vayokhal vayave lvo yayiin vayeshete

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֑יו גְּשָׁה־נָּ֥א וּשְׁקָה־לִּ֖י בְּנִֽי׃
Translated: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Come close and kiss me, my son”;
Transliteration: vayomer elayv yitsechak aviyv geshah-na ushekah-liy veniy

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּשׁ֙ וַיִּשַּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיָּ֛רַח אֶת־רֵ֥יחַ בְּגָדָ֖יו וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֑הוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר רְאֵה֙ רֵ֣יחַ בְּנִ֔י כְּרֵ֣יחַ שָׂדֶ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּרְכ֖וֹ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and he went up and kissed him. And he smelled his clothes and he blessed him, saying, “Ah, the smell of my son is like the smell of the fields that יהוה has blessed.
Transliteration: vayigash vayishak-lvo vayarach et-reycha vegadayv vayevarekhehu vayomer reeh reycha veniy khereycha shadeh asher verekhvo yehovah

Hebrew: וְיִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מִטַּל֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וּמִשְׁמַנֵּ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְרֹ֥ב דָּגָ֖ן וְתִירֹֽשׁ׃
Translated:
“May God give you
Of the dew of heaven and the fat of the earth,
Abundance of new grain and wine.
Transliteration: veyiten-lekha haElohim mital hashamayiim umishemaney haarets verov dagan vetiyrosh

Hebrew: יַֽעַבְד֣וּךָ עַמִּ֗ים (וישתחו) [וְיִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֤וּ] לְךָ֙ לְאֻמִּ֔ים הֱוֵ֤ה גְבִיר֙ לְאַחֶ֔יךָ וְיִשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּנֵ֣י אִמֶּ֑ךָ אֹרְרֶ֣יךָ אָר֔וּר וּֽמְבָרְכֶ֖יךָ בָּרֽוּךְ׃
Translated:
Let peoples serve you,
And nations bow to you;
Be master over your brothers,
And let your mother’s sons bow to you.
Cursed be they who curse you,
Blessed they who bless you.”
Transliteration: yaavedukha amiym (vyshtchv) [veyishetachavu] lekha leumiym heveh geviyr leacheykha veyishetachavu lekha veney imekha orereykha arur umevarekheykha varukhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר כִּלָּ֣ה יִצְחָק֮ לְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹב֒ וַיְהִ֗י אַ֣ךְ יָצֹ֤א יָצָא֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב מֵאֵ֥ת פְּנֵ֖י יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֑יו וְעֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֔יו בָּ֖א מִצֵּידֽוֹ׃
Translated: No sooner had Jacob left the presence of his father Isaac—after Isaac had finished blessing Jacob—than his brother Esau came back from his hunt.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher khilah yitsechak levarekhe et-yaakov vayehiy akhe yatso yatsa yaakov meet feney yitsechak aviyv veeshav achiyv va mitseydvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ גַּם־הוּא֙ מַטְעַמִּ֔ים וַיָּבֵ֖א לְאָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאָבִ֗יו יָקֻ֤ם אָבִי֙ וְיֹאכַל֙ מִצֵּ֣יד בְּנ֔וֹ בַּעֲבֻ֖ר תְּבָרְכַ֥נִּי נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: He too prepared a dish and brought it to his father. And he said to his father, “Let my father sit up and eat of his son’s game, so that you may give me your innermost blessing.”
Transliteration: vayaash gam-hu mateamiym vayave leaviyv vayomer leaviyv yakum aviy veyokhal mitseyd venvo vaavur tevarekhaniy nafeshekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֛וֹ יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו מִי־אָ֑תָּה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֲנִ֛י בִּנְךָ֥ בְכֹֽרְךָ֖ עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: His father Isaac said to him, “Who are you?” And he said, “I am your son, Esau, your first-born!”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo yitsechak aviyv miy-atah vayomer aniy vinekha vekhorekha eshav

Hebrew: וַיֶּחֱרַ֨ד יִצְחָ֣ק חֲרָדָה֮ גְּדֹלָ֣ה עַד־מְאֹד֒ וַיֹּ֡אמֶר מִֽי־אֵפ֡וֹא ה֣וּא הַצָּֽד־צַ֩יִד֩ וַיָּ֨בֵא לִ֜י וָאֹכַ֥ל מִכֹּ֛ל בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּב֖וֹא וָאֲבָרְכֵ֑הוּ גַּם־בָּר֖וּךְ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Isaac was seized with very violent trembling. “Who was it then,” he demanded, “that hunted game and brought it to me? Moreover, I ate of it before you came, and I blessed him; now he must remain blessed!”
Transliteration: vayecherad yitsechak charadah gedolah ad-meod vayomer miy-efvo hu hatsad-tsayiid vayave liy vaokhal mikhol veterem tavvo vaavarekhehu gam-varukhe yiheyeh

Hebrew: כִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ עֵשָׂו֙ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י אָבִ֔יו וַיִּצְעַ֣ק צְעָקָ֔ה גְּדֹלָ֥ה וּמָרָ֖ה עַד־מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְאָבִ֔יו בָּרְכֵ֥נִי גַם־אָ֖נִי אָבִֽי׃
Translated: When Esau heard his father’s words, he burst into wild and bitter sobbing, and said to his father, “Bless me too, Father!”
Transliteration: khishemoa eshav et-diverey aviyv vayitseak tseakah gedolah umarah ad-meod vayomer leaviyv varekheniy gam-aniy aviy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בָּ֥א אָחִ֖יךָ בְּמִרְמָ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֖ח בִּרְכָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But he answered, “Your brother came with guile and took away your blessing.”
Transliteration: vayomer va achiykha vemiremah vayikach virekhatekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר הֲכִי֩ קָרָ֨א שְׁמ֜וֹ יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַֽיַּעְקְבֵ֙נִי֙ זֶ֣ה פַעֲמַ֔יִם אֶת־בְּכֹרָתִ֣י לָקָ֔ח וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַתָּ֖ה לָקַ֣ח בִּרְכָתִ֑י וַיֹּאמַ֕ר הֲלֹא־אָצַ֥לְתָּ לִּ֖י בְּרָכָֽה׃
Translated: [Esau] said, “Was he, then, named Jacob that he might supplant me these two times? First he took away my birthright and now he has taken away my blessing!” And he added, “Have you not reserved a blessing for me?”
Transliteration: vayomer hakhiy kara shemvo yaakov vayaekeveniy zeh faamayiim et-vekhoratiy lakach vehineh atah lakach virekhatiy vayomar halo-atsaleta liy verakhah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן יִצְחָ֜ק וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְעֵשָׂ֗ו הֵ֣ן גְּבִ֞יר שַׂמְתִּ֥יו לָךְ֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֶחָ֗יו נָתַ֤תִּי לוֹ֙ לַעֲבָדִ֔ים וְדָגָ֥ן וְתִירֹ֖שׁ סְמַכְתִּ֑יו וּלְכָ֣ה אֵפ֔וֹא מָ֥ה אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֖ה בְּנִֽי׃
Translated: Isaac answered, saying to Esau, “But I have made him master over you: I have given him all his brothers for servants, and sustained him with grain and wine. What, then, can I still do for you, my son?”
Transliteration: vayaan yitsechak vayomer leeshav hen geviyr shametiyv lakhe veet-khׇl-echayv natatiy lvo laavadiym vedagan vetiyrosh semakhetiyv ulekhah efvo mah eesheh veniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו אֶל־אָבִ֗יו הַֽבְרָכָ֨ה אַחַ֤ת הִֽוא־לְךָ֙ אָבִ֔י בָּרְכֵ֥נִי גַם־אָ֖נִי אָבִ֑י וַיִּשָּׂ֥א עֵשָׂ֛ו קֹל֖וֹ וַיֵּֽבְךְּ׃
Translated: And Esau said to his father, “Have you but one blessing, Father? Bless me too, Father!” And Esau wept aloud.
Transliteration: vayomer eshav el-aviyv haverakhah achat hiv-lekha aviy varekheniy gam-aniy aviy vayisha eshav kolvo vayevekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛עַן יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו הִנֵּ֞ה מִשְׁמַנֵּ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה מֽוֹשָׁבֶ֔ךָ וּמִטַּ֥ל הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם מֵעָֽל׃
Translated:
And his father Isaac answered, saying to him,
“See, your abode shall enjoy the fat of the earth
And the dew of heaven above.
Transliteration: vayaan yitsechak aviyv vayomer elayv hineh mishemaney haarets yiheyeh mvoshavekha umital hashamayiim meal

Hebrew: וְעַל־חַרְבְּךָ֣ תִֽחְיֶ֔ה וְאֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ תַּעֲבֹ֑ד וְהָיָה֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּרִ֔יד וּפָרַקְתָּ֥ עֻלּ֖וֹ מֵעַ֥ל צַוָּארֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Yet by your sword you shall live,
And you shall serve your brother;
But when you grow restive,
You shall break his yoke from your neck.”
Transliteration: veal-charevekha ticheyeh veet-achiykha taavod vehayah khaasher tariyd ufaraketa ulvo meal tsavarekha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂטֹ֤ם עֵשָׂו֙ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב עַ֨ל־הַבְּרָכָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּרְכ֖וֹ אָבִ֑יו וַיֹּ֨אמֶר עֵשָׂ֜ו בְּלִבּ֗וֹ יִקְרְבוּ֙ יְמֵי֙ אֵ֣בֶל אָבִ֔י וְאַֽהַרְגָ֖ה אֶת־יַעֲקֹ֥ב אָחִֽי׃
Translated: Now Esau harbored a grudge against Jacob because of the blessing which his father had given him, and Esau said to himself, “Let but the mourning period of my father come, and I will kill my brother Jacob.”
Transliteration: vayishetom eshav et-yaakov al-haverakhah asher verekhvo aviyv vayomer eshav velivvo yikerevu yemey evel aviy veaharegah et-yaakov achiy

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֣ד לְרִבְקָ֔ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י עֵשָׂ֖ו בְּנָ֣הּ הַגָּדֹ֑ל וַתִּשְׁלַ֞ח וַתִּקְרָ֤א לְיַעֲקֹב֙ בְּנָ֣הּ הַקָּטָ֔ן וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו הִנֵּה֙ עֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֔יךָ מִתְנַחֵ֥ם לְךָ֖ לְהׇרְגֶֽךָ׃
Translated: When the words of her older son Esau were reported to Rebekah, she sent for her younger son Jacob and said to him, “Your brother Esau is consoling himself by planning to kill you.
Transliteration: vayugad lerivekah et-diverey eshav venah hagadol vatishelach vatikera leyaakov venah hakatan vatomer elayv hineh eshav achiykha mitenachem lekha lehׇregekha

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֥ה בְנִ֖י שְׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֑י וְק֧וּם בְּרַח־לְךָ֛ אֶל־לָבָ֥ן אָחִ֖י חָרָֽנָה׃
Translated: Now, my son, listen to me. Flee at once to Haran, to my brother Laban.
Transliteration: veatah veniy shema vekoliy vekum verach-lekha el-lavan achiy charanah

Hebrew: וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֥ עִמּ֖וֹ יָמִ֣ים אֲחָדִ֑ים עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־תָּשׁ֖וּב חֲמַ֥ת אָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: Stay with him a while, until your brother’s fury subsides—
Transliteration: veyashaveta imvo yamiym achadiym ad asher-tashuv chamat achiykha

Hebrew: עַד־שׁ֨וּב אַף־אָחִ֜יךָ מִמְּךָ֗ וְשָׁכַח֙ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ וְשָׁלַחְתִּ֖י וּלְקַחְתִּ֣יךָ מִשָּׁ֑ם לָמָ֥ה אֶשְׁכַּ֛ל גַּם־שְׁנֵיכֶ֖ם י֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: until your brother’s anger against you subsides—and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will fetch you from there. Let me not lose you both in one day!”
Transliteration: ad-shuv af-achiykha mimekha veshakhach et asher-ashiyta lvo veshalachetiy ulekachetiykha misham lamah eshekhal gam-sheneykhem yvom echad

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רִבְקָה֙ אֶל־יִצְחָ֔ק <small>קַ֣</small>צְתִּי בְחַיַּ֔י מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנ֣וֹת חֵ֑ת אִם־לֹקֵ֣חַ יַ֠עֲקֹ֠ב אִשָּׁ֨ה מִבְּנֽוֹת־חֵ֤ת כָּאֵ֙לֶּה֙ מִבְּנ֣וֹת הָאָ֔רֶץ לָ֥מָּה לִּ֖י חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am disgusted with my life because of the Hittite women. If Jacob marries a Hittite woman like these, from among the native women, what good will life be to me?”
Transliteration: vatomer rivekah el-yitsechak <small>ka</small>tsetiy vechayay mifeney venvot chet im-lokecha yaakov ishah mivenvot-chet khaeleh mivenvot haarets lamah liy chayiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יִצְחָ֛ק אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֹת֑וֹ וַיְצַוֵּ֙הוּ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: So Isaac sent for Jacob and blessed him. He instructed him, saying, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women.
Transliteration: vayikera yitsechak el-yaakov vayevarekhe otvo vayetsavehu vayomer lvo lo-tikach ishah mivenvot khenaan

Hebrew: ק֥וּם לֵךְ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם בֵּ֥יתָה בְתוּאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֣י אִמֶּ֑ךָ וְקַח־לְךָ֤ מִשָּׁם֙ אִשָּׁ֔ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֥י אִמֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Up, go to Paddan-aram, to the house of Bethuel, your mother’s father, and take a wife there from among the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother.
Transliteration: kum lekhe fadenah aram veytah vetuel aviy imekha vekach-lekha misham ishah mivenvot lavan achiy imekha

Hebrew: וְאֵ֤ל שַׁדַּי֙ יְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֹֽתְךָ֔ וְיַפְרְךָ֖ וְיַרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְהָיִ֖יתָ לִקְהַ֥ל עַמִּֽים׃
Translated: May El Shaddai bless you, make you fertile and numerous, so that you become an assembly of peoples.
Transliteration: veel shaday yevarekhe otekha veyaferekha veyarevekha vehayiyta likehal amiym

Hebrew: וְיִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ אֶת־בִּרְכַּ֣ת אַבְרָהָ֔ם לְךָ֖ וּלְזַרְעֲךָ֣ אִתָּ֑ךְ לְרִשְׁתְּךָ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מְגֻרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְאַבְרָהָֽם׃
Translated: May you and your offspring be granted the blessing of Abraham, that you may possess the land where you are sojourning, which God assigned to Abraham.”
Transliteration: veyiten-lekha et-virekhat averaham lekha ulezareakha itakhe lerishetekha et-erets megureykha asher-natan Elohim leaveraham

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִצְחָק֙ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֑ם אֶל־לָבָ֤ן בֶּן־בְּתוּאֵל֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּ֔י אֲחִ֣י רִבְקָ֔ה אֵ֥ם יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְעֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: Then Isaac sent Jacob off, and he went to Paddan-aram, to Laban the son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, mother of Jacob and Esau.
Transliteration: vayishelach yitsechak et-yaakov vayelekhe fadenah aram el-lavan ven-vetuel haaramiy achiy rivekah em yaakov veeshav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֗ו כִּֽי־בֵרַ֣ךְ יִצְחָק֮ אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹב֒ וְשִׁלַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ פַּדֶּ֣נָֽה אֲרָ֔ם לָקַֽחַת־ל֥וֹ מִשָּׁ֖ם אִשָּׁ֑ה בְּבָרְכ֣וֹ אֹת֔וֹ וַיְצַ֤ו עָלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹֽא־תִקַּ֥ח אִשָּׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him off to Paddan-aram to take a wife from there, charging him, as he blessed him, “You shall not take a wife from among the Canaanite women,”
Transliteration: vayare eshav khiy-verakhe yitsechak et-yaakov veshilach otvo fadenah aram lakachat-lvo misham ishah vevarekhvo otvo vayetsav alayv lemor lo-tikach ishah mivenvot khenaan

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־אָבִ֖יו וְאֶל־אִמּ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ פַּדֶּ֥נָֽה אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and gone to Paddan-aram,
Transliteration: vayishema yaakov el-aviyv veel-imvo vayelekhe fadenah aram

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא עֵשָׂ֔ו כִּ֥י רָע֖וֹת בְּנ֣וֹת כְּנָ֑עַן בְּעֵינֵ֖י יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: Esau realized that the Canaanite women displeased his father Isaac.
Transliteration: vayare eshav khiy ravot venvot khenaan veeyney yitsechak aviyv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ עֵשָׂ֖ו אֶל־יִשְׁמָעֵ֑אל וַיִּקַּ֡ח אֶֽת־מָחֲלַ֣ת ׀ בַּת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֨אל בֶּן־אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֲח֧וֹת נְבָי֛וֹת עַל־נָשָׁ֖יו ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: So Esau went to Ishmael and took to wife, in addition to the wives he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael son of Abraham, sister of Nebaioth.
Transliteration: vayelekhe eshav el-yishemael vayikach et-machalat vat-yishemael ven-averaham achvot nevayvot al-nashayv lvo leishah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִבְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ חָרָֽנָה׃
Translated: Jacob left Beer-sheba, and set out for Haran.
Transliteration: vayetse yaakov miveer shava vayelekhe charanah

Hebrew: וַיִּפְגַּ֨ע בַּמָּק֜וֹם וַיָּ֤לֶן שָׁם֙ כִּי־בָ֣א הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ וַיִּקַּח֙ מֵאַבְנֵ֣י הַמָּק֔וֹם וַיָּ֖שֶׂם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁכַּ֖ב בַּמָּק֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: He came upon a certain place and stopped there for the night, for the sun had set. Taking one of the stones of that place, he put it under his head and lay down in that place.
Transliteration: vayifega vamakvom vayalen sham khiy-va hashemesh vayikach meaveney hamakvom vayashem meraashotayv vayishekhav vamakvom hahu

Hebrew: וַֽיַּחֲלֹ֗ם וְהִנֵּ֤ה סֻלָּם֙ מֻצָּ֣ב אַ֔רְצָה וְרֹאשׁ֖וֹ מַגִּ֣יעַ הַשָּׁמָ֑יְמָה וְהִנֵּה֙ מַלְאֲכֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֔ים עֹלִ֥ים וְיֹרְדִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He had a dream; a stairway was set on the ground and its top reached to the sky, and messengers of God were going up and down on it.
Transliteration: vayachalom vehineh sulam mutsav aretsah veroshvo magiya hashamayemah vehineh maleakhey Elohim oliym veyorediym vvo

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה נִצָּ֣ב עָלָיו֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱלֹהֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם אָבִ֔יךָ וֵאלֹהֵ֖י יִצְחָ֑ק הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ שֹׁכֵ֣ב עָלֶ֔יהָ לְךָ֥ אֶתְּנֶ֖נָּה וּלְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And standing beside him was יהוה, who said, “I am יהוה, the God of your father Abraham’s [house] and the God of Isaac’s [house]: the ground on which you are lying I will assign to you and to your offspring.
Transliteration: vehineh yehovah nitsav alayv vayomar aniy yehovah elohey averaham aviykha velohey yitsechak haarets asher atah shokhev aleyha lekha etenenah ulezareekha

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה זַרְעֲךָ֙ כַּעֲפַ֣ר הָאָ֔רֶץ וּפָרַצְתָּ֛ יָ֥מָּה וָקֵ֖דְמָה וְצָפֹ֣נָה וָנֶ֑גְבָּה וְנִבְרְכ֥וּ בְךָ֛ כׇּל־מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הָאֲדָמָ֖ה וּבְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Your descendants shall be as the dust of the earth; you shall spread out to the west and to the east, to the north and to the south. All the families of the earth shall bless themselves by you and your descendants.
Transliteration: vehayah zareakha khaafar haarets ufaratseta yamah vakedemah vetsafonah vanegevah veniverekhu vekha khׇl-mishefechot haadamah uvezareekha

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֜י עִמָּ֗ךְ וּשְׁמַרְתִּ֙יךָ֙ בְּכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־תֵּלֵ֔ךְ וַהֲשִׁ֣בֹתִ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאֲדָמָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את כִּ֚י לֹ֣א אֶֽעֱזׇבְךָ֔ עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִם־עָשִׂ֔יתִי אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Remember, I am with you: I will protect you wherever you go and will bring you back to this land. I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
Transliteration: vehineh anokhiy imakhe ushemaretiykha vekhol asher-telekhe vahashivotiykha el-haadamah hazot khiy lo eezׇvekha ad asher im-ashiytiy et asher-divaretiy lakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּיקַ֣ץ יַעֲקֹב֮ מִשְּׁנָתוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָכֵן֙ יֵ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה בַּמָּק֖וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְאָנֹכִ֖י לֹ֥א יָדָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: Jacob awoke from his sleep and said, “Surely יהוה is present in this place, and I did not know it!”
Transliteration: vayiykats yaakov mishenatvo vayomer akhen eish yehovah vamakvom hazeh veanokhiy lo yadaetiy

Hebrew: וַיִּירָא֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מַה־נּוֹרָ֖א הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה אֵ֣ין זֶ֗ה כִּ֚י אִם־בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְזֶ֖ה שַׁ֥עַר הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: Shaken, he said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the abode of God, and that is the gateway to heaven.”
Transliteration: vayiyra vayomar mah-nvora hamakvom hazeh eyn zeh khiy im-veyt Elohim vezeh shaar hashamayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם יַעֲקֹ֜ב בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם מְרַֽאֲשֹׁתָ֔יו וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֹתָ֖הּ מַצֵּבָ֑ה וַיִּצֹ֥ק שֶׁ֖מֶן עַל־רֹאשָֽׁהּ׃
Translated: Early in the morning, Jacob took the stone that he had put under his head and set it up as a pillar and poured oil on the top of it.
Transliteration: vayashekhem yaakov vavoker vayikach et-haeven asher-sham meraashotayv vayashem otah matsevah vayitsok shemen al-roshah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְאוּלָ֛ם ל֥וּז שֵׁם־הָעִ֖יר לָרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: He named that site Bethel; but previously the name of the city had been Luz.
Transliteration: vayikera et-shem-hamakvom hahu veyt-el veulam luz shem-haiyr larishonah

Hebrew: וַיִּדַּ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב נֶ֣דֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־יִהְיֶ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֜ים עִמָּדִ֗י וּשְׁמָרַ֙נִי֙ בַּדֶּ֤רֶךְ הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י הוֹלֵ֔ךְ וְנָֽתַן־לִ֥י לֶ֛חֶם לֶאֱכֹ֖ל וּבֶ֥גֶד לִלְבֹּֽשׁ׃
Translated: Jacob then made a vow, saying, “If God remains with me, protecting me on this journey that I am making, and giving me bread to eat and clothing to wear,
Transliteration: vayidar yaakov neder lemor im-yiheyeh Elohim imadiy ushemaraniy vaderekhe hazeh asher anokhiy hvolekhe venatan-liy lechem leekhol uveged lilevosh

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְתִּ֥י בְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑י וְהָיָ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לִ֖י לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: and I return safe to my father’s house— יהוה shall be my God.
Transliteration: veshavetiy veshalvom el-veyt aviy vehayah yehovah liy lelohiym

Hebrew: וְהָאֶ֣בֶן הַזֹּ֗את אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֙מְתִּי֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה יִהְיֶ֖ה בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י עַשֵּׂ֖ר אֲעַשְּׂרֶ֥נּוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: And this stone, which I have set up as a pillar, shall be God’s abode; and of all that You give me, I will set aside a tithe for You.”
Transliteration: vehaeven hazot asher-shametiy matsevah yiheyeh veyt Elohim vekhol asher titen-liy asher aasherenu lakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב רַגְלָ֑יו וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אַ֥רְצָה בְנֵי־קֶֽדֶם׃
Translated: Jacob resumed his journey and came to the land of the Easterners.
Transliteration: vayisha yaakov ragelayv vayelekhe aretsah veney-kedem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֞רְא וְהִנֵּ֧ה בְאֵ֣ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה וְהִנֵּה־שָׁ֞ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶדְרֵי־צֹאן֙ רֹבְצִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֚י מִן־הַבְּאֵ֣ר הַהִ֔וא יַשְׁק֖וּ הָעֲדָרִ֑ים וְהָאֶ֥בֶן גְּדֹלָ֖ה עַל־פִּ֥י הַבְּאֵֽר׃
Translated: There before his eyes was a well in the open. Three flocks of sheep were lying there beside it, for the flocks were watered from that well. The stone on the mouth of the well was large.
Transliteration: vayare vehineh veer vashadeh vehineh-sham sheloshah ederey-tson rovetsiym aleyha khiy min-haveer hahiv yasheku haadariym vehaeven gedolah al-fiy haveer

Hebrew: וְנֶאֶסְפוּ־שָׁ֣מָּה כׇל־הָעֲדָרִ֗ים וְגָלְל֤וּ אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מֵעַל֙ פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֔ר וְהִשְׁק֖וּ אֶת־הַצֹּ֑אן וְהֵשִׁ֧יבוּ אֶת־הָאֶ֛בֶן עַל־פִּ֥י הַבְּאֵ֖ר לִמְקֹמָֽהּ׃
Translated: When all the flocks were gathered there, the stone would be rolled from the mouth of the well and the sheep watered; then the stone would be put back in its place on the mouth of the well.
Transliteration: veneesefu-shamah khׇl-haadariym vegalelu et-haeven meal fiy haveer vehisheku et-hatson veheshiyvu et-haeven al-fiy haveer limekomah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב אַחַ֖י מֵאַ֣יִן אַתֶּ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵחָרָ֖ן אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated: Jacob said to them, “My friends, where are you from?” And they said, “We are from Haran.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem yaakov achay meayiin atem vayomeru mecharan anachenu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם הַיְדַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־לָבָ֣ן בֶּן־נָח֑וֹר וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ יָדָֽעְנוּ׃
Translated: He said to them, “Do you know Laban the son of Nahor?” And they said, “Yes, we do.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem hayedaetem et-lavan ven-nachvor vayomeru yadaenu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָהֶ֖ם הֲשָׁל֣וֹם ל֑וֹ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ שָׁל֔וֹם וְהִנֵּה֙ רָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֔וֹ בָּאָ֖ה עִם־הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: He continued, “Is he well?” They answered, “Yes, he is; and there is his daughter Rachel, coming with the flock.”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem hashalvom lvo vayomeru shalvom vehineh rachel vitvo vaah im-hatson

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֵ֥ן עוֹד֙ הַיּ֣וֹם גָּד֔וֹל לֹא־עֵ֖ת הֵאָסֵ֣ף הַמִּקְנֶ֑ה הַשְׁק֥וּ הַצֹּ֖אן וּלְכ֥וּ רְעֽוּ׃
Translated: He said, “It is still broad daylight, too early to round up the animals; water the flock and take them to pasture.”
Transliteration: vayomer hen vod hayyvom gadvol lo-et heasef hamikeneh hasheku hatson ulekhu reu

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ לֹ֣א נוּכַל֒ עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁ֤ר יֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֲדָרִ֔ים וְגָֽלְלוּ֙ אֶת־הָאֶ֔בֶן מֵעַ֖ל פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֑ר וְהִשְׁקִ֖ינוּ הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: But they said, “We cannot, until all the flocks are rounded up; then the stone is rolled off the mouth of the well and we water the sheep.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lo nukhal ad asher eiasefu khׇl-haadariym vegalelu et-haeven meal fiy haveer vehishekiynu hatson

Hebrew: עוֹדֶ֖נּוּ מְדַבֵּ֣ר עִמָּ֑ם וְרָחֵ֣ל ׀ בָּ֗אָה עִם־הַצֹּאן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔יהָ כִּ֥י רֹעָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
Translated: While he was still speaking with them, Rachel came with her father’s flock—for she was its shepherd.
Transliteration: vodenu medaver imam verachel vaah im-hatson asher leaviyha khiy roah hiv

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ רָאָ֨ה יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־רָחֵ֗ל בַּת־לָבָן֙ אֲחִ֣י אִמּ֔וֹ וְאֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֣י אִמּ֑וֹ וַיִּגַּ֣שׁ יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַיָּ֤גֶל אֶת־הָאֶ֙בֶן֙ מֵעַל֙ פִּ֣י הַבְּאֵ֔ר וַיַּ֕שְׁקְ אֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן אֲחִ֥י אִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of his uncle Laban, and the flock of his uncle Laban, Jacob went up and rolled the stone off the mouth of the well, and watered the flock of his uncle Laban.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher raah yaakov et-rachel vat-lavan achiy imvo veet-tson lavan achiy imvo vayigash yaakov vayagel et-haeven meal fiy haveer vayasheke et-tson lavan achiy imvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשַּׁ֥ק יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְרָחֵ֑ל וַיִּשָּׂ֥א אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ וַיֵּֽבְךְּ׃
Translated: Then Jacob kissed Rachel, and broke into tears.
Transliteration: vayishak yaakov lerachel vayisha et-kolvo vayevekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֨ד יַעֲקֹ֜ב לְרָחֵ֗ל כִּ֣י אֲחִ֤י אָבִ֙יהָ֙ ה֔וּא וְכִ֥י בֶן־רִבְקָ֖ה ה֑וּא וַתָּ֖רׇץ וַתַּגֵּ֥ד לְאָבִֽיהָ׃
Translated: Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s kinsman, that he was Rebekah’s son; and she ran and told her father.
Transliteration: vayaged yaakov lerachel khiy achiy aviyha hu vekhiy ven-rivekah hu vatarׇts vataged leaviyha

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ לָבָ֜ן אֶת־שֵׁ֣מַע ׀ יַעֲקֹ֣ב בֶּן־אֲחֹת֗וֹ וַיָּ֤רׇץ לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ וַיְחַבֶּק־לוֹ֙ וַיְנַשֶּׁק־ל֔וֹ וַיְבִיאֵ֖הוּ אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיְסַפֵּ֣ר לְלָבָ֔ן אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: On hearing the news of his sister’s son Jacob, Laban ran to greet him; he embraced him and kissed him, and took him into his house. He told Laban all that had happened,
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa lavan et-shema yaakov ven-achotvo vayarׇts likeratvo vayechavek-lvo vayenashek-lvo vayeviyehu el-veytvo vayesafer lelavan et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ לָבָ֔ן אַ֛ךְ עַצְמִ֥י וּבְשָׂרִ֖י אָ֑תָּה וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב עִמּ֖וֹ חֹ֥דֶשׁ יָמִֽים׃
Translated: and Laban said to him, “You are truly my bone and flesh.” When he had stayed with him a month’s time,
Transliteration: vayomer lvo lavan akhe atsemiy uveshariy atah vayeshev imvo chodesh yamiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָבָן֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב הֲכִי־אָחִ֣י אַ֔תָּה וַעֲבַדְתַּ֖נִי חִנָּ֑ם הַגִּ֥ידָה לִּ֖י מַה־מַּשְׂכֻּרְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Laban said to Jacob, “Just because you are a kinsman, should you serve me for nothing? Tell me, what shall your wages be?”
Transliteration: vayomer lavan leyaakov hakhiy-achiy atah vaavadetaniy chinam hagiydah liy mah-mashekhuretekha

Hebrew: וּלְלָבָ֖ן שְׁתֵּ֣י בָנ֑וֹת שֵׁ֤ם הַגְּדֹלָה֙ לֵאָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַקְּטַנָּ֖ה רָחֵֽל׃
Translated: Now Laban had two daughters; the name of the older one was Leah, and the name of the younger was Rachel.
Transliteration: ulelavan shetey vanvot shem hagedolah leah veshem haketanah rachel

Hebrew: וְעֵינֵ֥י לֵאָ֖ה רַכּ֑וֹת וְרָחֵל֙ הָֽיְתָ֔ה יְפַת־תֹּ֖אַר וִיפַ֥ת מַרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: Leah had weak eyes; Rachel was shapely and beautiful.
Transliteration: veeyney leah rakhvot verachel hayetah yefat-toar viyfat mareeh

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־רָחֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֶֽעֱבׇדְךָ֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים בְּרָחֵ֥ל בִּתְּךָ֖ הַקְּטַנָּֽה׃
Translated: Jacob loved Rachel; so he answered, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”
Transliteration: vayeehav yaakov et-rachel vayomer eevׇdekha sheva shaniym verachel vitekha haketanah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֗ן ט֚וֹב תִּתִּ֣י אֹתָ֣הּ לָ֔ךְ מִתִּתִּ֥י אֹתָ֖הּ לְאִ֣ישׁ אַחֵ֑ר שְׁבָ֖ה עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated: Laban said, “Better that I give her to you than that I should give her to an outsider. Stay with me.”
Transliteration: vayomer lavan tvov titiy otah lakhe mititiy otah leiysh acher shevah imadiy

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ד יַעֲקֹ֛ב בְּרָחֵ֖ל שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֑ים וַיִּהְי֤וּ בְעֵינָיו֙ כְּיָמִ֣ים אֲחָדִ֔ים בְּאַהֲבָת֖וֹ אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel and they seemed to him but a few days because of his love for her.
Transliteration: vayaavod yaakov verachel sheva shaniym vayiheyu veeynayv kheyamiym achadiym veahavatvo otah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֤ב אֶל־לָבָן֙ הָבָ֣ה אֶת־אִשְׁתִּ֔י כִּ֥י מָלְא֖וּ יָמָ֑י וְאָב֖וֹאָה אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Then Jacob said to Laban, “Give me my wife, for my time is fulfilled, that I may cohabit with her.”
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov el-lavan havah et-ishetiy khiy maleu yamay veavvoah eleyha

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף לָבָ֛ן אֶת־כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַמָּק֖וֹם וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: And Laban gathered all the people of the place and made a feast.
Transliteration: vayeesof lavan et-khׇl-aneshey hamakvom vayaash misheteh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בָעֶ֔רֶב וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶת־לֵאָ֣ה בִתּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֵ֥א אֹתָ֖הּ אֵלָ֑יו וַיָּבֹ֖א אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: When evening came, he took his daughter Leah and brought her to him; and he cohabited with her.—
Transliteration: vayehiy vaerev vayikach et-leah vitvo vayave otah elayv vayavo eleyha

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן לָבָן֙ לָ֔הּ אֶת־זִלְפָּ֖ה שִׁפְחָת֑וֹ לְלֵאָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ שִׁפְחָֽה׃
Translated: Laban had given his maidservant Zilpah to his daughter Leah as her maid.—
Transliteration: vayiten lavan lah et-zilefah shifechatvo leleah vitvo shifechah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהִנֵּה־הִ֖וא לֵאָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־לָבָ֗ן מַה־זֹּאת֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לִּ֔י הֲלֹ֤א בְרָחֵל֙ עָבַ֣דְתִּי עִמָּ֔ךְ וְלָ֖מָּה רִמִּיתָֽנִי׃
Translated: When morning came, there was Leah! So he said to Laban, “What is this you have done to me? I was in your service for Rachel! Why did you deceive me?”
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker vehineh-hiv leah vayomer el-lavan mah-zot ashiyta liy halo verachel avadetiy imakhe velamah rimiytaniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֔ן לֹא־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה כֵ֖ן בִּמְקוֹמֵ֑נוּ לָתֵ֥ת הַצְּעִירָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הַבְּכִירָֽה׃
Translated: Laban said, “It is not the practice in our place to marry off the younger before the older.
Transliteration: vayomer lavan lo-eiasheh khen vimekvomenu latet hatseiyrah lifeney havekhiyrah

Hebrew: מַלֵּ֖א שְׁבֻ֣עַ זֹ֑את וְנִתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ גַּם־אֶת־זֹ֗את בַּעֲבֹדָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲבֹ֣ד עִמָּדִ֔י ע֖וֹד שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֥ים אֲחֵרֽוֹת׃
Translated: Wait until the bridal week of this one is over and we will give you that one too, provided you serve me another seven years.”
Transliteration: male shevua zot venitenah lekha gam-et-zot vaavodah asher taavod imadiy vod sheva-shaniym achervot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ יַעֲקֹב֙ כֵּ֔ן וַיְמַלֵּ֖א שְׁבֻ֣עַ זֹ֑את וַיִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־רָחֵ֥ל בִּתּ֖וֹ ל֥וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: Jacob did so; he waited out the bridal week of the one, and then he gave him his daughter Rachel as wife.—
Transliteration: vayaash yaakov khen vayemale shevua zot vayiten-lvo et-rachel vitvo lvo leishah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן לָבָן֙ לְרָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֔וֹ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֖ה שִׁפְחָת֑וֹ לָ֖הּ לְשִׁפְחָֽה׃
Translated: Laban had given his maidservant Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her maid.—
Transliteration: vayiten lavan lerachel vitvo et-vilehah shifechatvo lah leshifechah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ גַּ֣ם אֶל־רָחֵ֔ל וַיֶּאֱהַ֥ב גַּֽם־אֶת־רָחֵ֖ל מִלֵּאָ֑ה וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ד עִמּ֔וֹ ע֖וֹד שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֥ים אֲחֵרֽוֹת׃
Translated: And Jacob cohabited with Rachel also; indeed, he loved Rachel more than Leah. And he served him another seven years.
Transliteration: vayavo gam el-rachel vayeehav gam-et-rachel mileah vayaavod imvo vod sheva-shaniym achervot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־שְׂנוּאָ֣ה לֵאָ֔ה וַיִּפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־רַחְמָ֑הּ וְרָחֵ֖ל עֲקָרָֽה׃
Translated: Seeing that Leah was unloved, יהוה opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.
Transliteration: vayare yehovah khiy-shenuah leah vayifetach et-rachemah verachel akarah

Hebrew: וַתַּ֤הַר לֵאָה֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ רְאוּבֵ֑ן כִּ֣י אָֽמְרָ֗ה כִּֽי־רָאָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בְּעׇנְיִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה יֶאֱהָבַ֥נִי אִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: Leah conceived and bore a son, and named him Reuben; for she declared, “It means: ‘יהוה has seen my affliction’; it also means: ‘Now my husband will love me.’”
Transliteration: vatahar leah vateled ven vatikera shemvo reuven khiy amerah khiy-raah yehovah veׇneyiy khiy atah yeehavaniy iyshiy

Hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר עוֹד֮ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּן֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־שְׂנוּאָ֣ה אָנֹ֔כִי וַיִּתֶּן־לִ֖י גַּם־אֶת־זֶ֑ה וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This is because יהוה heard that I was unloved and has given me this one also”; so she named him Simeon.
Transliteration: vatahar vod vateled ven vatomer khiy-shama yehovah khiy-shenuah anokhiy vayiten-liy gam-et-zeh vatikera shemvo shimevon

Hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר עוֹד֮ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּן֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר עַתָּ֤ה הַפַּ֙עַם֙ יִלָּוֶ֤ה אִישִׁי֙ אֵלַ֔י כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי ל֖וֹ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ לֵוִֽי׃
Translated: Again she conceived and bore a son and declared, “This time my husband will become attached to me, for I have borne him three sons.” Therefore he was named Levi.
Transliteration: vatahar vod vateled ven vatomer atah hafaam yilaveh iyshiy elay khiy-yaladetiy lvo sheloshah vaniym al-khen kara-shemvo leviy

Hebrew: וַתַּ֨הַר ע֜וֹד וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֗ן וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַפַּ֙עַם֙ אוֹדֶ֣ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרְאָ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהוּדָ֑ה וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד מִלֶּֽדֶת׃
Translated: She conceived again and bore a son, and declared, “This time I will praise יהוה.” Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.
Transliteration: vatahar vod vateled ven vatomer hafaam vodeh et-yehovah al-khen kareah shemvo yehudah vataamod miledet

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא רָחֵ֗ל כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָֽלְדָה֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַתְּקַנֵּ֥א רָחֵ֖ל בַּאֲחֹתָ֑הּ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹב֙ הָֽבָה־לִּ֣י בָנִ֔ים וְאִם־אַ֖יִן מֵתָ֥ה אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: When Rachel saw that she had borne Jacob no children, she became envious of her sister; and Rachel said to Jacob, “Give me children, or I shall die.”
Transliteration: vatere rachel khiy lo yaledah leyaakov vatekane rachel vaachotah vatomer el-yaakov havah-liy vaniym veim-ayiin metah anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּרָחֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲתַ֤חַת אֱלֹהִים֙ אָנֹ֔כִי אֲשֶׁר־מָנַ֥ע מִמֵּ֖ךְ פְּרִי־בָֽטֶן׃
Translated: Jacob was incensed at Rachel, and said, “Can I take the place of God, who has denied you fruit of the womb?”
Transliteration: vayichar-af yaakov verachel vayomer hatachat Elohim anokhiy asher-mana mimekhe feriy-vaten

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֛ה אֲמָתִ֥י בִלְהָ֖ה בֹּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יהָ וְתֵלֵד֙ עַל־בִּרְכַּ֔י וְאִבָּנֶ֥ה גַם־אָנֹכִ֖י מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated: She said, “Here is my maid Bilhah. Consort with her, that she may bear on my knees and that through her I too may have children.”
Transliteration: vatomer hineh amatiy vilehah vo eleyha veteled al-virekhay veivaneh gam-anokhiy mimenah

Hebrew: וַתִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֥ה שִׁפְחָתָ֖הּ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: So she gave him her maid Bilhah as concubine, and Jacob cohabited with her.
Transliteration: vatiten-lvo et-vilehah shifechatah leishah vayavo eleyha yaakov

Hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר בִּלְהָ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בֵּֽן׃
Translated: Bilhah conceived and bore Jacob a son.
Transliteration: vatahar vilehah vateled leyaakov ven

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רָחֵל֙ דָּנַ֣נִּי אֱלֹהִ֔ים וְגַם֙ שָׁמַ֣ע בְּקֹלִ֔י וַיִּתֶּן־לִ֖י בֵּ֑ן עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרְאָ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ דָּֽן׃
Translated: And Rachel said, “God has vindicated me; indeed, [God] has heeded my plea and given me a son.” Therefore she named him Dan.
Transliteration: vatomer rachel dananiy Elohim vegam shama vekoliy vayiten-liy ven al-khen kareah shemvo dan

Hebrew: וַתַּ֣הַר ע֔וֹד וַתֵּ֕לֶד בִּלְהָ֖ה שִׁפְחַ֣ת רָחֵ֑ל בֵּ֥ן שֵׁנִ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: Rachel’s maid Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
Transliteration: vatahar vod vateled vilehah shifechat rachel ven sheniy leyaakov

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר רָחֵ֗ל נַפְתּוּלֵ֨י אֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> נִפְתַּ֛לְתִּי עִם־אֲחֹתִ֖י גַּם־יָכֹ֑לְתִּי וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ נַפְתָּלִֽי׃
Translated: And Rachel said, “A fateful contest I waged with my sister; yes, and I have prevailed.” So she named him Naphtali.
Transliteration: vatomer rachel nafetuley Elohim <small></small> nifetaletiy im-achotiy gam-yakholetiy vatikera shemvo nafetaliy

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא לֵאָ֔ה כִּ֥י עָמְדָ֖ה מִלֶּ֑דֶת וַתִּקַּח֙ אֶת־זִלְפָּ֣ה שִׁפְחָתָ֔הּ וַתִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֛הּ לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: When Leah saw that she had stopped bearing children, she took her maid Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as concubine.
Transliteration: vatere leah khiy amedah miledet vatikach et-zilefah shifechatah vatiten otah leyaakov leishah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֗לֶד זִלְפָּ֛ה שִׁפְחַ֥ת לֵאָ֖ה לְיַעֲקֹ֥ב בֵּֽן׃
Translated: And when Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a son,
Transliteration: vateled zilefah shifechat leah leyaakov ven

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֥אמֶר לֵאָ֖ה (בגד) [בָּ֣א גָ֑ד] וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ גָּֽד׃
Translated: Leah said, “What luck!” So she named him Gad.
Transliteration: vatomer leah (vgd) [va gad] vatikera et-shemvo gad

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֗לֶד זִלְפָּה֙ שִׁפְחַ֣ת לֵאָ֔ה בֵּ֥ן שֵׁנִ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: When Leah’s maid Zilpah bore Jacob a second son,
Transliteration: vateled zilefah shifechat leah ven sheniy leyaakov

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֔ה בְּאׇשְׁרִ֕י כִּ֥י אִשְּׁר֖וּנִי בָּנ֑וֹת וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אָשֵֽׁר׃
Translated: Leah declared, “What fortune!” meaning, “Women will deem me fortunate.” So she named him Asher.
Transliteration: vatomer leah veׇsheriy khiy isheruniy vanvot vatikera et-shemvo asher

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ רְאוּבֵ֜ן בִּימֵ֣י קְצִיר־חִטִּ֗ים וַיִּמְצָ֤א דֽוּדָאִים֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וַיָּבֵ֣א אֹתָ֔ם אֶל־לֵאָ֖ה אִמּ֑וֹ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר רָחֵל֙ אֶל־לֵאָ֔ה תְּנִי־נָ֣א לִ֔י מִדּוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Once, at the time of the wheat harvest, Reuben came upon some mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Rachel said to Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”
Transliteration: vayelekhe reuven viymey ketsiyr-chitiym vayimetsa dudaiym vashadeh vayave otam el-leah imvo vatomer rachel el-leah teniy-na liy midudaey venekhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לָ֗הּ הַמְעַט֙ קַחְתֵּ֣ךְ אֶת־אִישִׁ֔י וְלָקַ֕חַת גַּ֥ם אֶת־דּוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנִ֑י וַתֹּ֣אמֶר רָחֵ֗ל לָכֵן֙ יִשְׁכַּ֤ב עִמָּךְ֙ הַלַּ֔יְלָה תַּ֖חַת דּוּדָאֵ֥י בְנֵֽךְ׃
Translated: But she said to her, “Was it not enough for you to take away my husband, that you would also take my son’s mandrakes?” Rachel replied, “I promise, he shall lie with you tonight, in return for your son’s mandrakes.”
Transliteration: vatomer lah hameat kachetekhe et-iyshiy velakachat gam et-dudaey veniy vatomer rachel lakhen yishekhav imakhe halayelah tachat dudaey venekhe

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יַעֲקֹ֣ב מִן־הַשָּׂדֶה֮ בָּעֶ֒רֶב֒ וַתֵּצֵ֨א לֵאָ֜ה לִקְרָאת֗וֹ וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֵלַ֣י תָּב֔וֹא כִּ֚י שָׂכֹ֣ר שְׂכַרְתִּ֔יךָ בְּדוּדָאֵ֖י בְּנִ֑י וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב עִמָּ֖הּ בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הֽוּא׃
Translated: When Jacob came home from the field in the evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You are to sleep with me, for I have hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” And he lay with her that night.
Transliteration: vayavo yaakov min-hashadeh vaerev vatetse leah likeratvo vatomer elay tavvo khiy shakhor shekharetiykha vedudaey veniy vayishekhav imah valayelah hu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־לֵאָ֑ה וַתַּ֛הַר וַתֵּ֥לֶד לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בֵּ֥ן חֲמִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: God heeded Leah, and she conceived and bore him a fifth son.
Transliteration: vayishema Elohim el-leah vatahar vateled leyaakov ven chamiyshiy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֗ה נָתַ֤ן אֱלֹהִים֙ שְׂכָרִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי שִׁפְחָתִ֖י לְאִישִׁ֑י וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יִשָּׂשכָֽר׃
Translated: And Leah said, “God has given me my reward for having given my maid to my husband.” So she named him Issachar.
Transliteration: vatomer leah natan Elohim shekhariy asher-natatiy shifechatiy leiyshiy vatikera shemvo yishashkhar

Hebrew: וַתַּ֤הַר עוֹד֙ לֵאָ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד בֵּן־שִׁשִּׁ֖י לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: When Leah conceived again and bore Jacob a sixth son,
Transliteration: vatahar vod leah vateled ven-shishiy leyaakov

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר לֵאָ֗ה זְבָדַ֨נִי אֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֹתִי֮ זֵ֣בֶד טוֹב֒ הַפַּ֙עַם֙ יִזְבְּלֵ֣נִי אִישִׁ֔י כִּֽי־יָלַ֥דְתִּי ל֖וֹ שִׁשָּׁ֣ה בָנִ֑ים וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ זְבֻלֽוּן׃
Translated: Leah said, “God has given me a choice gift; this time my husband will exalt me, for I have borne him six sons.” So she named him Zebulun.
Transliteration: vatomer leah zevadaniy Elohim <small></small> otiy zeved tvov hafaam yizeveleniy iyshiy khiy-yaladetiy lvo shishah vaniym vatikera et-shemvo zevulun

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֖ר יָ֣לְדָה בַּ֑ת וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמָ֖הּ דִּינָֽה׃
Translated: Last, she bore him a daughter, and named her Dinah.
Transliteration: veachar yaledah vat vatikera et-shemah diynah

Hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־רָחֵ֑ל וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיִּפְתַּ֖ח אֶת־רַחְמָֽהּ׃
Translated: Now God remembered Rachel; God heeded her and opened her womb.
Transliteration: vayizekhor Elohim et-rachel vayishema eleyha Elohim vayifetach et-rachemah

Hebrew: וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר אָסַ֥ף אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־חֶרְפָּתִֽי׃
Translated: She conceived and bore a son, and said, “God has taken away my disgrace.”
Transliteration: vatahar vateled ven vatomer asaf Elohim et-cherefatiy

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֧א אֶת־שְׁמ֛וֹ יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר יֹסֵ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה לִ֖י בֵּ֥ן אַחֵֽר׃
Translated: So she named him Joseph, which is to say, “May יהוה add another son for me.”
Transliteration: vatikera et-shemvo yvosef lemor yosef yehovah liy ven acher

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יָלְדָ֥ה רָחֵ֖ל אֶת־יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־לָבָ֔ן שַׁלְּחֵ֙נִי֙ וְאֵ֣לְכָ֔ה אֶל־מְקוֹמִ֖י וּלְאַרְצִֽי׃
Translated: After Rachel had borne Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Give me leave to go back to my own homeland.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher yaledah rachel et-yvosef vayomer yaakov el-lavan shalecheniy veelekhah el-mekvomiy ulearetsiy

Hebrew: תְּנָ֞ה אֶת־נָשַׁ֣י וְאֶת־יְלָדַ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבַ֧דְתִּי אֹֽתְךָ֛ בָּהֵ֖ן וְאֵלֵ֑כָה כִּ֚י אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֶת־עֲבֹדָתִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲבַדְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated: Give me my wives and my children, for whom I have served you, that I may go; for well you know what services I have rendered you.”
Transliteration: tenah et-nashay veet-yeladay asher avadetiy otekha vahen veelekhah khiy atah yadaeta et-avodatiy asher avadetiykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ לָבָ֔ן אִם־נָ֛א מָצָ֥אתִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ נִחַ֕שְׁתִּי וַיְבָרְכֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּגְלָלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But Laban said to him, “If you will indulge me, I have learned by divination that יהוה has blessed me on your account.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv lavan im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha nichashetiy vayevarekheniy yehovah vigelalekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר נׇקְבָ֧ה שְׂכָרְךָ֛ עָלַ֖י וְאֶתֵּֽנָה׃
Translated: And he continued, “Name the wages due from me, and I will pay you.”
Transliteration: vayomar nׇkevah shekharekha alay veetenah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲבַדְתִּ֑יךָ וְאֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה מִקְנְךָ֖ אִתִּֽי׃
Translated: But he said, “You know well how I have served you and how your livestock has fared with me.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv atah yadaeta et asher avadetiykha veet asher-hayah mikenekha itiy

Hebrew: כִּ֡י מְעַט֩ אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֨ה לְךָ֤ לְפָנַי֙ וַיִּפְרֹ֣ץ לָרֹ֔ב וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֹתְךָ֖ לְרַגְלִ֑י וְעַתָּ֗ה מָתַ֛י אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה גַם־אָנֹכִ֖י לְבֵיתִֽי׃
Translated: For the little you had before I came has grown to much, since יהוה has blessed you wherever I turned. And now, when shall I make provision for my own household?”
Transliteration: khiy meat asher-hayah lekha lefanay vayiferots larov vayevarekhe yehovah otekha lerageliy veatah matay eesheh gam-anokhiy leveytiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מָ֣ה אֶתֶּן־לָ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ לֹא־תִתֶּן־לִ֣י מְא֔וּמָה אִם־תַּֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּי֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה אָשׁ֛וּבָה אֶרְעֶ֥ה צֹֽאנְךָ֖ אֶשְׁמֹֽר׃
Translated: He said, “What shall I pay you?” And Jacob said, “Pay me nothing! If you will do this thing for me, I will again pasture and keep your flocks:
Transliteration: vayomer mah eten-lakhe vayomer yaakov lo-titen-liy meumah im-taasheh-liy hadavar hazeh ashuvah ereeh tsonekha eshemor

Hebrew: אֶֽעֱבֹ֨ר בְּכׇל־צֹֽאנְךָ֜ הַיּ֗וֹם הָסֵ֨ר מִשָּׁ֜ם כׇּל־שֶׂ֣ה ׀ נָקֹ֣ד וְטָל֗וּא וְכׇל־שֶׂה־חוּם֙ בַּכְּשָׂבִ֔ים וְטָל֥וּא וְנָקֹ֖ד בָּעִזִּ֑ים וְהָיָ֖ה שְׂכָרִֽי׃
Translated: let me pass through your whole flock today, removing from there every speckled and spotted animal—every dark-colored sheep and every spotted and speckled goat. Such shall be my wages.
Transliteration: eevor vekhׇl-tsonekha hayyvom haser misham khׇl-sheh nakod vetalu vekhׇl-sheh-chum vakheshaviym vetalu venakod vaiziym vehayah shekhariy

Hebrew: וְעָֽנְתָה־בִּ֤י צִדְקָתִי֙ בְּי֣וֹם מָחָ֔ר כִּֽי־תָב֥וֹא עַל־שְׂכָרִ֖י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־אֵינֶ֩נּוּ֩ נָקֹ֨ד וְטָל֜וּא בָּֽעִזִּ֗ים וְחוּם֙ בַּכְּשָׂבִ֔ים גָּנ֥וּב ה֖וּא אִתִּֽי׃
Translated: In the future when you go over my wages, let my honesty toward you testify for me: if there are among my goats any that are not speckled or spotted or any sheep that are not dark-colored, they got there by theft.”
Transliteration: veanetah-viy tsidekatiy veyvom machar khiy-tavvo al-shekhariy lefaneykha khol asher-eynenu nakod vetalu vaiziym vechum vakheshaviym ganuv hu itiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָבָ֖ן הֵ֑ן ל֖וּ יְהִ֥י כִדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And Laban said, “Very well, let it be as you say.”
Transliteration: vayomer lavan hen lu yehiy khidevarekha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣סַר בַּיּוֹם֩ הַה֨וּא אֶת־הַתְּיָשִׁ֜ים הָֽעֲקֻדִּ֣ים וְהַטְּלֻאִ֗ים וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הָֽעִזִּים֙ הַנְּקֻדּ֣וֹת וְהַטְּלֻאֹ֔ת כֹּ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־לָבָן֙ בּ֔וֹ וְכׇל־ח֖וּם בַּכְּשָׂבִ֑ים וַיִּתֵּ֖ן בְּיַד־בָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: But that same day he removed the streaked and spotted he-goats and all the speckled and spotted she-goats—every one that had white on it—and all the dark-colored sheep, and left them in the charge of his sons.
Transliteration: vayasar vayyvom hahu et-hateyashiym haakudiym vehateluiym veet khׇl-haiziym hanekudvot vehateluot khol asher-lavan vvo vekhׇl-chum vakheshaviym vayiten veyad-vanayv
