Hebrew: וַיָּ֗שֶׂם דֶּ֚רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים בֵּינ֖וֹ וּבֵ֣ין יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיַעֲקֹ֗ב רֹעֶ֛ה אֶת־צֹ֥אן לָבָ֖ן הַנּוֹתָרֹֽת׃
Translated: And he put a distance of three days’ journey between himself and Jacob, while Jacob was pasturing the rest of Laban’s flock.
Transliteration: vayashem derekhe sheloshet yamiym veynvo uveyn yaakov veyaakov roeh et-tson lavan hanvotarot

Hebrew: וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ יַעֲקֹ֗ב מַקַּ֥ל לִבְנֶ֛ה לַ֖ח וְל֣וּז וְעַרְמ֑וֹן וַיְפַצֵּ֤ל בָּהֵן֙ פְּצָל֣וֹת לְבָנ֔וֹת מַחְשֹׂף֙ הַלָּבָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמַּקְלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Jacob then got fresh shoots of poplar, and of almond and plane, and peeled white stripes in them, laying bare the white of the shoots.
Transliteration: vayikach-lvo yaakov makal liveneh lach veluz vearemvon vayefatsel vahen fetsalvot levanvot macheshof halavan asher al-hamakelvot

Hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֗ג אֶת־הַמַּקְלוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּצֵּ֔ל בָּרְהָטִ֖ים בְּשִֽׁקְת֣וֹת הַמָּ֑יִם אֲשֶׁר֩ תָּבֹ֨אןָ הַצֹּ֤אן לִשְׁתּוֹת֙ לְנֹ֣כַח הַצֹּ֔אן וַיֵּחַ֖מְנָה בְּבֹאָ֥ן לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
Translated: The rods that he had peeled he set up in front of the goats in the troughs, the water receptacles, that the goats came to drink from. Their mating occurred when they came to drink,
Transliteration: vayatseg et-hamakelvot asher fitsel varehatiym veshiketvot hamayiim asher tavona hatson lishetvot lenokhach hatson vayechamenah vevoan lishetvot

Hebrew: וַיֶּחֱמ֥וּ הַצֹּ֖אן אֶל־הַמַּקְל֑וֹת וַתֵּלַ֣דְןָ הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּטְלֻאִֽים׃
Translated: and since the goats mated by the rods, the goats brought forth streaked, speckled, and spotted young.
Transliteration: vayechemu hatson el-hamakelvot vateladena hatson akudiym nekudiym uteluiym

Hebrew: וְהַכְּשָׂבִים֮ הִפְרִ֣יד יַעֲקֹב֒ וַ֠יִּתֵּ֠ן פְּנֵ֨י הַצֹּ֧אן אֶל־עָקֹ֛ד וְכׇל־ח֖וּם בְּצֹ֣אן לָבָ֑ן וַיָּֽשֶׁת־ל֤וֹ עֲדָרִים֙ לְבַדּ֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א שָׁתָ֖ם עַל־צֹ֥אן לָבָֽן׃
Translated: But Jacob dealt separately with the sheep; he made these animals face the streaked or wholly dark-colored animals in Laban’s flock. And so he produced special flocks for himself, which he did not put with Laban’s flocks.
Transliteration: vehakheshaviym hiferiyd yaakov vayiten feney hatson el-akod vekhׇl-chum vetson lavan vayashet-lvo adariym levadvo velo shatam al-tson lavan

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּכׇל־יַחֵם֮ הַצֹּ֣אן הַמְקֻשָּׁרוֹת֒ וְשָׂ֨ם יַעֲקֹ֧ב אֶת־הַמַּקְל֛וֹת לְעֵינֵ֥י הַצֹּ֖אן בָּרְהָטִ֑ים לְיַחְמֵ֖נָּה בַּמַּקְלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Moreover, when the sturdier animals were mating, Jacob would place the rods in the troughs, in full view of the animals, so that they mated by the rods;
Transliteration: vehayah vekhׇl-yachem hatson hamekusharvot vesham yaakov et-hamakelvot leeyney hatson varehatiym leyachemenah vamakelvot

Hebrew: וּבְהַעֲטִ֥יף הַצֹּ֖אן לֹ֣א יָשִׂ֑ים וְהָיָ֤ה הָעֲטֻפִים֙ לְלָבָ֔ן וְהַקְּשֻׁרִ֖ים לְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: but with the feebler animals he would not place them there. Thus the feeble ones went to Laban and the sturdy to Jacob.
Transliteration: uvehaatiyf hatson lo yashiym vehayah haatufiym lelavan vehakeshuriym leyaakov

Hebrew: וַיִּפְרֹ֥ץ הָאִ֖ישׁ מְאֹ֣ד מְאֹ֑ד וַֽיְהִי־לוֹ֙ צֹ֣אן רַבּ֔וֹת וּשְׁפָחוֹת֙ וַעֲבָדִ֔ים וּגְמַלִּ֖ים וַחֲמֹרִֽים׃
Translated: So the man grew exceedingly prosperous, and came to own large flocks, maidservants and menservants, camels and asses.
Transliteration: vayiferots haiysh meod meod vayehiy-lvo tson ravvot ushefachvot vaavadiym ugemaliym vachamoriym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֤י בְנֵֽי־לָבָן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לָקַ֣ח יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֑ינוּ וּמֵאֲשֶׁ֣ר לְאָבִ֔ינוּ עָשָׂ֕ה אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַכָּבֹ֖ד הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Now he heard the things that Laban’s sons were saying: “Jacob has taken all that was our father’s, and from that which was our father’s he has built up all this wealth.”
Transliteration: vayishema et-diverey veney-lavan lemor lakach yaakov et khׇl-asher leaviynu umeasher leaviynu ashah et khׇl-hakhavod hazeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י לָבָ֑ן וְהִנֵּ֥ה אֵינֶ֛נּוּ עִמּ֖וֹ כִּתְמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃
Translated: Jacob also saw that Laban’s manner toward him was not as it had been in the past.
Transliteration: vayare yaakov et-feney lavan vehineh eynenu imvo khitemvol shileshvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב שׁ֛וּב אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ אֲבוֹתֶ֖יךָ וּלְמוֹלַדְתֶּ֑ךָ וְאֶֽהְיֶ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Jacob, “Return to your ancestors’ land—where you were born—and I will be with you.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yaakov shuv el-erets avvoteykha ulemvoladetekha veeheyeh imakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח יַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיִּקְרָ֖א לְרָחֵ֣ל וּלְלֵאָ֑ה הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה אֶל־צֹאנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Jacob had Rachel and Leah called to the field, where his flock was,
Transliteration: vayishelach yaakov vayikera lerachel uleleah hashadeh el-tsonvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ן רֹאֶ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י אֲבִיכֶ֔ן כִּֽי־אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אֵלַ֖י כִּתְמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֔י הָיָ֖ה עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated: and said to them, “I see that your father’s manner toward me is not as it has been in the past. But the God of my father’s [house] has been with me.
Transliteration: vayomer lahen roeh anokhiy et-feney aviykhen khiy-eynenu elay khitemol shileshom velohey aviy hayah imadiy

Hebrew: וְאַתֵּ֖נָה יְדַעְתֶּ֑ן כִּ֚י בְּכׇל־כֹּחִ֔י עָבַ֖דְתִּי אֶת־אֲבִיכֶֽן׃
Translated: As you know, I have served your father with all my might;
Transliteration: veatenah yedaeten khiy vekhׇl-khochiy avadetiy et-aviykhen

Hebrew: וַאֲבִיכֶן֙ הֵ֣תֶל בִּ֔י וְהֶחֱלִ֥ף אֶת־מַשְׂכֻּרְתִּ֖י עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת מֹנִ֑ים וְלֹֽא־נְתָנ֣וֹ אֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהָרַ֖ע עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated: but your father has cheated me, changing my wages time and again. God, however, would not let him do me harm.
Transliteration: vaaviykhen hetel viy vehechelif et-mashekhuretiy asheret moniym velo-netanvo Elohim lehara imadiy

Hebrew: אִם־כֹּ֣ה יֹאמַ֗ר נְקֻדִּים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׂכָרֶ֔ךָ וְיָלְד֥וּ כׇל־הַצֹּ֖אן נְקֻדִּ֑ים וְאִם־כֹּ֣ה יֹאמַ֗ר עֲקֻדִּים֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׂכָרֶ֔ךָ וְיָלְד֥וּ כׇל־הַצֹּ֖אן עֲקֻדִּֽים׃
Translated: If he said thus, ‘The speckled shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop speckled young; and if he said thus, ‘The streaked shall be your wages,’ then all the flocks would drop streaked young.
Transliteration: im-khoh yomar nekudiym yiheyeh shekharekha veyaledu khׇl-hatson nekudiym veim-khoh yomar akudiym yiheyeh shekharekha veyaledu khׇl-hatson akudiym

Hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֧ל אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־מִקְנֵ֥ה אֲבִיכֶ֖ם וַיִּתֶּן־לִֽי׃
Translated: God has taken away your father’s livestock and given it to me.
Transliteration: vayatsel Elohim et-mikeneh aviykhem vayiten-liy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּעֵת֙ יַחֵ֣ם הַצֹּ֔אן וָאֶשָּׂ֥א עֵינַ֛י וָאֵ֖רֶא בַּחֲל֑וֹם וְהִנֵּ֤ה הָֽעַתֻּדִים֙ הָעֹלִ֣ים עַל־הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּבְרֻדִּֽים׃
Translated: “Once, at the mating time of the flocks, I had a dream in which I saw that the he-goats mating with the flock were streaked, speckled, and mottled.
Transliteration: vayehiy veet yachem hatson vaesha eynay vaere vachalvom vehineh haatudiym haoliym al-hatson akudiym nekudiym uverudiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלַ֜י מַלְאַ֧ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים בַּחֲל֖וֹם יַֽעֲקֹ֑ב וָאֹמַ֖ר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: And in the dream a messenger of God said to me, ‘Jacob!’ ‘Here,’ I answered.
Transliteration: vayomer elay maleakhe haElohim vachalvom yaakov vaomar hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר שָׂא־נָ֨א עֵינֶ֤יךָ וּרְאֵה֙ כׇּל־הָֽעַתֻּדִים֙ הָעֹלִ֣ים עַל־הַצֹּ֔אן עֲקֻדִּ֥ים נְקֻדִּ֖ים וּבְרֻדִּ֑ים כִּ֣י רָאִ֔יתִי אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָבָ֖ן עֹ֥שֶׂה לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And the messenger said, ‘Note well that all the he-goats which are mating with the flock are streaked, speckled, and mottled; for I have noted all that Laban has been doing to you.
Transliteration: vayomer sha-na eyneykha ureeh khׇl-haatudiym haoliym al-hatson akudiym nekudiym uverudiym khiy raiytiy et khׇl-asher lavan osheh lakhe

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֤י הָאֵל֙ בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָשַׁ֤חְתָּ שָּׁם֙ מַצֵּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֥רְתָּ לִּ֛י שָׁ֖ם נֶ֑דֶר עַתָּ֗ה ק֥וּם צֵא֙ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וְשׁ֖וּב אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ מוֹלַדְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed a pillar and where you made a vow to Me. Now, arise and leave this land and return to your native land.’”
Transliteration: anokhiy hael veyt-el asher mashacheta sham matsevah asher nadareta liy sham neder atah kum tse min-haarets hazot veshuv el-erets mvoladetekha

Hebrew: וַתַּ֤עַן רָחֵל֙ וְלֵאָ֔ה וַתֹּאמַ֖רְנָה ל֑וֹ הַע֥וֹד לָ֛נוּ חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה בְּבֵ֥ית אָבִֽינוּ׃
Translated: Then Rachel and Leah answered him, saying, “Have we still a share in the inheritance of our father’s house?
Transliteration: vataan rachel veleah vatomarenah lvo havod lanu chelek venachalah veveyt aviynu

Hebrew: הֲל֧וֹא נׇכְרִיּ֛וֹת נֶחְשַׁ֥בְנוּ ל֖וֹ כִּ֣י מְכָרָ֑נוּ וַיֹּ֥אכַל גַּם־אָכ֖וֹל אֶת־כַּסְפֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated: Surely, he regards us as outsiders, now that he has sold us and has used up our purchase price.
Transliteration: halvo nׇkheriyyvot necheshavenu lvo khiy mekharanu vayokhal gam-akhvol et-khasefenu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כׇל־הָעֹ֗שֶׁר אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצִּ֤יל אֱלֹהִים֙ מֵֽאָבִ֔ינוּ לָ֥נוּ ה֖וּא וּלְבָנֵ֑ינוּ וְעַתָּ֗ה כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֧ר אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֵלֶ֖יךָ עֲשֵֽׂה׃
Translated: Truly, all the wealth that God has taken away from our father belongs to us and to our children. Now then, do just as God has told you.”
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-haosher asher hitsiyl Elohim meaviynu lanu hu ulevaneynu veatah khol asher amar Elohim eleykha asheh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖קׇם יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיִּשָּׂ֛א אֶת־בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶת־נָשָׁ֖יו עַל־הַגְּמַלִּֽים׃
Translated: Thereupon Jacob put his children and wives on camels;
Transliteration: vayakׇm yaakov vayisha et-vanayv veet-nashayv al-hagemaliym

Hebrew: וַיִּנְהַ֣ג אֶת־כׇּל־מִקְנֵ֗הוּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־רְכֻשׁוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָכָ֔שׁ מִקְנֵה֙ קִנְיָנ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָכַ֖שׁ בְּפַדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם לָב֛וֹא אֶל־יִצְחָ֥ק אָבִ֖יו אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: and he drove off all his livestock and all the wealth that he had amassed, the livestock in his possession that he had acquired in Paddan-aram, to go to his father Isaac in the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayinehag et-khׇl-mikenehu veet-khׇl-rekhushvo asher rakhash mikeneh kineyanvo asher rakhash vefadan aram lavvo el-yitsechak aviyv aretsah khenaan

Hebrew: וְלָבָ֣ן הָלַ֔ךְ לִגְזֹ֖ז אֶת־צֹאנ֑וֹ וַתִּגְנֹ֣ב רָחֵ֔ל אֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְאָבִֽיהָ׃
Translated: Meanwhile Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole her father’s household idols.
Transliteration: velavan halakhe ligezoz et-tsonvo vatigenov rachel et-haterafiym asher leaviyha

Hebrew: וַיִּגְנֹ֣ב יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֶת־לֵ֥ב לָבָ֖ן הָאֲרַמִּ֑י עַל־בְּלִי֙ הִגִּ֣יד ל֔וֹ כִּ֥י בֹרֵ֖חַ הֽוּא׃
Translated: Jacob kept Laban the Aramean in the dark, not telling him that he was fleeing,
Transliteration: vayigenov yaakov et-lev lavan haaramiy al-veliy higiyd lvo khiy vorecha hu

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֥ח הוּא֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר אֶת־הַנָּהָ֑ר וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־פָּנָ֖יו הַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: and fled with all that he had. Soon he was across the Euphrates and heading toward the hill country of Gilead.
Transliteration: vayiverach hu vekhׇl-asher-lvo vayakׇm vayaavor et-hanahar vayashem et-fanayv har hagilead

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְלָבָ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י כִּ֥י בָרַ֖ח יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: On the third day, Laban was told that Jacob had fled.
Transliteration: vayugad lelavan vayyvom hasheliyshiy khiy varach yaakov

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־אֶחָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַיִּרְדֹּ֣ף אַחֲרָ֔יו דֶּ֖רֶךְ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וַיַּדְבֵּ֥ק אֹת֖וֹ בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: So he took his kinsmen with him and pursued him a distance of seven days, catching up with him in the hill country of Gilead.
Transliteration: vayikach et-echayv imvo vayiredof acharayv derekhe shiveat yamiym vayadevek otvo vehar hagilead

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶל־לָבָ֥ן הָאֲרַמִּ֖י בַּחֲלֹ֣ם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ הִשָּׁ֧מֶר לְךָ֛ פֶּן־תְּדַבֵּ֥ר עִֽם־יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִטּ֥וֹב עַד־רָֽע׃
Translated: But God appeared to Laban the Aramean in a dream by night and said to him, “Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.”
Transliteration: vayavo Elohim el-lavan haaramiy vachalom halayelah vayomer lvo hishamer lekha fen-tedaver im-yaakov mitvov ad-ra

Hebrew: וַיַּשֵּׂ֥ג לָבָ֖ן אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְיַעֲקֹ֗ב תָּקַ֤ע אֶֽת־אׇהֳלוֹ֙ בָּהָ֔ר וְלָבָ֛ן תָּקַ֥ע אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו בְּהַ֥ר הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: Laban overtook Jacob. Jacob had pitched his tent on the Height, and Laban with his kinsmen encamped in the hill country of Gilead.
Transliteration: vayasheg lavan et-yaakov veyaakov taka et-ׇholvo vahar velavan taka et-echayv vehar hagilead

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָבָן֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֔יתָ וַתִּגְנֹ֖ב אֶת־לְבָבִ֑י וַתְּנַהֵג֙ אֶת־בְּנֹתַ֔י כִּשְׁבֻי֖וֹת חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: And Laban said to Jacob, “What did you mean by keeping me in the dark and carrying off my daughters like captives of the sword?
Transliteration: vayomer lavan leyaakov meh ashiyta vatigenov et-levaviy vatenaheg et-venotay khishevuyvot charev

Hebrew: לָ֤מָּה נַחְבֵּ֙אתָ֙ לִבְרֹ֔חַ וַתִּגְנֹ֖ב אֹתִ֑י וְלֹא־הִגַּ֣דְתָּ לִּ֔י וָֽאֲשַׁלֵּחֲךָ֛ בְּשִׂמְחָ֥ה וּבְשִׁרִ֖ים בְּתֹ֥ף וּבְכִנּֽוֹר׃
Translated: Why did you flee in secrecy and mislead me and not tell me? I would have sent you off with festive music, with timbrel and lyre.
Transliteration: lamah nacheveta liverocha vatigenov otiy velo-higadeta liy vaashalechakha veshimechah uveshiriym vetof uvekhinvor

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א נְטַשְׁתַּ֔נִי לְנַשֵּׁ֥ק לְבָנַ֖י וְלִבְנֹתָ֑י עַתָּ֖ה הִסְכַּ֥לְתָּֽ עֲשֽׂוֹ׃
Translated: You did not even let me kiss my sons and daughters good-by! It was a foolish thing for you to do.
Transliteration: velo netashetaniy lenashek levanay velivenotay atah hisekhaleta ashvo

Hebrew: יֶשׁ־לְאֵ֣ל יָדִ֔י לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עִמָּכֶ֖ם רָ֑ע וֵֽאלֹהֵ֨י אֲבִיכֶ֜ם אֶ֣מֶשׁ ׀ אָמַ֧ר אֵלַ֣י לֵאמֹ֗ר הִשָּׁ֧מֶר לְךָ֛ מִדַּבֵּ֥ר עִֽם־יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִטּ֥וֹב עַד־רָֽע׃
Translated: I have it in my power to do you harm; but the God of your father’s [house] said to me last night, ‘Beware of attempting anything with Jacob, good or bad.’
Transliteration: yesh-leel yadiy laashvot imakhem ra velohey aviykhem emesh amar elay lemor hishamer lekha midaver im-yaakov mitvov ad-ra

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ הָלֹ֣ךְ הָלַ֔כְתָּ כִּֽי־נִכְסֹ֥ף נִכְסַ֖פְתָּה לְבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יךָ לָ֥מָּה גָנַ֖בְתָּ אֶת־אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated: Very well, you had to leave because you were longing for your father’s house; but why did you steal my gods?”
Transliteration: veatah halokhe halakheta khiy-nikhesof nikhesafetah leveyt aviykha lamah ganaveta et-elohay

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן יַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְלָבָ֑ן כִּ֣י יָרֵ֔אתִי כִּ֣י אָמַ֔רְתִּי פֶּן־תִּגְזֹ֥ל אֶת־בְּנוֹתֶ֖יךָ מֵעִמִּֽי׃
Translated: Jacob answered Laban, saying, “I was afraid because I thought you would take your daughters from me by force.
Transliteration: vayaan yaakov vayomer lelavan khiy yaretiy khiy amaretiy fen-tigezol et-venvoteykha meimiy

Hebrew: עִ֠ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּמְצָ֣א אֶת־אֱלֹהֶ֘יךָ֮ לֹ֣א יִֽחְיֶה֒ נֶ֣גֶד אַחֵ֧ינוּ הַֽכֶּר־לְךָ֛ מָ֥ה עִמָּדִ֖י וְקַֽח־לָ֑ךְ וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֥י רָחֵ֖ל גְּנָבָֽתַם׃
Translated: But anyone with whom you find your gods shall not remain alive! In the presence of our kin, point out what I have of yours and take it.” Jacob, of course, did not know that Rachel had stolen them.
Transliteration: im asher timetsa et-eloheykha lo yicheyeh neged acheynu hakher-lekha mah imadiy vekach-lakhe velo-yada yaakov khiy rachel genavatam

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א לָבָ֜ן בְּאֹ֥הֶל יַעֲקֹ֣ב ׀ וּבְאֹ֣הֶל לֵאָ֗ה וּבְאֹ֛הֶל שְׁתֵּ֥י הָאֲמָהֹ֖ת וְלֹ֣א מָצָ֑א וַיֵּצֵא֙ מֵאֹ֣הֶל לֵאָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א בְּאֹ֥הֶל רָחֵֽל׃
Translated: So Laban went into Jacob’s tent and Leah’s tent and the tents of the two maidservants; but he did not find them. Leaving Leah’s tent, he entered Rachel’s tent.
Transliteration: vayavo lavan veohel yaakov uveohel leah uveohel shetey haamahot velo matsa vayetse meohel leah vayavo veohel rachel

Hebrew: וְרָחֵ֞ל לָקְחָ֣ה אֶת־הַתְּרָפִ֗ים וַתְּשִׂמֵ֛ם בְּכַ֥ר הַגָּמָ֖ל וַתֵּ֣שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וַיְמַשֵּׁ֥שׁ לָבָ֛ן אֶת־כׇּל־הָאֹ֖הֶל וְלֹ֥א מָצָֽא׃
Translated: Rachel, meanwhile, had taken the idols and placed them in the camel cushion and sat on them; and Laban rummaged through the tent without finding them.
Transliteration: verachel lakechah et-haterafiym vateshimem vekhar hagamal vateshev aleyhem vayemashesh lavan et-khׇl-haohel velo matsa

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־אָבִ֗יהָ אַל־יִ֙חַר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י כִּ֣י ל֤וֹא אוּכַל֙ לָק֣וּם מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ כִּי־דֶ֥רֶךְ נָשִׁ֖ים לִ֑י וַיְחַפֵּ֕שׂ וְלֹ֥א מָצָ֖א אֶת־הַתְּרָפִֽים׃
Translated: For she said to her father, “Let not my lord take it amiss that I cannot rise before you, for I am in a womanly way.” Thus he searched, but could not find the household idols.
Transliteration: vatomer el-aviyha al-yichar veeyney adoniy khiy lvo ukhal lakum mifaneykha khiy-derekhe nashiym liy vayechafesh velo matsa et-haterafiym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥חַר לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב וַיָּ֣רֶב בְּלָבָ֑ן וַיַּ֤עַן יַעֲקֹב֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְלָבָ֔ן מַה־פִּשְׁעִי֙ מַ֣ה חַטָּאתִ֔י כִּ֥י דָלַ֖קְתָּ אַחֲרָֽי׃
Translated: Now Jacob became incensed and took up his grievance with Laban. Jacob spoke up and said to Laban, “What is my crime, what is my guilt that you should pursue me?
Transliteration: vayichar leyaakov vayarev velavan vayaan yaakov vayomer lelavan mah-fisheiy mah chatatiy khiy dalaketa acharay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מִשַּׁ֣שְׁתָּ אֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלַ֗י מַה־מָּצָ֙אתָ֙ מִכֹּ֣ל כְּלֵי־בֵיתֶ֔ךָ שִׂ֣ים כֹּ֔ה נֶ֥גֶד אַחַ֖י וְאַחֶ֑יךָ וְיוֹכִ֖יחוּ בֵּ֥ין שְׁנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: You rummaged through all my things; what have you found of all your household objects? Set it here, before my kin and yours, and let them decide between us two.
Transliteration: khiy-mishasheta et-khׇl-khelay mah-matsata mikhol kheley-veytekha shiym khoh neged achay veacheykha veyvokhiychu veyn sheneynu

Hebrew: זֶה֩ עֶשְׂרִ֨ים שָׁנָ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ רְחֵלֶ֥יךָ וְעִזֶּ֖יךָ לֹ֣א שִׁכֵּ֑לוּ וְאֵילֵ֥י צֹאנְךָ֖ לֹ֥א אָכָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated: “These twenty years I have spent in your service, your ewes and she-goats never miscarried, nor did I feast on rams from your flock.
Transliteration: zeh esheriym shanah anokhiy imakhe recheleykha veizeykha lo shikhelu veeyley tsonekha lo akhaletiy

Hebrew: טְרֵפָה֙ לֹא־הֵבֵ֣אתִי אֵלֶ֔יךָ אָנֹכִ֣י אֲחַטֶּ֔נָּה מִיָּדִ֖י תְּבַקְשֶׁ֑נָּה גְּנֻֽבְתִ֣י י֔וֹם וּגְנֻֽבְתִ֖י לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: That which was torn by beasts I never brought to you; I myself made good the loss; you exacted it of me, whether snatched by day or snatched by night.
Transliteration: terefah lo-hevetiy eleykha anokhiy achatenah miyadiy tevakeshenah genuvetiy yvom ugenuvetiy layelah

Hebrew: הָיִ֧יתִי בַיּ֛וֹם אֲכָלַ֥נִי חֹ֖רֶב וְקֶ֣רַח בַּלָּ֑יְלָה וַתִּדַּ֥ד שְׁנָתִ֖י מֵֽעֵינָֽי׃
Translated: Often, scorching heat ravaged me by day and frost by night; and sleep fled from my eyes.
Transliteration: hayiytiy vayyvom akhalaniy chorev vekerach valayelah vatidad shenatiy meeynay

Hebrew: זֶה־לִּ֞י עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָה֮ בְּבֵיתֶ֒ךָ֒ עֲבַדְתִּ֜יךָ אַרְבַּֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ בִּשְׁתֵּ֣י בְנֹתֶ֔יךָ וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים בְּצֹאנֶ֑ךָ וַתַּחֲלֵ֥ף אֶת־מַשְׂכֻּרְתִּ֖י עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת מֹנִֽים׃
Translated: Of the twenty years that I spent in your household, I served you fourteen years for your two daughters, and six years for your flocks; and you changed my wages time and again.
Transliteration: zeh-liy esheriym shanah veveytekha avadetiykha areva-eshereh shanah vishetey venoteykha veshesh shaniym vetsonekha vatachalef et-mashekhuretiy asheret moniym

Hebrew: לוּלֵ֡י אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִי֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם וּפַ֤חַד יִצְחָק֙ הָ֣יָה לִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה רֵיקָ֣ם שִׁלַּחְתָּ֑נִי אֶת־עׇנְיִ֞י וְאֶת־יְגִ֧יעַ כַּפַּ֛י רָאָ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַיּ֥וֹכַח אָֽמֶשׁ׃
Translated: Had not the God of my father’s [house]—the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac—been with me, you would have sent me away empty-handed. But it was my plight and the toil of my hands that God took notice of—and gave judgment on last night.”
Transliteration: luley elohey aviy elohey averaham ufachad yitsechak hayah liy khiy atah reykam shilachetaniy et-ׇneyiy veet-yegiya khafay raah Elohim vayyvokhach amesh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן לָבָ֜ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הַבָּנ֨וֹת בְּנֹתַ֜י וְהַבָּנִ֤ים בָּנַי֙ וְהַצֹּ֣אן צֹאנִ֔י וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה רֹאֶ֖ה לִי־ה֑וּא וְלִבְנֹתַ֞י מָֽה־אֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה לָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַיּ֔וֹם א֥וֹ לִבְנֵיהֶ֖ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלָֽדוּ׃
Translated: Then Laban spoke up and said to Jacob, “The daughters are my daughters, the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks; all that you see is mine. Yet what can I do now about my daughters or the children they have borne?
Transliteration: vayaan lavan vayomer el-yaakov havanvot venotay vehavaniym vanay vehatson tsoniy vekhol asher-atah roeh liy-hu velivenotay mah-eesheh laeleh hayyvom vo liveneyhen asher yaladu

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה לְכָ֛ה נִכְרְתָ֥ה בְרִ֖ית אֲנִ֣י וָאָ֑תָּה וְהָיָ֥ה לְעֵ֖ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Come, then, let us make a pact, you and I, that there may be a witness between you and me.”
Transliteration: veatah lekhah nikheretah veriyt aniy vaatah vehayah leed veyniy uveynekha

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב אָ֑בֶן וַיְרִימֶ֖הָ מַצֵּבָֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon Jacob took a stone and set it up as a pillar.
Transliteration: vayikach yaakov aven vayeriymeha matsevah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֤ב לְאֶחָיו֙ לִקְט֣וּ אֲבָנִ֔ים וַיִּקְח֥וּ אֲבָנִ֖ים וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־גָ֑ל וַיֹּ֥אכְלוּ שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַגָּֽל׃
Translated: And Jacob said to his kinsmen, “Gather stones.” So they took stones and made a mound; and they partook of a meal there by the mound.
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov leechayv liketu avaniym vayikechu avaniym vayaashu-gal vayokhelu sham al-hagal

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא־ל֣וֹ לָבָ֔ן יְגַ֖ר שָׂהֲדוּתָ֑א וְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב קָ֥רָא ל֖וֹ גַּלְעֵֽד׃
Translated: Laban named it Yegar-sahadutha, but Jacob named it Gal-ed.
Transliteration: vayikera-lvo lavan yegar shahaduta veyaakov kara lvo galeed

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָבָ֔ן הַגַּ֨ל הַזֶּ֥ה עֵ֛ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינְךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמ֖וֹ גַּלְעֵֽד׃
Translated: And Laban declared, “This mound is a witness between you and me this day.” That is why it was named Gal-ed;
Transliteration: vayomer lavan hagal hazeh ed veyniy uveynekha hayyvom al-khen kara-shemvo galeed

Hebrew: וְהַמִּצְפָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔ר יִ֥צֶף יְהֹוָ֖ה בֵּינִ֣י וּבֵינֶ֑ךָ כִּ֥י נִסָּתֵ֖ר אִ֥ישׁ מֵרֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: and [it was called] Mizpah, because he said, “May יהוה watch between you and me, when we are out of sight of each other.
Transliteration: vehamitsefah asher amar yitsef yehovah veyniy uveynekha khiy nisater iysh mereehu

Hebrew: אִם־תְּעַנֶּ֣ה אֶת־בְּנֹתַ֗י וְאִם־תִּקַּ֤ח נָשִׁים֙ עַל־בְּנֹתַ֔י אֵ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ עִמָּ֑נוּ רְאֵ֕ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים עֵ֖ד בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
Translated: If you ill-treat my daughters or take other wives besides my daughters—though no one else be about, remember, it is God who will be witness between you and me.”
Transliteration: im-teaneh et-venotay veim-tikach nashiym al-venotay eyn iysh imanu reeh Elohim ed veyniy uveynekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לָבָ֖ן לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֗ה וְהִנֵּה֙ הַמַּצֵּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָרִ֖יתִי בֵּינִ֥י וּבֵינֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And Laban said to Jacob, “Here is this mound and here the pillar which I have set up between you and me:
Transliteration: vayomer lavan leyaakov hineh hagal hazeh vehineh hamatsevah asher yariytiy veyniy uveynekha

Hebrew: עֵ֚ד הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה וְעֵדָ֖ה הַמַּצֵּבָ֑ה אִם־אָ֗נִי לֹֽא־אֶעֱבֹ֤ר אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַגַּ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה וְאִם־אַ֠תָּ֠ה לֹא־תַעֲבֹ֨ר אֵלַ֜י אֶת־הַגַּ֥ל הַזֶּ֛ה וְאֶת־הַמַּצֵּבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְרָעָֽה׃
Translated: this mound shall be witness and this pillar shall be witness that I am not to cross to you past this mound, and that you are not to cross to me past this mound and this pillar, with hostile intent.
Transliteration: ed hagal hazeh veedah hamatsevah im-aniy lo-eevor eleykha et-hagal hazeh veim-atah lo-taavor elay et-hagal hazeh veet-hamatsevah hazot leraah

Hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֨י אַבְרָהָ֜ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֤י נָחוֹר֙ יִשְׁפְּט֣וּ בֵינֵ֔ינוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֣ע יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּפַ֖חַד אָבִ֥יו יִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: May the God of Abraham’s [house] and the god of Nahor’s [house]”—their ancestral deities—“judge between us.” And Jacob swore by the Fear of his father Isaac’s [house].
Transliteration: elohey averaham velohey nachvor yishefetu veyneynu elohey aviyhem vayishava yaakov vefachad aviyv yitsechak

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֨ח יַעֲקֹ֥ב זֶ֙בַח֙ בָּהָ֔ר וַיִּקְרָ֥א לְאֶחָ֖יו לֶאֱכׇל־לָ֑חֶם וַיֹּ֣אכְלוּ לֶ֔חֶם וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ בָּהָֽר׃
Translated: Jacob then offered up a sacrifice on the Height, and invited his kinsmen to partake of the meal. After the meal, they spent the night on the Height.
Transliteration: vayizevach yaakov zevach vahar vayikera leechayv leekhׇl-lachem vayokhelu lechem vayaliynu vahar

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֨ם לָבָ֜ן בַּבֹּ֗קֶר וַיְנַשֵּׁ֧ק לְבָנָ֛יו וְלִבְנוֹתָ֖יו וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֶתְהֶ֑ם וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ וַיָּ֥שׇׁב לָבָ֖ן לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Early in the morning, Laban kissed his sons and daughters and bade them good-by; then Laban left on his journey homeward.
Transliteration: vayashekhem lavan vavoker vayenashek levanayv velivenvotayv vayevarekhe etehem vayelekhe vayashׇv lavan limekomvo

Hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב הָלַ֣ךְ לְדַרְכּ֑וֹ וַיִּפְגְּעוּ־ב֖וֹ מַלְאֲכֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Jacob went on his way, and messengers of God encountered him.
Transliteration: veyaakov halakhe ledarekhvo vayifegeu-vvo maleakhey Elohim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאָ֔ם מַחֲנֵ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים זֶ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֛א שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא מַֽחֲנָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: When he saw them, Jacob said, “This is God’s camp.” So he named that place Mahanaim.
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov khaasher raam machaneh Elohim zeh vayikera shem-hamakvom hahu machanayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יַעֲקֹ֤ב מַלְאָכִים֙ לְפָנָ֔יו אֶל־עֵשָׂ֖ו אָחִ֑יו אַ֥רְצָה שֵׂעִ֖יר שְׂדֵ֥ה אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: Jacob sent messengers ahead to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom,
Transliteration: vayishelach yaakov maleakhiym lefanayv el-eshav achiyv aretsah sheiyr shedeh edvom

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו אֹתָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֣ה תֹאמְר֔וּן לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ עַבְדְּךָ֣ יַעֲקֹ֔ב עִם־לָבָ֣ן גַּ֔רְתִּי וָאֵחַ֖ר עַד־עָֽתָּה׃
Translated: and instructed them as follows, “Thus shall you say, ‘To my lord Esau, thus says your servant Jacob: I stayed with Laban and remained until now;
Transliteration: vayetsav otam lemor khoh tomerun ladoniy leeshav khoh amar avedekha yaakov im-lavan garetiy vaechar ad-atah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי־לִי֙ שׁ֣וֹר וַחֲמ֔וֹר צֹ֖אן וְעֶ֣בֶד וְשִׁפְחָ֑ה וָֽאֶשְׁלְחָה֙ לְהַגִּ֣יד לַֽאדֹנִ֔י לִמְצֹא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: I have acquired cattle, asses, sheep, and male and female slaves; and I send this message to my lord in the hope of gaining your favor.’”
Transliteration: vayehiy-liy shvor vachamvor tson veeved veshifechah vaeshelechah lehagiyd ladoniy limetso-chen veeyneykha

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֙בוּ֙ הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר בָּ֤אנוּ אֶל־אָחִ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו וְגַם֙ הֹלֵ֣ךְ לִקְרָֽאתְךָ֔ וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת אִ֖ישׁ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: The messengers returned to Jacob, saying, “We came to your brother Esau; he himself is coming to meet you, and his retinue numbers four hundred.”
Transliteration: vayashuvu hamaleakhiym el-yaakov lemor vanu el-achiykha el-eshav vegam holekhe likeratekha veareva-mevot iysh imvo

Hebrew: וַיִּירָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב מְאֹ֖ד וַיֵּ֣צֶר ל֑וֹ וַיַּ֜חַץ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ וְאֶת־הַצֹּ֧אן וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֛ר וְהַגְּמַלִּ֖ים לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Jacob was greatly frightened; in his anxiety, he divided the people with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps,
Transliteration: vayiyra yaakov meod vayetser lvo vayachats et-haam asher-itvo veet-hatson veet-havakar vehagemaliym lisheney machanvot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אִם־יָב֥וֹא עֵשָׂ֛ו אֶל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הָאַחַ֖ת וְהִכָּ֑הוּ וְהָיָ֛ה הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הַנִּשְׁאָ֖ר לִפְלֵיטָֽה׃
Translated: thinking, “If Esau comes to the one camp and attacks it, the other camp may yet escape.”
Transliteration: vayomer im-yavvo eshav el-hamachaneh haachat vehikhahu vehayah hamachaneh hanishear lifeleytah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ יַעֲקֹב֒ אֱלֹהֵי֙ אָבִ֣י אַבְרָהָ֔ם וֵאלֹהֵ֖י אָבִ֣י יִצְחָ֑ק יְהֹוָ֞ה הָאֹמֵ֣ר אֵלַ֗י שׁ֧וּב לְאַרְצְךָ֛ וּלְמוֹלַדְתְּךָ֖ וְאֵיטִ֥יבָה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Then Jacob said, “O God of my father Abraham’s [house] and God of my father Isaac’s [house], O יהוה, who said to me, ‘Return to your native land and I will deal bountifully with you’!
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov elohey aviy averaham velohey aviy yitsechak yehovah haomer elay shuv learetsekha ulemvoladetekha veeytiyvah imakhe

Hebrew: קָטֹ֜נְתִּי מִכֹּ֤ל הַחֲסָדִים֙ וּמִכׇּל־הָ֣אֱמֶ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתָ אֶת־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֣י בְמַקְלִ֗י עָבַ֙רְתִּי֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן הַזֶּ֔ה וְעַתָּ֥ה הָיִ֖יתִי לִשְׁנֵ֥י מַחֲנֽוֹת׃
Translated: I am unworthy of all the kindness that You have so steadfastly shown Your servant: with my staff alone I crossed this Jordan, and now I have become two camps.
Transliteration: katonetiy mikhol hachasadiym umikhׇl-haemet asher ashiyta et-avedekha khiy vemakeliy avaretiy et-hayareden hazeh veatah hayiytiy lisheney machanvot

Hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֥נִי נָ֛א מִיַּ֥ד אָחִ֖י מִיַּ֣ד עֵשָׂ֑ו כִּֽי־יָרֵ֤א אָנֹכִי֙ אֹת֔וֹ פֶּן־יָב֣וֹא וְהִכַּ֔נִי אֵ֖ם עַל־בָּנִֽים׃
Translated: Deliver me, I pray, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau; else, I fear, he may come and strike me down, mothers and children alike.
Transliteration: hatsiyleniy na miyad achiy miyad eshav khiy-yare anokhiy otvo fen-yavvo vehikhaniy em al-vaniym

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה אָמַ֔רְתָּ הֵיטֵ֥ב אֵיטִ֖יב עִמָּ֑ךְ וְשַׂמְתִּ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ כְּח֣וֹל הַיָּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יִסָּפֵ֖ר מֵרֹֽב׃
Translated: Yet You have said, ‘I will deal bountifully with you and make your offspring as the sands of the sea, which are too numerous to count.’”
Transliteration: veatah amareta heytev eytiyv imakhe veshametiy et-zareakha khechvol hayam asher lo-yisafer merov

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥לֶן שָׁ֖ם בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח מִן־הַבָּ֧א בְיָד֛וֹ מִנְחָ֖ה לְעֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: After spending the night there, he selected from what was at hand these presents for his brother Esau:
Transliteration: vayalen sham valayelah hahu vayikach min-hava veyadvo minechah leeshav achiyv

Hebrew: עִזִּ֣ים מָאתַ֔יִם וּתְיָשִׁ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֑ים רְחֵלִ֥ים מָאתַ֖יִם וְאֵילִ֥ים עֶשְׂרִֽים׃
Translated: 200 she-goats and 20 he-goats; 200 ewes and 20 rams;
Transliteration: iziym matayiim uteyashiym esheriym recheliym matayiim veeyliym esheriym

Hebrew: גְּמַלִּ֧ים מֵינִיק֛וֹת וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם שְׁלֹשִׁ֑ים פָּר֤וֹת אַרְבָּעִים֙ וּפָרִ֣ים עֲשָׂרָ֔ה אֲתֹנֹ֣ת עֶשְׂרִ֔ים וַעְיָרִ֖ם עֲשָׂרָֽה׃
Translated: 30 milch camels with their colts; 40 cows and 10 bulls; 20 she-asses and 10 he-asses.
Transliteration: gemaliym meyniykvot uveneyhem sheloshiym farvot arevaiym ufariym asharah atonot esheriym vaeyarim asharah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֙ בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֔יו עֵ֥דֶר עֵ֖דֶר לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־עֲבָדָיו֙ עִבְר֣וּ לְפָנַ֔י וְרֶ֣וַח תָּשִׂ֔ימוּ בֵּ֥ין עֵ֖דֶר וּבֵ֥ין עֵֽדֶר׃
Translated: These he put in the charge of his servants, drove by drove, and he told his servants, “Go on ahead, and keep a distance between droves.”
Transliteration: vayiten veyad-avadayv eder eder levadvo vayomer el-avadayv iveru lefanay verevach tashiymu veyn eder uveyn eder

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו אֶת־הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לֵאמֹ֑ר כִּ֣י יִֽפְגׇשְׁךָ֞ עֵשָׂ֣ו אָחִ֗י וּשְׁאֵֽלְךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְמִי־אַ֙תָּה֙ וְאָ֣נָה תֵלֵ֔ךְ וּלְמִ֖י אֵ֥לֶּה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: He instructed the one in front as follows, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks you, ‘Who’s your master? Where are you going? And whose [animals] are these ahead of you?’
Transliteration: vayetsav et-harishvon lemor khiy yifegׇshekha eshav achiy usheelekha lemor lemiy-atah veanah telekhe ulemiy eleh lefaneykha

Hebrew: וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ לְעַבְדְּךָ֣ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב מִנְחָ֥ה הִוא֙ שְׁלוּחָ֔ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לְעֵשָׂ֑ו וְהִנֵּ֥ה גַם־ה֖וּא אַחֲרֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: you shall answer, ‘Your servant Jacob’s; they are a gift sent to my lord Esau; and [Jacob] himself is right behind us.’”
Transliteration: veamareta leavedekha leyaakov minechah hiv sheluchah ladoniy leeshav vehineh gam-hu achareynu

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֞ו גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַשֵּׁנִ֗י גַּ֚ם אֶת־הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י גַּ֚ם אֶת־כׇּל־הַהֹ֣לְכִ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֥י הָעֲדָרִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ תְּדַבְּר֣וּן אֶל־עֵשָׂ֔ו בְּמֹצַאֲכֶ֖ם אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: He gave similar instructions to the second one, and the third, and all the others who followed the droves, namely, “Thus and so shall you say to Esau when you reach him.
Transliteration: vayetsav gam et-hasheniy gam et-hasheliyshiy gam et-khׇl-haholekhiym acharey haadariym lemor khadavar hazeh tedaverun el-eshav vemotsaakhem otvo

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם גַּ֗ם הִנֵּ֛ה עַבְדְּךָ֥ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אַחֲרֵ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־אָמַ֞ר אֲכַפְּרָ֣ה פָנָ֗יו בַּמִּנְחָה֙ הַהֹלֶ֣כֶת לְפָנָ֔י וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵן֙ אֶרְאֶ֣ה פָנָ֔יו אוּלַ֖י יִשָּׂ֥א פָנָֽי׃
Translated: And you shall add, ‘And your servant Jacob himself is right behind us.’” For he reasoned, “If I propitiate him with presents in advance, and then face him, perhaps he will show me favor.”
Transliteration: vaamaretem gam hineh avedekha yaakov achareynu khiy-amar akhaferah fanayv vaminechah haholekhet lefanay veacharey-khen ereeh fanayv ulay yisha fanay

Hebrew: וַתַּעֲבֹ֥ר הַמִּנְחָ֖ה עַל־פָּנָ֑יו וְה֛וּא לָ֥ן בַּלַּֽיְלָה־הַה֖וּא בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: And so the gift went on ahead, while he remained in camp that night.
Transliteration: vataavor haminechah al-fanayv vehu lan valayelah-hahu vamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ בַּלַּ֣יְלָה ה֗וּא וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֤י נָשָׁיו֙ וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י שִׁפְחֹתָ֔יו וְאֶת־אַחַ֥ד עָשָׂ֖ר יְלָדָ֑יו וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֔ר אֵ֖ת מַעֲבַ֥ר יַבֹּֽק׃
Translated: That same night he arose, and taking his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven sons, he crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
Transliteration: vayakׇm valayelah hu vayikach et-shetey nashayv veet-shetey shifechotayv veet-achad ashar yeladayv vayaavor et maavar yavok

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨קָּחֵ֔ם וַיַּֽעֲבִרֵ֖ם אֶת־הַנָּ֑חַל וַֽיַּעֲבֵ֖ר אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: After taking them across the stream, he sent across all his possessions.
Transliteration: vayikachem vayaavirem et-hanachal vayaaver et-asher-lvo

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּתֵ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֵּאָבֵ֥ק אִישׁ֙ עִמּ֔וֹ עַ֖ד עֲל֥וֹת הַשָּֽׁחַר׃
Translated: Jacob was left alone. And a figure wrestled with him until the break of dawn.
Transliteration: vayivater yaakov levadvo vayeavek iysh imvo ad alvot hashachar

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗רְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָכֹל֙ ל֔וֹ וַיִּגַּ֖ע בְּכַף־יְרֵכ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֙קַע֙ כַּף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּהֵאָֽבְק֖וֹ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When he saw that he had not prevailed against him, he wrenched Jacob’s hip at its socket, so that the socket of his hip was strained as he wrestled with him.
Transliteration: vayare khiy lo yakhol lvo vayiga vekhaf-yerekhvo vateka khaf-yerekhe yaakov veheavekvo imvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שַׁלְּחֵ֔נִי כִּ֥י עָלָ֖ה הַשָּׁ֑חַר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לֹ֣א אֲשַֽׁלֵּחֲךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־בֵּרַכְתָּֽנִי׃
Translated: Then he said, “Let me go, for dawn is breaking.” But he answered, “I will not let you go, unless you bless me.”
Transliteration: vayomer shalecheniy khiy alah hashachar vayomer lo ashalechakha khiy im-verakhetaniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו מַה־שְּׁמֶ֑ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: Said the other, “What is your name?” He replied, “Jacob.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv mah-shemekha vayomer yaakov

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לֹ֤א יַעֲקֹב֙ יֵאָמֵ֥ר עוֹד֙ שִׁמְךָ֔ כִּ֖י אִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־שָׂרִ֧יתָ עִם־אֱלֹהִ֛ים וְעִם־אֲנָשִׁ֖ים וַתּוּכָֽל׃
Translated: Said he, “Your name shall no longer be Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven with beings divine and human, and have prevailed.”
Transliteration: vayomer lo yaakov eiamer vod shimekha khiy im-yisherael khiy-shariyta im-Elohim veim-anashiym vatukhal

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֣ל יַעֲקֹ֗ב וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַגִּֽידָה־נָּ֣א שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה תִּשְׁאַ֣ל לִשְׁמִ֑י וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֹת֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Jacob asked, “Pray tell me your name.” But he said, “You must not ask my name!” And he took leave of him there.
Transliteration: vayisheal yaakov vayomer hagiydah-na shemekha vayomer lamah zeh tisheal lishemiy vayevarekhe otvo sham

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֧א יַעֲקֹ֛ב שֵׁ֥ם הַמָּק֖וֹם פְּנִיאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־רָאִ֤יתִי אֱלֹהִים֙ פָּנִ֣ים אֶל־פָּנִ֔ים וַתִּנָּצֵ֖ל נַפְשִֽׁי׃
Translated: So Jacob named the place Peniel, meaning, “I have seen a divine being face to face, yet my life has been preserved.”
Transliteration: vayikera yaakov shem hamakvom feniyel khiy-raiytiy Elohim faniym el-faniym vatinatsel nafeshiy

Hebrew: וַיִּֽזְרַֽח־ל֣וֹ הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָבַ֖ר אֶת־פְּנוּאֵ֑ל וְה֥וּא צֹלֵ֖עַ עַל־יְרֵכֽוֹ׃
Translated: The sun rose upon him as he passed Penuel, limping on his hip.
Transliteration: vayizerach-lvo hashemesh khaasher avar et-fenuel vehu tsolea al-yerekhvo

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֡ן לֹֽא־יֹאכְל֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־גִּ֣יד הַנָּשֶׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַיָּרֵ֔ךְ עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י נָגַע֙ בְּכַף־יֶ֣רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּגִ֖יד הַנָּשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: That is why the children of Israel to this day do not eat the thigh muscle that is on the socket of the hip, since Jacob’s hip socket was wrenched at the thigh muscle.
Transliteration: al-khen lo-yokhelu veney-yisherael et-giyd hanasheh asher al-khaf hayarekhe ad hayyvom hazeh khiy naga vekhaf-yerekhe yaakov vegiyd hanasheh

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א יַעֲקֹ֜ב עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ וְהִנֵּ֣ה עֵשָׂ֣ו בָּ֔א וְעִמּ֕וֹ אַרְבַּ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת אִ֑ישׁ וַיַּ֣חַץ אֶת־הַיְלָדִ֗ים עַל־לֵאָה֙ וְעַל־רָחֵ֔ל וְעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֥י הַשְּׁפָחֽוֹת׃
Translated: Looking up, Jacob saw Esau coming, with a retinue of four hundred. He divided the children among Leah, Rachel, and the two maids,
Transliteration: vayisha yaakov eynayv vayare vehineh eshav va veimvo areva mevot iysh vayachats et-hayeladiym al-leah veal-rachel veal shetey hashefachvot

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שֶׂם אֶת־הַשְּׁפָח֛וֹת וְאֶת־יַלְדֵיהֶ֖ן רִֽאשֹׁנָ֑ה וְאֶת־לֵאָ֤ה וִֽילָדֶ֙יהָ֙ אַחֲרֹנִ֔ים וְאֶת־רָחֵ֥ל וְאֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף אַחֲרֹנִֽים׃
Translated: putting the maids and their children first, Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph last.
Transliteration: vayashem et-hashefachvot veet-yaledeyhen rishonah veet-leah viyladeyha acharoniym veet-rachel veet-yvosef acharoniym

Hebrew: וְה֖וּא עָבַ֣ר לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֤חוּ אַ֙רְצָה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֔ים עַד־גִּשְׁתּ֖וֹ עַד־אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: He himself went on ahead and bowed low to the ground seven times until he was near his brother.
Transliteration: vehu avar lifeneyhem vayishetachu aretsah sheva feamiym ad-gishetvo ad-achiyv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨רׇץ עֵשָׂ֤ו לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ וַֽיְחַבְּקֵ֔הוּ וַיִּפֹּ֥ל עַל־צַוָּארָ֖ו וַׄיִּׄשָּׁׄקֵ֑ׄהׄוּׄ וַיִּבְכּֽוּ׃
Translated: Esau ran to greet him. He embraced him and, falling on his neck, he kissed him; and they wept.
Transliteration: vayarׇts eshav likeratvo vayechavekehu vayifol al-tsavarav vayishakehu vayivekhu

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֤רְא אֶת־הַנָּשִׁים֙ וְאֶת־הַיְלָדִ֔ים וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִי־אֵ֣לֶּה לָּ֑ךְ וַיֹּאמַ֕ר הַיְלָדִ֕ים אֲשֶׁר־חָנַ֥ן אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Looking about, he saw the women and the children. “Who,” he asked, “are these with you?” He answered, “The children with whom God has favored your servant.”
Transliteration: vayisha et-eynayv vayare et-hanashiym veet-hayeladiym vayomer miy-eleh lakhe vayomar hayeladiym asher-chanan Elohim et-avedekha

Hebrew: וַתִּגַּ֧שְׁןָ הַשְּׁפָח֛וֹת הֵ֥נָּה וְיַלְדֵיהֶ֖ן וַתִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֶֽיןָ׃
Translated: Then the maids, with their children, came forward and bowed low;
Transliteration: vatigashena hashefachvot henah veyaledeyhen vatishetachaveyna

Hebrew: וַתִּגַּ֧שׁ גַּם־לֵאָ֛ה וִילָדֶ֖יהָ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֑וּ וְאַחַ֗ר נִגַּ֥שׁ יוֹסֵ֛ף וְרָחֵ֖ל וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ׃
Translated: next Leah, with her children, came forward and bowed low; and last, Joseph and Rachel came forward and bowed low.
Transliteration: vatigash gam-leah viyladeyha vayishetachavu veachar nigash yvosef verachel vayishetachavu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֥י לְךָ֛ כׇּל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּגָ֑שְׁתִּי וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לִמְצֹא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: And he asked, “What do you mean by all this company which I have met?” He answered, “To gain my lord’s favor.”
Transliteration: vayomer miy lekha khׇl-hamachaneh hazeh asher fagashetiy vayomer limetso-chen veeyney adoniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר עֵשָׂ֖ו יֶשׁ־לִ֣י רָ֑ב אָחִ֕י יְהִ֥י לְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Esau said, “I have enough, my brother; let what you have remain yours.”
Transliteration: vayomer eshav yesh-liy rav achiy yehiy lekha asher-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֗ב אַל־נָא֙ אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ מִנְחָתִ֖י מִיָּדִ֑י כִּ֣י עַל־כֵּ֞ן רָאִ֣יתִי פָנֶ֗יךָ כִּרְאֹ֛ת פְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים וַתִּרְצֵֽנִי׃
Translated: But Jacob said, “No, I pray you; if you would do me this favor, accept from me this gift; for to see your face is like seeing the face of God, and you have received me favorably.
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov al-na im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha velakacheta minechatiy miyadiy khiy al-khen raiytiy faneykha khireot feney Elohim vatiretseniy

Hebrew: קַח־נָ֤א אֶת־בִּרְכָתִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֻבָ֣את לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־חַנַּ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְכִ֣י יֶשׁ־לִי־כֹ֑ל וַיִּפְצַר־בּ֖וֹ וַיִּקָּֽח׃
Translated: Please accept my present which has been brought to you, for God has favored me and I have plenty.” And when he urged him, he accepted.
Transliteration: kach-na et-virekhatiy asher huvat lakhe khiy-chananiy Elohim vekhiy yesh-liy-khol vayifetsar-vvo vayikach

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר נִסְעָ֣ה וְנֵלֵ֑כָה וְאֵלְכָ֖ה לְנֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: And [Esau] said, “Let us start on our journey, and I will proceed at your pace.”
Transliteration: vayomer niseah venelekhah veelekhah lenegedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו אֲדֹנִ֤י יֹדֵ֙עַ֙ כִּֽי־הַיְלָדִ֣ים רַכִּ֔ים וְהַצֹּ֥אן וְהַבָּקָ֖ר עָל֣וֹת עָלָ֑י וּדְפָקוּם֙ י֣וֹם אֶחָ֔ד וָמֵ֖תוּ כׇּל־הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: But he said to him, “My lord knows that the children are frail and that the flocks and herds, which are nursing, are a care to me; if they are driven hard a single day, all the flocks will die.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv adoniy yodea khiy-hayeladiym rakhiym vehatson vehavakar alvot alay udefakum yvom echad vametu khׇl-hatson

Hebrew: יַעֲבׇר־נָ֥א אֲדֹנִ֖י לִפְנֵ֣י עַבְדּ֑וֹ וַאֲנִ֞י אֶֽתְנָהֲלָ֣ה לְאִטִּ֗י לְרֶ֨גֶל הַמְּלָאכָ֤ה אֲשֶׁר־לְפָנַי֙ וּלְרֶ֣גֶל הַיְלָדִ֔ים עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־אָבֹ֥א אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֖י שֵׂעִֽירָה׃
Translated: Let my lord go on ahead of his servant, while I travel slowly, at the pace of the cattle before me and at the pace of the children, until I come to my lord in Seir.”
Transliteration: yaavׇr-na adoniy lifeney avedvo vaaniy etenahalah leitiy leregel hamelakhah asher-lefanay uleregel hayeladiym ad asher-avo el-adoniy sheiyrah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר עֵשָׂ֔ו אַצִּֽיגָה־נָּ֣א עִמְּךָ֔ מִן־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתִּ֑י וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לָ֣מָּה זֶּ֔ה אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: Then Esau said, “Let me assign to you some of the people who are with me.” But he said, “Oh no, my lord is too kind to me!”
Transliteration: vayomer eshav atsiygah-na imekha min-haam asher itiy vayomer lamah zeh emetsa-chen veeyney adoniy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩שׇׁב֩ בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֥וּא עֵשָׂ֛ו לְדַרְכּ֖וֹ שֵׂעִֽירָה׃
Translated: So Esau started back that day on his way to Seir.
Transliteration: vayashׇv vayyvom hahu eshav ledarekhvo sheiyrah

Hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹב֙ נָסַ֣ע סֻכֹּ֔תָה וַיִּ֥בֶן ל֖וֹ בָּ֑יִת וּלְמִקְנֵ֙הוּ֙ עָשָׂ֣ה סֻכֹּ֔ת עַל־כֵּ֛ן קָרָ֥א שֵׁם־הַמָּק֖וֹם סֻכּֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: But Jacob journeyed on to Succoth, and built a house for himself and made stalls for his cattle; that is why the place was called Succoth.
Transliteration: veyaakov nasa sukhotah vayiven lvo vayiit ulemikenehu ashah sukhot al-khen kara shem-hamakvom sukhvot {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ יַעֲקֹ֨ב שָׁלֵ֜ם עִ֣יר שְׁכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בְּבֹא֖וֹ מִפַּדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם וַיִּ֖חַן אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: Jacob arrived safe in the city of Shechem which is in the land of Canaan—having come thus from Paddan-aram—and he encamped before the city.
Transliteration: vayavo yaakov shalem iyr shekhem asher veerets khenaan vevovo mifadan aram vayichan et-feney haiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּ֜קֶן אֶת־חֶלְקַ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָֽטָה־שָׁם֙ אׇהֳל֔וֹ מִיַּ֥ד בְּנֵֽי־חֲמ֖וֹר אֲבִ֣י שְׁכֶ֑ם בְּמֵאָ֖ה קְשִׂיטָֽה׃
Translated: The parcel of land where he pitched his tent he purchased from the kin of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred kesitahs.
Transliteration: vayiken et-chelekat hashadeh asher natah-sham ׇholvo miyad veney-chamvor aviy shekhem vemeah keshiytah

Hebrew: וַיַּצֶּב־שָׁ֖ם מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּ֨קְרָא־ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ל אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: He set up an altar there, and called it El-elohe-yisrael.
Transliteration: vayatsev-sham mizevecha vayikera-lvo el elohey yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַתֵּצֵ֤א דִינָה֙ בַּת־לֵאָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֖ה לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב לִרְא֖וֹת בִּבְנ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Now Dinah, the daughter whom Leah had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land.
Transliteration: vatetse diynah vat-leah asher yaledah leyaakov lirevot vivenvot haarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא אֹתָ֜הּ שְׁכֶ֧ם בֶּן־חֲמ֛וֹר הַֽחִוִּ֖י נְשִׂ֣יא הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּקַּ֥ח אֹתָ֛הּ וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב אֹתָ֖הּ וַיְעַנֶּֽהָ׃
Translated: Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, chief of the country, saw her, and took her and lay with her and disgraced her.
Transliteration: vayare otah shekhem ven-chamvor hachiviy neshiy haarets vayikach otah vayishekhav otah vayeaneha

Hebrew: וַתִּדְבַּ֣ק נַפְשׁ֔וֹ בְּדִינָ֖ה בַּֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיֶּֽאֱהַב֙ אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר עַל־לֵ֥ב הַֽנַּעֲרָֽ׃
Translated: Being strongly drawn to Dinah daughter of Jacob, and in love with the maiden, he spoke to the maiden tenderly.
Transliteration: vatidevak nafeshvo vediynah vat-yaakov vayeehav et-hanaara vayedaver al-lev hanaara

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שְׁכֶ֔ם אֶל־חֲמ֥וֹר אָבִ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר קַֽח־לִ֛י אֶת־הַיַּלְדָּ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: So Shechem said to his father Hamor, “Get me this girl as a wife.”
Transliteration: vayomer shekhem el-chamvor aviyv lemor kach-liy et-hayaledah hazot leishah

Hebrew: וְיַעֲקֹ֣ב שָׁמַ֗ע כִּ֤י טִמֵּא֙ אֶת־דִּינָ֣ה בִתּ֔וֹ וּבָנָ֛יו הָי֥וּ אֶת־מִקְנֵ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְהֶחֱרִ֥שׁ יַעֲקֹ֖ב עַד־בֹּאָֽם׃
Translated: Jacob heard that he had defiled his daughter Dinah; but since his sons were in the field with his cattle, Jacob kept silent until they came home.
Transliteration: veyaakov shama khiy time et-diynah vitvo uvanayv hayu et-mikenehu vashadeh vehecherish yaakov ad-voam

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֛א חֲמ֥וֹר אֲבִֽי־שְׁכֶ֖ם אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֑ב לְדַבֵּ֖ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then Shechem’s father Hamor came out to Jacob to speak to him.
Transliteration: vayetse chamvor aviy-shekhem el-yaakov ledaver itvo

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֨י יַעֲקֹ֜ב בָּ֤אוּ מִן־הַשָּׂדֶה֙ כְּשׇׁמְעָ֔ם וַיִּֽתְעַצְּבוּ֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיִּ֥חַר לָהֶ֖ם מְאֹ֑ד כִּֽי־נְבָלָ֞ה עָשָׂ֣ה בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־בַּֽת־יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְכֵ֖ן לֹ֥א יֵעָשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Meanwhile Jacob’s sons, having heard the news, came in from the field. The men were distressed and very angry, because he had committed an outrage in Israel by lying with Jacob’s daughter—a thing not to be done.
Transliteration: uveney yaakov vau min-hashadeh kheshׇmeam vayiteatsevu haanashiym vayichar lahem meod khiy-nevalah ashah veyisherael lishekhav et-vat-yaakov vekhen lo eiasheh

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר חֲמ֖וֹר אִתָּ֣ם לֵאמֹ֑ר שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנִ֗י חָֽשְׁקָ֤ה נַפְשׁוֹ֙ בְּבִתְּכֶ֔ם תְּנ֨וּ נָ֥א אֹתָ֛הּ ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: And Hamor spoke with them, saying, “My son Shechem longs for your daughter. Please give her to him in marriage.
Transliteration: vayedaver chamvor itam lemor shekhem veniy chashekah nafeshvo vevitekhem tenu na otah lvo leishah

Hebrew: וְהִֽתְחַתְּנ֖וּ אֹתָ֑נוּ בְּנֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ תִּתְּנוּ־לָ֔נוּ וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֖ינוּ תִּקְח֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Intermarry with us: give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves:
Transliteration: vehitechatenu otanu venoteykhem titenu-lanu veet-venoteynu tikechu lakhem

Hebrew: וְאִתָּ֖נוּ תֵּשֵׁ֑בוּ וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם שְׁבוּ֙ וּסְחָר֔וּהָ וְהֵֽאָחֲז֖וּ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: You will dwell among us, and the land will be open before you; settle, move about, and acquire holdings in it.”
Transliteration: veitanu teshevu vehaarets tiheyeh lifeneykhem shevu usecharuha veheachazu vah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר שְׁכֶם֙ אֶל־אָבִ֣יהָ וְאֶל־אַחֶ֔יהָ אֶמְצָא־חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תֹּאמְר֛וּ אֵלַ֖י אֶתֵּֽן׃
Translated: Then Shechem said to her father and brothers, “Do me this favor, and I will pay whatever you tell me.
Transliteration: vayomer shekhem el-aviyha veel-acheyha emetsa-chen veeyneykhem vaasher tomeru elay eten

Hebrew: הַרְבּ֨וּ עָלַ֤י מְאֹד֙ מֹ֣הַר וּמַתָּ֔ן וְאֶ֨תְּנָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תֹּאמְר֖וּ אֵלָ֑י וּתְנוּ־לִ֥י אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: Ask of me a bride-price ever so high, as well as gifts, and I will pay what you tell me; only give me the maiden for a wife.”
Transliteration: harevu alay meod mohar umatan veetenah khaasher tomeru elay utenu-liy et-hanaara leishah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־שְׁכֶ֨ם וְאֶת־חֲמ֥וֹר אָבִ֛יו בְּמִרְמָ֖ה וַיְדַבֵּ֑רוּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר טִמֵּ֔א אֵ֖ת דִּינָ֥ה אֲחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Jacob’s sons answered Shechem and his father Hamor—speaking with guile because he had defiled their sister Dinah—
Transliteration: vayaanu veney-yaakov et-shekhem veet-chamvor aviyv vemiremah vayedaveru asher time et diynah achotam

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לֹ֤א נוּכַל֙ לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לָתֵת֙ אֶת־אֲחֹתֵ֔נוּ לְאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־ל֣וֹ עׇרְלָ֑ה כִּֽי־חֶרְפָּ֥ה הִ֖וא לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: and said to them, “We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to a man who is uncircumcised, for that is a disgrace among us.
Transliteration: vayomeru aleyhem lo nukhal laashvot hadavar hazeh latet et-achotenu leiysh asher-lvo ׇrelah khiy-cherefah hiv lanu

Hebrew: אַךְ־בְּזֹ֖את נֵא֣וֹת לָכֶ֑ם אִ֚ם תִּהְי֣וּ כָמֹ֔נוּ לְהִמֹּ֥ל לָכֶ֖ם כׇּל־זָכָֽר׃
Translated: Only on this condition will we agree with you; that you will become like us in that every male among you is circumcised.
Transliteration: akhe-vezot nevot lakhem im tiheyu khamonu lehimol lakhem khׇl-zakhar

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֤נּוּ אֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵיכֶ֖ם נִֽקַּֽח־לָ֑נוּ וְיָשַׁ֣בְנוּ אִתְּכֶ֔ם וְהָיִ֖ינוּ לְעַ֥ם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: Then we will give our daughters to you and take your daughters to ourselves; and we will dwell among you and become as one kindred.
Transliteration: venatanu et-venoteynu lakhem veet-venoteykhem nikach-lanu veyashavenu itekhem vehayiynu leam echad

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֧א תִשְׁמְע֛וּ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ לְהִמּ֑וֹל וְלָקַ֥חְנוּ אֶת־בִּתֵּ֖נוּ וְהָלָֽכְנוּ׃
Translated: But if you will not listen to us and become circumcised, we will take our daughter and go.”
Transliteration: veim-lo tishemeu eleynu lehimvol velakachenu et-vitenu vehalakhenu

Hebrew: וַיִּֽיטְב֥וּ דִבְרֵיהֶ֖ם בְּעֵינֵ֣י חֲמ֑וֹר וּבְעֵינֵ֖י שְׁכֶ֥ם בֶּן־חֲמֽוֹר׃
Translated: Their words pleased Hamor and Hamor’s son Shechem.
Transliteration: vayiytevu divereyhem veeyney chamvor uveeyney shekhem ven-chamvor

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־אֵחַ֤ר הַנַּ֙עַר֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הַדָּבָ֔ר כִּ֥י חָפֵ֖ץ בְּבַֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְה֣וּא נִכְבָּ֔ד מִכֹּ֖ל בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: And the youth lost no time in doing the thing, for he wanted Jacob’s daughter. Now he was the most respected in his father’s house.
Transliteration: velo-echar hanaar laashvot hadavar khiy chafets vevat-yaakov vehu nikhevad mikhol veyt aviyv

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א חֲמ֛וֹר וּשְׁכֶ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר עִירָ֑ם וַֽיְדַבְּר֛וּ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י עִירָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: So Hamor and his son Shechem went to the public place of their town and spoke to their town council, saying,
Transliteration: vayavo chamvor ushekhem venvo el-shaar iyram vayedaveru el-aneshey iyram lemor

Hebrew: הָאֲנָשִׁ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה שְֽׁלֵמִ֧ים הֵ֣ם אִתָּ֗נוּ וְיֵשְׁב֤וּ בָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וְיִסְחֲר֣וּ אֹתָ֔הּ וְהָאָ֛רֶץ הִנֵּ֥ה רַֽחֲבַת־יָדַ֖יִם לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם אֶת־בְּנֹתָם֙ נִקַּֽח־לָ֣נוּ לְנָשִׁ֔ים וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֵ֖ינוּ נִתֵּ֥ן לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: “These people are our friends; let them settle in the land and move about in it, for the land is large enough for them; we will take their daughters to ourselves as wives and give our daughters to them.
Transliteration: haanashiym haeleh shelemiym hem itanu veeishevu vaarets veyisecharu otah vehaarets hineh rachavat-yadayiim lifeneyhem et-venotam nikach-lanu lenashiym veet-venoteynu niten lahem

Hebrew: אַךְ־בְּ֠זֹ֠את יֵאֹ֨תוּ לָ֤נוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים֙ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת אִתָּ֔נוּ לִהְי֖וֹת לְעַ֣ם אֶחָ֑ד בְּהִמּ֥וֹל לָ֙נוּ֙ כׇּל־זָכָ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר הֵ֥ם נִמֹּלִֽים׃
Translated: But only on this condition will their representatives agree with us to dwell among us and be as one kindred: that all our males become circumcised as they are circumcised.
Transliteration: akhe-vezot eiotu lanu haanashiym lashevet itanu liheyvot leam echad vehimvol lanu khׇl-zakhar khaasher hem nimoliym

Hebrew: מִקְנֵהֶ֤ם וְקִנְיָנָם֙ וְכׇל־בְּהֶמְתָּ֔ם הֲל֥וֹא לָ֖נוּ הֵ֑ם אַ֚ךְ נֵא֣וֹתָה לָהֶ֔ם וְיֵשְׁב֖וּ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: Their cattle and substance and all their beasts will be ours, if we only agree to their terms, so that they will settle among us.”
Transliteration: mikenehem vekineyanam vekhׇl-vehemetam halvo lanu hem akhe nevotah lahem veeishevu itanu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֤וּ אֶל־חֲמוֹר֙ וְאֶל־שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנ֔וֹ כׇּל־יֹצְאֵ֖י שַׁ֣עַר עִיר֑וֹ וַיִּמֹּ֙לוּ֙ כׇּל־זָכָ֔ר כׇּל־יֹצְאֵ֖י שַׁ֥עַר עִירֽוֹ׃
Translated: All his fellow townsmen heeded Hamor and his son Shechem, and all males, all his fellow townsmen, were circumcised.
Transliteration: vayishemeu el-chamvor veel-shekhem venvo khׇl-yotseey shaar iyrvo vayimolu khׇl-zakhar khׇl-yotseey shaar iyrvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֜י בִּֽהְיוֹתָ֣ם כֹּֽאֲבִ֗ים וַיִּקְח֣וּ שְׁנֵֽי־בְנֵי־יַ֠עֲקֹ֠ב שִׁמְע֨וֹן וְלֵוִ֜י אֲחֵ֤י דִינָה֙ אִ֣ישׁ חַרְבּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ עַל־הָעִ֖יר בֶּ֑טַח וַיַּֽהַרְג֖וּ כׇּל־זָכָֽר׃
Translated: On the third day, when they were in pain, Simeon and Levi, two of Jacob’s sons, brothers of Dinah, took each his sword, came upon the city unmolested, and slew all the males.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheliyshiy viheyvotam khoaviym vayikechu sheney-veney-yaakov shimevon veleviy achey diynah iysh charevvo vayavou al-haiyr vetach vayaharegu khׇl-zakhar

Hebrew: וְאֶת־חֲמוֹר֙ וְאֶת־שְׁכֶ֣ם בְּנ֔וֹ הָרְג֖וּ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וַיִּקְח֧וּ אֶת־דִּינָ֛ה מִבֵּ֥ית שְׁכֶ֖ם וַיֵּצֵֽאוּ׃
Translated: They put Hamor and his son Shechem to the sword, took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went away.
Transliteration: veet-chamvor veet-shekhem venvo haregu lefiy-charev vayikechu et-diynah miveyt shekhem vayetseu

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֗ב בָּ֚אוּ עַל־הַ֣חֲלָלִ֔ים וַיָּבֹ֖זּוּ הָעִ֑יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר טִמְּא֖וּ אֲחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The other sons of Jacob came upon the slain and plundered the town, because their sister had been defiled.
Transliteration: veney yaakov vau al-hachalaliym vayavozu haiyr asher timeu achvotam

Hebrew: אֶת־צֹאנָ֥ם וְאֶת־בְּקָרָ֖ם וְאֶת־חֲמֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־בָּעִ֛יר וְאֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּשָּׂדֶ֖ה לָקָֽחוּ׃
Translated: They seized their flocks and herds and asses, all that was inside the town and outside;
Transliteration: et-tsonam veet-vekaram veet-chamoreyhem veet asher-vaiyr veet-asher vashadeh lakachu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־כׇּל־חֵילָ֤ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־טַפָּם֙ וְאֶת־נְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם שָׁב֖וּ וַיָּבֹ֑זּוּ וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: all their wealth, all their children, and their wives, all that was in the houses, they took as captives and booty.
Transliteration: veet-khׇl-cheylam veet-khׇl-tafam veet-nesheyhem shavu vayavozu veet khׇl-asher vavayiit

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶל־שִׁמְע֣וֹן וְאֶל־לֵוִי֮ עֲכַרְתֶּ֣ם אֹתִי֒ לְהַבְאִישֵׁ֙נִי֙ בְּיֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ בַּֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י וּבַפְּרִזִּ֑י וַאֲנִי֙ מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֔ר וְנֶאֶסְפ֤וּ עָלַי֙ וְהִכּ֔וּנִי וְנִשְׁמַדְתִּ֖י אֲנִ֥י וּבֵיתִֽי׃
Translated: Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble on me, making me odious among the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites and the Perizzites; my fighters are few in number, so that if they unite against me and attack me, I and my house will be destroyed.”
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov el-shimevon veel-leviy akharetem otiy lehaveiysheniy veyoshev haarets vakhenaaniy uvaferiziy vaaniy metey misefar veneesefu alay vehikhuniy venishemadetiy aniy uveytiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֑וּ הַכְזוֹנָ֕ה יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֶת־אֲחוֹתֵֽנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: But they answered, “Should our sister be treated like a whore?”
Transliteration: vayomeru hakhezvonah yaasheh et-achvotenu {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֔ב ק֛וּם עֲלֵ֥ה בֵֽית־אֵ֖ל וְשֶׁב־שָׁ֑ם וַעֲשֵׂה־שָׁ֣ם מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לָאֵל֙ הַנִּרְאֶ֣ה אֵלֶ֔יךָ בְּבׇ֨רְחֲךָ֔ מִפְּנֵ֖י עֵשָׂ֥ו אָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and remain there; and build an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you were fleeing from your brother Esau.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-yaakov kum aleh veyt-el veshev-sham vaasheh-sham mizevecha lael hanireeh eleykha vevׇrechakha mifeney eshav achiykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־בֵּית֔וֹ וְאֶ֖ל כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמּ֑וֹ הָסִ֜רוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַנֵּכָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּתֹכְכֶ֔ם וְהִֽטַּהֲר֔וּ וְהַחֲלִ֖יפוּ שִׂמְלֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: So Jacob said to his household and to all who were with him, “Rid yourselves of the alien gods in your midst, purify yourselves, and change your clothes.
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov el-veytvo veel khׇl-asher imvo hasiru et-elohey hanekhar asher vetokhekhem vehitaharu vehachaliyfu shimeloteykhem

Hebrew: וְנָק֥וּמָה וְנַעֲלֶ֖ה בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂה־שָּׁ֣ם מִזְבֵּ֗חַ לָאֵ֞ל הָעֹנֶ֤ה אֹתִי֙ בְּי֣וֹם צָֽרָתִ֔י וַֽיְהִי֙ עִמָּדִ֔י בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלָֽכְתִּי׃
Translated: Come, let us go up to Bethel, and I will build an altar there to the God who answered me when I was in distress and who has been with me wherever I have gone.”
Transliteration: venakumah venaaleh veyt-el veeesheh-sham mizevecha lael haoneh otiy veyvom tsaratiy vayehiy imadiy vaderekhe asher halakhetiy

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֗ב אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֱלֹהֵ֤י הַנֵּכָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָדָ֔ם וְאֶת־הַנְּזָמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּטְמֹ֤ן אֹתָם֙ יַעֲקֹ֔ב תַּ֥חַת הָאֵלָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִם־שְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: They gave to Jacob all the alien gods that they had, and the rings that were in their ears, and Jacob buried them under the terebinth that was near Shechem.
Transliteration: vayitenu el-yaakov et khׇl-elohey hanekhar asher veyadam veet-hanezamiym asher veׇzeneyhem vayitemon otam yaakov tachat haelah asher im-shekhem

Hebrew: וַיִּסָּ֑עוּ וַיְהִ֣י ׀ חִתַּ֣ת אֱלֹהִ֗ים עַל־הֶֽעָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ סְבִיב֣וֹתֵיהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֣א רָֽדְפ֔וּ אַחֲרֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: As they set out, a terror from God fell on the cities round about, so that they did not pursue the sons of Jacob.
Transliteration: vayisau vayehiy chitat Elohim al-heariym asher seviyvvoteyhem velo radefu acharey veney yaakov

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יַעֲקֹ֜ב ל֗וּזָה אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן הִ֖וא בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל ה֖וּא וְכׇל־הָעָ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Thus Jacob came to Luz—that is, Bethel—in the land of Canaan, he and all the people who were with him.
Transliteration: vayavo yaakov luzah asher veerets khenaan hiv veyt-el hu vekhׇl-haam asher-imvo

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤בֶן שָׁם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ וַיִּקְרָא֙ לַמָּק֔וֹם אֵ֖ל בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל כִּ֣י שָׁ֗ם נִגְל֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים בְּבׇרְח֖וֹ מִפְּנֵ֥י אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: There he built an altar and named the site El-bethel, for it was there that God had been revealed to him when he was fleeing from his brother.
Transliteration: vayiven sham mizevecha vayikera lamakvom el veyt-el khiy sham nigelu elayv haElohimm vevׇrechvo mifeney achiyv

Hebrew: וַתָּ֤מׇת דְּבֹרָה֙ מֵינֶ֣קֶת רִבְקָ֔ה וַתִּקָּבֵ֛ר מִתַּ֥חַת לְבֵֽית־אֵ֖ל תַּ֣חַת הָֽאַלּ֑וֹן וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ אַלּ֥וֹן בָּכֽוּת׃ {פ}
Translated: Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died, and was buried under the oak below Bethel; so it was named Allon-bacuth.
Transliteration: vatamׇt devorah meyneket rivekah vatikaver mitachat leveyt-el tachat haalvon vayikera shemvo alvon vakhut {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹב֙ ע֔וֹד בְּבֹא֖וֹ מִפַּדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֑ם וַיְבָ֖רֶךְ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: God appeared again to Jacob on his arrival from Paddan-aram. God blessed him,
Transliteration: vayera Elohim el-yaakov vod vevovo mifadan aram vayevarekhe otvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים שִׁמְךָ֣ יַעֲקֹ֑ב לֹֽא־יִקָּרֵא֩ שִׁמְךָ֨ ע֜וֹד יַעֲקֹ֗ב כִּ֤י אִם־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה שְׁמֶ֔ךָ וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
saying to him,
“You whose name is Jacob,
You shall be called Jacob no more,
But Israel shall be your name.” Thus he was named Israel.
Transliteration: vayomer-lvo Elohim shimekha yaakov lo-yikare shimekha vod yaakov khiy im-yisherael yiheyeh shemekha vayikera et-shemvo yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ל֨וֹ אֱלֹהִ֜ים אֲנִ֨י אֵ֤ל שַׁדַּי֙ פְּרֵ֣ה וּרְבֵ֔ה גּ֛וֹי וּקְהַ֥ל גּוֹיִ֖ם יִהְיֶ֣ה מִמֶּ֑ךָּ וּמְלָכִ֖ים מֵחֲלָצֶ֥יךָ יֵצֵֽאוּ׃
Translated:
And God said to him,
“I am El Shaddai.
Be fertile and increase;
A nation, yea an assembly of nations,
Shall descend from you.
Kings shall issue from your loins.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo Elohim aniy el shaday fereh ureveh gvoy ukehal gvoyim yiheyeh mimekha umelakhiym mechalatseykha eitseu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛תִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם וּלְיִצְחָ֖ק לְךָ֣ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אַחֲרֶ֖יךָ אֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
The land that I assigned to Abraham and Isaac
I assign to you;
And to your offspring to come
Will I assign the land.”
Transliteration: veet-haarets asher natatiy leaveraham uleyitsechak lekha etenenah ulezareakha achareykha eten et-haarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל מֵעָלָ֖יו אֱלֹהִ֑ים בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: God parted from him at the spot where [God] had spoken to him;
Transliteration: vayaal mealayv Elohim vamakvom asher-diver itvo

Hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֨ב יַעֲקֹ֜ב מַצֵּבָ֗ה בַּמָּק֛וֹם אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ מַצֶּ֣בֶת אָ֑בֶן וַיַּסֵּ֤ךְ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ נֶ֔סֶךְ וַיִּצֹ֥ק עָלֶ֖יהָ שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: and Jacob set up a pillar at the site where [God] had spoken to him, a pillar of stone, and he offered a libation on it and poured oil upon it.
Transliteration: vayatsev yaakov matsevah vamakvom asher-diver itvo matsevet aven vayasekhe aleyha nesekhe vayitsok aleyha shamen

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א יַעֲקֹ֜ב אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבֶּ֨ר אִתּ֥וֹ שָׁ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים בֵּֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated: Jacob gave the site, where God had spoken to him, the name of Bethel.
Transliteration: vayikera yaakov et-shem hamakvom asher diver itvo sham Elohim veyt-el

Hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית אֵ֔ל וַֽיְהִי־ע֥וֹד כִּבְרַת־הָאָ֖רֶץ לָב֣וֹא אֶפְרָ֑תָה וַתֵּ֥לֶד רָחֵ֖ל וַתְּקַ֥שׁ בְּלִדְתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: They set out from Bethel; but when they were still some distance short of Ephrath, Rachel was in childbirth, and she had hard labor.
Transliteration: vayiseu miveyt el vayehiy-vod khiverat-haarets lavvo eferatah vateled rachel vatekash velidetah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בְהַקְשֹׁתָ֖הּ בְּלִדְתָּ֑הּ וַתֹּ֨אמֶר לָ֤הּ הַמְיַלֶּ֙דֶת֙ אַל־תִּ֣ירְאִ֔י כִּֽי־גַם־זֶ֥ה לָ֖ךְ בֵּֽן׃
Translated: When her labor was at its hardest, the midwife said to her, “Have no fear, for it is another boy for you.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vehakeshotah velidetah vatomer lah hameyaledet al-tiyreiy khiy-gam-zeh lakhe ven

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בְּצֵ֤את נַפְשָׁהּ֙ כִּ֣י מֵ֔תָה וַתִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ בֶּן־אוֹנִ֑י וְאָבִ֖יו קָֽרָא־ל֥וֹ בִנְיָמִֽין׃
Translated: But as she breathed her last—for she was dying—she named him Ben-oni; but his father called him Benjamin.
Transliteration: vayehiy vetset nafeshah khiy metah vatikera shemvo ven-voniy veaviyv kara-lvo vineyamiyn

Hebrew: וַתָּ֖מׇת רָחֵ֑ל וַתִּקָּבֵר֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אֶפְרָ֔תָה הִ֖וא בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: Thus Rachel died. She was buried on the road to Ephrath—now Bethlehem.
Transliteration: vatamׇt rachel vatikaver vederekhe eferatah hiv veyt lachem

Hebrew: וַיַּצֵּ֧ב יַעֲקֹ֛ב מַצֵּבָ֖ה עַל־קְבֻרָתָ֑הּ הִ֛וא מַצֶּ֥בֶת קְבֻֽרַת־רָחֵ֖ל עַד־הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Over her grave Jacob set up a pillar; it is the pillar at Rachel’s grave to this day.
Transliteration: vayatsev yaakov matsevah al-kevuratah hiv matsevet kevurat-rachel ad-hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֖ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֣ט אׇֽהֳלֹ֔ה מֵהָ֖לְאָה לְמִגְדַּל־עֵֽדֶר׃
Translated: Israel journeyed on, and pitched his tent beyond Migdal-eder.
Transliteration: vayisa yisherael vayet ׇholoh mehaleah lemigedal-eder

Hebrew:
וַיְהִ֗י בִּשְׁכֹּ֤ן יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֔וא וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ רְאוּבֵ֗֔ן וַיִּשְׁכַּ֕ב֙ אֶת־בִּלְהָ֖ה֙ פִּילֶ֣גֶשׁ אָבִ֑֔יו וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑͏ֽל׃ {פ}
וַיִּֽהְי֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֖ב שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃
Translated: While Israel stayed in that land, Reuben went and lay with Bilhah, his father’s concubine; and Israel found out. Now the sons of Jacob were twelve in number.
Transliteration:
vayehiy vishekhon yisherael vaarets hahiv vayelekhe reuven vayishekhav et-vilehah fiylegesh aviyv vayishema yisherae͏l {f}
vayiheyu veney-yaakov sheneym ashar

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י לֵאָ֔ה בְּכ֥וֹר יַעֲקֹ֖ב רְאוּבֵ֑ן וְשִׁמְעוֹן֙ וְלֵוִ֣י וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וְיִשָּׂשכָ֖ר וּזְבֻלֽוּן׃
Translated: The sons of Leah: Reuben—Jacob’s first-born—Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
Transliteration: veney leah vekhvor yaakov reuven veshimevon veleviy viyhudah veyishashkhar uzevulun

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י רָחֵ֔ל יוֹסֵ֖ף וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
Transliteration: veney rachel yvosef uvineyamin

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י בִלְהָה֙ שִׁפְחַ֣ת רָחֵ֔ל דָּ֖ן וְנַפְתָּלִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Bilhah, Rachel’s maid: Dan and Naphtali.
Transliteration: uveney vilehah shifechat rachel dan venafetaliy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י זִלְפָּ֛ה שִׁפְחַ֥ת לֵאָ֖ה גָּ֣ד וְאָשֵׁ֑ר אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלַּד־ל֖וֹ בְּפַדַּ֥ן אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: And the sons of Zilpah, Leah’s maid: Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob who were born to him in Paddan-aram.
Transliteration: uveney zilefah shifechat leah gad veasher eleh veney yaakov asher yulad-lvo vefadan aram

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־יִצְחָ֣ק אָבִ֔יו מַמְרֵ֖א קִרְיַ֣ת הָֽאַרְבַּ֑ע הִ֣וא חֶבְר֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־גָּֽר־שָׁ֥ם אַבְרָהָ֖ם וְיִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: And Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre, at Kiriath-arba—now Hebron—where Abraham and Isaac had sojourned.
Transliteration: vayavo yaakov el-yitsechak aviyv mamere kireyat haareva hiv chevervon asher-gar-sham averaham veyitsechak

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֖וּ יְמֵ֣י יִצְחָ֑ק מְאַ֥ת שָׁנָ֖ה וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Isaac was a hundred and eighty years old
Transliteration: vayiheyu yemey yitsechak meat shanah ushemoniym shanah

Hebrew: וַיִּגְוַ֨ע יִצְחָ֤ק וַיָּ֙מׇת֙ וַיֵּאָ֣סֶף אֶל־עַמָּ֔יו זָקֵ֖ן וּשְׂבַ֣ע יָמִ֑ים וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ עֵשָׂ֥ו וְיַעֲקֹ֖ב בָּנָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: when he breathed his last and died. He was gathered to his kin in ripe old age; and he was buried by his sons Esau and Jacob.
Transliteration: vayigeva yitsechak vayamׇt vayeasef el-amayv zaken usheva yamiym vayikeveru otvo eshav veyaakov vanayv {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְד֥וֹת עֵשָׂ֖ו ה֥וּא אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: This is the line of Esau—that is, Edom.
Transliteration: veeleh toledvot eshav hu edvom

Hebrew: עֵשָׂ֛ו לָקַ֥ח אֶת־נָשָׁ֖יו מִבְּנ֣וֹת כְּנָ֑עַן אֶת־עָדָ֗ה בַּת־אֵילוֹן֙ הַֽחִתִּ֔י וְאֶת־אׇהֳלִֽיבָמָה֙ בַּת־עֲנָ֔ה בַּת־צִבְע֖וֹן הַֽחִוִּֽי׃
Translated: Esau took his wives from among the Canaanite women—Adah daughter of Elon the Hittite, and Oholibamah daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon the Hivite —
Transliteration: eshav lakach et-nashayv mivenvot khenaan et-adah vat-eylvon hachitiy veet-ׇholiyvamah vat-anah vat-tsivevon hachiviy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בָּשְׂמַ֥ת בַּת־יִשְׁמָעֵ֖אל אֲח֥וֹת נְבָיֽוֹת׃
Translated: and also Basemath daughter of Ishmael and sister of Nebaioth.
Transliteration: veet-vashemat vat-yishemael achvot nevayvot

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֧לֶד עָדָ֛ה לְעֵשָׂ֖ו אֶת־אֱלִיפָ֑ז וּבָ֣שְׂמַ֔ת יָלְדָ֖ה אֶת־רְעוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: Adah bore to Esau Eliphaz; Basemath bore Reuel;
Transliteration: vateled adah leeshav et-eliyfaz uvashemat yaledah et-reuel

Hebrew: וְאׇהֳלִֽיבָמָה֙ יָֽלְדָ֔ה אֶת־[יְע֥וּשׁ] (יעיש) וְאֶת־יַעְלָ֖ם וְאֶת־קֹ֑רַח אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י עֵשָׂ֔ו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלְּדוּ־ל֖וֹ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: and Oholibamah bore Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. Those were the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: veׇholiyvamah yaledah et-[yeush] (yysh) veet-yaelam veet-korach eleh veney eshav asher yuledu-lvo veerets khenaan

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח עֵשָׂ֡ו אֶת־נָ֠שָׁ֠יו וְאֶת־בָּנָ֣יו וְאֶת־בְּנֹתָיו֮ וְאֶת־כׇּל־נַפְשׁ֣וֹת בֵּיתוֹ֒ וְאֶת־מִקְנֵ֣הוּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־בְּהֶמְתּ֗וֹ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־קִנְיָנ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָכַ֖שׁ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ אֶל־אֶ֔רֶץ מִפְּנֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֥ב אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: Esau took his wives, his sons and daughters, and all the members of his household, his cattle and all his livestock, and all the property that he had acquired in the land of Canaan, and went to another land because of his brother Jacob.
Transliteration: vayikach eshav et-nashayv veet-vanayv veet-venotayv veet-khׇl-nafeshvot veytvo veet-mikenehu veet-khׇl-vehemetvo veet khׇl-kineyanvo asher rakhash veerets khenaan vayelekhe el-erets mifeney yaakov achiyv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הָיָ֧ה רְכוּשָׁ֛ם רָ֖ב מִשֶּׁ֣בֶת יַחְדָּ֑ו וְלֹ֨א יָֽכְלָ֜ה אֶ֤רֶץ מְגֽוּרֵיהֶם֙ לָשֵׂ֣את אֹתָ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֖י מִקְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: For their possessions were too many for them to dwell together, and the land where they sojourned could not support them because of their livestock.
Transliteration: khiy-hayah rekhusham rav mishevet yachedav velo yakhelah erets megureyhem lashet otam mifeney mikeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב עֵשָׂו֙ בְּהַ֣ר שֵׂעִ֔יר עֵשָׂ֖ו ה֥וּא אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: So Esau settled in the hill country of Seir—Esau being Edom.
Transliteration: vayeshev eshav vehar sheiyr eshav hu edvom

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תֹּלְד֥וֹת עֵשָׂ֖ו אֲבִ֣י אֱד֑וֹם בְּהַ֖ר שֵׂעִֽיר׃
Translated: This, then, is the line of Esau, the ancestor of the Edomites, in the hill country of Seir.
Transliteration: veeleh toledvot eshav aviy edvom vehar sheiyr

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת בְּנֵֽי־עֵשָׂ֑ו אֱלִיפַ֗ז בֶּן־עָדָה֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת עֵשָׂ֔ו רְעוּאֵ֕ל בֶּן־בָּשְׂמַ֖ת אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz, the son of Esau’s wife Adah; Reuel, the son of Esau’s wife Basemath.
Transliteration: eleh shemvot veney-eshav eliyfaz ven-adah eshet eshav reuel ven-vashemat eshet eshav

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י אֱלִיפָ֑ז תֵּימָ֣ן אוֹמָ֔ר צְפ֥וֹ וְגַעְתָּ֖ם וּקְנַֽז׃
Translated: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney eliyfaz teyman vomar tsefvo vegaetam ukenaz

Hebrew: וְתִמְנַ֣ע ׀ הָיְתָ֣ה פִילֶ֗גֶשׁ לֶֽאֱלִיפַז֙ בֶּן־עֵשָׂ֔ו וַתֵּ֥לֶד לֶאֱלִיפַ֖ז אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֑ק אֵ֕לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י עָדָ֖ה אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: Timna was a concubine of Esau’s son Eliphaz; she bore Amalek to Eliphaz. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Adah.
Transliteration: vetimena hayetah fiylegesh leeliyfaz ven-eshav vateled leeliyfaz et-amalek eleh veney adah eshet eshav

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּנֵ֣י רְעוּאֵ֔ל נַ֥חַת וָזֶ֖רַח שַׁמָּ֣ה וּמִזָּ֑ה אֵ֣לֶּה הָי֔וּ בְּנֵ֥י בָשְׂמַ֖ת אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: And these were the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. Those were the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.
Transliteration: veeleh veney reuel nachat vazerach shamah umizah eleh hayu veney vashemat eshet eshav

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה הָי֗וּ בְּנֵ֨י אׇהֳלִיבָמָ֧ה בַת־עֲנָ֛ה בַּת־צִבְע֖וֹן אֵ֣שֶׁת עֵשָׂ֑ו וַתֵּ֣לֶד לְעֵשָׂ֔ו אֶת־[יְע֥וּשׁ] (יעיש) וְאֶת־יַעְלָ֖ם וְאֶת־קֹֽרַח׃
Translated: And these were the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, daughter of Anah daughter of Zibeon: she bore to Esau Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
Transliteration: veeleh hayu veney ׇholiyvamah vat-anah vat-tsivevon eshet eshav vateled leeshav et-[yeush] (yysh) veet-yaelam veet-korach

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עֵשָׂ֑ו בְּנֵ֤י אֱלִיפַז֙ בְּכ֣וֹר עֵשָׂ֔ו אַלּ֤וּף תֵּימָן֙ אַלּ֣וּף אוֹמָ֔ר אַלּ֥וּף צְפ֖וֹ אַלּ֥וּף קְנַֽז׃
Translated: These are the clans of the sons of Esau. The descendants of Esau’s first-born Eliphaz: the clans Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,
Transliteration: eleh alufey veney-eshav veney eliyfaz vekhvor eshav aluf teyman aluf vomar aluf tsefvo aluf kenaz

Hebrew: אַלּֽוּף־קֹ֛רַח אַלּ֥וּף גַּעְתָּ֖ם אַלּ֣וּף עֲמָלֵ֑ק אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֤י אֱלִיפַז֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֔וֹם אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י עָדָֽה׃
Translated: Korah, Gatam, and Amalek; these are the clans of Eliphaz in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Adah.
Transliteration: aluf-korach aluf gaetam aluf amalek eleh alufey eliyfaz veerets edvom eleh veney adah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה בְּנֵ֤י רְעוּאֵל֙ בֶּן־עֵשָׂ֔ו אַלּ֥וּף נַ֙חַת֙ אַלּ֣וּף זֶ֔רַח אַלּ֥וּף שַׁמָּ֖ה אַלּ֣וּף מִזָּ֑ה אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֤י רְעוּאֵל֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֔וֹם אֵ֕לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י בָשְׂמַ֖ת אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: And these are the descendants of Esau’s son Reuel: the clans Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah; these are the clans of Reuel in the land of Edom. Those are the descendants of Esau’s wife Basemath.
Transliteration: veeleh veney reuel ven-eshav aluf nachat aluf zerach aluf shamah aluf mizah eleh alufey reuel veerets edvom eleh veney vashemat eshet eshav

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה בְּנֵ֤י אׇהֳלִֽיבָמָה֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת עֵשָׂ֔ו אַלּ֥וּף יְע֛וּשׁ אַלּ֥וּף יַעְלָ֖ם אַלּ֣וּף קֹ֑רַח אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֞י אׇהֳלִֽיבָמָ֛ה בַּת־עֲנָ֖ה אֵ֥שֶׁת עֵשָֽׂו׃
Translated: And these are the descendants of Esau’s wife Oholibamah: the clans Jeush, Jalam, and Korah; these are the clans of Esau’s wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.
Transliteration: veeleh veney ׇholiyvamah eshet eshav aluf yeush aluf yaelam aluf korach eleh alufey ׇholiyvamah vat-anah eshet eshav

Hebrew: אֵ֧לֶּה בְנֵי־עֵשָׂ֛ו וְאֵ֥לֶּה אַלּוּפֵיהֶ֖ם ה֥וּא אֱדֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: Those were the sons of Esau—that is, Edom—and those are their clans.
Transliteration: eleh veney-eshav veeleh alufeyhem hu edvom {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה בְנֵֽי־שֵׂעִיר֙ הַחֹרִ֔י יֹשְׁבֵ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ לוֹטָ֥ן וְשׁוֹבָ֖ל וְצִבְע֥וֹן וַעֲנָֽה׃
Translated: These were the sons of Seir the Horite, who were settled in the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
Transliteration: eleh veney-sheiyr hachoriy yoshevey haarets lvotan veshvoval vetsivevon vaanah

Hebrew: וְדִשׁ֥וֹן וְאֵ֖צֶר וְדִישָׁ֑ן אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֧י הַחֹרִ֛י בְּנֵ֥י שֵׂעִ֖יר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, the descendants of Seir, in the land of Edom.
Transliteration: vedishvon veetser vediyshan eleh alufey hachoriy veney sheiyr veerets edvom

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־לוֹטָ֖ן חֹרִ֣י וְהֵימָ֑ם וַאֲח֥וֹת לוֹטָ֖ן תִּמְנָֽע׃
Translated: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-lvotan choriy veheymam vaachvot lvotan timena

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּנֵ֣י שׁוֹבָ֔ל עַלְוָ֥ן וּמָנַ֖חַת וְעֵיבָ֑ל שְׁפ֖וֹ וְאוֹנָֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Shobal were these: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
Transliteration: veeleh veney shvoval alevan umanachat veeyval shefvo vevonam

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־צִבְע֖וֹן וְאַיָּ֣ה וַעֲנָ֑ה ה֣וּא עֲנָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָצָ֤א אֶת־הַיֵּמִם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בִּרְעֹת֥וֹ אֶת־הַחֲמֹרִ֖ים לְצִבְע֥וֹן אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: The sons of Zibeon were these: Aiah and Anah—that was the Anah who discovered the hot springs in the wilderness while pasturing the asses of his father Zibeon.
Transliteration: veeleh veney-tsivevon veayah vaanah hu anah asher matsa et-hayemim vamidevar vireotvo et-hachamoriym letsivevon aviyv

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־עֲנָ֖ה דִּשֹׁ֑ן וְאׇהֳלִיבָמָ֖ה בַּת־עֲנָֽה׃
Translated: The children of Anah were these: Dishon and Anah’s daughter Oholibamah.
Transliteration: veeleh veney-anah dishon veׇholiyvamah vat-anah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י דִישָׁ֑ן חֶמְדָּ֥ן וְאֶשְׁבָּ֖ן וְיִתְרָ֥ן וּכְרָֽן׃
Translated: The sons of Dishon were these: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
Transliteration: veeleh veney diyshan chemedan veeshevan veyiteran ukheran

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵי־אֵ֑צֶר בִּלְהָ֥ן וְזַעֲוָ֖ן וַעֲקָֽן׃
Translated: The sons of Ezer were these: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.
Transliteration: eleh veney-etser vilehan vezaavan vaakan

Hebrew: אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־דִישָׁ֖ן ע֥וּץ וַאֲרָֽן׃
Translated: And the sons of Dishan were these: Uz and Aran.
Transliteration: eleh veney-diyshan uts vaaran

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֣י הַחֹרִ֑י אַלּ֤וּף לוֹטָן֙ אַלּ֣וּף שׁוֹבָ֔ל אַלּ֥וּף צִבְע֖וֹן אַלּ֥וּף עֲנָֽה׃
Translated: These are the clans of the Horites: the clans Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
Transliteration: eleh alufey hachoriy aluf lvotan aluf shvoval aluf tsivevon aluf anah

Hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף דִּשֹׁ֛ן אַלּ֥וּף אֵ֖צֶר אַלּ֣וּף דִּישָׁ֑ן אֵ֣לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֧י הַחֹרִ֛י לְאַלֻּפֵיהֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ שֵׂעִֽיר׃ {פ}
Translated: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. Those are the clans of the Horites, clan by clan, in the land of Seir.
Transliteration: aluf dishon aluf etser aluf diyshan eleh alufey hachoriy lealufeyhem veerets sheiyr {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ הַמְּלָכִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָלְכ֖וּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֑וֹם לִפְנֵ֥י מְלׇךְ־מֶ֖לֶךְ לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites.
Transliteration: veeleh hamelakhiym asher malekhu veerets edvom lifeney melׇkhe-melekhe liveney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ בֶּאֱד֔וֹם בֶּ֖לַע בֶּן־בְּע֑וֹר וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ דִּנְהָֽבָה׃
Translated: Bela son of Beor reigned in Edom, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
Transliteration: vayimelokhe veedvom vela ven-vevor veshem iyrvo dinehavah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת בָּ֑לַע וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו יוֹבָ֥ב בֶּן־זֶ֖רַח מִבׇּצְרָֽה׃
Translated: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah, from Bozrah, succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt vala vayimelokhe tachetayv yvovav ven-zerach mivׇtserah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת יוֹבָ֑ב וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו חֻשָׁ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ הַתֵּימָנִֽי׃
Translated: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt yvovav vayimelokhe tachetayv chusham meerets hateymaniy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת חֻשָׁ֑ם וַיִּמְלֹ֨ךְ תַּחְתָּ֜יו הֲדַ֣ד בֶּן־בְּדַ֗ד הַמַּכֶּ֤ה אֶת־מִדְיָן֙ בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה מוֹאָ֔ב וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ עֲוִֽית׃
Translated: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated the Midianites in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Avith.
Transliteration: vayamׇt chusham vayimelokhe tachetayv hadad ven-vedad hamakheh et-mideyan vishedeh mvoav veshem iyrvo aviyt

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת הֲדָ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו שַׂמְלָ֖ה מִמַּשְׂרֵקָֽה׃
Translated: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt hadad vayimelokhe tachetayv shamelah mimasherekah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת שַׂמְלָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו שָׁא֖וּל מֵרְחֹב֥וֹת הַנָּהָֽר׃
Translated: When Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-on-the-river succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt shamelah vayimelokhe tachetayv shaul merechovvot hanahar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת שָׁא֑וּל וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו בַּ֥עַל חָנָ֖ן בֶּן־עַכְבּֽוֹר׃
Translated: When Saul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt shaul vayimelokhe tachetayv vaal chanan ven-akhevvor

Hebrew: וַיָּ֘מׇת֮ בַּ֣עַל חָנָ֣ן בֶּן־עַכְבּוֹר֒ וַיִּמְלֹ֤ךְ תַּחְתָּיו֙ הֲדַ֔ר וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ פָּ֑עוּ וְשֵׁ֨ם אִשְׁתּ֤וֹ מְהֵֽיטַבְאֵל֙ בַּת־מַטְרֵ֔ד בַּ֖ת מֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
Translated: And when Baal-hanan son of Achbor died, Hadar succeeded him as king; the name of his city was Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred daughter of Me-zahab.
Transliteration: vayamׇt vaal chanan ven-akhevvor vayimelokhe tachetayv hadar veshem iyrvo fau veshem ishetvo meheytaveel vat-matered vat mey zahav

Hebrew: וְ֠אֵ֠לֶּה שְׁמ֞וֹת אַלּוּפֵ֤י עֵשָׂו֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם לִמְקֹמֹתָ֖ם בִּשְׁמֹתָ֑ם אַלּ֥וּף תִּמְנָ֛ע אַלּ֥וּף עַֽלְוָ֖ה אַלּ֥וּף יְתֵֽת׃
Translated: These are the names of the clans of Esau, each with its families and locality, name by name: the clans Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot alufey eshav lemishefechotam limekomotam vishemotam aluf timena aluf alevah aluf yetet

Hebrew: אַלּ֧וּף אׇהֳלִיבָמָ֛ה אַלּ֥וּף אֵלָ֖ה אַלּ֥וּף פִּינֹֽן׃
Translated: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
Transliteration: aluf ׇholiyvamah aluf elah aluf fiynon

Hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף קְנַ֛ז אַלּ֥וּף תֵּימָ֖ן אַלּ֥וּף מִבְצָֽר׃
Translated: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
Transliteration: aluf kenaz aluf teyman aluf mivetsar
