Hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף מַגְדִּיאֵ֖ל אַלּ֣וּף עִירָ֑ם אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ אַלּוּפֵ֣י אֱד֗וֹם לְמֹֽשְׁבֹתָם֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֲחֻזָּתָ֔ם ה֥וּא עֵשָׂ֖ו אֲבִ֥י אֱדֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated: Magdiel, and Iram. Those are the clans of Edom—that is, of Esau, father of the Edomites—by their settlements in the land which they hold.
Transliteration: aluf magediyel aluf iyram eleh alufey edvom lemoshevotam veerets achuzatam hu eshav aviy edvom {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב יַעֲקֹ֔ב בְּאֶ֖רֶץ מְגוּרֵ֣י אָבִ֑יו בְּאֶ֖רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: Now Jacob was settled in the land where his father had sojourned, the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayeshev yaakov veerets megurey aviyv veerets khenaan

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ תֹּלְד֣וֹת יַעֲקֹ֗ב יוֹסֵ֞ף בֶּן־שְׁבַֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה שָׁנָה֙ הָיָ֨ה רֹעֶ֤ה אֶת־אֶחָיו֙ בַּצֹּ֔אן וְה֣וּא נַ֗עַר אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י בִלְהָ֛ה וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י זִלְפָּ֖ה נְשֵׁ֣י אָבִ֑יו וַיָּבֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־דִּבָּתָ֥ם רָעָ֖ה אֶל־אֲבִיהֶֽם׃

Translated: Now Israel loved Joseph best of all his sons—he was his “child of old age”; and he had made him an ornamented tunic.

Translated: And when his brothers saw that their father loved him more than any of his brothers, they hated him so that they could not speak a friendly word to him.

Translated: Once Joseph had a dream which he told to his brothers; and they hated him even more.

Translated: He said to them, “Hear this dream which I have dreamed:

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ אֶחָ֔יו הֲמָלֹ֤ךְ תִּמְלֹךְ֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ אִם־מָשׁ֥וֹל תִּמְשֹׁ֖ל בָּ֑נוּ וַיּוֹסִ֤פוּ עוֹד֙ שְׂנֹ֣א אֹת֔וֹ עַל־חֲלֹמֹתָ֖יו וְעַל־דְּבָרָֽיו׃
Translated: His brothers answered, “Do you mean to reign over us? Do you mean to rule over us?” And they hated him even more for his talk about his dreams.

Translated: He dreamed another dream and told it to his brothers, saying, “Look, I have had another dream: And this time, the sun, the moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”

Translated: And when he told it to his father and brothers, his father berated him. “What,” he said to him, “is this dream you have dreamed? Are we to come, I and your mother and your brothers, and bow low to you to the ground?”

Transliteration: vayelekhu echayv lirevot et-tson aviyhem vishekhem

Translated: Israel said to Joseph, “Your brothers are pasturing at Shechem. Come, I will send you to them.” He answered, “I am ready.”

Translated: And he said to him, “Go and see how your brothers are and how the flocks are faring, and bring me back word.” So he sent him from the valley of Hebron. When he reached Shechem,

Translated: The man said, “They have gone from here, for I heard them say: Let us go to Dothan.” So Joseph followed his brothers and found them at Dothan.

Translated: Come now, let us kill him and throw him into one of the pits; and we can say, ‘A savage beast devoured him.’ We shall see what comes of his dreams!”
Transliteration: veatah lekhu venaharegehu venashelikhehu veachad havorvot veamarenu chayah raah akhalatehu venireeh mah-yiheyu chalomotayv

Translated: And Reuben went on, “Shed no blood! Cast him into that pit out in the wilderness, but do not touch him yourselves”—intending to save him from them and restore him to his father.

Translated: and took him and cast him into the pit. The pit was empty; there was no water in it.

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁבוּ֮ לֶֽאֱכׇל־לֶ֒חֶם֒ וַיִּשְׂא֤וּ עֵֽינֵיהֶם֙ וַיִּרְא֔וּ וְהִנֵּה֙ אֹרְחַ֣ת יִשְׁמְעֵאלִ֔ים בָּאָ֖ה מִגִּלְעָ֑ד וּגְמַלֵּיהֶ֣ם נֹֽשְׂאִ֗ים נְכֹאת֙ וּצְרִ֣י וָלֹ֔ט הוֹלְכִ֖ים לְהוֹרִ֥יד מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: Then they sat down to a meal. Looking up, they saw a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead, their camels bearing gum, balm, and ladanum to be taken to Egypt.

Translated: Then Judah said to his brothers, “What do we gain by killing our brother and covering up his blood?
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah el-echayv mah-vetsa khiy naharog et-achiynu vekhisiynu et-damvo

Translated: Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, but let us not do away with him ourselves. After all, he is our brother, our own flesh.” His brothers agreed.

Translated: When Midianite traders passed by, they pulled Joseph up out of the pit. They sold Joseph for twenty pieces of silver to the Ishmaelites, who brought Joseph to Egypt.

Translated: When Reuben returned to the pit and saw that Joseph was not in the pit, he rent his clothes.

Translated: Returning to his brothers, he said, “The boy is gone! Now, what am I to do?”
Transliteration: vayashׇv el-echayv vayomar hayeled eynenu vaaniy anah aniy-va

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֖וּ אֶת־כְּתֹ֣נֶת יוֹסֵ֑ף וַֽיִּשְׁחֲטוּ֙ שְׂעִ֣יר עִזִּ֔ים וַיִּטְבְּל֥וּ אֶת־הַכֻּתֹּ֖נֶת בַּדָּֽם׃
Translated: Then they took Joseph’s tunic, slaughtered a kid, and dipped the tunic in the blood.
Transliteration: vayikechu et-khetonet yvosef vayishechatu sheiyr iziym vayitevelu et-hakhutonet vadam

Hebrew: וַֽיְשַׁלְּח֞וּ אֶת־כְּתֹ֣נֶת הַפַּסִּ֗ים וַיָּבִ֙יאוּ֙ אֶל־אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ זֹ֣את מָצָ֑אנוּ הַכֶּר־נָ֗א הַכְּתֹ֧נֶת בִּנְךָ֛ הִ֖וא אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translated: They had the ornamented tunic taken to their father, and they said, “We found this. Please examine it; is it your son’s tunic or not?”
Transliteration: vayeshalechu et-khetonet hafasiym vayaviyu el-aviyhem vayomeru zot matsanu hakher-na hakhetonet vinekha hiv im-lo

Hebrew: וַיַּכִּירָ֤הּ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כְּתֹ֣נֶת בְּנִ֔י חַיָּ֥ה רָעָ֖ה אֲכָלָ֑תְהוּ טָרֹ֥ף טֹרַ֖ף יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: He recognized it, and said, “My son’s tunic! A savage beast devoured him! Joseph was torn by a beast!”
Transliteration: vayakhiyrah vayomer khetonet veniy chayah raah akhalatehu tarof toraf yvosef

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרַ֤ע יַעֲקֹב֙ שִׂמְלֹתָ֔יו וַיָּ֥שֶׂם שַׂ֖ק בְּמׇתְנָ֑יו וַיִּתְאַבֵּ֥ל עַל־בְּנ֖וֹ יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
Translated: Jacob rent his clothes, put sackcloth on his loins, and observed mourning for his son many days.
Transliteration: vayikera yaakov shimelotayv vayashem shak vemׇtenayv vayiteavel al-venvo yamiym raviym

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֩מוּ֩ כׇל־בָּנָ֨יו וְכׇל־בְּנֹתָ֜יו לְנַחֲמ֗וֹ וַיְמָאֵן֙ לְהִתְנַחֵ֔ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר כִּֽי־אֵרֵ֧ד אֶל־בְּנִ֛י אָבֵ֖ל שְׁאֹ֑לָה וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ אֹת֖וֹ אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: All his sons and daughters sought to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted, saying, “No, I will go down mourning to my son in Sheol.” Thus his father bewailed him.
Transliteration: vayakumu khׇl-vanayv vekhׇl-venotayv lenachamvo vayemaen lehitenachem vayomer khiy-ered el-veniy avel sheolah vayevekhe otvo aviyv

Hebrew: וְהַ֨מְּדָנִ֔ים מָכְר֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־מִצְרָ֑יִם לְפֽוֹטִיפַר֙ סְרִ֣יס פַּרְעֹ֔ה שַׂ֖ר הַטַּבָּחִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: The Midianites, meanwhile, sold him in Egypt to Potiphar, a courtier of Pharaoh and his prefect.
Transliteration: vehamedaniym makheru otvo el-mitserayiim lefvotiyfar seriys fareoh shar hatavachiym {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא וַיֵּ֥רֶד יְהוּדָ֖ה מֵאֵ֣ת אֶחָ֑יו וַיֵּ֛ט עַד־אִ֥ישׁ עֲדֻלָּמִ֖י וּשְׁמ֥וֹ חִירָֽה׃
Translated: About that time Judah left his brothers and camped near a certain Adullamite whose name was Hirah.
Transliteration: vayehiy vaet hahiv vayered yehudah meet echayv vayet ad-iysh adulamiy ushemvo chiyrah

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא־שָׁ֧ם יְהוּדָ֛ה בַּת־אִ֥ישׁ כְּנַעֲנִ֖י וּשְׁמ֣וֹ שׁ֑וּעַ וַיִּקָּחֶ֖הָ וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: There Judah saw the daughter of a certain Canaanite whose name was Shua, and he took her [into his household as wife] and cohabited with her.
Transliteration: vayare-sham yehudah vat-iysh khenaaniy ushemvo shua vayikacheha vayavo eleyha

Hebrew: וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ עֵֽר׃
Translated: She conceived and bore a son, and he named him Er.
Transliteration: vatahar vateled ven vayikera et-shemvo er

Hebrew: וַתַּ֥הַר ע֖וֹד וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ אוֹנָֽן׃
Translated: She conceived again and bore a son, and named him Onan.
Transliteration: vatahar vod vateled ven vatikera et-shemvo vonan

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤סֶף עוֹד֙ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שֵׁלָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה בִכְזִ֖יב בְּלִדְתָּ֥הּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Once again she bore a son, and named him Shelah; he was at Chezib when she bore him.
Transliteration: vatosef vod vateled ven vatikera et-shemvo shelah vehayah vikheziyv velidetah otvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֧ח יְהוּדָ֛ה אִשָּׁ֖ה לְעֵ֣ר בְּכוֹר֑וֹ וּשְׁמָ֖הּ תָּמָֽר׃
Translated: Judah got a wife for Er his first-born; her name was Tamar.
Transliteration: vayikach yehudah ishah leer vekhvorvo ushemah tamar

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י עֵ֚ר בְּכ֣וֹר יְהוּדָ֔ה רַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְמִתֵ֖הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But Er, Judah’s first-born, was displeasing to יהוה, and יהוה took his life.
Transliteration: vayehiy er vekhvor yehudah ra veeyney yehovah vayemitehu yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוּדָה֙ לְאוֹנָ֔ן בֹּ֛א אֶל־אֵ֥שֶׁת אָחִ֖יךָ וְיַבֵּ֣ם אֹתָ֑הּ וְהָקֵ֥ם זֶ֖רַע לְאָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: Then Judah said to Onan, “Join with your brother’s wife and do your duty by her as a brother-in-law, and provide offspring for your brother.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah levonan vo el-eshet achiykha veyavem otah vehakem zera leachiykha

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣דַע אוֹנָ֔ן כִּ֛י לֹּ֥א ל֖וֹ יִהְיֶ֣ה הַזָּ֑רַע וְהָיָ֞ה אִם־בָּ֨א אֶל־אֵ֤שֶׁת אָחִיו֙ וְשִׁחֵ֣ת אַ֔רְצָה לְבִלְתִּ֥י נְתׇן־זֶ֖רַע לְאָחִֽיו׃
Translated: But Onan, knowing that the offspring would not count as his, let [the semen] go to waste whenever he joined with his brother’s wife, so as not to provide offspring for his brother.
Transliteration: vayeda vonan khiy lo lvo yiheyeh hazara vehayah im-va el-eshet achiyv veshichet aretsah leviletiy netׇn-zera leachiyv

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֛רַע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה וַיָּ֖מֶת גַּם־אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: What he did was displeasing to יהוה, who took his life also.
Transliteration: vayera veeyney yehovah asher ashah vayamet gam-otvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָה֩ לְתָמָ֨ר כַּלָּת֜וֹ שְׁבִ֧י אַלְמָנָ֣ה בֵית־אָבִ֗יךְ עַד־יִגְדַּל֙ שֵׁלָ֣ה בְנִ֔י כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר פֶּן־יָמ֥וּת גַּם־ה֖וּא כְּאֶחָ֑יו וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ תָּמָ֔ר וַתֵּ֖שֶׁב בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיהָ׃
Translated: Then Judah said to his daughter-in-law Tamar, “Stay as a widow in your father’s house until my son Shelah grows up”—for he thought, “He too might die like his brothers.” So Tamar went to live in her father’s house.
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah letamar khalatvo sheviy alemanah veyt-aviykhe ad-yigedal shelah veniy khiy amar fen-yamut gam-hu kheechayv vatelekhe tamar vateshev veyt aviyha

Hebrew: וַיִּרְבּוּ֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וַתָּ֖מׇת בַּת־שׁ֣וּעַ אֵֽשֶׁת־יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיַּ֜עַל עַל־גֹּֽזְזֵ֤י צֹאנוֹ֙ ה֗וּא וְחִירָ֛ה רֵעֵ֥הוּ הָעֲדֻלָּמִ֖י תִּמְנָֽתָה׃
Translated: A long time afterward, Shua’s daughter, the wife of Judah, died. When his period of mourning was over, Judah went up to Timnah to his sheepshearers, together with his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
Transliteration: vayirevu hayamiym vatamׇt vat-shua eshet-yehudah vayinachem yehudah vayaal al-gozezey tsonvo hu vechiyrah reehu haadulamiy timenatah

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֥ד לְתָמָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֥ה חָמִ֛יךְ עֹלֶ֥ה תִמְנָ֖תָה לָגֹ֥ז צֹאנֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Tamar was told, “Your father-in-law is coming up to Timnah for the sheepshearing.”
Transliteration: vayugad letamar lemor hineh chamiykhe oleh timenatah lagoz tsonvo

Hebrew: וַתָּ֩סַר֩ בִּגְדֵ֨י אַלְמְנוּתָ֜הּ מֵֽעָלֶ֗יהָ וַתְּכַ֤ס בַּצָּעִיף֙ וַתִּתְעַלָּ֔ף וַתֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בְּפֶ֣תַח עֵינַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־דֶּ֣רֶךְ תִּמְנָ֑תָה כִּ֤י רָאֲתָה֙ כִּֽי־גָדַ֣ל שֵׁלָ֔ה וְהִ֕וא לֹֽא־נִתְּנָ֥ה ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: So she took off her widow’s garb, covered her face with a veil, and, wrapping herself up, sat down at the entrance to Enaim, which is on the road to Timnah; for she saw that Shelah was grown up, yet she had not been given to him as wife.
Transliteration: vatasar vigedey alemenutah mealeyha vatekhas vatsaiyf vatitealaf vateshev vefetach eynayiim asher al-derekhe timenatah khiy raatah khiy-gadal shelah vehiv lo-nitenah lvo leishah

Hebrew: וַיִּרְאֶ֣הָ יְהוּדָ֔ה וַֽיַּחְשְׁבֶ֖הָ לְזוֹנָ֑ה כִּ֥י כִסְּתָ֖ה פָּנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: When Judah saw her, he took her for a harlot; for she had covered her face.
Transliteration: vayireeha yehudah vayachesheveha lezvonah khiy khisetah faneyha

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט אֵלֶ֜יהָ אֶל־הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָֽבָה־נָּא֙ אָב֣וֹא אֵלַ֔יִךְ כִּ֚י לֹ֣א יָדַ֔ע כִּ֥י כַלָּת֖וֹ הִ֑וא וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ מַה־תִּתֶּן־לִ֔י כִּ֥י תָב֖וֹא אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: So he turned aside to her by the road and said, “Here, let me sleep with you”—for he did not know that she was his daughter-in-law. “What,” she asked, “will you pay for sleeping with me?”
Transliteration: vayet eleyha el-haderekhe vayomer havah-na avvo elayiikhe khiy lo yada khiy khalatvo hiv vatomer mah-titen-liy khiy tavvo elay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֛י אֲשַׁלַּ֥ח גְּדִֽי־עִזִּ֖ים מִן־הַצֹּ֑אן וַתֹּ֕אמֶר אִם־תִּתֵּ֥ן עֵרָב֖וֹן עַ֥ד שׇׁלְחֶֽךָ׃
Translated: He replied, “I will send a kid from my flock.” But she said, “You must leave a pledge until you have sent it.”
Transliteration: vayomer anokhiy ashalach gediy-iziym min-hatson vatomer im-titen eravvon ad shׇlechekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָ֣ה הָעֵֽרָבוֹן֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶתֶּן־לָךְ֒ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר חֹתָֽמְךָ֙ וּפְתִילֶ֔ךָ וּמַטְּךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וַיִּתֶּן־לָ֛הּ וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ וַתַּ֥הַר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And he said, “What pledge shall I give you?” She replied, “Your seal and cord, and the staff which you carry.” So he gave them to her and slept with her, and she conceived by him.
Transliteration: vayomer mah haeravvon asher eten-lakhe vatomer chotamekha ufetiylekha umatekha asher veyadekha vayiten-lah vayavo eleyha vatahar lvo

Hebrew: וַתָּ֣קׇם וַתֵּ֔לֶךְ וַתָּ֥סַר צְעִיפָ֖הּ מֵעָלֶ֑יהָ וַתִּלְבַּ֖שׁ בִּגְדֵ֥י אַלְמְנוּתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Then she went on her way. She took off her veil and again put on her widow’s garb.
Transliteration: vatakׇm vatelekhe vatasar tseiyfah mealeyha vatilevash vigedey alemenutah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח יְהוּדָ֜ה אֶת־גְּדִ֣י הָֽעִזִּ֗ים בְּיַד֙ רֵעֵ֣הוּ הָֽעֲדֻלָּמִ֔י לָקַ֥חַת הָעֵרָב֖וֹן מִיַּ֣ד הָאִשָּׁ֑ה וְלֹ֖א מְצָאָֽהּ׃
Translated: Judah sent the kid by his friend the Adullamite, to redeem the pledge from the woman; but he could not find her.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehudah et-gediy haiziym veyad reehu haadulamiy lakachat haeravvon miyad haishah velo metsaah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֞ל אֶת־אַנְשֵׁ֤י מְקֹמָהּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַיֵּ֧ה הַקְּדֵשָׁ֛ה הִ֥וא בָעֵינַ֖יִם עַל־הַדָּ֑רֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ לֹא־הָיְתָ֥ה בָזֶ֖ה קְדֵשָֽׁה׃
Translated: He inquired of the council of that locale, “Where is the prostitute, the one at Enaim, by the road?” But they said, “There has been no prostitute here.”
Transliteration: vayisheal et-aneshey mekomah lemor ayeh hakedeshah hiv vaeynayiim al-hadarekhe vayomeru lo-hayetah vazeh kedeshah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ אֶל־יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹ֣א מְצָאתִ֑יהָ וְגַ֨ם אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמָּקוֹם֙ אָֽמְר֔וּ לֹא־הָיְתָ֥ה בָזֶ֖ה קְדֵשָֽׁה׃
Translated: So he returned to Judah and said, “I could not find her; moreover, the local council said: There has been no prostitute here.”
Transliteration: vayashׇv el-yehudah vayomer lo metsatiyha vegam aneshey hamakvom ameru lo-hayetah vazeh kedeshah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוּדָה֙ תִּֽקַּֽח־לָ֔הּ פֶּ֖ן נִהְיֶ֣ה לָב֑וּז הִנֵּ֤ה שָׁלַ֙חְתִּי֙ הַגְּדִ֣י הַזֶּ֔ה וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֥א מְצָאתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Judah said, “Let her keep them, lest we become a laughingstock. I did send her this kid, but you did not find her.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah tikach-lah fen niheyeh lavuz hineh shalachetiy hagediy hazeh veatah lo metsatah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּמִשְׁלֹ֣שׁ חֳדָשִׁ֗ים וַיֻּגַּ֨ד לִֽיהוּדָ֤ה לֵאמֹר֙ זָֽנְתָה֙ תָּמָ֣ר כַּלָּתֶ֔ךָ וְגַ֛ם הִנֵּ֥ה הָרָ֖ה לִזְנוּנִ֑ים וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָ֔ה הוֹצִיא֖וּהָ וְתִשָּׂרֵֽף׃
Translated: About three months later, Judah was told, “Your daughter-in-law Tamar has played the harlot; in fact, she is pregnant from harlotry.” “Bring her out,” said Judah. “She should be burned!”
Transliteration: vayehiy khemishelosh chodashiym vayugad liyhudah lemor zanetah tamar khalatekha vegam hineh harah lizenuniym vayomer yehudah hvotsiyuha vetisharef

Hebrew: הִ֣וא מוּצֵ֗את וְהִ֨יא שָׁלְחָ֤ה אֶל־חָמִ֙יהָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁר־אֵ֣לֶּה לּ֔וֹ אָנֹכִ֖י הָרָ֑ה וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַכֶּר־נָ֔א לְמִ֞י הַחֹתֶ֧מֶת וְהַפְּתִילִ֛ים וְהַמַּטֶּ֖ה הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: As she was being brought out, she sent this message to her father-in-law, “It’s by the man to whom these belong that I’m pregnant.” And she added, “Examine these: whose seal and cord and staff are these?”
Transliteration: hiv mutset vehiy shalechah el-chamiyha lemor leiysh asher-eleh lvo anokhiy harah vatomer hakher-na lemiy hachotemet vehafetiyliym vehamateh haeleh

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֣ר יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ צָֽדְקָ֣ה מִמֶּ֔נִּי כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֥ן לֹא־נְתַתִּ֖יהָ לְשֵׁלָ֣ה בְנִ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָסַ֥ף ע֖וֹד לְדַעְתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Judah recognized them, and said, “She is more in the right than I, inasmuch as I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he was not intimate with her again.
Transliteration: vayakher yehudah vayomer tsadekah mimeniy khiy-al-khen lo-netatiyha leshelah veniy velo-yasaf vod ledaetah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י בְּעֵ֣ת לִדְתָּ֑הּ וְהִנֵּ֥ה תְאוֹמִ֖ים בְּבִטְנָֽהּ׃
Translated: When the time came for her to give birth, there were twins in her womb!
Transliteration: vayehiy veet lidetah vehineh tevomiym vevitenah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בְלִדְתָּ֖הּ וַיִּתֶּן־יָ֑ד וַתִּקַּ֣ח הַמְיַלֶּ֗דֶת וַתִּקְשֹׁ֨ר עַל־יָד֤וֹ שָׁנִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר זֶ֖ה יָצָ֥א רִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: While she was in labor, one of them put out a hand, and the midwife tied a crimson thread on that hand, to signify: This one came out first.
Transliteration: vayehiy velidetah vayiten-yad vatikach hameyaledet vatikeshor al-yadvo shaniy lemor zeh yatsa rishonah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּמֵשִׁ֣יב יָד֗וֹ וְהִנֵּה֙ יָצָ֣א אָחִ֔יו וַתֹּ֕אמֶר מַה־פָּרַ֖צְתָּ עָלֶ֣יךָ פָּ֑רֶץ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ פָּֽרֶץ׃
Translated: But just then it drew back its hand, and out came its brother; and she said, “What a breach you have made for yourself!” So he was named Perez.
Transliteration: vayehiy khemeshiyv yadvo vehineh yatsa achiyv vatomer mah-faratseta aleykha farets vayikera shemvo farets

Hebrew: וְאַחַר֙ יָצָ֣א אָחִ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־יָד֖וֹ הַשָּׁנִ֑י וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ זָֽרַח׃ {ס}
Translated: Afterward his brother came out, on whose hand was the crimson thread; he was named Zerah.
Transliteration: veachar yatsa achiyv asher al-yadvo hashaniy vayikera shemvo zarach {s}

Hebrew: וְיוֹסֵ֖ף הוּרַ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וַיִּקְנֵ֡הוּ פּוֹטִיפַר֩ סְרִ֨יס פַּרְעֹ֜ה שַׂ֤ר הַטַּבָּחִים֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י מִיַּד֙ הַיִּשְׁמְעֵאלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹרִדֻ֖הוּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: When Joseph was taken down to Egypt, Potiphar, a courtier of Pharaoh and his prefect —a [type of] Egyptian official —bought him from the Ishmaelites who had brought him there.
Transliteration: veyvosef hurad mitserayemah vayikenehu fvotiyfar seriys fareoh shar hatavachiym iysh mitseriy miyad hayishemeeliym asher hvoriduhu shamah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיְהִ֖י אִ֣ישׁ מַצְלִ֑יחַ וַיְהִ֕י בְּבֵ֖ית אֲדֹנָ֥יו הַמִּצְרִֽי׃
Translated: יהוה was with Joseph, and he was a successful man; and he stayed in the house of his Egyptian master.
Transliteration: vayehiy yehovah et-yvosef vayehiy iysh matseliycha vayehiy veveyt adonayv hamitseriy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא אֲדֹנָ֔יו כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אִתּ֑וֹ וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁר־ה֣וּא עֹשֶׂ֔ה יְהֹוָ֖ה מַצְלִ֥יחַ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when his master saw that יהוה was with him and that יהוה lent success to everything he undertook,
Transliteration: vayare adonayv khiy yehovah itvo vekhol asher-hu osheh yehovah matseliycha veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיִּמְצָ֨א יוֹסֵ֥ף חֵ֛ן בְּעֵינָ֖יו וַיְשָׁ֣רֶת אֹת֑וֹ וַיַּפְקִדֵ֙הוּ֙ עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ וְכׇל־יֶשׁ־ל֖וֹ נָתַ֥ן בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: he took a liking to Joseph. He made him his personal attendant and put him in charge of his household, placing in his hands all that he owned.
Transliteration: vayimetsa yvosef chen veeynayv vayesharet otvo vayafekidehu al-veytvo vekhׇl-yesh-lvo natan veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י מֵאָז֩ הִפְקִ֨יד אֹת֜וֹ בְּבֵית֗וֹ וְעַל֙ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶשׁ־ל֔וֹ וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית הַמִּצְרִ֖י בִּגְלַ֣ל יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְהִ֞י בִּרְכַּ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ בְּכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶשׁ־ל֔וֹ בַּבַּ֖יִת וּבַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: And from the time that the Egyptian put him in charge of his household and of all that he owned, יהוה blessed his house for Joseph’s sake, so that the blessing of יהוה was upon everything that he owned, in the house and outside.
Transliteration: vayehiy meaz hifekiyd otvo veveytvo veal khׇl-asher yesh-lvo vayevarekhe yehovah et-veyt hamitseriy vigelal yvosef vayehiy virekhat yehovah vekhׇl-asher yesh-lvo vavayiit uvashadeh

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲזֹ֣ב כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֮ בְּיַד־יוֹסֵף֒ וְלֹא־יָדַ֤ע אִתּוֹ֙ מְא֔וּמָה כִּ֥י אִם־הַלֶּ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁר־ה֣וּא אוֹכֵ֑ל וַיְהִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף יְפֵה־תֹ֖אַר וִיפֵ֥ה מַרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: He left all that he had in Joseph’s hands and, with him there, he paid attention to nothing save the food that he ate. Now Joseph was well built and handsome.
Transliteration: vayaazov khׇl-asher-lvo veyad-yvosef velo-yada itvo meumah khiy im-halechem asher-hu vokhel vayehiy yvosef yefeh-toar viyfeh mareeh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַתִּשָּׂ֧א אֵֽשֶׁת־אֲדֹנָ֛יו אֶת־עֵינֶ֖יהָ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף וַתֹּ֖אמֶר שִׁכְבָ֥ה עִמִּֽי׃
Translated: After a time, his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph and said, “Lie with me.”
Transliteration: vayehiy achar hadevariym haeleh vatisha eshet-adonayv et-eyneyha el-yvosef vatomer shikhevah imiy

Hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֓ן ׀ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֵ֣שֶׁת אֲדֹנָ֔יו הֵ֣ן אֲדֹנִ֔י לֹא־יָדַ֥ע אִתִּ֖י מַה־בַּבָּ֑יִת וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יֶשׁ־ל֖וֹ נָתַ֥ן בְּיָדִֽי׃
Translated: But he refused. He said to his master’s wife, “Look, with me here, my master gives no thought to anything in this house, and all that he owns he has placed in my hands.
Transliteration: vayemaen vayomer el-eshet adonayv hen adoniy lo-yada itiy mah-vavayiit vekhol asher-yesh-lvo natan veyadiy

Hebrew: אֵינֶ֨נּוּ גָד֜וֹל בַּבַּ֣יִת הַזֶּה֮ מִמֶּ֒נִּי֒ וְלֹֽא־חָשַׂ֤ךְ מִמֶּ֙נִּי֙ מְא֔וּמָה כִּ֥י אִם־אוֹתָ֖ךְ בַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתְּ־אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֨יךְ אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֜ה הָרָעָ֤ה הַגְּדֹלָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את וְחָטָ֖אתִי לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: He wields no more authority in this house than I, and he has withheld nothing from me except yourself, since you are his wife. How then could I do this most wicked thing, and sin before God?”
Transliteration: eynenu gadvol vavayiit hazeh mimeniy velo-chashakhe mimeniy meumah khiy im-votakhe vaasher ate-ishetvo veeykhe eesheh haraah hagedolah hazot vechatatiy lelohiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כְּדַבְּרָ֥הּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף י֣וֹם <small>׀</small> י֑וֹם וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע אֵלֶ֛יהָ לִשְׁכַּ֥ב אֶצְלָ֖הּ לִהְי֥וֹת עִמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And much as she coaxed Joseph day after day, he did not yield to her request to lie beside her, to be with her.
Transliteration: vayehiy khedaverah el-yvosef yvom <small></small> yvom velo-shama eleyha lishekhav etselah liheyvot imah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כְּהַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֥א הַבַּ֖יְתָה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת מְלַאכְתּ֑וֹ וְאֵ֨ין אִ֜ישׁ מֵאַנְשֵׁ֥י הַבַּ֛יִת שָׁ֖ם בַּבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: One such day, he came into the house to do his work. None of the household being there inside,
Transliteration: vayehiy khehayyvom hazeh vayavo havayetah laashvot melakhetvo veeyn iysh meaneshey havayiit sham vavayiit

Hebrew: וַתִּתְפְּשֵׂ֧הוּ בְּבִגְד֛וֹ לֵאמֹ֖ר שִׁכְבָ֣ה עִמִּ֑י וַיַּעֲזֹ֤ב בִּגְדוֹ֙ בְּיָדָ֔הּ וַיָּ֖נׇס וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַחֽוּצָה׃
Translated: she caught hold of him by his garment and said, “Lie with me!” But he left his garment in her hand and got away and fled outside.
Transliteration: vatitefeshehu vevigedvo lemor shikhevah imiy vayaazov vigedvo veyadah vayanׇs vayetse hachutsah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּרְאוֹתָ֔הּ כִּֽי־עָזַ֥ב בִּגְד֖וֹ בְּיָדָ֑הּ וַיָּ֖נׇס הַחֽוּצָה׃
Translated: When she saw that he had left it in her hand and had fled outside,
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevotah khiy-azav vigedvo veyadah vayanׇs hachutsah

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֞א לְאַנְשֵׁ֣י בֵיתָ֗הּ וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר רְא֗וּ הֵ֥בִיא לָ֛נוּ אִ֥ישׁ עִבְרִ֖י לְצַ֣חֶק בָּ֑נוּ בָּ֤א אֵלַי֙ לִשְׁכַּ֣ב עִמִּ֔י וָאֶקְרָ֖א בְּק֥וֹל גָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: she called out to her servants and said to them, “Look, he had to bring us a Hebrew to dally with us! This one came to lie with me; but I screamed loud.
Transliteration: vatikera leaneshey veytah vatomer lahem lemor reu heviy lanu iysh iveriy letsachek vanu va elay lishekhav imiy vaekera vekvol gadvol

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כְשׇׁמְע֔וֹ כִּֽי־הֲרִימֹ֥תִי קוֹלִ֖י וָאֶקְרָ֑א וַיַּעֲזֹ֤ב בִּגְדוֹ֙ אֶצְלִ֔י וַיָּ֖נׇס וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַחֽוּצָה׃
Translated: And when he heard me screaming at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and got away and fled outside.”
Transliteration: vayehiy kheshׇmevo khiy-hariymotiy kvoliy vaekera vayaazov vigedvo etseliy vayanׇs vayetse hachutsah

Hebrew: וַתַּנַּ֥ח בִּגְד֖וֹ אֶצְלָ֑הּ עַד־בּ֥וֹא אֲדֹנָ֖יו אֶל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: She kept his garment beside her, until his master came home.
Transliteration: vatanach vigedvo etselah ad-vvo adonayv el-veytvo

Hebrew: וַתְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֔יו כַּדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לֵאמֹ֑ר בָּֽא־אֵלַ֞י הָעֶ֧בֶד הָֽעִבְרִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־הֵבֵ֥אתָ לָּ֖נוּ לְצַ֥חֶק בִּֽי׃
Translated: Then she told him the same story, saying, “The Hebrew slave whom you brought into our house came to me to dally with me;
Transliteration: vatedaver elayv khadevariym haeleh lemor va-elay haeved haiveriy asher-heveta lanu letsachek viy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּהֲרִימִ֥י קוֹלִ֖י וָאֶקְרָ֑א וַיַּעֲזֹ֥ב בִּגְד֛וֹ אֶצְלִ֖י וַיָּ֥נׇס הַחֽוּצָה׃
Translated: but when I screamed at the top of my voice, he left his garment with me and fled outside.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khahariymiy kvoliy vaekera vayaazov vigedvo etseliy vayanׇs hachutsah

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ אֲדֹנָ֜יו אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֣י אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבְּרָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כַּדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה עָ֥שָׂה לִ֖י עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וַיִּ֖חַר אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When his master heard the story that his wife told him, namely, “Thus and so your slave did to me,” he was furious.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa adonayv et-diverey ishetvo asher diverah elayv lemor khadevariym haeleh ashah liy avedekha vayichar afvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ אֲדֹנֵ֨י יוֹסֵ֜ף אֹת֗וֹ וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית הַסֹּ֔הַר מְק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁר־[אֲסִירֵ֥י] (אסורי) הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲסוּרִ֑ים וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֖ם בְּבֵ֥ית הַסֹּֽהַר׃
Translated: So Joseph’s master had him put in prison, where the king’s prisoners were confined. But even while he was there in prison,
Transliteration: vayikach adoney yvosef otvo vayitenehu el-veyt hasohar mekvom asher-[asiyrey] (svry) hamelekhe asuriym vayehiy-sham veveyt hasohar

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיֵּ֥ט אֵלָ֖יו חָ֑סֶד וַיִּתֵּ֣ן חִנּ֔וֹ בְּעֵינֵ֖י שַׂ֥ר בֵּית־הַסֹּֽהַר׃
Translated: יהוה was with Joseph—extending kindness to him and disposing the chief jailer favorably toward him.
Transliteration: vayehiy yehovah et-yvosef vayet elayv chased vayiten chinvo veeyney shar veyt-hasohar

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֞ן שַׂ֤ר בֵּית־הַסֹּ֙הַר֙ בְּיַד־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָ֣אֲסִירִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית הַסֹּ֑הַר וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר עֹשִׂים֙ שָׁ֔ם ה֖וּא הָיָ֥ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: The chief jailer put in Joseph’s charge all the prisoners who were in that prison, and he was the one to carry out everything that was done there.
Transliteration: vayiten shar veyt-hasohar veyad-yvosef et khׇl-haasiyrim asher veveyt hasohar veet khׇl-asher oshiym sham hu hayah osheh

Hebrew: אֵ֣ין ׀ שַׂ֣ר בֵּית־הַסֹּ֗הַר רֹאֶ֤ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־מְא֙וּמָה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אִתּ֑וֹ וַֽאֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא עֹשֶׂ֖ה יְהֹוָ֥ה מַצְלִֽיחַ׃ {פ}
Translated: The chief jailer did not supervise anything that was in Joseph’s charge, because יהוה was with him, and whatever he did יהוה made successful.
Transliteration: eyn shar veyt-hasohar roeh et-khׇl-meumah veyadvo vaasher yehovah itvo vaasher-hu osheh yehovah matseliycha {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחַר֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה חָ֥טְא֛וּ מַשְׁקֵ֥ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְהָאֹפֶ֑ה לַאֲדֹנֵיהֶ֖ם לְמֶ֥לֶךְ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Some time later, the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt gave offense to their lord the king of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayehiy achar hadevariym haeleh chateu mashekeh melekhe-mitserayiim vehaofeh laadoneyhem lemelekhe mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְצֹ֣ף פַּרְעֹ֔ה עַ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣י סָרִיסָ֑יו עַ֚ל שַׂ֣ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֔ים וְעַ֖ל שַׂ֥ר הָאוֹפִֽים׃
Translated: Pharaoh was angry with his two courtiers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker,
Transliteration: vayiketsof fareoh al sheney sariysayv al shar hamashekiym veal shar havofiym

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹתָ֜ם בְּמִשְׁמַ֗ר בֵּ֛ית שַׂ֥ר הַטַּבָּחִ֖ים אֶל־בֵּ֣ית הַסֹּ֑הַר מְק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אָס֥וּר שָֽׁם׃
Translated: and put them in custody, in the house of the prefect, in the same prison house where Joseph was confined.
Transliteration: vayiten otam vemishemar veyt shar hatavachiym el-veyt hasohar mekvom asher yvosef asur sham

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּפְקֹ֠ד שַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֧ים אֶת־יוֹסֵ֛ף אִתָּ֖ם וַיְשָׁ֣רֶת אֹתָ֑ם וַיִּהְי֥וּ יָמִ֖ים בְּמִשְׁמָֽר׃
Translated: The prefect assigned Joseph to them, and he attended them. When they had been in custody for some time,
Transliteration: vayifekod shar hatavachiym et-yvosef itam vayesharet otam vayiheyu yamiym vemishemar

Hebrew: וַיַּֽחַלְמוּ֩ חֲל֨וֹם שְׁנֵיהֶ֜ם אִ֤ישׁ חֲלֹמוֹ֙ בְּלַ֣יְלָה אֶחָ֔ד אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִתְר֣וֹן חֲלֹמ֑וֹ הַמַּשְׁקֶ֣ה וְהָאֹפֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲסוּרִ֖ים בְּבֵ֥ית הַסֹּֽהַר׃
Translated: both of them—the cupbearer and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were confined in the prison—dreamed in the same night, each his own dream and each dream with its own meaning.
Transliteration: vayachalemu chalvom sheneyhem iysh chalomvo velayelah echad iysh khefitervon chalomvo hamashekeh vehaofeh asher lemelekhe mitserayiim asher asuriym veveyt hasohar

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֲלֵיהֶ֛ם יוֹסֵ֖ף בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וַיַּ֣רְא אֹתָ֔ם וְהִנָּ֖ם זֹעֲפִֽים׃
Translated: When Joseph came to them in the morning, he saw that they were distraught.
Transliteration: vayavo aleyhem yvosef vavoker vayare otam vehinam zoafiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֞ל אֶת־סְרִיסֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אִתּ֧וֹ בְמִשְׁמַ֛ר בֵּ֥ית אֲדֹנָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֛וּעַ פְּנֵיכֶ֥ם רָעִ֖ים הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: He asked Pharaoh’s courtiers, who were with him in custody in his master’s house, saying, “Why do you appear downcast today?”
Transliteration: vayisheal et-seriysey fareoh asher itvo vemishemar veyt adonayv lemor madua feneykhem raiym hayyvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו חֲל֣וֹם חָלַ֔מְנוּ וּפֹתֵ֖ר אֵ֣ין אֹת֑וֹ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם יוֹסֵ֗ף הֲל֤וֹא לֵֽאלֹהִים֙ פִּתְרֹנִ֔ים סַפְּרוּ־נָ֖א לִֽי׃
Translated: And they said to him, “We had dreams, and there is no one to interpret them.” So Joseph said to them, “Surely God can interpret! Tell me [your dreams].”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv chalvom chalamenu ufoter eyn otvo vayomer alehem yvosef halvo lelohiym fiteroniym saferu-na liy

Hebrew: וַיְסַפֵּ֧ר שַֽׂר־הַמַּשְׁקִ֛ים אֶת־חֲלֹמ֖וֹ לְיוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ בַּחֲלוֹמִ֕י וְהִנֵּה־גֶ֖פֶן לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: Then the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph. He said to him, “In my dream, there was a vine in front of me.
Transliteration: vayesafer shar-hamashekiym et-chalomvo leyvosef vayomer lvo vachalvomiy vehineh-gefen lefanay

Hebrew: וּבַגֶּ֖פֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה שָׂרִיגִ֑ם וְהִ֤וא כְפֹרַ֙חַת֙ עָלְתָ֣ה נִצָּ֔הּ הִבְשִׁ֥ילוּ אַשְׁכְּלֹתֶ֖יהָ עֲנָבִֽים׃
Translated: On the vine were three branches. It had barely budded, when out came its blossoms and its clusters ripened into grapes.
Transliteration: uvagefen sheloshah shariygim vehiv kheforachat aletah nitsah hiveshiylu ashekheloteyha anaviym

Hebrew: וְכ֥וֹס פַּרְעֹ֖ה בְּיָדִ֑י וָאֶקַּ֣ח אֶת־הָֽעֲנָבִ֗ים וָֽאֶשְׂחַ֤ט אֹתָם֙ אֶל־כּ֣וֹס פַּרְעֹ֔ה וָאֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־הַכּ֖וֹס עַל־כַּ֥ף פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand, and I took the grapes, pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand.”
Transliteration: vekhvos fareoh veyadiy vaekach et-haanaviym vaeshechat otam el-khvos fareoh vaeten et-hakhvos al-khaf fareoh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף זֶ֖ה פִּתְרֹנ֑וֹ שְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַשָּׂ֣רִגִ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים הֵֽם׃
Translated: Joseph said to him, “This is its interpretation: The three branches are three days.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo yvosef zeh fiteronvo sheloshet hasharigiym sheloshet yamiym hem

Hebrew: בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים יִשָּׂ֤א פַרְעֹה֙ אֶת־רֹאשֶׁ֔ךָ וַהֲשִֽׁיבְךָ֖ עַל־כַּנֶּ֑ךָ וְנָתַתָּ֤ כוֹס־פַּרְעֹה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ כַּמִּשְׁפָּט֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיִ֖יתָ מַשְׁקֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: In three days Pharaoh will pardon you and restore you to your post; you will place Pharaoh’s cup in his hand, as was your custom formerly when you were his cupbearer.
Transliteration: vevod sheloshet yamiym yisha fareoh et-roshekha vahashiyvekha al-khanekha venatata khvos-fareoh veyadvo khamishefat harishvon asher hayiyta mashekehu

Hebrew: כִּ֧י אִם־זְכַרְתַּ֣נִי אִתְּךָ֗ כַּאֲשֶׁר֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ וְעָשִֽׂיתָ־נָּ֥א עִמָּדִ֖י חָ֑סֶד וְהִזְכַּרְתַּ֙נִי֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וְהוֹצֵאתַ֖נִי מִן־הַבַּ֥יִת הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But think of me when all is well with you again, and do me the kindness of mentioning me to Pharaoh, so as to free me from this place.
Transliteration: khiy im-zekharetaniy itekha khaasher yiytav lakhe veashiyta-na imadiy chased vehizekharetaniy el-fareoh vehvotsetaniy min-havayiit hazeh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־גֻנֹּ֣ב גֻּנַּ֔בְתִּי מֵאֶ֖רֶץ הָעִבְרִ֑ים וְגַם־פֹּה֙ לֹא־עָשִׂ֣יתִֽי מְא֔וּמָה כִּֽי־שָׂמ֥וּ אֹתִ֖י בַּבּֽוֹר׃
Translated: For in truth, I was kidnapped from the land of the Hebrews; nor have I done anything here that they should have put me in the dungeon.”
Transliteration: khiy-gunov gunavetiy meerets haiveriym vegam-foh lo-ashiytiy meumah khiy-shamu otiy vavvor

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא שַׂר־הָאֹפִ֖ים כִּ֣י ט֣וֹב פָּתָ֑ר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אַף־אֲנִי֙ בַּחֲלוֹמִ֔י וְהִנֵּ֗ה שְׁלֹשָׁ֛ה סַלֵּ֥י חֹרִ֖י עַל־רֹאשִֽׁי׃
Translated: When the chief baker saw how favorably he had interpreted, he said to Joseph, “In my dream, similarly, there were three openwork baskets on my head.
Transliteration: vayare shar-haofiym khiy tvov fatar vayomer el-yvosef af-aniy vachalvomiy vehineh sheloshah saley choriy al-roshiy

Hebrew: וּבַסַּ֣ל הָֽעֶלְי֗וֹן מִכֹּ֛ל מַאֲכַ֥ל פַּרְעֹ֖ה מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֹפֶ֑ה וְהָע֗וֹף אֹכֵ֥ל אֹתָ֛ם מִן־הַסַּ֖ל מֵעַ֥ל רֹאשִֽׁי׃
Translated: In the uppermost basket were all kinds of food for Pharaoh that a baker prepares; and the birds were eating it out of the basket above my head.”
Transliteration: uvasal haeleyvon mikhol maakhal fareoh maasheh ofeh vehavof okhel otam min-hasal meal roshiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן יוֹסֵף֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר זֶ֖ה פִּתְרֹנ֑וֹ שְׁלֹ֙שֶׁת֙ הַסַּלִּ֔ים שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים הֵֽם׃
Translated: Joseph answered, “This is its interpretation: The three baskets are three days.
Transliteration: vayaan yvosef vayomer zeh fiteronvo sheloshet hasaliym sheloshet yamiym hem

Hebrew: בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים יִשָּׂ֨א פַרְעֹ֤ה אֶת־רֹֽאשְׁךָ֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְתָלָ֥ה אוֹתְךָ֖ עַל־עֵ֑ץ וְאָכַ֥ל הָע֛וֹף אֶת־בְּשָׂרְךָ֖ מֵעָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: In three days Pharaoh will lift off your head and impale you upon a pole; and the birds will pick off your flesh.”
Transliteration: vevod sheloshet yamiym yisha fareoh et-roshekha mealeykha vetalah votekha al-ets veakhal havof et-vesharekha mealeykha

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י י֚וֹם הֻלֶּ֣דֶת אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֔ה וַיַּ֥עַשׂ מִשְׁתֶּ֖ה לְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיִּשָּׂ֞א אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ ׀ שַׂ֣ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֗ים וְאֶת־רֹ֛אשׁ שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִ֖ים בְּת֥וֹךְ עֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated: On the third day—his birthday—Pharaoh made a banquet for all his officials, and he singled out his chief cupbearer and his chief baker from among his officials.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheliyshiy yvom huledet et-fareoh vayaash misheteh lekhׇl-avadayv vayisha et-rosh shar hamashekiym veet-rosh shar haofiym vetvokhe avadayv

Hebrew: וַיָּ֛שֶׁב אֶת־שַׂ֥ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֖ים עַל־מַשְׁקֵ֑הוּ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן הַכּ֖וֹס עַל־כַּ֥ף פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: He restored the chief cupbearer to his cupbearing, and he placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand;
Transliteration: vayashev et-shar hamashekiym al-mashekehu vayiten hakhvos al-khaf fareoh

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִ֖ים תָּלָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּתַ֛ר לָהֶ֖ם יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: but the chief baker he impaled—just as Joseph had interpreted to them.
Transliteration: veet shar haofiym talah khaasher fatar lahem yvosef

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־זָכַ֧ר שַֽׂר־הַמַּשְׁקִ֛ים אֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף וַיִּשְׁכָּחֵֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Yet the chief cupbearer did not think of Joseph; he forgot him.
Transliteration: velo-zakhar shar-hamashekiym et-yvosef vayishekhachehu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ שְׁנָתַ֣יִם יָמִ֑ים וּפַרְעֹ֣ה חֹלֵ֔ם וְהִנֵּ֖ה עֹמֵ֥ד עַל־הַיְאֹֽר׃
Translated: After two years’ time, Pharaoh dreamed that he was standing by the Nile,
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets shenatayiim yamiym ufareoh cholem vehineh omed al-hayeor

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִן־הַיְאֹ֗ר עֹלֹת֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פָּר֔וֹת יְפ֥וֹת מַרְאֶ֖ה וּבְרִיאֹ֣ת בָּשָׂ֑ר וַתִּרְעֶ֖ינָה בָּאָֽחוּ׃
Translated: when out of the Nile there came up seven cows, handsome and sturdy, and they grazed in the reed grass.
Transliteration: vehineh min-hayeor olot sheva farvot yefvot mareeh uveriyot vashar vatireeynah vaachu

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֞ה שֶׁ֧בַע פָּר֣וֹת אֲחֵר֗וֹת עֹל֤וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶן֙ מִן־הַיְאֹ֔ר רָע֥וֹת מַרְאֶ֖ה וְדַקּ֣וֹת בָּשָׂ֑ר וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֛דְנָה אֵ֥צֶל הַפָּר֖וֹת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
Translated: But presently, seven other cows came up from the Nile close behind them, ugly and gaunt, and stood beside the cows on the bank of the Nile;
Transliteration: vehineh sheva farvot achervot olvot achareyhen min-hayeor ravot mareeh vedakvot vashar vataamodenah etsel hafarvot al-shefat hayeor

Hebrew: וַתֹּאכַ֣לְנָה הַפָּר֗וֹת רָע֤וֹת הַמַּרְאֶה֙ וְדַקֹּ֣ת הַבָּשָׂ֔ר אֵ֚ת שֶׁ֣בַע הַפָּר֔וֹת יְפֹ֥ת הַמַּרְאֶ֖ה וְהַבְּרִיאֹ֑ת וַיִּיקַ֖ץ פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: and the ugly gaunt cows ate up the seven handsome sturdy cows. And Pharaoh awoke.
Transliteration: vatokhalenah hafarvot ravot hamareeh vedakot havashar et sheva hafarvot yefot hamareeh vehaveriyot vayiykats fareoh

Hebrew: וַיִּישָׁ֕ן וַֽיַּחֲלֹ֖ם שֵׁנִ֑ית וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֗ים עֹל֛וֹת בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד בְּרִיא֥וֹת וְטֹבֽוֹת׃
Translated: He fell asleep and dreamed a second time: Seven ears of grain, solid and healthy, grew on a single stalk.
Transliteration: vayiyshan vayachalom sheniyt vehineh sheva shivoliym olvot vekaneh echad veriyvot vetovvot

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֔ים דַּקּ֖וֹת וּשְׁדוּפֹ֣ת קָדִ֑ים צֹמְח֖וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: But close behind them sprouted seven ears, thin and scorched by the east wind.
Transliteration: vehineh sheva shivoliym dakvot ushedufot kadiym tsomechvot achareyhen

Hebrew: וַתִּבְלַ֙עְנָה֙ הַשִּׁבֳּלִ֣ים הַדַּקּ֔וֹת אֵ֚ת שֶׁ֣בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִ֔ים הַבְּרִיא֖וֹת וְהַמְּלֵא֑וֹת וַיִּיקַ֥ץ פַּרְעֹ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה חֲלֽוֹם׃
Translated: And the thin ears swallowed up the seven solid and full ears. Then Pharaoh awoke: it was a dream!
Transliteration: vativelaenah hashivoliym hadakvot et sheva hashivoliym haveriyvot vehamelevot vayiykats fareoh vehineh chalvom

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י בַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ וַתִּפָּ֣עֶם רוּח֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־כׇּל־חַרְטֻמֵּ֥י מִצְרַ֖יִם וְאֶת־כׇּל־חֲכָמֶ֑יהָ וַיְסַפֵּ֨ר פַּרְעֹ֤ה לָהֶם֙ אֶת־חֲלֹמ֔וֹ וְאֵין־פּוֹתֵ֥ר אוֹתָ֖ם לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Next morning, his spirit was agitated, and he sent for all the magician-priests of Egypt, and all its sages; and Pharaoh told them his dreams, but none could interpret them for Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker vatifaem ruchvo vayishelach vayikera et-khׇl-charetumey mitserayiim veet-khׇl-chakhameyha vayesafer fareoh lahem et-chalomvo veeyn-fvoter votam lefareoh

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּר֙ שַׂ֣ר הַמַּשְׁקִ֔ים אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אֶת־חֲטָאַ֕י אֲנִ֖י מַזְכִּ֥יר הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: The chief cupbearer then spoke up and said to Pharaoh, “I must make mention today of my offenses.
Transliteration: vayedaver shar hamashekiym et-fareoh lemor et-chataay aniy mazekhiyr hayyvom

Hebrew: פַּרְעֹ֖ה קָצַ֣ף עַל־עֲבָדָ֑יו וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹתִ֜י בְּמִשְׁמַ֗ר בֵּ֚ית שַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֔ים אֹתִ֕י וְאֵ֖ת שַׂ֥ר הָאֹפִֽים׃
Translated: Once Pharaoh was angry with his servants, and placed me in custody in the house of the prefect, together with the chief baker.
Transliteration: fareoh katsaf al-avadayv vayiten otiy vemishemar veyt shar hatavachiym otiy veet shar haofiym

Hebrew: וַנַּֽחַלְמָ֥ה חֲל֛וֹם בְּלַ֥יְלָה אֶחָ֖ד אֲנִ֣י וָה֑וּא אִ֛ישׁ כְּפִתְר֥וֹן חֲלֹמ֖וֹ חָלָֽמְנוּ׃
Translated: We had dreams the same night, he and I, each of us a dream with a meaning of its own.
Transliteration: vanachalemah chalvom velayelah echad aniy vahu iysh khefitervon chalomvo chalamenu

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֨ם אִתָּ֜נוּ נַ֣עַר עִבְרִ֗י עֶ֚בֶד לְשַׂ֣ר הַטַּבָּחִ֔ים וַ֨נְּסַפֶּר־ל֔וֹ וַיִּפְתׇּר־לָ֖נוּ אֶת־חֲלֹמֹתֵ֑ינוּ אִ֥ישׁ כַּחֲלֹמ֖וֹ פָּתָֽר׃
Translated: A Hebrew youth was there with us, a servant of the prefect; and when we told him our dreams, he interpreted them for us, telling each of the meaning of his dream.
Transliteration: vesham itanu naar iveriy eved leshar hatavachiym vanesafer-lvo vayifetׇr-lanu et-chalomoteynu iysh khachalomvo fatar

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּֽתַר־לָ֖נוּ כֵּ֣ן הָיָ֑ה אֹתִ֛י הֵשִׁ֥יב עַל־כַּנִּ֖י וְאֹת֥וֹ תָלָֽה׃
Translated: And as he interpreted for us, so it came to pass: I was restored to my post, and the other was impaled.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher fatar-lanu khen hayah otiy heshiyv al-khaniy veotvo talah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח פַּרְעֹה֙ וַיִּקְרָ֣א אֶת־יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיְרִיצֻ֖הוּ מִן־הַבּ֑וֹר וַיְגַלַּח֙ וַיְחַלֵּ֣ף שִׂמְלֹתָ֔יו וַיָּבֹ֖א אֶל־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Thereupon Pharaoh sent for Joseph, and he was rushed from the dungeon. He had his hair cut and changed his clothes, and he appeared before Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vayishelach fareoh vayikera et-yvosef vayeriytsuhu min-havvor vayegalach vayechalef shimelotayv vayavo el-fareoh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף חֲל֣וֹם חָלַ֔מְתִּי וּפֹתֵ֖ר אֵ֣ין אֹת֑וֹ וַאֲנִ֗י שָׁמַ֤עְתִּי עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תִּשְׁמַ֥ע חֲל֖וֹם לִפְתֹּ֥ר אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I have had a dream, but no one can interpret it. Now I have heard it said of you that for you to hear a dream is to tell its meaning.”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-yvosef chalvom chalametiy ufoter eyn otvo vaaniy shamaetiy aleykha lemor tishema chalvom lifetor otvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן יוֹסֵ֧ף אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֛ה לֵאמֹ֖ר בִּלְעָדָ֑י אֱלֹהִ֕ים יַעֲנֶ֖ה אֶת־שְׁל֥וֹם פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, “Not I! God will see to Pharaoh’s welfare.”
Transliteration: vayaan yvosef et-fareoh lemor vileaday Elohim yaaneh et-shelvom fareoh

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף בַּחֲלֹמִ֕י הִנְנִ֥י עֹמֵ֖ד עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיְאֹֽר׃
Translated: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “In my dream, I was standing on the bank of the Nile,
Transliteration: vayedaver fareoh el-yvosef vachalomiy hineniy omed al-shefat hayeor

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִן־הַיְאֹ֗ר עֹלֹת֙ שֶׁ֣בַע פָּר֔וֹת בְּרִיא֥וֹת בָּשָׂ֖ר וִיפֹ֣ת תֹּ֑אַר וַתִּרְעֶ֖ינָה בָּאָֽחוּ׃
Translated: when out of the Nile came up seven sturdy and well-formed cows and grazed in the reed grass.
Transliteration: vehineh min-hayeor olot sheva farvot veriyvot vashar viyfot toar vatireeynah vaachu

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֞ה שֶֽׁבַע־פָּר֤וֹת אֲחֵרוֹת֙ עֹל֣וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ן דַּלּ֨וֹת וְרָע֥וֹת תֹּ֛אַר מְאֹ֖ד וְרַקּ֣וֹת בָּשָׂ֑ר לֹֽא־רָאִ֧יתִי כָהֵ֛נָּה בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לָרֹֽעַ׃
Translated: Presently there followed them seven other cows, scrawny, ill-formed, and emaciated—never had I seen their likes for ugliness in all the land of Egypt!
Transliteration: vehineh sheva-farvot achervot olvot achareyhen dalvot veravot toar meod verakvot vashar lo-raiytiy khahenah vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim laroa

Hebrew: וַתֹּאכַ֙לְנָה֙ הַפָּר֔וֹת הָרַקּ֖וֹת וְהָרָע֑וֹת אֵ֣ת שֶׁ֧בַע הַפָּר֛וֹת הָרִאשֹׁנ֖וֹת הַבְּרִיאֹֽת׃
Translated: And the seven lean and ugly cows ate up the first seven cows, the sturdy ones;
Transliteration: vatokhalenah hafarvot harakvot veharavot et sheva hafarvot harishonvot haveriyot

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֣אנָה אֶל־קִרְבֶּ֗נָה וְלֹ֤א נוֹדַע֙ כִּי־בָ֣אוּ אֶל־קִרְבֶּ֔נָה וּמַרְאֵיהֶ֣ן רַ֔ע כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בַּתְּחִלָּ֑ה וָאִיקָֽץ׃
Translated: but when they had consumed them, one could not tell that they had consumed them, for they looked just as bad as before. And I awoke.
Transliteration: vatavonah el-kirevenah velo nvoda khiy-vau el-kirevenah umareeyhen ra khaasher vatechilah vaiykats

Hebrew: וָאֵ֖רֶא בַּחֲלֹמִ֑י וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֗ים עֹלֹ֛ת בְּקָנֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד מְלֵאֹ֥ת וְטֹבֽוֹת׃
Translated: In my other dream, I saw seven ears of grain, full and healthy, growing on a single stalk;
Transliteration: vaere vachalomiy vehineh sheva shivoliym olot vekaneh echad meleot vetovvot

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שִׁבֳּלִ֔ים צְנֻמ֥וֹת דַּקּ֖וֹת שְׁדֻפ֣וֹת קָדִ֑ים צֹמְח֖וֹת אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: but right behind them sprouted seven ears, shriveled, thin, and scorched by the east wind.
Transliteration: vehineh sheva shivoliym tsenumvot dakvot shedufvot kadiym tsomechvot achareyhem

Hebrew: וַתִּבְלַ֙עְןָ֙ הַשִּׁבֳּלִ֣ים הַדַּקֹּ֔ת אֵ֛ת שֶׁ֥בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִ֖ים הַטֹּב֑וֹת וָֽאֹמַר֙ אֶל־הַֽחַרְטֻמִּ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין מַגִּ֖יד לִֽי׃
Translated: And the thin ears swallowed the seven healthy ears. I have told my magician-priests, but none has an explanation for me.”
Transliteration: vativelaena hashivoliym hadakot et sheva hashivoliym hatovvot vaomar el-hacharetumiym veeyn magiyd liy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה חֲל֥וֹם פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶחָ֣ד ה֑וּא אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עֹשֶׂ֖ה הִגִּ֥יד לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: And Joseph said to Pharaoh, “Pharaoh’s dreams are one and the same: Pharaoh has been told what God is about to do.
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-fareoh chalvom fareoh echad hu et asher haElohim osheh higiyd lefareoh

Hebrew: שֶׁ֧בַע פָּרֹ֣ת הַטֹּבֹ֗ת שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְשֶׁ֤בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִים֙ הַטֹּבֹ֔ת שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים הֵ֑נָּה חֲל֖וֹם אֶחָ֥ד הֽוּא׃
Translated: The seven healthy cows are seven years, and the seven healthy ears are seven years; it is the same dream.
Transliteration: sheva farot hatovot sheva shaniym henah vesheva hashivoliym hatovot sheva shaniym henah chalvom echad hu

Hebrew: וְשֶׁ֣בַע הַ֠פָּר֠וֹת הָֽרַקּ֨וֹת וְהָרָעֹ֜ת הָעֹלֹ֣ת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ן שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ הֵ֔נָּה וְשֶׁ֤בַע הַֽשִּׁבֳּלִים֙ הָרֵק֔וֹת שְׁדֻפ֖וֹת הַקָּדִ֑ים יִהְי֕וּ שֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֥י רָעָֽב׃
Translated: The seven lean and ugly cows that followed are seven years, as are also the seven empty ears scorched by the east wind; they are seven years of famine.
Transliteration: vesheva hafarvot harakvot veharaot haolot achareyhen sheva shaniym henah vesheva hashivoliym harekvot shedufvot hakadiym yiheyu sheva sheney raav

Hebrew: ה֣וּא הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים עֹשֶׂ֖ה הֶרְאָ֥ה אֶת־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: It is just as I have told Pharaoh: Pharaoh has been shown what God is about to do.
Transliteration: hu hadavar asher divaretiy el-fareoh asher haElohim osheh hereah et-fareoh

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים בָּא֑וֹת שָׂבָ֥ע גָּד֖וֹל בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Immediately ahead are seven years of great abundance in all the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: hineh sheva shaniym vavot shava gadvol vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְ֠קָ֠מוּ שֶׁ֜בַע שְׁנֵ֤י רָעָב֙ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ן וְנִשְׁכַּ֥ח כׇּל־הַשָּׂבָ֖ע בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְכִלָּ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ב אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: After them will come seven years of famine, and all the abundance in the land of Egypt will be forgotten. As the land is ravaged by famine,
Transliteration: vekamu sheva sheney raav achareyhen venishekhach khׇl-hashava veerets mitserayiim vekhilah haraav et-haarets

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִוָּדַ֤ע הַשָּׂבָע֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ מִפְּנֵ֛י הָרָעָ֥ב הַה֖וּא אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֑ן כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד ה֖וּא מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: no trace of the abundance will be left in the land because of the famine thereafter, for it will be very severe.
Transliteration: velo-yivada hashava vaarets mifeney haraav hahu acharey-khen khiy-khaved hu meod

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל הִשָּׁנ֧וֹת הַחֲל֛וֹם אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה פַּעֲמָ֑יִם כִּֽי־נָכ֤וֹן הַדָּבָר֙ מֵעִ֣ם הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּמְמַהֵ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לַעֲשֹׂתֽוֹ׃
Translated: As for Pharaoh having had the same dream twice, it means that the matter has been determined by God, and that God will soon carry it out.
Transliteration: veal hishanvot hachalvom el-fareoh faamayiim khiy-nakhvon hadavar meim haElohim umemaher haElohim laashotvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יֵרֶ֣א פַרְעֹ֔ה אִ֖ישׁ נָב֣וֹן וְחָכָ֑ם וִישִׁיתֵ֖הוּ עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: “Accordingly, let Pharaoh find someone who’s discerning and wise, whom you can set over the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: veatah eire fareoh iysh navvon vechakham viyshiytehu al-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה פַרְעֹ֔ה וְיַפְקֵ֥ד פְּקִדִ֖ים עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְחִמֵּשׁ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֥י הַשָּׂבָֽע׃
Translated: And let Pharaoh take steps to appoint overseers over the land, and organize the land of Egypt in the seven years of plenty.
Transliteration: yaasheh fareoh veyafeked fekidiym al-haarets vechimesh et-erets mitserayiim vesheva sheney hashava

Hebrew: וְיִקְבְּצ֗וּ אֶת־כׇּל־אֹ֙כֶל֙ הַשָּׁנִ֣ים הַטֹּב֔וֹת הַבָּאֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְיִצְבְּרוּ־בָ֞ר תַּ֧חַת יַד־פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֹ֥כֶל בֶּעָרִ֖ים וְשָׁמָֽרוּ׃
Translated: Let all the food of these good years that are coming be gathered, and let the grain be collected under Pharaoh’s authority as food to be stored in the cities.
Transliteration: veyikevetsu et-khׇl-okhel hashaniym hatovvot havaot haeleh veyitseveru-var tachat yad-fareoh okhel veariym veshamaru

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הָאֹ֤כֶל לְפִקָּדוֹן֙ לָאָ֔רֶץ לְשֶׁ֙בַע֙ שְׁנֵ֣י הָרָעָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּהְיֶ֖יןָ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְלֹֽא־תִכָּרֵ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּרָעָֽב׃
Translated: Let that food be a reserve for the land for the seven years of famine which will come upon the land of Egypt, so that the land may not perish in the famine.”
Transliteration: vehayah haokhel lefikadvon laarets lesheva sheney haraav asher tiheyeyna veerets mitserayiim velo-tikharet haarets varaav

Hebrew: וַיִּיטַ֥ב הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וּבְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־עֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated: The plan pleased Pharaoh and all his courtiers.
Transliteration: vayiytav hadavar veeyney fareoh uveeyney khׇl-avadayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־עֲבָדָ֑יו הֲנִמְצָ֣א כָזֶ֔ה אִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֛ר ר֥וּחַ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Pharaoh said to his courtiers, “Could we find another like him—a man with the divine spirit?”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-avadayv hanimetsa khazeh iysh asher rucha Elohim vvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אַחֲרֵ֨י הוֹדִ֧יעַ אֱלֹהִ֛ים אוֹתְךָ֖ אֶת־כׇּל־זֹ֑את אֵין־נָב֥וֹן וְחָכָ֖ם כָּמֽוֹךָ׃
Translated: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Since God has made all this known to you, there is none so discerning and wise as you.
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-yvosef acharey hvodiya Elohim votekha et-khׇl-zot eyn-navvon vechakham khamvokha

Hebrew: אַתָּה֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה עַל־בֵּיתִ֔י וְעַל־פִּ֖יךָ יִשַּׁ֣ק כׇּל־עַמִּ֑י רַ֥ק הַכִּסֵּ֖א אֶגְדַּ֥ל מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated: You shall be in charge of my court, and by your command shall all my people be directed; only with respect to the throne shall I be superior to you.”
Transliteration: atah tiheyeh al-veytiy veal-fiykha yishak khׇl-amiy rak hakhise egedal mimekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף רְאֵה֙ נָתַ֣תִּי אֹֽתְךָ֔ עַ֖ל כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Pharaoh further said to Joseph, “See, I put you in charge of all the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-yvosef reeh natatiy otekha al khׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨סַר פַּרְעֹ֤ה אֶת־טַבַּעְתּוֹ֙ מֵעַ֣ל יָד֔וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֹתָ֖הּ עַל־יַ֣ד יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיַּלְבֵּ֤שׁ אֹתוֹ֙ בִּגְדֵי־שֵׁ֔שׁ וַיָּ֛שֶׂם רְבִ֥ד הַזָּהָ֖ב עַל־צַוָּארֽוֹ׃
Translated: And removing his signet ring from his hand, Pharaoh put it on Joseph’s hand; and he had him dressed in robes of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck.
Transliteration: vayasar fareoh et-tavaetvo meal yadvo vayiten otah al-yad yvosef vayalevesh otvo vigedey-shesh vayashem revid hazahav al-tsavarvo

Hebrew: וַיַּרְכֵּ֣ב אֹת֗וֹ בְּמִרְכֶּ֤בֶת הַמִּשְׁנֶה֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיִּקְרְא֥וּ לְפָנָ֖יו אַבְרֵ֑ךְ וְנָת֣וֹן אֹת֔וֹ עַ֖ל כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: He had him ride in the chariot of his second-in-command, and they cried before him, “Abrek!” Thus he placed him over all the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vayarekhev otvo vemirekhevet hamisheneh asher-lvo vayikereu lefanayv averekhe venatvon otvo al khׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף אֲנִ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וּבִלְעָדֶ֗יךָ לֹֽא־יָרִ֨ים אִ֧ישׁ אֶת־יָד֛וֹ וְאֶת־רַגְל֖וֹ בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I am Pharaoh; yet without you, no one shall lift up hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-yvosef aniy fareoh uvileadeykha lo-yariym iysh et-yadvo veet-ragelvo vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א פַרְעֹ֣ה שֵׁם־יוֹסֵף֮ צָֽפְנַ֣ת פַּעְנֵ֒חַ֒ וַיִּתֶּן־ל֣וֹ אֶת־אָֽסְנַ֗ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֛רַע כֹּהֵ֥ן אֹ֖ן לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֖ף עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Pharaoh then gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-paneah; and he gave him for a wife Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On. Thus Joseph emerged in charge of the land of Egypt.—
Transliteration: vayikera fareoh shem-yvosef tsafenat faenecha vayiten-lvo et-asenat vat-fvotiy fera khohen on leishah vayetse yvosef al-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְיוֹסֵף֙ בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּעׇמְד֕וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י פַּרְעֹ֣ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיֵּצֵ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ר בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt.—Leaving Pharaoh’s presence, Joseph traveled through all the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: veyvosef ven-sheloshiym shanah veׇmedvo lifeney fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim vayetse yvosef milifeney fareoh vayaavor vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַתַּ֣עַשׂ הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּשֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֣י הַשָּׂבָ֑ע לִקְמָצִֽים׃
Translated: During the seven years of plenty, the land produced in abundance.
Transliteration: vataash haarets vesheva sheney hashava likematsiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֞ץ אֶת־כׇּל־אֹ֣כֶל ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָיוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּתֶּן־אֹ֖כֶל בֶּעָרִ֑ים אֹ֧כֶל שְׂדֵה־הָעִ֛יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְבִיבֹתֶ֖יהָ נָתַ֥ן בְּתוֹכָֽהּ׃
Translated: And he gathered all the grain of the seven years that the land of Egypt was enjoying, and stored the grain in the cities; he put in each city the grain of the fields around it.
Transliteration: vayikevots et-khׇl-okhel sheva shaniym asher hayu veerets mitserayiim vayiten-okhel veariym okhel shedeh-haiyr asher seviyvoteyha natan vetvokhah

Hebrew: וַיִּצְבֹּ֨ר יוֹסֵ֥ף בָּ֛ר כְּח֥וֹל הַיָּ֖ם הַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד עַ֛ד כִּי־חָדַ֥ל לִסְפֹּ֖ר כִּי־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated: So Joseph collected produce in very large quantity, like the sands of the sea, until he ceased to measure it, for it could not be measured.
Transliteration: vayitsevor yvosef var khechvol hayam hareveh meod ad khiy-chadal lisefor khiy-eyn misefar

Hebrew: וּלְיוֹסֵ֤ף יֻלַּד֙ שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים בְּטֶ֥רֶם תָּב֖וֹא שְׁנַ֣ת הָרָעָ֑ב אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָֽלְדָה־לּוֹ֙ אָֽסְנַ֔ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֖רַע כֹּהֵ֥ן אֽוֹן׃
Translated: Before the years of famine came, Joseph became the father of two sons, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera, priest of On, bore to him.
Transliteration: uleyvosef yulad sheney vaniym veterem tavvo shenat haraav asher yaledah-lvo asenat vat-fvotiy fera khohen von

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם הַבְּכ֖וֹר מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה כִּֽי־נַשַּׁ֤נִי אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־כׇּל־עֲמָלִ֔י וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽי׃
Translated: Joseph named the first-born Manasseh, meaning, “God has made me forget completely my hardship and my parental home.”
Transliteration: vayikera yvosef et-shem havekhvor menasheh khiy-nashaniy Elohim et-khׇl-amaliy veet khׇl-veyt aviy

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת שֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖י קָרָ֣א אֶפְרָ֑יִם כִּֽי־הִפְרַ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּאֶ֥רֶץ עׇנְיִֽי׃
Translated: And the second he named Ephraim, meaning, “God has made me fertile in the land of my affliction.”
Transliteration: veet shem hasheniy kara eferayiim khiy-hiferaniy Elohim veerets ׇneyiy

Hebrew: וַתִּכְלֶ֕ינָה שֶׁ֖בַע שְׁנֵ֣י הַשָּׂבָ֑ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: The seven years of abundance that the land of Egypt enjoyed came to an end,
Transliteration: vatikheleynah sheva sheney hashava asher hayah veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַתְּחִלֶּ֜ינָה שֶׁ֣בַע שְׁנֵ֤י הָרָעָב֙ לָב֔וֹא כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְהִ֤י רָעָב֙ בְּכׇל־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת וּבְכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם הָ֥יָה לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: and the seven years of famine set in, just as Joseph had foretold. There was famine in all lands, but throughout the land of Egypt there was bread.
Transliteration: vatechileynah sheva sheney haraav lavvo khaasher amar yvosef vayehiy raav vekhׇl-haaratsvot uvekhׇl-erets mitserayiim hayah lachem

Hebrew: וַתִּרְעַב֙ כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּצְעַ֥ק הָעָ֛ם אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֖ה לַלָּ֑חֶם וַיֹּ֨אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֤ה לְכׇל־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְכ֣וּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמַ֥ר לָכֶ֖ם תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: And when all the land of Egypt felt the hunger, the people cried out to Pharaoh for bread; and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, “Go to Joseph; whatever he tells you, you shall do.”—
Transliteration: vatireav khׇl-erets mitserayiim vayitseak haam el-fareoh lalachem vayomer fareoh lekhׇl-mitserayiim lekhu el-yvosef asher-yomar lakhem taashu

Hebrew: וְהָרָעָ֣ב הָיָ֔ה עַ֖ל כׇּל־פְּנֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּפְתַּ֨ח יוֹסֵ֜ף אֶֽת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּהֶם֙ וַיִּשְׁבֹּ֣ר לְמִצְרַ֔יִם וַיֶּחֱזַ֥ק הָֽרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Accordingly, when the famine became severe in the land of Egypt, Joseph laid open all that was within, and rationed out grain to the Egyptians. The famine, however, spread over the whole world.
Transliteration: veharaav hayah al khׇl-feney haarets vayifetach yvosef et-khׇl-asher vahem vayishevor lemitserayiim vayechezak haraav veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ בָּ֣אוּ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה לִשְׁבֹּ֖ר אֶל־יוֹסֵ֑ף כִּֽי־חָזַ֥ק הָרָעָ֖ב בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: So all the world came to Joseph in Egypt to procure rations, for the famine had become severe throughout the world.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haarets vau mitserayemah lishevor el-yvosef khiy-chazak haraav vekhׇl-haarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יַעֲקֹ֔ב כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־שֶׁ֖בֶר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ לְבָנָ֔יו לָ֖מָּה תִּתְרָאֽוּ׃
Translated: When Jacob saw that there were food rations to be had in Egypt, he said to his sons, “Why do you keep looking at one another?
Transliteration: vayare yaakov khiy yesh-shever vemitserayiim vayomer yaakov levanayv lamah titerau

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֣ה שָׁמַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־שֶׁ֖בֶר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם רְדוּ־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ וְשִׁבְרוּ־לָ֣נוּ מִשָּׁ֔ם וְנִחְיֶ֖ה וְלֹ֥א נָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Now I hear,” he went on, “that there are rations to be had in Egypt. Go down and procure rations for us there, that we may live and not die.”
Transliteration: vayomer hineh shamaetiy khiy yesh-shever vemitserayiim redu-shamah veshiveru-lanu misham venicheyeh velo namut

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֥וּ אֲחֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֖ף עֲשָׂרָ֑ה לִשְׁבֹּ֥ר בָּ֖ר מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: So ten of Joseph’s brothers went down to get grain rations in Egypt;
Transliteration: vayeredu achey-yvosef asharah lishevor var mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִין֙ אֲחִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לֹא־שָׁלַ֥ח יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־אֶחָ֑יו כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר פֶּן־יִקְרָאֶ֖נּוּ אָסֽוֹן׃
Translated: for Jacob did not send Joseph’s brother Benjamin with his brothers, since he feared that he might meet with disaster.
Transliteration: veet-vineyamiyn achiy yvosef lo-shalach yaakov et-echayv khiy amar fen-yikeraenu asvon

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִשְׁבֹּ֖ר בְּת֣וֹךְ הַבָּאִ֑ים כִּֽי־הָיָ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: Thus the sons of Israel were among those who came to procure rations, for the famine extended to the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayavou veney yisherael lishevor vetvokhe havaiym khiy-hayah haraav veerets khenaan

Hebrew: וְיוֹסֵ֗ף ה֚וּא הַשַּׁלִּ֣יט עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ ה֥וּא הַמַּשְׁבִּ֖יר לְכׇל־עַ֣ם הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֲחֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף וַיִּשְׁתַּֽחֲווּ־ל֥וֹ אַפַּ֖יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: Now Joseph was the vizier of the land; it was he who dispensed rations to all the people of the land. And Joseph’s brothers came and bowed low to him, with their faces to the ground.
Transliteration: veyvosef hu hashaliyt al-haarets hu hamasheviyr lekhׇl-am haarets vayavou achey yvosef vayishetachavu-lvo afayiim aretsah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו וַיַּכִּרֵ֑ם וַיִּתְנַכֵּ֨ר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר אִתָּ֣ם קָשׁ֗וֹת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מֵאַ֣יִן בָּאתֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנַ֖עַן לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated: When Joseph saw his brothers, he recognized them; but he acted like a stranger toward them and spoke harshly to them. He asked them, “Where do you come from?” And they said, “From the land of Canaan, to procure food.”
Transliteration: vayare yvosef et-echayv vayakhirem vayitenakher aleyhem vayedaver itam kashvot vayomer alehem meayiin vatem vayomeru meerets khenaan lishevׇr-okhel

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אֶת־אֶחָ֑יו וְהֵ֖ם לֹ֥א הִכִּרֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: For though Joseph recognized his brothers, they did not recognize him.
Transliteration: vayakher yvosef et-echayv vehem lo hikhiruhu

Hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֣ר יוֹסֵ֔ף אֵ֚ת הַחֲלֹמ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָלַ֖ם לָהֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ מְרַגְּלִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם לִרְא֛וֹת אֶת־עֶרְוַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּאתֶֽם׃
Translated: Recalling the dreams that he had dreamed about them, Joseph said to them, “You are spies, you have come to see the land in its nakedness.”
Transliteration: vayizekhor yvosef et hachalomvot asher chalam lahem vayomer alehem merageliym atem lirevot et-erevat haarets vatem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו לֹ֣א אֲדֹנִ֑י וַעֲבָדֶ֥יךָ בָּ֖אוּ לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated: But they said to him, “No, my lord! Truly, your servants have come to procure food.
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv lo adoniy vaavadeykha vau lishevׇr-okhel

Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֕נוּ בְּנֵ֥י אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד נָ֑חְנוּ כֵּנִ֣ים אֲנַ֔חְנוּ לֹא־הָי֥וּ עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ מְרַגְּלִֽים׃
Translated: We are all of us sons of the same man; we are being honest; your servants have never been spies!”
Transliteration: khulanu veney iysh-echad nachenu kheniym anachenu lo-hayu avadeykha merageliym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם לֹ֕א כִּֽי־עֶרְוַ֥ת הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּאתֶ֥ם לִרְאֽוֹת׃
Translated: And he said to them, “No, you have come to see the land in its nakedness!”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem lo khiy-erevat haarets vatem lirevot

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂר֩ עֲבָדֶ֨יךָ אַחִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֲנַ֛חְנוּ בְּנֵ֥י אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְהִנֵּ֨ה הַקָּטֹ֤ן אֶת־אָבִ֙ינוּ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וְהָאֶחָ֖ד אֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: And they replied, “We your servants were twelve brothers, sons of a certain man in the land of Canaan; the youngest, however, is now with our father, and one is no more.”
Transliteration: vayomeru sheneym ashar avadeykha achiym <small></small> anachenu veney iysh-echad veerets khenaan vehineh hakaton et-aviynu hayyvom vehaechad eynenu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֖ם יוֹסֵ֑ף ה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֧רְתִּי אֲלֵכֶ֛ם לֵאמֹ֖ר מְרַגְּלִ֥ים אַתֶּֽם׃
Translated: But Joseph said to them, “It is just as I have told you: You are spies!
Transliteration: vayomer alehem yvosef hu asher divaretiy alekhem lemor merageliym atem

Hebrew: בְּזֹ֖את תִּבָּחֵ֑נוּ חֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ אִם־תֵּצְא֣וּ מִזֶּ֔ה כִּ֧י אִם־בְּב֛וֹא אֲחִיכֶ֥ם הַקָּטֹ֖ן הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: By this you shall be put to the test: unless your youngest brother comes here, by Pharaoh, you shall not depart from this place!
Transliteration: vezot tivachenu chey fareoh im-tetseu mizeh khiy im-vevvo achiykhem hakaton henah

Hebrew: שִׁלְח֨וּ מִכֶּ֣ם אֶחָד֮ וְיִקַּ֣ח אֶת־אֲחִיכֶם֒ וְאַתֶּם֙ הֵאָ֣סְר֔וּ וְיִבָּֽחֲנוּ֙ דִּבְרֵיכֶ֔ם הַֽאֱמֶ֖ת אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְאִם־לֹ֕א חֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה כִּ֥י מְרַגְּלִ֖ים אַתֶּֽם׃
Translated: Let one of you go and bring your brother, while the rest of you remain confined, that your words may be put to the test whether there is truth in you. Else, by Pharaoh, you are nothing but spies!”
Transliteration: shilechu mikhem echad veyikach et-achiykhem veatem heaseru veyivachanu divereykhem haemet itekhem veim-lo chey fareoh khiy merageliym atem

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף אֹתָ֛ם אֶל־מִשְׁמָ֖ר שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: And he confined them in the guardhouse for three days.
Transliteration: vayeesof otam el-mishemar sheloshet yamiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֤ם יוֹסֵף֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י זֹ֥את עֲשׂ֖וּ וִֽחְי֑וּ אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יָרֵֽא׃
Translated: On the third day Joseph said to them, “Do this and you shall live, for I fear God.
Transliteration: vayomer alehem yvosef vayyvom hasheliyshiy zot ashu vicheyu et-haElohim aniy yare

Hebrew: אִם־כֵּנִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם אֲחִיכֶ֣ם אֶחָ֔ד יֵאָסֵ֖ר בְּבֵ֣ית מִשְׁמַרְכֶ֑ם וְאַתֶּם֙ לְכ֣וּ הָבִ֔יאוּ שֶׁ֖בֶר רַעֲב֥וֹן בָּתֵּיכֶֽם׃
Translated: If you are being honest, let one of your brothers be held in your place of detention, while the rest of you go and take home rations for your starving households;
Transliteration: im-kheniym atem achiykhem echad eiaser veveyt mishemarekhem veatem lekhu haviyu shever raavvon vateykhem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֤ם הַקָּטֹן֙ תָּבִ֣יאוּ אֵלַ֔י וְיֵאָמְנ֥וּ דִבְרֵיכֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א תָמ֑וּתוּ וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵֽן׃
Translated: but you must bring me your youngest brother, that your words may be verified and that you may not die.” And they did accordingly.
Transliteration: veet-achiykhem hakaton taviyu elay veeiamenu divereykhem velo tamutu vayaashu-khen

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֗יו אֲבָל֮ אֲשֵׁמִ֣ים <small>׀</small> אֲנַ֘חְנוּ֮ עַל־אָחִ֒ינוּ֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר רָאִ֜ינוּ צָרַ֥ת נַפְשׁ֛וֹ בְּהִתְחַֽנְנ֥וֹ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ וְלֹ֣א שָׁמָ֑עְנוּ עַל־כֵּן֙ בָּ֣אָה אֵלֵ֔ינוּ הַצָּרָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: They said to one another, “Alas, we are being punished on account of our brother, because we looked on at his anguish, yet paid no heed as he pleaded with us. That is why this distress has come upon us.”
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh el-achiyv aval ashemiym <small></small> anachenu al-achiynu asher raiynu tsarat nafeshvo vehitechanenvo eleynu velo shamaenu al-khen vaah eleynu hatsarah hazot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ רְאוּבֵ֨ן אֹתָ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר הֲלוֹא֩ אָמַ֨רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֧ם <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֛ר אַל־תֶּחֶטְא֥וּ בַיֶּ֖לֶד וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם וְגַם־דָּמ֖וֹ הִנֵּ֥ה נִדְרָֽשׁ׃
Translated: Then Reuben spoke up and said to them, “Did I not tell you, ‘Do no wrong to the boy’? But you paid no heed. Now comes the reckoning for his blood.”
Transliteration: vayaan reuven otam lemor halvo amaretiy aleykhem <small></small> lemor al-techeteu vayeled velo shemaetem vegam-damvo hineh niderash

Hebrew: וְהֵם֙ לֹ֣א יָֽדְע֔וּ כִּ֥י שֹׁמֵ֖עַ יוֹסֵ֑ף כִּ֥י הַמֵּלִ֖יץ בֵּינֹתָֽם׃
Translated: They did not know that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between him and them.
Transliteration: vehem lo yadeu khiy shomea yvosef khiy hameliyts veynotam

Hebrew: וַיִּסֹּ֥ב מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם וַיֵּ֑בְךְּ וַיָּ֤שׇׁב אֲלֵהֶם֙ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֵֽאִתָּם֙ אֶת־שִׁמְע֔וֹן וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ר אֹת֖וֹ לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: He turned away from them and wept. But he came back to them and spoke to them; and he took Simeon from among them and had him bound before their eyes.
Transliteration: vayisov mealeyhem vayevekhe vayashׇv alehem vayedaver alehem vayikach meitam et-shimevon vayeesor otvo leeyneyhem

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו יוֹסֵ֗ף וַיְמַלְא֣וּ אֶת־כְּלֵיהֶם֮ בָּר֒ וּלְהָשִׁ֤יב כַּסְפֵּיהֶם֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־שַׂקּ֔וֹ וְלָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם צֵדָ֖ה לַדָּ֑רֶךְ וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם כֵּֽן׃
Translated: Then Joseph gave orders to fill their bags with grain, return each one’s money to his sack, and give them provisions for the journey; and this was done for them.
Transliteration: vayetsav yvosef vayemaleu et-kheleyhem var ulehashiyv khasefeyhem iysh el-shakvo velatet lahem tsedah ladarekhe vayaash lahem khen

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ אֶת־שִׁבְרָ֖ם עַל־חֲמֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: So they loaded their asses with the rations and departed from there.
Transliteration: vayisheu et-shiveram al-chamoreyhem vayelekhu misham

Hebrew: וַיִּפְתַּ֨ח הָאֶחָ֜ד אֶת־שַׂקּ֗וֹ לָתֵ֥ת מִסְפּ֛וֹא לַחֲמֹר֖וֹ בַּמָּל֑וֹן וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־כַּסְפּ֔וֹ וְהִנֵּה־ה֖וּא בְּפִ֥י אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: As one of them was opening his sack to give feed to his ass at the night encampment, he saw his money right there at the mouth of his bag.
Transliteration: vayifetach haechad et-shakvo latet misefvo lachamorvo vamalvon vayare et-khasefvo vehineh-hu vefiy ametachetvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ הוּשַׁ֣ב כַּסְפִּ֔י וְגַ֖ם הִנֵּ֣ה בְאַמְתַּחְתִּ֑י וַיֵּצֵ֣א לִבָּ֗ם וַיֶּֽחֶרְד֞וּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־אָחִיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַה־זֹּ֛את עָשָׂ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֖ים לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: And he said to his brothers, “My money has been returned! It is here in my bag!” Their hearts sank; and, trembling, they turned to one another, saying, “What is this that God has done to us?”
Transliteration: vayomer el-echayv hushav khasefiy vegam hineh veametachetiy vayetse livam vayecheredu iysh el-achiyv lemor mah-zot ashah Elohim lanu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֛אוּ אֶל־יַעֲקֹ֥ב אֲבִיהֶ֖ם אַ֣רְצָה כְּנָ֑עַן וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ ל֔וֹ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־הַקֹּרֹ֥ת אֹתָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: When they came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan, they told him all that had befallen them, saying,
Transliteration: vayavou el-yaakov aviyhem aretsah khenaan vayagiydu lvo et khׇl-hakorot otam lemor

Hebrew: דִּ֠בֶּ֠ר הָאִ֨ישׁ אֲדֹנֵ֥י הָאָ֛רֶץ אִתָּ֖נוּ קָשׁ֑וֹת וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֹתָ֔נוּ כִּֽמְרַגְּלִ֖ים אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: “The man who is lord of the land spoke harshly to us and accused us of spying on the land.
Transliteration: diver haiysh adoney haarets itanu kashvot vayiten otanu khimerageliym et-haarets

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו כֵּנִ֣ים אֲנָ֑חְנוּ לֹ֥א הָיִ֖ינוּ מְרַגְּלִֽים׃
Translated: We said to him, ‘We are being honest; we have never been spies!
Transliteration: vanomer elayv kheniym anachenu lo hayiynu merageliym

Hebrew: שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֲנַ֛חְנוּ אַחִ֖ים בְּנֵ֣י אָבִ֑ינוּ הָאֶחָ֣ד אֵינֶ֔נּוּ וְהַקָּטֹ֥ן הַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־אָבִ֖ינוּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: There were twelve of us brothers, sons by the same father; but one is no more, and the youngest is now with our father in the land of Canaan.’
Transliteration: sheneym-ashar anachenu achiym veney aviynu haechad eynenu vehakaton hayyvom et-aviynu veerets khenaan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֵ֗ינוּ הָאִישׁ֙ אֲדֹנֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ בְּזֹ֣את אֵדַ֔ע כִּ֥י כֵנִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם אֲחִיכֶ֤ם הָֽאֶחָד֙ הַנִּ֣יחוּ אִתִּ֔י וְאֶת־רַעֲב֥וֹן בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם קְח֥וּ וָלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: But the man—who is lord of the land—said to us, ‘By this I shall know that you are being honest: leave one of your brothers with me, and take something for your starving households and be off.
Transliteration: vayomer eleynu haiysh adoney haarets vezot eda khiy kheniym atem achiykhem haechad haniychu itiy veet-raavvon vateykhem kechu valekhu

Hebrew: וְ֠הָבִ֠יאוּ אֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֣ם הַקָּטֹן֮ אֵלַי֒ וְאֵֽדְעָ֗ה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א מְרַגְּלִים֙ אַתֶּ֔ם כִּ֥י כֵנִ֖ים אַתֶּ֑ם אֶת־אֲחִיכֶם֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ תִּסְחָֽרוּ׃
Translated: And bring your youngest brother to me, that I may know that you are not spies, that you are being honest. I will then restore your brother to you, and you shall be free to move about in the land.’”
Transliteration: vehaviyu et-achiykhem hakaton elay veedeah khiy lo merageliym atem khiy kheniym atem et-achiykhem eten lakhem veet-haarets tisecharu

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י הֵ֚ם מְרִיקִ֣ים שַׂקֵּיהֶ֔ם וְהִנֵּה־אִ֥ישׁ צְרוֹר־כַּסְפּ֖וֹ בְּשַׂקּ֑וֹ וַיִּרְא֞וּ אֶת־צְרֹר֧וֹת כַּסְפֵּיהֶ֛ם הֵ֥מָּה וַאֲבִיהֶ֖ם וַיִּירָֽאוּ׃
Translated: As they were emptying their sacks, there, in each one’s sack, was his money-bag! When they and their father saw their money-bags, they were dismayed.
Transliteration: vayehiy hem meriykiym shakeyhem vehineh-iysh tservor-khasefvo veshakvo vayireu et-tserorvot khasefeyhem hemah vaaviyhem vayiyrau

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ יַעֲקֹ֣ב אֲבִיהֶ֔ם אֹתִ֖י שִׁכַּלְתֶּ֑ם יוֹסֵ֤ף אֵינֶ֙נּוּ֙ וְשִׁמְע֣וֹן אֵינֶ֔נּוּ וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֣ן תִּקָּ֔חוּ עָלַ֖י הָי֥וּ כֻלָּֽנָה׃
Translated: Their father Jacob said to them, “It is always me that you bereave: Joseph is no more and Simeon is no more, and now you would take away Benjamin. These things always happen to me!”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem yaakov aviyhem otiy shikhaletem yvosef eynenu veshimevon eynenu veet-vineyamin tikachu alay hayu khulanah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר רְאוּבֵן֙ אֶל־אָבִ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י בָנַי֙ תָּמִ֔ית אִם־לֹ֥א אֲבִיאֶ֖נּוּ אֵלֶ֑יךָ תְּנָ֤ה אֹתוֹ֙ עַל־יָדִ֔י וַאֲנִ֖י אֲשִׁיבֶ֥נּוּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Then Reuben said to his father, “You may kill my two sons if I do not bring him back to you. Put him in my care, and I will return him to you.”
Transliteration: vayomer reuven el-aviyv lemor et-sheney vanay tamiyt im-lo aviyenu eleykha tenah otvo al-yadiy vaaniy ashiyvenu eleykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לֹֽא־יֵרֵ֥ד בְּנִ֖י עִמָּכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אָחִ֨יו מֵ֜ת וְה֧וּא לְבַדּ֣וֹ נִשְׁאָ֗ר וּקְרָאָ֤הוּ אָסוֹן֙ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּֽלְכוּ־בָ֔הּ וְהוֹרַדְתֶּ֧ם אֶת־שֵׂיבָתִ֛י בְּיָג֖וֹן שְׁאֽוֹלָה׃
Translated: But he said, “My son must not go down with you, for his brother is dead and he alone is left. If he meets with disaster on the journey you are taking, you will send my white head down to Sheol in grief.”
Transliteration: vayomer lo-eired veniy imakhem khiy-achiyv met vehu levadvo nishear ukeraahu asvon vaderekhe asher telekhu-vah vehvoradetem et-sheyvatiy veyagvon shevolah

Hebrew: וְהָרָעָ֖ב כָּבֵ֥ד בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: But the famine in the land was severe.
Transliteration: veharaav khaved vaarets

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר כִּלּוּ֙ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל אֶת־הַשֶּׁ֔בֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵבִ֖יאוּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֲבִיהֶ֔ם שֻׁ֖בוּ שִׁבְרוּ־לָ֥נוּ מְעַט־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated: And when they had eaten up the rations which they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, “Go again and procure some food for us.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher khilu leekhol et-hashever asher heviyu mimitserayiim vayomer aleyhem aviyhem shuvu shiveru-lanu meat-okhel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֵלָ֛יו יְהוּדָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הָעֵ֣ד הֵעִד֩ בָּ֨נוּ הָאִ֤ישׁ לֵאמֹר֙ לֹֽא־תִרְא֣וּ פָנַ֔י בִּלְתִּ֖י אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: But Judah said to him, “The man warned us, ‘Do not let me see your faces unless your brother is with you.’
Transliteration: vayomer elayv yehudah lemor haed heid vanu haiysh lemor lo-tireu fanay viletiy achiykhem itekhem

Hebrew: אִם־יֶשְׁךָ֛ מְשַׁלֵּ֥חַ אֶת־אָחִ֖ינוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ נֵרְדָ֕ה וְנִשְׁבְּרָ֥ה לְךָ֖ אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated: If you will let our brother go with us, we will go down and procure food for you;
Transliteration: im-yeshekha meshalecha et-achiynu itanu neredah venisheverah lekha okhel

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֵינְךָ֥ מְשַׁלֵּ֖חַ לֹ֣א נֵרֵ֑ד כִּֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אָמַ֤ר אֵלֵ֙ינוּ֙ לֹֽא־תִרְא֣וּ פָנַ֔י בִּלְתִּ֖י אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: but if you will not let him go, we will not go down, for that man said to us, ‘Do not let me see your faces unless your brother is with you.’”
Transliteration: veim-eynekha meshalecha lo nered khiy-haiysh amar eleynu lo-tireu fanay viletiy achiykhem itekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָמָ֥ה הֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם לִ֑י לְהַגִּ֣יד לָאִ֔ישׁ הַע֥וֹד לָכֶ֖ם אָֽח׃
Translated: And Israel said, “Why did you serve me so ill as to tell the man that you had another brother?”
Transliteration: vayomer yisherael lamah hareotem liy lehagiyd laiysh havod lakhem ach

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֡וּ שָׁא֣וֹל שָֽׁאַל־הָ֠אִ֠ישׁ לָ֣נוּ וּלְמֽוֹלַדְתֵּ֜נוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר הַע֨וֹד אֲבִיכֶ֥ם חַי֙ הֲיֵ֣שׁ לָכֶ֣ם אָ֔ח וַנַּ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ עַל־פִּ֖י הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה הֲיָד֣וֹעַ נֵדַ֔ע כִּ֣י יֹאמַ֔ר הוֹרִ֖ידוּ אֶת־אֲחִיכֶֽם׃
Translated: They replied, “But the man kept asking about us and our family, saying, ‘Is your father still living? Have you another brother?’ And we answered him accordingly. How were we to know that he would say, ‘Bring your brother here’?”
Transliteration: vayomeru shavol shaal-haiysh lanu ulemvoladetenu lemor havod aviykhem chay haeish lakhem ach vanaged-lvo al-fiy hadevariym haeleh hayadvoa neda khiy yomar hvoriydu et-achiykhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוּדָ֜ה אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אָבִ֗יו שִׁלְחָ֥ה הַנַּ֛עַר אִתִּ֖י וְנָק֣וּמָה וְנֵלֵ֑כָה וְנִֽחְיֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א נָמ֔וּת גַּם־אֲנַ֥חְנוּ גַם־אַתָּ֖ה גַּם־טַפֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated: Then Judah said to his father Israel, “Send the boy in my care, and let us be on our way, that we may live and not die—you and we and our children.
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah el-yisherael aviyv shilechah hanaar itiy venakumah venelekhah venicheyeh velo namut gam-anachenu gam-atah gam-tafenu

Hebrew: אָֽנֹכִי֙ אֶֽעֶרְבֶ֔נּוּ מִיָּדִ֖י תְּבַקְשֶׁ֑נּוּ אִם־לֹ֨א הֲבִיאֹתִ֤יו אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ וְהִצַּגְתִּ֣יו לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְחָטָ֥אתִֽי לְךָ֖ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: I myself will be surety for him; you may hold me responsible: if I do not bring him back to you and set him before you, I shall stand guilty before you forever.
Transliteration: anokhiy eerevenu miyadiy tevakeshenu im-lo haviyotiyv eleykha vehitsagetiyv lefaneykha vechatatiy lekha khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: כִּ֖י לוּלֵ֣א הִתְמַהְמָ֑הְנוּ כִּֽי־עַתָּ֥ה שַׁ֖בְנוּ זֶ֥ה פַעֲמָֽיִם׃
Translated: For we could have been there and back twice if we had not dawdled.”
Transliteration: khiy lule hitemahemahenu khiy-atah shavenu zeh faamayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אֲבִיהֶ֗ם אִם־כֵּ֣ן <small>׀</small> אֵפוֹא֮ זֹ֣את עֲשׂוּ֒ קְח֞וּ מִזִּמְרַ֤ת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ בִּכְלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהוֹרִ֥ידוּ לָאִ֖ישׁ מִנְחָ֑ה מְעַ֤ט צֳרִי֙ וּמְעַ֣ט דְּבַ֔שׁ נְכֹ֣את וָלֹ֔ט בׇּטְנִ֖ים וּשְׁקֵדִֽים׃
Translated: Then their father Israel said to them, “If it must be so, do this: take some of the choice products of the land in your baggage, and carry them down as a gift for the man—some balm and some honey, gum, ladanum, pistachio nuts, and almonds.
Transliteration: vayomer alehem yisherael aviyhem im-khen <small></small> efvo zot ashu kechu mizimerat haarets vikheleykhem vehvoriydu laiysh minechah meat tsoriy umeat devash nekhot valot vׇteniym ushekediym

Hebrew: וְכֶ֥סֶף מִשְׁנֶ֖ה קְח֣וּ בְיֶדְכֶ֑ם וְאֶת־הַכֶּ֜סֶף הַמּוּשָׁ֨ב בְּפִ֤י אַמְתְּחֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ תָּשִׁ֣יבוּ בְיֶדְכֶ֔ם אוּלַ֥י מִשְׁגֶּ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: And take with you double the money, carrying back with you the money that was replaced in the mouths of your bags; perhaps it was a mistake.
Transliteration: vekhesef misheneh kechu veyedekhem veet-hakhesef hamushav vefiy ametechoteykhem tashiyvu veyedekhem ulay mishegeh hu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֖ם קָ֑חוּ וְק֖וּמוּ שׁ֥וּבוּ אֶל־הָאִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Take your brother too; and go back at once to the man.
Transliteration: veet-achiykhem kachu vekumu shuvu el-haiysh

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ל שַׁדַּ֗י יִתֵּ֨ן לָכֶ֤ם רַחֲמִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ וְשִׁלַּ֥ח לָכֶ֛ם אֶת־אֲחִיכֶ֥ם אַחֵ֖ר וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֑ין וַאֲנִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁכֹ֖לְתִּי שָׁכָֽלְתִּי׃
Translated: And may El Shaddai dispose the man to mercy toward you, that he may release to you your other brother, as well as Benjamin. As for me, if I am to be bereaved, I shall be bereaved.”
Transliteration: veel shaday yiten lakhem rachamiym lifeney haiysh veshilach lakhem et-achiykhem acher veet-vineyamiyn vaaniy khaasher shakholetiy shakhaletiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֤וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וּמִשְׁנֶה־כֶּ֛סֶף לָקְח֥וּ בְיָדָ֖ם וְאֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וַיָּקֻ֙מוּ֙ וַיֵּרְד֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: So the agents took that gift, and they took with them double the money, as well as Benjamin. They made their way down to Egypt, where they presented themselves to Joseph.
Transliteration: vayikechu haanashiym et-haminechah hazot umisheneh-khesef lakechu veyadam veet-vineyamin vayakumu vayeredu mitserayiim vayaamedu lifeney yvosef

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא יוֹסֵ֣ף אִתָּם֮ אֶת־בִּנְיָמִין֒ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ לַֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ הָבֵ֥א אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים הַבָּ֑יְתָה וּטְבֹ֤חַ טֶ֙בַח֙ וְהָכֵ֔ן כִּ֥י אִתִּ֛י יֹאכְל֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בַּֽצׇּהֳרָֽיִם׃
Translated: When Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to his house steward, “Take those men into the house; slaughter and prepare an animal, for those men will dine with me at noon.”
Transliteration: vayare yvosef itam et-vineyamiyn vayomer laasher al-veytvo have et-haanashiym havayetah utevocha tevach vehakhen khiy itiy yokhelu haanashiym vatsׇhorayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ הָאִ֔ישׁ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיָּבֵ֥א הָאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בֵּ֥יתָה יוֹסֵֽף׃
