Translated: The man did as Joseph said, and he brought the men into Joseph’s house.
Transliteration: vayaash haiysh khaasher amar yvosef vayave haiysh et-haanashiym veytah yvosef

Hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֣וּ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֗ים כִּ֣י הֽוּבְאוּ֮ בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵף֒ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ עַל־דְּבַ֤ר הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ הַשָּׁ֤ב בְּאַמְתְּחֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ בַּתְּחִלָּ֔ה אֲנַ֖חְנוּ מֽוּבָאִ֑ים לְהִתְגֹּלֵ֤ל עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ וּלְהִתְנַפֵּ֣ל עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְלָקַ֧חַת אֹתָ֛נוּ לַעֲבָדִ֖ים וְאֶת־חֲמֹרֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: But the men were frightened at being brought into Joseph’s house. “It must be,” they thought, “because of the money replaced in our bags the first time that we have been brought inside, as a pretext to attack us and seize us as slaves, with our pack animals.”
Transliteration: vayiyreu haanashiym khiy huveu veyt yvosef vayomeru al-devar hakhesef hashav veametechoteynu vatechilah anachenu muvaiym lehitegolel aleynu ulehitenafel aleynu velakachat otanu laavadiym veet-chamoreynu

Hebrew: וַֽיִּגְּשׁוּ֙ אֶל־הָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו פֶּ֥תַח הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: So they went up to Joseph’s house steward and spoke to him at the entrance of the house.
Transliteration: vayigeshu el-haiysh asher al-veyt yvosef vayedaveru elayv fetach havayiit

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֑י יָרֹ֥ד יָרַ֛דְנוּ בַּתְּחִלָּ֖ה לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated: “If you please, my lord,” they said, “we came down once before to procure food.
Transliteration: vayomeru viy adoniy yarod yaradenu vatechilah lishevׇr-okhel

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּי־בָ֣אנוּ אֶל־הַמָּל֗וֹן וַֽנִּפְתְּחָה֙ אֶת־אַמְתְּחֹתֵ֔ינוּ וְהִנֵּ֤ה כֶֽסֶף־אִישׁ֙ בְּפִ֣י אַמְתַּחְתּ֔וֹ כַּסְפֵּ֖נוּ בְּמִשְׁקָל֑וֹ וַנָּ֥שֶׁב אֹת֖וֹ בְּיָדֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: But when we arrived at the night encampment and opened our bags, there was each one’s money in the mouth of his bag, our money in full. So we have brought it back with us.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-vanu el-hamalvon vanifetechah et-ametechoteynu vehineh khesef-iysh vefiy ametachetvo khasefenu vemishekalvo vanashev otvo veyadenu

Hebrew: וְכֶ֧סֶף אַחֵ֛ר הוֹרַ֥דְנוּ בְיָדֵ֖נוּ לִשְׁבׇּר־אֹ֑כֶל לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְנוּ מִי־שָׂ֥ם כַּסְפֵּ֖נוּ בְּאַמְתְּחֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: And we have brought down with us other money to procure food. We do not know who put the money in our bags.”
Transliteration: vekhesef acher hvoradenu veyadenu lishevׇr-okhel lo yadaenu miy-sham khasefenu veametechoteynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ שָׁל֨וֹם לָכֶ֜ם אַל־תִּירָ֗אוּ אֱלֹ֨הֵיכֶ֜ם וֵֽאלֹהֵ֤י אֲבִיכֶם֙ נָתַ֨ן לָכֶ֤ם מַטְמוֹן֙ בְּאַמְתְּחֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם כַּסְפְּכֶ֖ם בָּ֣א אֵלָ֑י וַיּוֹצֵ֥א אֲלֵהֶ֖ם אֶת־שִׁמְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: He replied, “All is well with you; do not be afraid. Your God, the God of your father’s [house], must have put treasure in your bags for you. I got your payment.” And he brought out Simeon to them.
Transliteration: vayomer shalvom lakhem al-tiyrau eloheykhem velohey aviykhem natan lakhem matemvon veametechoteykhem khasefekhem va elay vayyvotse alehem et-shimevon

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֥א הָאִ֛ישׁ אֶת־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים בֵּ֣יתָה יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיִּתֶּן־מַ֙יִם֙ וַיִּרְחֲצ֣וּ רַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּתֵּ֥ן מִסְפּ֖וֹא לַחֲמֹֽרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Then the steward brought the men into Joseph’s house; he gave them water to bathe their feet, and he provided feed for their asses.
Transliteration: vayave haiysh et-haanashiym veytah yvosef vayiten-mayiim vayirechatsu rageleyhem vayiten misefvo lachamoreyhem

Hebrew: וַיָּכִ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה עַד־בּ֥וֹא יוֹסֵ֖ף בַּֽצׇּהֳרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י שָֽׁמְע֔וּ כִּי־שָׁ֖ם יֹ֥אכְלוּ לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: They laid out their gifts to await Joseph’s arrival at noon, for they had heard that they were to dine there.
Transliteration: vayakhiynu et-haminechah ad-vvo yvosef vatsׇhorayiim khiy shameu khiy-sham yokhelu lachem

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ הַבַּ֔יְתָה וַיָּבִ֥יאּוּ ל֛וֹ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָדָ֖ם הַבָּ֑יְתָה וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֖וֹ אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: When Joseph came home, they presented to him the gifts that they had brought with them into the house, bowing low before him to the ground.
Transliteration: vayavo yvosef havayetah vayaviyu lvo et-haminechah asher-veyadam havayetah vayishetachavu-lvo aretsah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל לָהֶם֙ לְשָׁל֔וֹם וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲשָׁל֛וֹם אֲבִיכֶ֥ם הַזָּקֵ֖ן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֑ם הַעוֹדֶ֖נּוּ חָֽי׃
Translated: He greeted them, and he said, “How is your aged father of whom you spoke? Is he still in good health?”
Transliteration: vayisheal lahem leshalvom vayomer hashalvom aviykhem hazaken asher amaretem havodenu chay

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ שָׁל֛וֹם לְעַבְדְּךָ֥ לְאָבִ֖ינוּ עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ חָ֑י וַֽיִּקְּד֖וּ (וישתחו) [וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲוֽוּ]׃
Translated: They replied, “It is well with your servant our father; he is still in good health.” And they bowed and made obeisance.
Transliteration: vayomeru shalvom leavedekha leaviynu vodenu chay vayikedu (vyshtchv) [vayishetachavu]

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֞רְא אֶת־בִּנְיָמִ֣ין אָחִיו֮ בֶּן־אִמּוֹ֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲזֶה֙ אֲחִיכֶ֣ם הַקָּטֹ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֵלָ֑י וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֱלֹהִ֥ים יׇחְנְךָ֖ בְּנִֽי׃
Translated: Looking about, he saw his brother Benjamin, his mother’s son, and asked, “Is this your youngest brother of whom you spoke to me?” And he went on, “May God be gracious to you, my boy.”
Transliteration: vayisha eynayv vayare et-vineyamiyn achiyv ven-imvo vayomer hazeh achiykhem hakaton asher amaretem elay vayomar Elohim yׇchenekha veniy

Hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֣ר יוֹסֵ֗ף כִּֽי־נִכְמְר֤וּ רַחֲמָיו֙ אֶל־אָחִ֔יו וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ לִבְכּ֑וֹת וַיָּבֹ֥א הַחַ֖דְרָה וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: With that, Joseph hurried out, for he was overcome with feeling toward his brother and was on the verge of tears; he went into a room and wept there.
Transliteration: vayemaher yvosef khiy-nikhemeru rachamayv el-achiyv vayevakesh livekhvot vayavo hachaderah vayevekhe shamah

Hebrew: וַיִּרְחַ֥ץ פָּנָ֖יו וַיֵּצֵ֑א וַיִּ֨תְאַפַּ֔ק וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שִׂ֥ימוּ לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: Then he washed his face, reappeared, and—now in control of himself—gave the order, “Serve the meal.”
Transliteration: vayirechats fanayv vayetse vayiteafak vayomer shiymu lachem

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ ל֛וֹ לְבַדּ֖וֹ וְלָהֶ֣ם לְבַדָּ֑ם וְלַמִּצְרִ֞ים הָאֹכְלִ֤ים אִתּוֹ֙ לְבַדָּ֔ם כִּי֩ לֹ֨א יוּכְל֜וּן הַמִּצְרִ֗ים לֶאֱכֹ֤ל אֶת־הָֽעִבְרִים֙ לֶ֔חֶם כִּי־תוֹעֵבָ֥ה הִ֖וא לְמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They served him by himself, and them by themselves, and the Egyptians who ate with him by themselves; for the Egyptians could not dine with the Hebrews, since that would be abhorrent to the Egyptians.
Transliteration: vayashiymu lvo levadvo velahem levadam velamitseriym haokheliym itvo levadam khiy lo yukhelun hamitseriym leekhol et-haiveriym lechem khiy-tvoevah hiv lemitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ לְפָנָ֔יו הַבְּכֹר֙ כִּבְכֹ֣רָת֔וֹ וְהַצָּעִ֖יר כִּצְעִרָת֑וֹ וַיִּתְמְה֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אִ֥ישׁ אֶל־רֵעֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: As they were seated by his direction, from the oldest in the order of his seniority to the youngest in the order of his youth, the men looked at one another in astonishment.
Transliteration: vayeshevu lefanayv havekhor khivekhoratvo vehatsaiyr khitseiratvo vayitemehu haanashiym iysh el-reehu

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א מַשְׂאֹ֜ת מֵאֵ֣ת פָּנָיו֮ אֲלֵהֶם֒ וַתֵּ֜רֶב מַשְׂאַ֧ת בִּנְיָמִ֛ן מִמַּשְׂאֹ֥ת כֻּלָּ֖ם חָמֵ֣שׁ יָד֑וֹת וַיִּשְׁתּ֥וּ וַֽיִּשְׁכְּר֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Portions were served them from his table; but Benjamin’s portion was several times that of anyone else. And they drank their fill with him.
Transliteration: vayisha masheot meet fanayv alehem vaterev masheat vineyamin mimasheot khulam chamesh yadvot vayishetu vayishekheru imvo

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֞ו אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּיתוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ מַלֵּ֞א אֶת־אַמְתְּחֹ֤ת הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ אֹ֔כֶל כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יוּכְל֖וּן שְׂאֵ֑ת וְשִׂ֥ים כֶּֽסֶף־אִ֖ישׁ בְּפִ֥י אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Then he instructed his house steward as follows, “Fill the men’s bags with food, as much as they can carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his bag.
Transliteration: vayetsav et-asher al-veytvo lemor male et-ametechot haanashiym okhel khaasher yukhelun sheet veshiym khesef-iysh vefiy ametachetvo

Hebrew: וְאֶת־גְּבִיעִ֞י גְּבִ֣יעַ הַכֶּ֗סֶף תָּשִׂים֙ בְּפִי֙ אַמְתַּ֣חַת הַקָּטֹ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת כֶּ֣סֶף שִׁבְר֑וֹ וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כִּדְבַ֥ר יוֹסֵ֖ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃
Translated: Put my silver goblet in the mouth of the bag of the youngest one, together with his money for the rations.” And he did as Joseph told him.
Transliteration: veet-geviyiy geviya hakhesef tashiym vefiy ametachat hakaton veet khesef shivervo vayaash khidevar yvosef asher diver

Hebrew: הַבֹּ֖קֶר א֑וֹר וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים שֻׁלְּח֔וּ הֵ֖מָּה וַחֲמֹרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: With the first light of morning, the men were sent off with their pack animals.
Transliteration: havoker vor vehaanashiym shulechu hemah vachamoreyhem

Hebrew: הֵ֠ם יָֽצְא֣וּ אֶת־הָעִיר֮ לֹ֣א הִרְחִ֒יקוּ֒ וְיוֹסֵ֤ף אָמַר֙ לַֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־בֵּית֔וֹ ק֥וּם רְדֹ֖ף אַחֲרֵ֣י הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֑ים וְהִשַּׂגְתָּם֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לָ֛מָּה שִׁלַּמְתֶּ֥ם רָעָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת טוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: They had just left the city and had not gone far, when Joseph said to his house steward, “Up, go after those men! And when you overtake them, say to them, ‘Why did you repay good with evil?
Transliteration: hem yatseu et-haiyr lo hirechiyku veyvosef amar laasher al-veytvo kum redof acharey haanashiym vehishagetam veamareta alehem lamah shilametem raah tachat tvovah

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא זֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁתֶּ֤ה אֲדֹנִי֙ בּ֔וֹ וְה֕וּא נַחֵ֥שׁ יְנַחֵ֖שׁ בּ֑וֹ הֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשִׂיתֶֽם׃
Translated: It is the very one from which my master drinks and which he uses for divination. It was a wicked thing for you to do!’”
Transliteration: halvo zeh asher yisheteh adoniy vvo vehu nachesh yenachesh vvo hareotem asher ashiytem

Hebrew: וַֽיַּשִּׂגֵ֑ם וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: He overtook them and spoke those words to them.
Transliteration: vayashigem vayedaver alehem et-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֔יו לָ֚מָּה יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲדֹנִ֔י כַּדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה חָלִ֙ילָה֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ מֵעֲשׂ֖וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And they said to him, “Why does my lord say such things? Far be it from your servants to do anything of the kind!
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv lamah yedaver adoniy khadevariym haeleh chaliylah laavadeykha meashvot khadavar hazeh

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן כֶּ֗סֶף אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָצָ֙אנוּ֙ בְּפִ֣י אַמְתְּחֹתֵ֔ינוּ הֱשִׁיבֹ֥נוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְאֵ֗יךְ נִגְנֹב֙ מִבֵּ֣ית אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ כֶּ֖סֶף א֥וֹ זָהָֽב׃
Translated: Here we brought back to you from the land of Canaan the money that we found in the mouths of our bags. How then could we have stolen any silver or gold from your master’s house!
Transliteration: hen khesef asher matsanu vefiy ametechoteynu heshiyvonu eleykha meerets khenaan veeykhe nigenov miveyt adoneykha khesef vo zahav

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֥א אִתּ֛וֹ מֵעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ וָמֵ֑ת וְגַם־אֲנַ֕חְנוּ נִֽהְיֶ֥ה לַֽאדֹנִ֖י לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: Whichever of your servants it is found with shall die; the rest of us, moreover, shall become slaves to my lord.”
Transliteration: asher yimatse itvo meavadeykha vamet vegam-anachenu niheyeh ladoniy laavadiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר גַּם־עַתָּ֥ה כְדִבְרֵיכֶ֖ם כֶּן־ה֑וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִמָּצֵ֤א אִתּוֹ֙ יִהְיֶה־לִּ֣י עָ֔בֶד וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּהְי֥וּ נְקִיִּֽם׃
Translated: He replied, “Although what you are proposing is right, only the one with whom it is found shall be my slave; but the rest of you shall go free.”
Transliteration: vayomer gam-atah khedivereykhem khen-hu asher yimatse itvo yiheyeh-liy aved veatem tiheyu nekiyim

Hebrew: וַֽיְמַהֲר֗וּ וַיּוֹרִ֛דוּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אַמְתַּחְתּ֖וֹ אָ֑רְצָה וַֽיִּפְתְּח֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ אַמְתַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: So each one hastened to lower his bag to the ground, and each one opened his bag.
Transliteration: vayemaharu vayyvoridu iysh et-ametachetvo aretsah vayifetechu iysh ametachetvo

Hebrew: וַיְחַפֵּ֕שׂ בַּגָּד֣וֹל הֵחֵ֔ל וּבַקָּטֹ֖ן כִּלָּ֑ה וַיִּמָּצֵא֙ הַגָּבִ֔יעַ בְּאַמְתַּ֖חַת בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: He searched, beginning with the oldest and ending with the youngest; and the goblet turned up in Benjamin’s bag.
Transliteration: vayechafesh vagadvol hechel uvakaton khilah vayimatse hagaviya veametachat vineyamin

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְע֖וּ שִׂמְלֹתָ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲמֹס֙ אִ֣ישׁ עַל־חֲמֹר֔וֹ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ הָעִֽירָה׃
Translated: At this they rent their clothes. Each reloaded his pack animal, and they returned to the city.
Transliteration: vayikereu shimelotam vayaamos iysh al-chamorvo vayashuvu haiyrah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יְהוּדָ֤ה וְאֶחָיו֙ בֵּ֣יתָה יוֹסֵ֔ף וְה֖וּא עוֹדֶ֣נּוּ שָׁ֑ם וַיִּפְּל֥וּ לְפָנָ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: When Judah and his brothers reentered the house of Joseph, who was still there, they threw themselves on the ground before him.
Transliteration: vayavo yehudah veechayv veytah yvosef vehu vodenu sham vayifelu lefanayv aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף מָֽה־הַמַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֑ם הֲל֣וֹא יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּֽי־נַחֵ֧שׁ יְנַחֵ֛שׁ אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּמֹֽנִי׃
Translated: Joseph said to them, “What is this deed that you have done? Do you not know that a man like me practices divination?”
Transliteration: vayomer lahem yvosef mah-hamaasheh hazeh asher ashiytem halvo yedaetem khiy-nachesh yenachesh iysh asher khamoniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוּדָ֗ה מַה־נֹּאמַר֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י מַה־נְּדַבֵּ֖ר וּמַה־נִּצְטַדָּ֑ק הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים מָצָא֙ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ הִנֶּ֤נּוּ עֲבָדִים֙ לַֽאדֹנִ֔י גַּם־אֲנַ֕חְנוּ גַּ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־נִמְצָ֥א הַגָּבִ֖יעַ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Judah replied, “What can we say to my lord? How can we plead, how can we prove our innocence? God has uncovered the crime of your servants. Here we are, then, slaves of my lord, the rest of us as much as he in whose possession the goblet was found.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehudah mah-nomar ladoniy mah-nedaver umah-nitsetadak haElohim matsa et-avon avadeykha hinenu avadiym ladoniy gam-anachenu gam asher-nimetsa hagaviya veyadvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר חָלִ֣ילָה לִּ֔י מֵעֲשׂ֖וֹת זֹ֑את הָאִ֡ישׁ אֲשֶׁר֩ נִמְצָ֨א הַגָּבִ֜יעַ בְּיָד֗וֹ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶה־לִּ֣י עָ֔בֶד וְאַתֶּ֕ם עֲל֥וּ לְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־אֲבִיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: But he replied, “Far be it from me to act thus! Only the one in whose possession the goblet was found shall be my slave; the rest of you go back in peace to your father.”
Transliteration: vayomer chaliylah liy meashvot zot haiysh asher nimetsa hagaviya veyadvo hu yiheyeh-liy aved veatem alu leshalvom el-aviykhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֨שׁ אֵלָ֜יו יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִי֒ יְדַבֶּר־נָ֨א עַבְדְּךָ֤ דָבָר֙ בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְאַל־יִ֥חַר אַפְּךָ֖ בְּעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י כָמ֖וֹךָ כְּפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Then Judah went up to him and said, “Please, my lord, let your servant appeal to my lord, and do not be impatient with your servant, you who are the equal of Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vayigash elayv yehudah vayomer viy adoniy yedaver-na avedekha davar veׇzeney adoniy veal-yichar afekha veavedekha khiy khamvokha khefareoh

Hebrew: אֲדֹנִ֣י שָׁאַ֔ל אֶת־עֲבָדָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר הֲיֵשׁ־לָכֶ֥ם אָ֖ב אוֹ־אָֽח׃
Translated: My lord asked his servants, ‘Have you a father or another brother?’
Transliteration: adoniy shaal et-avadayv lemor haeish-lakhem av vo-ach

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י יֶשׁ־לָ֙נוּ֙ אָ֣ב זָקֵ֔ן וְיֶ֥לֶד זְקֻנִ֖ים קָטָ֑ן וְאָחִ֣יו מֵ֔ת וַיִּוָּתֵ֨ר ה֧וּא לְבַדּ֛וֹ לְאִמּ֖וֹ וְאָבִ֥יו אֲהֵבֽוֹ׃
Translated: We told my lord, ‘We have an old father, and there is a child of his old age, the youngest; his full brother is dead, so that he alone is left of his mother, and his father dotes on him.’
Transliteration: vanomer el-adoniy yesh-lanu av zaken veyeled zekuniym katan veachiyv met vayivater hu levadvo leimvo veaviyv ahevvo

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ הוֹרִדֻ֖הוּ אֵלָ֑י וְאָשִׂ֥ימָה עֵינִ֖י עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: Then you said to your servants, ‘Bring him down to me, that I may set eyes on him.’
Transliteration: vatomer el-avadeykha hvoriduhu elay veashiymah eyniy alayv

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל הַנַּ֖עַר לַעֲזֹ֣ב אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וְעָזַ֥ב אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וָמֵֽת׃
Translated: We said to my lord, ‘The boy cannot leave his father; if he were to leave him, his father would die.’
Transliteration: vanomer el-adoniy lo-yukhal hanaar laazov et-aviyv veazav et-aviyv vamet

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ אִם־לֹ֥א יֵרֵ֛ד אֲחִיכֶ֥ם הַקָּטֹ֖ן אִתְּכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תֹסִפ֖וּן לִרְא֥וֹת פָּנָֽי׃
Translated: But you said to your servants, ‘Unless your youngest brother comes down with you, do not let me see your faces.’
Transliteration: vatomer el-avadeykha im-lo eired achiykhem hakaton itekhem lo tosifun lirevot fanay

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כִּ֣י עָלִ֔ינוּ אֶֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֖ אָבִ֑י וַנַּ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translated: When we came back to your servant my father, we reported my lord’s words to him.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy aliynu el-avedekha aviy vanaged-lvo et diverey adoniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָבִ֑ינוּ שֻׁ֖בוּ שִׁבְרוּ־לָ֥נוּ מְעַט־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translated: “Later our father said, ‘Go back and procure some food for us.’
Transliteration: vayomer aviynu shuvu shiveru-lanu meat-okhel

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א נוּכַ֖ל לָרֶ֑דֶת אִם־יֵשׁ֩ אָחִ֨ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֤ן אִתָּ֙נוּ֙ וְיָרַ֔דְנוּ כִּי־לֹ֣א נוּכַ֗ל לִרְאוֹת֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ וְאָחִ֥ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֖ן אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: We answered, ‘We cannot go down; only if our youngest brother is with us can we go down, for we may not show our faces to the man unless our youngest brother is with us.’
Transliteration: vanomer lo nukhal laredet im-eish achiynu hakaton itanu veyaradenu khiy-lo nukhal lirevot feney haiysh veachiynu hakaton eynenu itanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֖י אֵלֵ֑ינוּ אַתֶּ֣ם יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁנַ֖יִם יָֽלְדָה־לִּ֥י אִשְׁתִּֽי׃
Translated: Your servant my father said to us, ‘As you know, my wife bore me two sons.
Transliteration: vayomer avedekha aviy eleynu atem yedaetem khiy shenayiim yaledah-liy ishetiy

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָֽאֶחָד֙ מֵֽאִתִּ֔י וָאֹמַ֕ר אַ֖ךְ טָרֹ֣ף טֹרָ֑ף וְלֹ֥א רְאִיתִ֖יו עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: But one is gone from me, and I said: Alas, he was torn by a beast! And I have not seen him since.
Transliteration: vayetse haechad meitiy vaomar akhe tarof toraf velo reiytiyv ad-henah

Hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֧ם גַּם־אֶת־זֶ֛ה מֵעִ֥ם פָּנַ֖י וְקָרָ֣הוּ אָס֑וֹן וְהֽוֹרַדְתֶּ֧ם אֶת־שֵׂיבָתִ֛י בְּרָעָ֖ה שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
Translated: If you take this one from me, too, and he meets with disaster, you will send my white head down to Sheol in sorrow.’
Transliteration: ulekachetem gam-et-zeh meim fanay vekarahu asvon vehvoradetem et-sheyvatiy veraah sheolah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כְּבֹאִי֙ אֶל־עַבְדְּךָ֣ אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ קְשׁוּרָ֥ה בְנַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: “Now, if I come to your servant my father and the boy is not with us—since his own life is so bound up with his—
Transliteration: veatah khevoiy el-avedekha aviy vehanaar eynenu itanu venafeshvo keshurah venafeshvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּרְאוֹת֛וֹ כִּי־אֵ֥ין הַנַּ֖עַר וָמֵ֑ת וְהוֹרִ֨ידוּ עֲבָדֶ֜יךָ אֶת־שֵׂיבַ֨ת עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֛ינוּ בְּיָג֖וֹן שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
Translated: when he sees that the boy is not with us, he will die, and your servants will send the white head of your servant our father down to Sheol in grief.
Transliteration: vehayah khirevotvo khiy-eyn hanaar vamet vehvoriydu avadeykha et-sheyvat avedekha aviynu veyagvon sheolah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עַבְדְּךָ֙ עָרַ֣ב אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר מֵעִ֥ם אָבִ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־לֹ֤א אֲבִיאֶ֙נּוּ֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְחָטָ֥אתִי לְאָבִ֖י כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: Now your servant has pledged himself for the boy to my father, saying, ‘If I do not bring him back to you, I shall stand guilty before my father forever.’
Transliteration: khiy avedekha arav et-hanaar meim aviy lemor im-lo aviyenu eleykha vechatatiy leaviy khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה יֵֽשֶׁב־נָ֤א עַבְדְּךָ֙ תַּ֣חַת הַנַּ֔עַר עֶ֖בֶד לַֽאדֹנִ֑י וְהַנַּ֖עַר יַ֥עַל עִם־אֶחָֽיו׃
Translated: Therefore, please let your servant remain as a slave to my lord instead of the boy, and let the boy go back with his brothers.
Transliteration: veatah eishev-na avedekha tachat hanaar eved ladoniy vehanaar yaal im-echayv

Hebrew: כִּי־אֵיךְ֙ אֶֽעֱלֶ֣ה אֶל־אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתִּ֑י פֶּ֚ן אֶרְאֶ֣ה בָרָ֔ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִמְצָ֖א אֶת־אָבִֽי׃
Translated: For how can I go back to my father unless the boy is with me? Let me not be witness to the woe that would overtake my father!”
Transliteration: khiy-eykhe eeleh el-aviy vehanaar eynenu itiy fen ereeh vara asher yimetsa et-aviy

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יָכֹ֨ל יוֹסֵ֜ף לְהִתְאַפֵּ֗ק לְכֹ֤ל הַנִּצָּבִים֙ עָלָ֔יו וַיִּקְרָ֕א הוֹצִ֥יאוּ כׇל־אִ֖ישׁ מֵעָלָ֑י וְלֹא־עָ֤מַד אִישׁ֙ אִתּ֔וֹ בְּהִתְוַדַּ֥ע יוֹסֵ֖ף אֶל־אֶחָֽיו׃
Translated: Joseph could no longer control himself before all his attendants, and he cried out, “Have everyone withdraw from me!” So there was no one else about when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.
Transliteration: velo-yakhol yvosef lehiteafek lekhol hanitsaviym alayv vayikera hvotsiyu khׇl-iysh mealay velo-amad iysh itvo vehitevada yvosef el-echayv

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ בִּבְכִ֑י וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: His sobs were so loud that the Egyptians could hear, and so the news reached Pharaoh’s palace.
Transliteration: vayiten et-kolvo vivekhiy vayishemeu mitserayiim vayishema veyt fareoh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ אֲנִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף הַע֥וֹד אָבִ֖י חָ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָכְל֤וּ אֶחָיו֙ לַעֲנ֣וֹת אֹת֔וֹ כִּ֥י נִבְהֲל֖וּ מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: Joseph said to his brothers, “I am Joseph. Is my father still well?” But his brothers could not answer him, so dumbfounded were they on account of him.
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv aniy yvosef havod aviy chay velo-yakhelu echayv laanvot otvo khiy nivehalu mifanayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֧ף אֶל־אֶחָ֛יו גְּשׁוּ־נָ֥א אֵלַ֖י וַיִּגָּ֑שׁוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֲנִי֙ יוֹסֵ֣ף אֲחִיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־מְכַרְתֶּ֥ם אֹתִ֖י מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: Then Joseph said to his brothers, “Come forward to me.” And when they came forward, he said, “I am your brother Joseph, he whom you sold into Egypt.
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv geshu-na elay vayigashu vayomer aniy yvosef achiykhem asher-mekharetem otiy mitserayemah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ אַל־תֵּעָ֣צְב֗וּ וְאַל־יִ֙חַר֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־מְכַרְתֶּ֥ם אֹתִ֖י הֵ֑נָּה כִּ֣י לְמִֽחְיָ֔ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים לִפְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Now, do not be distressed or reproach yourselves because you sold me hither; it was to save life that God sent me ahead of you.
Transliteration: veatah al-teatsevu veal-yichar veeyneykhem khiy-mekharetem otiy henah khiy lemicheyah shelachaniy Elohim lifeneykhem

Hebrew: כִּי־זֶ֛ה שְׁנָתַ֥יִם הָרָעָ֖ב בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעוֹד֙ חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־חָרִ֖ישׁ וְקָצִֽיר׃
Translated: It is now two years that there has been famine in the land, and there are still five years to come in which there shall be no yield from tilling.
Transliteration: khiy-zeh shenatayiim haraav vekerev haarets vevod chamesh shaniym asher eyn-chariysh vekatsiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהִים֙ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם לָשׂ֥וּם לָכֶ֛ם שְׁאֵרִ֖ית בָּאָ֑רֶץ וּלְהַחֲי֣וֹת לָכֶ֔ם לִפְלֵיטָ֖ה גְּדֹלָֽה׃
Translated: God has sent me ahead of you to ensure your survival on earth, and to save your lives in an extraordinary deliverance.
Transliteration: vayishelacheniy Elohim lifeneykhem lashum lakhem sheeriyt vaarets ulehachayvot lakhem lifeleytah gedolah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה לֹֽא־אַתֶּ֞ם שְׁלַחְתֶּ֤ם אֹתִי֙ הֵ֔נָּה כִּ֖י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיְשִׂימֵ֨נִֽי לְאָ֜ב לְפַרְעֹ֗ה וּלְאָדוֹן֙ לְכׇל־בֵּית֔וֹ וּמֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּכׇל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: So, it was not you who sent me here, but God—who has made me a father to Pharaoh, lord of all his household, and ruler over the whole land of Egypt.
Transliteration: veatah lo-atem shelachetem otiy henah khiy haElohim vayeshiymeniy leav lefareoh uleadvon lekhׇl-veytvo umoshel vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim

Hebrew: מַהֲרוּ֮ וַעֲל֣וּ אֶל־אָבִי֒ וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֣ם אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ בִּנְךָ֣ יוֹסֵ֔ף שָׂמַ֧נִי אֱלֹהִ֛ים לְאָד֖וֹן לְכׇל־מִצְרָ֑יִם רְדָ֥ה אֵלַ֖י אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated: “Now, hurry back to my father and say to him: Thus says your son Joseph, ‘God has made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me without delay.
Transliteration: maharu vaalu el-aviy vaamaretem elayv khoh amar vinekha yvosef shamaniy Elohim leadvon lekhׇl-mitserayiim redah elay al-taamod

Hebrew: וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֣ בְאֶֽרֶץ־גֹּ֗שֶׁן וְהָיִ֤יתָ קָרוֹב֙ אֵלַ֔י אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֖יךָ וּבְנֵ֣י בָנֶ֑יךָ וְצֹאנְךָ֥ וּבְקָרְךָ֖ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: You will dwell in the region of Goshen, where you will be near me—you and your children and your grandchildren, your flocks and herds, and all that is yours.
Transliteration: veyashaveta veerets-goshen vehayiyta karvov elay atah uvaneykha uveney vaneykha vetsonekha uvekarekha vekhׇl-asher-lakhe

Hebrew: וְכִלְכַּלְתִּ֤י אֹֽתְךָ֙ שָׁ֔ם כִּי־ע֛וֹד חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים רָעָ֑ב פֶּן־תִּוָּרֵ֛שׁ אַתָּ֥ה וּבֵֽיתְךָ֖ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: There I will provide for you—for there are yet five years of famine to come—that you and your household and all that is yours may not suffer want.’
Transliteration: vekhilekhaletiy otekha sham khiy-vod chamesh shaniym raav fen-tivaresh atah uveytekha vekhׇl-asher-lakhe

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֤ה עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ רֹא֔וֹת וְעֵינֵ֖י אָחִ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ין כִּי־פִ֖י הַֽמְדַבֵּ֥ר אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You can see for yourselves, and my brother Benjamin for himself, that it is indeed I who am speaking to you.
Transliteration: vehineh eyneykhem rovot veeyney achiy vineyamiyn khiy-fiy hamedaver aleykhem

Hebrew: וְהִגַּדְתֶּ֣ם לְאָבִ֗י אֶת־כׇּל־כְּבוֹדִי֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר רְאִיתֶ֑ם וּמִֽהַרְתֶּ֛ם וְהוֹרַדְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־אָבִ֖י הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: And you must tell my father everything about my high station in Egypt and all that you have seen; and bring my father here with all speed.”
Transliteration: vehigadetem leaviy et-khׇl-khevvodiy vemitserayiim veet khׇl-asher reiytem umiharetem vehvoradetem et-aviy henah

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֛ל עַל־צַוְּארֵ֥י בִנְיָֽמִן־אָחִ֖יו וַיֵּ֑בְךְּ וּבִ֨נְיָמִ֔ן בָּכָ֖ה עַל־צַוָּארָֽיו׃
Translated: With that he embraced his brother Benjamin around the neck and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.
Transliteration: vayifol al-tsaverey vineyamin-achiyv vayevekhe uvineyamin vakhah al-tsavarayv

Hebrew: וַיְנַשֵּׁ֥ק לְכׇל־אֶחָ֖יו וַיֵּ֣בְךְּ עֲלֵהֶ֑ם וְאַ֣חֲרֵי כֵ֔ן דִּבְּר֥וּ אֶחָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He kissed all his brothers and wept upon them; only then were his brothers able to talk to him.
Transliteration: vayenashek lekhׇl-echayv vayevekhe alehem veacharey khen diveru echayv itvo

Hebrew: וְהַקֹּ֣ל נִשְׁמַ֗ע בֵּ֤ית פַּרְעֹה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּ֖אוּ אֲחֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיִּיטַב֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וּבְעֵינֵ֖י עֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translated: The news reached Pharaoh’s palace: “Joseph’s brothers have come.” Pharaoh and his courtiers were pleased.
Transliteration: vehakol nishema veyt fareoh lemor vau achey yvosef vayiytav veeyney fareoh uveeyney avadayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֱמֹ֥ר אֶל־אַחֶ֖יךָ זֹ֣את עֲשׂ֑וּ טַֽעֲנוּ֙ אֶת־בְּעִ֣ירְכֶ֔ם וּלְכוּ־בֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “Say to your brothers, ‘Do as follows: load up your beasts and go at once to the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-yvosef emor el-acheykha zot ashu taanu et-veiyrekhem ulekhu-vou aretsah khenaan

Hebrew: וּקְח֧וּ אֶת־אֲבִיכֶ֛ם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם וּבֹ֣אוּ אֵלָ֑י וְאֶתְּנָ֣ה לָכֶ֗ם אֶת־טוּב֙ אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וְאִכְל֖וּ אֶת־חֵ֥לֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Take your father and your households and come to me; I will give you the best of the land of Egypt and you shall live off the fat of the land.’
Transliteration: ukechu et-aviykhem veet-vateykhem uvou elay veetenah lakhem et-tuv erets mitserayiim veikhelu et-chelev haarets

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה צֻוֵּ֖יתָה זֹ֣את עֲשׂ֑וּ קְחוּ־לָכֶם֩ מֵאֶ֨רֶץ מִצְרַ֜יִם עֲגָל֗וֹת לְטַפְּכֶם֙ וְלִנְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם וּנְשָׂאתֶ֥ם אֶת־אֲבִיכֶ֖ם וּבָאתֶֽם׃
Translated: And you are bidden [to add], ‘Do as follows: take from the land of Egypt wagons for your children and your wives, and bring your father here.
Transliteration: veatah tsuveytah zot ashu kechu-lakhem meerets mitserayiim agalvot letafekhem velinesheykhem uneshatem et-aviykhem uvatem

Hebrew: וְעֵ֣ינְכֶ֔ם אַל־תָּחֹ֖ס עַל־כְּלֵיכֶ֑ם כִּי־ט֛וּב כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לָכֶ֥ם הֽוּא׃
Translated: And never mind your belongings, for the best of all the land of Egypt shall be yours.’”
Transliteration: veeynekhem al-tachos al-kheleykhem khiy-tuv khׇl-erets mitserayiim lakhem hu

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֥ם יוֹסֵ֛ף עֲגָל֖וֹת עַל־פִּ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֥ן לָהֶ֛ם צֵדָ֖ה לַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: The sons of Israel did so; Joseph gave them wagons as Pharaoh had commanded, and he supplied them with provisions for the journey.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen veney yisherael vayiten lahem yvosef agalvot al-fiy fareoh vayiten lahem tsedah ladarekhe

Hebrew: לְכֻלָּ֥ם נָתַ֛ן לָאִ֖ישׁ חֲלִפ֣וֹת שְׂמָלֹ֑ת וּלְבִנְיָמִ֤ן נָתַן֙ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת כֶּ֔סֶף וְחָמֵ֖שׁ חֲלִפֹ֥ת שְׂמָלֹֽת׃
Translated: To each of them, moreover, he gave a change of clothing; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver and several changes of clothing.
Transliteration: lekhulam natan laiysh chalifvot shemalot ulevineyamin natan shelosh mevot khesef vechamesh chalifot shemalot

Hebrew: וּלְאָבִ֞יו שָׁלַ֤ח כְּזֹאת֙ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה חֲמֹרִ֔ים נֹשְׂאִ֖ים מִטּ֣וּב מִצְרָ֑יִם וְעֶ֣שֶׂר אֲתֹנֹ֡ת נֹֽ֠שְׂאֹ֠ת בָּ֣ר וָלֶ֧חֶם וּמָז֛וֹן לְאָבִ֖יו לַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: And to his father he sent the following: ten he-asses laden with the best things of Egypt, and ten she-asses laden with grain, bread, and provisions for his father on the journey.
Transliteration: uleaviyv shalach khezot asharah chamoriym nosheiym mituv mitserayiim veesher atonot nosheot var valechem umazvon leaviyv ladarekhe

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַֽל־תִּרְגְּז֖וּ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: As he sent his brothers off on their way, he told them, “Do not be quarrelsome on the way.”
Transliteration: vayeshalach et-echayv vayelekhu vayomer alehem al-tiregezu vadarekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They went up from Egypt and came to their father Jacob in the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayaalu mimitserayiim vayavou erets khenaan el-yaakov aviyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֨דוּ ל֜וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר ע֚וֹד יוֹסֵ֣ף חַ֔י וְכִֽי־ה֥וּא מֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיָּ֣פׇג לִבּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י לֹא־הֶאֱמִ֖ין לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: And they told him, “Joseph is still alive; yes, he is ruler over the whole land of Egypt.” His heart went numb, for he did not believe them.
Transliteration: vayagidu lvo lemor vod yvosef chay vekhiy-hu moshel vekhׇl-erets mitserayiim vayafׇg livvo khiy lo-heemiyn lahem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו אֵ֣ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֤י יוֹסֵף֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֲגָל֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח יוֹסֵ֖ף לָשֵׂ֣את אֹת֑וֹ וַתְּחִ֕י ר֖וּחַ יַעֲקֹ֥ב אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But when they recounted all that Joseph had said to them, and when he saw the wagons that Joseph had sent to transport him, the spirit of their father Jacob revived.
Transliteration: vayedaveru elayv et khׇl-diverey yvosef asher diver alehem vayare et-haagalvot asher-shalach yvosef lashet otvo vatechiy rucha yaakov aviyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רַ֛ב עוֹד־יוֹסֵ֥ף בְּנִ֖י חָ֑י אֵֽלְכָ֥ה וְאֶרְאֶ֖נּוּ בְּטֶ֥רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
Translated: “Enough!” said Israel. “My son Joseph is still alive! I must go and see him before I die.”
Transliteration: vayomer yisherael rav vod-yvosef veniy chay elekhah veereenu veterem amut

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֤ע יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֖א בְּאֵ֣רָה שָּׁ֑בַע וַיִּזְבַּ֣ח זְבָחִ֔ים לֵאלֹהֵ֖י אָבִ֥יו יִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: So Israel set out with all that was his, and he came to Beer-sheba, where he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac’s [house].
Transliteration: vayisa yisherael vekhׇl-asher-lvo vayavo veerah shava vayizevach zevachiym lelohey aviyv yitsechak

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּמַרְאֹ֣ת הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֣ב <small>׀</small> יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: God called to Israel in a vision by night: “Jacob! Jacob!” He answered, “Here.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim <small></small> leyisherael vemareot halayelah vayomer yaakov <small></small> yaakov vayomer hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֥י הָאֵ֖ל אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ אַל־תִּירָא֙ מֵרְדָ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יְמָה כִּֽי־לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל אֲשִֽׂימְךָ֥ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: “I am God, the God of your father’s [house]. Fear not to go down to Egypt, for I will make you there into a great nation.
Transliteration: vayomer anokhiy hael elohey aviykha al-tiyra meredah mitserayemah khiy-legvoy gadvol ashiymekha sham

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֗י אֵרֵ֤ד עִמְּךָ֙ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה וְאָנֹכִ֖י אַֽעַלְךָ֣ גַם־עָלֹ֑ה וְיוֹסֵ֕ף יָשִׁ֥ית יָד֖וֹ עַל־עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: I Myself will go down with you to Egypt, and I Myself will also bring you back; and Joseph’s hand shall close your eyes.”
Transliteration: anokhiy ered imekha mitserayemah veanokhiy aalekha gam-aloh veyvosef yashiyt yadvo al-eyneykha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קׇם יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִבְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־יַעֲקֹ֣ב אֲבִיהֶ֗ם וְאֶת־טַפָּם֙ וְאֶת־נְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם בָּעֲגָל֕וֹת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח פַּרְעֹ֖ה לָשֵׂ֥את אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: So Jacob set out from Beer-sheba. The sons of Israel put their father Jacob and their children and their wives in the wagons that Pharaoh had sent to transport him;
Transliteration: vayakׇm yaakov miveer shava vayisheu veney-yisherael et-yaakov aviyhem veet-tafam veet-nesheyhem vaagalvot asher-shalach fareoh lashet otvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶ֗ם וְאֶת־רְכוּשָׁם֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר רָֽכְשׁוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ מִצְרָ֑יְמָה יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְכׇל־זַרְע֥וֹ אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and they took along their livestock and the wealth that they had amassed in the land of Canaan. Thus Jacob and all his offspring with him came to Egypt:
Transliteration: vayikechu et-mikeneyhem veet-rekhusham asher rakheshu veerets khenaan vayavou mitserayemah yaakov vekhׇl-zarevo itvo

Hebrew: בָּנָ֞יו וּבְנֵ֤י בָנָיו֙ אִתּ֔וֹ בְּנֹתָ֛יו וּבְנ֥וֹת בָּנָ֖יו וְכׇל־זַרְע֑וֹ הֵבִ֥יא אִתּ֖וֹ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃ {ס}
Translated: he brought with him to Egypt his sons and grandsons, his daughters and granddaughters—all his offspring.
Transliteration: vanayv uveney vanayv itvo venotayv uvenvot vanayv vekhׇl-zarevo heviy itvo mitserayemah {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה שְׁמ֧וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הַבָּאִ֥ים מִצְרַ֖יְמָה יַעֲקֹ֣ב וּבָנָ֑יו בְּכֹ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב רְאוּבֵֽן׃
Translated: These are the names of the Israelites, Jacob and his descendants, who came to Egypt. Jacob’s first-born Reuben;
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot veney-yisherael havaiym mitserayemah yaakov uvanayv vekhor yaakov reuven

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י רְאוּבֵ֑ן חֲנ֥וֹךְ וּפַלּ֖וּא וְחֶצְרֹ֥ן וְכַרְמִֽי׃
Translated: Reuben’s sons: Enoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
Transliteration: uveney reuven chanvokhe ufalu vechetseron vekharemiy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֗וֹן יְמוּאֵ֧ל וְיָמִ֛ין וְאֹ֖הַד וְיָכִ֣ין וְצֹ֑חַר וְשָׁא֖וּל בֶּן־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽית׃
Translated: Simeon’s sons: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Saul the son of a Canaanite woman.
Transliteration: uveney shimevon yemuel veyamiyn veohad veyakhiyn vetsochar veshaul ven-hakhenaaniyt

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י לֵוִ֑י גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן קְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃
Translated: Levi’s sons: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Transliteration: uveney leviy gereshvon kehat umerariy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה עֵ֧ר וְאוֹנָ֛ן וְשֵׁלָ֖ה וָפֶ֣רֶץ וָזָ֑רַח וַיָּ֨מׇת עֵ֤ר וְאוֹנָן֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־פֶ֖רֶץ חֶצְרֹ֥ן וְחָמֽוּל׃
Translated: Judah’s sons: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah—but Er and Onan had died in the land of Canaan; and Perez’s sons were Hezron and Hamul.
Transliteration: uveney yehudah er vevonan veshelah vaferets vazarach vayamׇt er vevonan veerets khenaan vayiheyu veney-ferets chetseron vechamul

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יִשָּׂשכָ֑ר תּוֹלָ֥ע וּפֻוָ֖ה וְי֥וֹב וְשִׁמְרֹֽן׃
Translated: Issachar’s sons: Tola, Puvah, Iob, and Shimron.
Transliteration: uveney yishashkhar tvola ufuvah veyvov veshimeron

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י זְבֻל֑וּן סֶ֥רֶד וְאֵל֖וֹן וְיַחְלְאֵֽל׃
Translated: Zebulun’s sons: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.
Transliteration: uveney zevulun sered veelvon veyacheleel

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ בְּנֵ֣י לֵאָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָֽלְדָ֤ה לְיַעֲקֹב֙ בְּפַדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת דִּינָ֣ה בִתּ֑וֹ כׇּל־נֶ֧פֶשׁ בָּנָ֛יו וּבְנוֹתָ֖יו שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשָׁלֹֽשׁ׃
Translated: Those were the sons whom Leah bore to Jacob in Paddan-aram, in addition to his daughter Dinah. Persons in all, male and female: 33.
Transliteration: eleh veney leah asher yaledah leyaakov vefadan aram veet diynah vitvo khׇl-nefesh vanayv uvenvotayv sheloshiym veshalosh

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י גָ֔ד צִפְי֥וֹן וְחַגִּ֖י שׁוּנִ֣י וְאֶצְבֹּ֑ן עֵרִ֥י וַֽאֲרוֹדִ֖י וְאַרְאֵלִֽי׃
Translated: Gad’s sons: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.
Transliteration: uveney gad tsifeyvon vechagiy shuniy veetsevon eriy vaarvodiy veareeliy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֗ר יִמְנָ֧ה וְיִשְׁוָ֛ה וְיִשְׁוִ֥י וּבְרִיעָ֖ה וְשֶׂ֣רַח אֲחֹתָ֑ם וּבְנֵ֣י בְרִיעָ֔ה חֶ֖בֶר וּמַלְכִּיאֵֽל׃
Translated: Asher’s sons: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah, and their sister Serah. Beriah’s sons: Heber and Malchiel.
Transliteration: uveney asher yimenah veyishevah veyisheviy uveriyah vesherach achotam uveney veriyah chever umalekhiyel

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י זִלְפָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָבָ֖ן לְלֵאָ֣ה בִתּ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֤לֶד אֶת־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב שֵׁ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated: These were the descendants of Zilpah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Leah. These she bore to Jacob—16 persons.
Transliteration: eleh veney zilefah asher-natan lavan leleah vitvo vateled et-eleh leyaakov shesh eshereh nafesh

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י רָחֵל֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת יַעֲקֹ֔ב יוֹסֵ֖ף וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.
Transliteration: veney rachel eshet yaakov yvosef uvineyamin

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּלֵ֣ד לְיוֹסֵף֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֒יִם֒ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָֽלְדָה־לּוֹ֙ אָֽסְנַ֔ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֖רַע כֹּהֵ֣ן אֹ֑ן אֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: To Joseph were born in the land of Egypt Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asenath daughter of Poti-phera priest of On bore to him.
Transliteration: vayivaled leyvosef veerets mitserayiim asher yaledah-lvo asenat vat-fvotiy fera khohen on et-menasheh veet-eferayiim

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֗ן בֶּ֤לַע וָבֶ֙כֶר֙ וְאַשְׁבֵּ֔ל גֵּרָ֥א וְנַעֲמָ֖ן אֵחִ֣י וָרֹ֑אשׁ מֻפִּ֥ים וְחֻפִּ֖ים וָאָֽרְדְּ׃
Translated: Benjamin’s sons: Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.
Transliteration: uveney vineyamin vela vavekher veashevel gera venaaman echiy varosh mufiym vechufiym vaarede

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י רָחֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלַּ֖ד לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב כׇּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃
Translated: These were the descendants of Rachel who were born to Jacob—14 persons in all.
Transliteration: eleh veney rachel asher yulad leyaakov khׇl-nefesh arevaah ashar

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי־דָ֖ן חֻשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Dan’s son: Hushim.
Transliteration: uveney-dan chushiym

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י נַפְתָּלִ֑י יַחְצְאֵ֥ל וְגוּנִ֖י וְיֵ֥צֶר וְשִׁלֵּֽם׃
Translated: Naphtali’s sons: Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.
Transliteration: uveney nafetaliy yachetseel veguniy veeitser veshilem

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י בִלְהָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָבָ֖ן לְרָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֧לֶד אֶת־אֵ֛לֶּה לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב כׇּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ שִׁבְעָֽה׃
Translated: These were the descendants of Bilhah, whom Laban had given to his daughter Rachel. These she bore to Jacob—7 persons in all.
Transliteration: eleh veney vilehah asher-natan lavan lerachel vitvo vateled et-eleh leyaakov khׇl-nefesh shiveah

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֠נֶּ֠פֶשׁ הַבָּאָ֨ה לְיַעֲקֹ֤ב מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ יֹצְאֵ֣י יְרֵכ֔וֹ מִלְּבַ֖ד נְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵי־יַעֲקֹ֑ב כׇּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וָשֵֽׁשׁ׃
Translated: All the persons belonging to Jacob who came to Egypt —his own issue, aside from the wives of Jacob’s sons—all these persons numbered 66.
Transliteration: khׇl-hanefesh havaah leyaakov mitserayemah yotseey yerekhvo milevad neshey veney-yaakov khׇl-nefesh shishiym vashesh

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יוֹסֵ֛ף אֲשֶׁר־יֻלַּד־ל֥וֹ בְמִצְרַ֖יִם נֶ֣פֶשׁ שְׁנָ֑יִם כׇּל־הַנֶּ֧פֶשׁ לְבֵֽית־יַעֲקֹ֛ב הַבָּ֥אָה מִצְרַ֖יְמָה שִׁבְעִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: And Joseph’s sons who were born to him in Egypt were two in number. Thus the total of Jacob’s household who came to Egypt was seventy persons.
Transliteration: uveney yvosef asher-yulad-lvo vemitserayiim nefesh shenayiim khׇl-hanefesh leveyt-yaakov havaah mitserayemah shiveiym {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶת־יְהוּדָ֞ה שָׁלַ֤ח לְפָנָיו֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף לְהוֹרֹ֥ת לְפָנָ֖יו גֹּ֑שְׁנָה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: He had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph, to point the way before him to Goshen. So when they came to the region of Goshen,
Transliteration: veet-yehudah shalach lefanayv el-yvosef lehvorot lefanayv goshenah vayavou aretsah goshen

Hebrew: וַיֶּאְסֹ֤ר יוֹסֵף֙ מֶרְכַּבְתּ֔וֹ וַיַּ֛עַל לִקְרַֽאת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אָבִ֖יו גֹּ֑שְׁנָה וַיֵּרָ֣א אֵלָ֗יו וַיִּפֹּל֙ עַל־צַוָּארָ֔יו וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ עַל־צַוָּארָ֖יו עֽוֹד׃
Translated: Joseph ordered his chariot and went to Goshen to meet his father Israel; he presented himself to him and, embracing him around the neck, he wept on his neck a good while.
Transliteration: vayeesor yvosef merekhavetvo vayaal likerat-yisherael aviyv goshenah vayera elayv vayifol al-tsavarayv vayevekhe al-tsavarayv vod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף אָמ֣וּתָה הַפָּ֑עַם אַחֲרֵי֙ רְאוֹתִ֣י אֶת־פָּנֶ֔יךָ כִּ֥י עוֹדְךָ֖ חָֽי׃
Translated: Then Israel said to Joseph, “Now I can die, having seen for myself that you are still alive.”
Transliteration: vayomer yisherael el-yvosef amutah hafaam acharey revotiy et-faneykha khiy vodekha chay

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ וְאֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יו אֶעֱלֶ֖ה וְאַגִּ֣ידָה לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאֹֽמְרָ֣ה אֵלָ֔יו אַחַ֧י וּבֵית־אָבִ֛י אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־כְּנַ֖עַן בָּ֥אוּ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: Then Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s household, “I will go up and tell the news to Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘My brothers and my father’s household, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv veel-veyt aviyv eeleh veagiydah lefareoh veomerah elayv achay uveyt-aviy asher veerets-khenaan vau elay

Hebrew: וְהָאֲנָשִׁים֙ רֹ֣עֵי צֹ֔אן כִּֽי־אַנְשֵׁ֥י מִקְנֶ֖ה הָי֑וּ וְצֹאנָ֧ם וּבְקָרָ֛ם וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
Translated: They happen to be shepherds; they have always been breeders of livestock, and they have brought with them their flocks and herds and all that is theirs.’
Transliteration: vehaanashiym roey tson khiy-aneshey mikeneh hayu vetsonam uvekaram vekhׇl-asher lahem heviyu

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כִּֽי־יִקְרָ֥א לָכֶ֖ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְאָמַ֖ר מַה־מַּעֲשֵׂיכֶֽם׃
Translated: So when Pharaoh summons you and asks, ‘What is your occupation?’
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yikera lakhem fareoh veamar mah-maasheykhem

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֗ם אַנְשֵׁ֨י מִקְנֶ֜ה הָי֤וּ עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ מִנְּעוּרֵ֣ינוּ וְעַד־עַ֔תָּה גַּם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ גַּם־אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ בַּעֲב֗וּר תֵּשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן כִּֽי־תוֹעֲבַ֥ת מִצְרַ֖יִם כׇּל־רֹ֥עֵה צֹֽאן׃
Translated: you shall answer, ‘Your servants have been breeders of livestock from the start until now, both we and our fathers’—so that you may stay in the region of Goshen. For all shepherds are abhorrent to Egyptians.”
Transliteration: vaamaretem aneshey mikeneh hayu avadeykha mineureynu vead-atah gam-anachenu gam-avoteynu vaavur teshevu veerets goshen khiy-tvoavat mitserayiim khׇl-roeh tson

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א יוֹסֵף֮ וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לְפַרְעֹה֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אָבִ֨י וְאַחַ֜י וְצֹאנָ֤ם וּבְקָרָם֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֔ם בָּ֖אוּ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְהִנָּ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: Then Joseph came and reported to Pharaoh, saying, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and herds and all that is theirs, have come from the land of Canaan and are now in the region of Goshen.”
Transliteration: vayavo yvosef vayaged lefareoh vayomer aviy veachay vetsonam uvekaram vekhׇl-asher lahem vau meerets khenaan vehinam veerets goshen

Hebrew: וּמִקְצֵ֣ה אֶחָ֔יו לָקַ֖ח חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּצִּגֵ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: And carefully selecting a few of his brothers, he presented them to Pharaoh.
Transliteration: umiketseh echayv lakach chamishah anashiym vayatsigem lifeney fareoh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֶל־אֶחָ֖יו מַה־מַּעֲשֵׂיכֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֗ה רֹעֵ֥ה צֹאן֙ עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ גַּם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ גַּם־אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Pharaoh said to his brothers, “What is your occupation?” They answered Pharaoh, “We your servants are shepherds, as were also our fathers.
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-echayv mah-maasheykhem vayomeru el-fareoh roeh tson avadeykha gam-anachenu gam-avvoteynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֗ה לָג֣וּר בָּאָ֘רֶץ֮ בָּ֒אנוּ֒ כִּי־אֵ֣ין מִרְעֶ֗ה לַצֹּאן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְעַתָּ֛ה יֵֽשְׁבוּ־נָ֥א עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: We have come,” they told Pharaoh, “to sojourn in this land, for there is no pasture for your servants’ flocks, the famine being severe in the land of Canaan. Pray, then, let your servants stay in the region of Goshen.”
Transliteration: vayomeru el-fareoh lagur vaarets vanu khiy-eyn mireeh latson asher laavadeykha khiy-khaved haraav veerets khenaan veatah eishevu-na avadeykha veerets goshen

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר אָבִ֥יךָ וְאַחֶ֖יךָ בָּ֥אוּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “As regards your father and your brothers who have come to you,
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-yvosef lemor aviykha veacheykha vau eleykha

Hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְפָנֶ֣יךָ הִ֔וא בְּמֵיטַ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ הוֹשֵׁ֥ב אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ וְאֶת־אַחֶ֑יךָ יֵשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן וְאִם־יָדַ֗עְתָּ וְיֶשׁ־בָּם֙ אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֔יִל וְשַׂמְתָּ֛ם שָׂרֵ֥י מִקְנֶ֖ה עַל־אֲשֶׁר־לִֽי׃
Translated: the land of Egypt is open before you: settle your father and your brothers in the best part of the land; let them stay in the region of Goshen. And if you know some men of ability among them, put them in charge of my livestock.”
Transliteration: erets mitserayiim lefaneykha hiv vemeytav haarets hvoshev et-aviykha veet-acheykha eishevu veerets goshen veim-yadaeta veyesh-vam aneshey-chayiil veshametam sharey mikeneh al-asher-liy

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ אֶת־יַֽעֲקֹ֣ב אָבִ֔יו וַיַּֽעֲמִדֵ֖הוּ לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Joseph then brought his father Jacob and presented him to Pharaoh; and Jacob greeted Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vayave yvosef et-yaakov aviyv vayaamidehu lifeney fareoh vayevarekhe yaakov et-fareoh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֑ב כַּמָּ֕ה יְמֵ֖י שְׁנֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated: Pharaoh asked Jacob, “How many are the years of your life?”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh el-yaakov khamah yemey sheney chayeykha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵ֣י מְגוּרַ֔י שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה מְעַ֣ט וְרָעִ֗ים הָיוּ֙ יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵ֣י חַיַּ֔י וְלֹ֣א הִשִּׂ֗יגוּ אֶת־יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י אֲבֹתַ֔י בִּימֵ֖י מְגוּרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And Jacob answered Pharaoh, “The years of my sojourn [on earth] are one hundred and thirty. Few and hard have been the years of my life, nor do they come up to the life spans of my ancestors during their sojourns.”
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov el-fareoh yemey sheney meguray sheloshiym umeat shanah meat veraiym hayu yemey sheney chayay velo hishiygu et-yemey sheney chayey avotay viymey megureyhem

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֖א מִלִּפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Then Jacob bade Pharaoh farewell, and left Pharaoh’s presence.
Transliteration: vayevarekhe yaakov et-fareoh vayetse milifeney fareoh

Hebrew: וַיּוֹשֵׁ֣ב יוֹסֵף֮ אֶת־אָבִ֣יו וְאֶת־אֶחָיו֒ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֤ם אֲחֻזָּה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּמֵיטַ֥ב הָאָ֖רֶץ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ רַעְמְסֵ֑ס כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: So Joseph settled his father and his brothers, giving them holdings in the choicest part of the land of Egypt, in the region of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
Transliteration: vayyvoshev yvosef et-aviyv veet-echayv vayiten lahem achuzah veerets mitserayiim vemeytav haarets veerets raemeses khaasher tsivah fareoh

Hebrew: וַיְכַלְכֵּ֤ל יוֹסֵף֙ אֶת־אָבִ֣יו וְאֶת־אֶחָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יו לֶ֖חֶם לְפִ֥י הַטָּֽף׃
Translated: Joseph sustained his father, and his brothers, and all his father’s household with bread, down to the little ones.
Transliteration: vayekhalekhel yvosef et-aviyv veet-echayv veet khׇl-veyt aviyv lechem lefiy hataf

Hebrew: וְלֶ֤חֶם אֵין֙ בְּכׇל־הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב מְאֹ֑ד וַתֵּ֜לַהּ אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וְאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן מִפְּנֵ֖י הָרָעָֽב׃
Translated: Now there was no bread in all the world, for the famine was very severe; both the land of Egypt and the land of Canaan languished because of the famine.
Transliteration: velechem eyn vekhׇl-haarets khiy-khaved haraav meod vatelah erets mitserayiim veerets khenaan mifeney haraav

Hebrew: וַיְלַקֵּ֣ט יוֹסֵ֗ף אֶת־כׇּל־הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ הַנִּמְצָ֤א בְאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ וּבְאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בַּשֶּׁ֖בֶר אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣ם שֹׁבְרִ֑ים וַיָּבֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־הַכֶּ֖סֶף בֵּ֥יתָה פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: Joseph gathered in all the money that was to be found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, as payment for the rations that were being procured, and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s palace.
Transliteration: vayelaket yvosef et-khׇl-hakhesef hanimetsa veerets-mitserayiim uveerets khenaan vashever asher-hem shoveriym vayave yvosef et-hakhesef veytah fareoh

Hebrew: וַיִּתֹּ֣ם הַכֶּ֗סֶף מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֘יִם֮ וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֒עַן֒ וַיָּבֹ֩אוּ֩ כׇל־מִצְרַ֨יִם אֶל־יוֹסֵ֤ף לֵאמֹר֙ הָֽבָה־לָּ֣נוּ לֶ֔חֶם וְלָ֥מָּה נָמ֖וּת נֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י אָפֵ֖ס כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: And when the money gave out in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, “Give us bread, lest we die before your very eyes; for the money is gone!”
Transliteration: vayitom hakhesef meerets mitserayiim umeerets khenaan vayavou khׇl-mitserayiim el-yvosef lemor havah-lanu lechem velamah namut negedekha khiy afes khasef

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ הָב֣וּ מִקְנֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם בְּמִקְנֵיכֶ֑ם אִם־אָפֵ֖ס כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: And Joseph said, “Bring your livestock, and I will sell to you against your livestock, if the money is gone.”
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef havu mikeneykhem veetenah lakhem vemikeneykhem im-afes khasef

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶם֮ אֶל־יוֹסֵף֒ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָהֶם֩ יוֹסֵ֨ף לֶ֜חֶם בַּסּוּסִ֗ים וּבְמִקְנֵ֥ה הַצֹּ֛אן וּבְמִקְנֵ֥ה הַבָּקָ֖ר וּבַחֲמֹרִ֑ים וַיְנַהֲלֵ֤ם בַּלֶּ֙חֶם֙ בְּכׇל־מִקְנֵהֶ֔ם בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַהִֽוא׃
Translated: So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for the horses, for the stocks of sheep and cattle, and the asses; thus he provided them with bread that year in exchange for all their livestock.
Transliteration: vayaviyu et-mikeneyhem el-yvosef vayiten lahem yvosef lechem vasusiym uvemikeneh hatson uvemikeneh havakar uvachamoriym vayenahalem valechem vekhׇl-mikenehem vashanah hahiv

Hebrew: וַתִּתֹּם֮ הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַהִוא֒ וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ אֵלָ֜יו בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ לֹֽא־נְכַחֵ֣ד מֵֽאֲדֹנִ֔י כִּ֚י אִם־תַּ֣ם הַכֶּ֔סֶף וּמִקְנֵ֥ה הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֑י לֹ֤א נִשְׁאַר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י בִּלְתִּ֥י אִם־גְּוִיָּתֵ֖נוּ וְאַדְמָתֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: And when that year was ended, they came to him the next year and said to him, “We cannot hide from my lord that, with all the money and animal stocks consigned to my lord, nothing is left at my lord’s disposal save our persons and our farmland.
Transliteration: vatitom hashanah hahiv vayavou elayv vashanah hasheniyt vayomeru lvo lo-nekhached meadoniy khiy im-tam hakhesef umikeneh havehemah el-adoniy lo nishear lifeney adoniy viletiy im-geviyatenu veadematenu

Hebrew: לָ֧מָּה נָמ֣וּת לְעֵינֶ֗יךָ גַּם־אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ גַּ֣ם אַדְמָתֵ֔נוּ קְנֵֽה־אֹתָ֥נוּ וְאֶת־אַדְמָתֵ֖נוּ בַּלָּ֑חֶם וְנִֽהְיֶ֞ה אֲנַ֤חְנוּ וְאַדְמָתֵ֙נוּ֙ עֲבָדִ֣ים לְפַרְעֹ֔ה וְתֶן־זֶ֗רַע וְנִֽחְיֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א נָמ֔וּת וְהָאֲדָמָ֖ה לֹ֥א תֵשָֽׁם׃
Translated: Let us not perish before your eyes, both we and our land. Take us and our land in exchange for bread, and we with our land will be serfs to Pharaoh; provide the seed, that we may live and not die, and that the land may not become a waste.”
Transliteration: lamah namut leeyneykha gam-anachenu gam adematenu keneh-otanu veet-adematenu valachem veniheyeh anachenu veadematenu avadiym lefareoh veten-zera venicheyeh velo namut vehaadamah lo tesham

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨קֶן יוֹסֵ֜ף אֶת־כׇּל־אַדְמַ֤ת מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה כִּֽי־מָכְר֤וּ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֵ֔הוּ כִּֽי־חָזַ֥ק עֲלֵהֶ֖ם הָרָעָ֑ב וַתְּהִ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: So Joseph gained possession of all the farm land of Egypt for Pharaoh, all the Egyptians having sold their fields because the famine was too much for them; thus the land passed over to Pharaoh.
Transliteration: vayiken yvosef et-khׇl-ademat mitserayiim lefareoh khiy-makheru mitserayiim iysh shadehu khiy-chazak alehem haraav vatehiy haarets lefareoh

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־הָעָ֔ם הֶעֱבִ֥יר אֹת֖וֹ לֶעָרִ֑ים מִקְצֵ֥ה גְבוּל־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְעַד־קָצֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: And he removed the population town by town, from one end of Egypt’s border to the other.
Transliteration: veet-haam heeviyr otvo leariym miketseh gevul-mitserayiim vead-katsehu

Hebrew: רַ֛ק אַדְמַ֥ת הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים לֹ֣א קָנָ֑ה כִּי֩ חֹ֨ק לַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים מֵאֵ֣ת פַּרְעֹ֗ה וְאָֽכְל֤וּ אֶת־חֻקָּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן לָהֶם֙ פַּרְעֹ֔ה עַל־כֵּ֕ן לֹ֥א מָכְר֖וּ אֶת־אַדְמָתָֽם׃
Translated: Only the land of the priests he did not take over, for the priests had an allotment from Pharaoh, and they lived off the allotment which Pharaoh had made to them; therefore they did not sell their land.
Transliteration: rak ademat hakhohaniym lo kanah khiy chok lakhohaniym meet fareoh veakhelu et-chukam asher natan lahem fareoh al-khen lo makheru et-adematam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם הֵן֩ קָנִ֨יתִי אֶתְכֶ֥ם הַיּ֛וֹם וְאֶת־אַדְמַתְכֶ֖ם לְפַרְעֹ֑ה הֵֽא־לָכֶ֣ם זֶ֔רַע וּזְרַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: Then Joseph said to the people, “Whereas I have this day acquired you and your land for Pharaoh, here is seed for you to sow the land.
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-haam hen kaniytiy etekhem hayyvom veet-adematekhem lefareoh he-lakhem zera uzeraetem et-haadamah

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּתְּבוּאֹ֔ת וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם חֲמִישִׁ֖ית לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע הַיָּדֹ֡ת יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶם֩ לְזֶ֨רַע הַשָּׂדֶ֧ה וּֽלְאׇכְלְכֶ֛ם וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּבָתֵּיכֶ֖ם וְלֶאֱכֹ֥ל לְטַפְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: And when harvest comes, you shall give one-fifth to Pharaoh, and four-fifths shall be yours as seed for the fields and as food for you and those in your households, and as nourishment for your children.”
Transliteration: vehayah vatevuot unetatem chamiyshiyt lefareoh veareva hayadot yiheyeh lakhem lezera hashadeh uleׇkhelekhem velaasher vevateykhem veleekhol letafekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ הֶחֱיִתָ֑נוּ נִמְצָא־חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְהָיִ֥ינוּ עֲבָדִ֖ים לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: And they said, “You have saved our lives! We are grateful to my lord, and we shall be serfs to Pharaoh.”
Transliteration: vayomeru hecheyitanu nimetsa-chen veeyney adoniy vehayiynu avadiym lefareoh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שֶׂם אֹתָ֣הּ יוֹסֵ֡ף לְחֹק֩ עַד־הַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֜ה עַל־אַדְמַ֥ת מִצְרַ֛יִם לְפַרְעֹ֖ה לַחֹ֑מֶשׁ רַ֞ק אַדְמַ֤ת הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ לְבַדָּ֔ם לֹ֥א הָיְתָ֖ה לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translated: And Joseph made it into a land law in Egypt, which is still valid, that a fifth should be Pharaoh’s; only the land of the priests did not become Pharaoh’s.
Transliteration: vayashem otah yvosef lechok ad-hayyvom hazeh al-ademat mitserayiim lefareoh lachomesh rak ademat hakhohaniym levadam lo hayetah lefareoh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֑שֶׁן וַיֵּאָחֲז֣וּ בָ֔הּ וַיִּפְר֥וּ וַיִּרְבּ֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Thus Israel settled in the country of Egypt, in the region of Goshen; they acquired holdings in it, and were fertile and increased greatly.
Transliteration: vayeshev yisherael veerets mitserayiim veerets goshen vayeachazu vah vayiferu vayirevu meod

Hebrew: וַיְחִ֤י יַעֲקֹב֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם שְׁבַ֥ע עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה וַיְהִ֤י יְמֵֽי־יַעֲקֹב֙ שְׁנֵ֣י חַיָּ֔יו שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Jacob lived seventeen years in the land of Egypt, so that the span of Jacob’s life came to one hundred and forty-seven years.
Transliteration: vayechiy yaakov veerets mitserayiim sheva eshereh shanah vayehiy yemey-yaakov sheney chayayv sheva shaniym vearevaiym umeat shanah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְב֣וּ יְמֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לָמוּת֒ וַיִּקְרָ֣א ׀ לִבְנ֣וֹ לְיוֹסֵ֗ף וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ שִֽׂים־נָ֥א יָדְךָ֖ תַּ֣חַת יְרֵכִ֑י וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ עִמָּדִי֙ חֶ֣סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֔ת אַל־נָ֥א תִקְבְּרֵ֖נִי בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And when the time approached for Israel to die, he summoned his son Joseph and said to him, “Do me this favor, place your hand under my thigh as a pledge of your steadfast loyalty: please do not bury me in Egypt.
Transliteration: vayikerevu yemey-yisherael lamut vayikera livenvo leyvosef vayomer lvo im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykha shiym-na yadekha tachat yerekhiy veashiyta imadiy chesed veemet al-na tikevereniy vemitserayiim

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁכַבְתִּי֙ עִם־אֲבֹתַ֔י וּנְשָׂאתַ֙נִי֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וּקְבַרְתַּ֖נִי בִּקְבֻרָתָ֑ם וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אָנֹכִ֖י אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה כִדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated: When I lie down with my ancestors, take me up from Egypt and bury me in their burial-place.” He replied, “I will do as you have spoken.”
Transliteration: veshakhavetiy im-avotay uneshataniy mimitserayiim ukevaretaniy vikevuratam vayomar anokhiy eesheh khidevarekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִשָּֽׁבְעָה֙ לִ֔י וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע ל֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הַמִּטָּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And he said, “Swear to me.” And he swore to him. Then Israel bowed at the head of the bed.
Transliteration: vayomer hishaveah liy vayishava lvo vayishetachu yisherael al-rosh hamitah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵי֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְיוֹסֵ֔ף הִנֵּ֥ה אָבִ֖יךָ חֹלֶ֑ה וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׁנֵ֤י בָנָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ אֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Some time afterward, Joseph was told, “Your father is ill.” So he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey hadevariym haeleh vayomer leyvosef hineh aviykha choleh vayikach et-sheney vanayv imvo et-menasheh veet-eferayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּ֛ה בִּנְךָ֥ יוֹסֵ֖ף בָּ֣א אֵלֶ֑יךָ וַיִּתְחַזֵּק֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב עַל־הַמִּטָּֽה׃
Translated: When Jacob was told, “Your son Joseph has come to see you,” Israel summoned his strength and sat up in bed.
Transliteration: vayaged leyaakov vayomer hineh vinekha yvosef va eleykha vayitechazek yisherael vayeshev al-hamitah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֵ֥ל שַׁדַּ֛י נִרְאָֽה־אֵלַ֥י בְּל֖וּז בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיְבָ֖רֶךְ אֹתִֽי׃
Translated: And Jacob said to Joseph, “El Shaddai, who appeared to me at Luz in the land of Canaan, blessed me—
Transliteration: vayomer yaakov el-yvosef el shaday nireah-elay veluz veerets khenaan vayevarekhe otiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י הִנְנִ֤י מַפְרְךָ֙ וְהִרְבִּיתִ֔ךָ וּנְתַתִּ֖יךָ לִקְהַ֣ל עַמִּ֑ים וְנָ֨תַתִּ֜י אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את לְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אַחֲרֶ֖יךָ אֲחֻזַּ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: and said to me, ‘I will make you fertile and numerous, making of you a community of peoples; and I will assign this land to your offspring to come for an everlasting possession.’
Transliteration: vayomer elay hineniy maferekha vehireviytikha unetatiykha likehal amiym venatatiy et-haarets hazot lezareakha achareykha achuzat volam

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה שְׁנֵֽי־בָנֶ֩יךָ֩ הַנּוֹלָדִ֨ים לְךָ֜ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם עַד־בֹּאִ֥י אֵלֶ֛יךָ מִצְרַ֖יְמָה לִי־הֵ֑ם אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וּמְנַשֶּׁ֔ה כִּרְאוּבֵ֥ן וְשִׁמְע֖וֹן יִֽהְיוּ־לִֽי׃
Translated: Now, your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, shall be mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine no less than Reuben and Simeon.
Transliteration: veatah sheney-vaneykha hanvoladiym lekha veerets mitserayiim ad-voiy eleykha mitserayemah liy-hem eferayiim umenasheh khireuven veshimevon yiheyu-liy

Hebrew: וּמוֹלַדְתְּךָ֛ אֲשֶׁר־הוֹלַ֥דְתָּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם לְךָ֣ יִהְי֑וּ עַ֣ל שֵׁ֧ם אֲחֵיהֶ֛ם יִקָּרְא֖וּ בְּנַחֲלָתָֽם׃
Translated: But progeny born to you after them shall be yours; they shall be recorded instead of their brothers in their inheritance.
Transliteration: umvoladetekha asher-hvoladeta achareyhem lekha yiheyu al shem acheyhem yikareu venachalatam

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י ׀ בְּבֹאִ֣י מִפַּדָּ֗ן מֵ֩תָה֩ עָלַ֨י רָחֵ֜ל בְּאֶ֤רֶץ כְּנַ֙עַן֙ בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ בְּע֥וֹד כִּבְרַת־אֶ֖רֶץ לָבֹ֣א אֶפְרָ֑תָה וָאֶקְבְּרֶ֤הָ שָּׁם֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ אֶפְרָ֔ת הִ֖וא בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: I [do this because], when I was returning from Paddan, Rachel died, to my sorrow, while I was journeying in the land of Canaan, when still some distance short of Ephrath; and I buried her there on the road to Ephrath”—now Bethlehem.
Transliteration: vaaniy vevoiy mifadan metah alay rachel veerets khenaan vaderekhe vevod khiverat-erets lavo eferatah vaekevereha sham vederekhe eferat hiv veyt lachem

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מִי־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Noticing Joseph’s sons, Israel asked, “Who are these?”
Transliteration: vayare yisherael et-veney yvosef vayomer miy-eleh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־אָבִ֔יו בָּנַ֣י הֵ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־נָֽתַן־לִ֥י אֱלֹהִ֖ים בָּזֶ֑ה וַיֹּאמַ֕ר קָֽחֶם־נָ֥א אֵלַ֖י וַאֲבָרְכֵֽם׃
Translated: And Joseph said to his father, “They are my sons, whom God has given me here.” “Bring them up to me,” he said, “that I may bless them.”
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-aviyv vanay hem asher-natan-liy Elohim vazeh vayomar kachem-na elay vaavarekhem

Hebrew: וְעֵינֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כָּבְד֣וּ מִזֹּ֔קֶן לֹ֥א יוּכַ֖ל לִרְא֑וֹת וַיַּגֵּ֤שׁ אֹתָם֙ אֵלָ֔יו וַיִּשַּׁ֥ק לָהֶ֖ם וַיְחַבֵּ֥ק לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Now Israel’s eyes were dim with age; he could not see. So [Joseph] brought them close to him, and he kissed them and embraced them.
Transliteration: veeyney yisherael khavedu mizoken lo yukhal lirevot vayagesh otam elayv vayishak lahem vayechavek lahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף רְאֹ֥ה פָנֶ֖יךָ לֹ֣א פִלָּ֑לְתִּי וְהִנֵּ֨ה הֶרְאָ֥ה אֹתִ֛י אֱלֹהִ֖ים גַּ֥ם אֶת־זַרְעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And Israel said to Joseph, “I never expected to see you again, and here God has let me see your children as well.”
Transliteration: vayomer yisherael el-yvosef reoh faneykha lo filaletiy vehineh hereah otiy Elohim gam et-zareekha

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֹתָ֖ם מֵעִ֣ם בִּרְכָּ֑יו וַיִּשְׁתַּ֥חוּ לְאַפָּ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: Joseph then removed them from his knees, and bowed low with his face to the ground.
Transliteration: vayyvotse yvosef otam meim virekhayv vayishetachu leafayv aretsah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח יוֹסֵף֮ אֶת־שְׁנֵיהֶם֒ אֶת־אֶפְרַ֤יִם בִּֽימִינוֹ֙ מִשְּׂמֹ֣אל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה בִשְׂמֹאל֖וֹ מִימִ֣ין יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּגֵּ֖שׁ אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: Joseph took the two of them, Ephraim with his right hand—to Israel’s left—and Manasseh with his left hand—to Israel’s right—and brought them close to him.
Transliteration: vayikach yvosef et-sheneyhem et-eferayiim viymiynvo mishemol yisherael veet-menasheh vishemolvo miymiyn yisherael vayagesh elayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל אֶת־יְמִינ֜וֹ וַיָּ֨שֶׁת עַל־רֹ֤אשׁ אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וְה֣וּא הַצָּעִ֔יר וְאֶת־שְׂמֹאל֖וֹ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה שִׂכֵּל֙ אֶת־יָדָ֔יו כִּ֥י מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה הַבְּכֽוֹר׃
Translated: But Israel stretched out his right hand and laid it on Ephraim’s head, though he was the younger, and his left hand on Manasseh’s head—thus crossing his hands—although Manasseh was the first-born.
Transliteration: vayishelach yisherael et-yemiynvo vayashet al-rosh eferayiim vehu hatsaiyr veet-shemolvo al-rosh menasheh shikhel et-yadayv khiy menasheh havekhvor

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֶת־יוֹסֵ֖ף וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הָֽאֱלֹהִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ הִתְהַלְּכ֨וּ אֲבֹתַ֤י לְפָנָיו֙ אַבְרָהָ֣ם וְיִצְחָ֔ק הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ הָרֹעֶ֣ה אֹתִ֔י מֵעוֹדִ֖י עַד־הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated:
And he blessed Joseph, saying,
“The God in whose ways my fathers Abraham and Isaac walked,
The God who has been my shepherd from my birth to this day—
Transliteration: vayevarekhe et-yvosef vayomar haElohimm asher hitehalekhu avotay lefanayv averaham veyitsechak haElohim haroeh otiy mevodiy ad-hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: הַמַּלְאָךְ֩ הַגֹּאֵ֨ל אֹתִ֜י מִכׇּל־רָ֗ע יְבָרֵךְ֮ אֶת־הַנְּעָרִים֒ וְיִקָּרֵ֤א בָהֶם֙ שְׁמִ֔י וְשֵׁ֥ם אֲבֹתַ֖י אַבְרָהָ֣ם וְיִצְחָ֑ק וְיִדְגּ֥וּ לָרֹ֖ב בְּקֶ֥רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
The Messenger who has redeemed me from all harm—
Bless the lads.
In them may my name be recalled,
And the names of my fathers Abraham and Isaac,
And may they be teeming multitudes upon the earth.”
Transliteration: hamaleakhe hagoel otiy mikhׇl-ra yevarekhe et-haneariym veyikare vahem shemiy veshem avotay averaham veyitsechak veyidegu larov vekerev haarets

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יוֹסֵ֗ף כִּי־יָשִׁ֨ית אָבִ֧יו יַד־יְמִינ֛וֹ עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ אֶפְרַ֖יִם וַיֵּ֣רַע בְּעֵינָ֑יו וַיִּתְמֹ֣ךְ יַד־אָבִ֗יו לְהָסִ֥יר אֹתָ֛הּ מֵעַ֥ל רֹאשׁ־אֶפְרַ֖יִם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: When Joseph saw that his father was placing his right hand on Ephraim’s head, he thought it wrong; so he took hold of his father’s hand to move it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s.
Transliteration: vayare yvosef khiy-yashiyt aviyv yad-yemiynvo al-rosh eferayiim vayera veeynayv vayitemokhe yad-aviyv lehasiyr otah meal rosh-eferayiim al-rosh menasheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶל־אָבִ֖יו לֹא־כֵ֣ן אָבִ֑י כִּי־זֶ֣ה הַבְּכֹ֔ר שִׂ֥ים יְמִינְךָ֖ עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: “Not so, Father,” Joseph said to his father, “for the other is the first-born; place your right hand on his head.”
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-aviyv lo-khen aviy khiy-zeh havekhor shiym yemiynekha al-roshvo

Hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֣ן אָבִ֗יו וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ יָדַ֤עְתִּֽי בְנִי֙ יָדַ֔עְתִּי גַּם־ה֥וּא יִֽהְיֶה־לְּעָ֖ם וְגַם־ה֣וּא יִגְדָּ֑ל וְאוּלָ֗ם אָחִ֤יו הַקָּטֹן֙ יִגְדַּ֣ל מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְזַרְע֖וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה מְלֹֽא־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: But his father objected, saying, “I know, my son, I know. He too shall become a people, and he too shall be great. Yet his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his offspring shall be plentiful enough for nations.”
Transliteration: vayemaen aviyv vayomer yadaetiy veniy yadaetiy gam-hu yiheyeh-leam vegam-hu yigedal veulam achiyv hakaton yigedal mimenu vezarevo yiheyeh melo-hagvoyim

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֨רְכֵ֜ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַהוּא֮ לֵאמוֹר֒ בְּךָ֗ יְבָרֵ֤ךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְשִֽׂמְךָ֣ אֱלֹהִ֔ים כְּאֶפְרַ֖יִם וְכִמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־אֶפְרַ֖יִם לִפְנֵ֥י מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: So he blessed them that day, saying, “By you shall Israel invoke blessings, saying: God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh.” Thus he put Ephraim before Manasseh.
Transliteration: vayevarekhem vayyvom hahu lemvor vekha yevarekhe yisherael lemor yeshimekha Elohim kheeferayiim vekhimenasheh vayashem et-eferayiim lifeney menasheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף הִנֵּ֥ה אָנֹכִ֖י מֵ֑ת וְהָיָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם וְהֵשִׁ֣יב אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ אֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then Israel said to Joseph, “I am about to die; but God will be with you and bring you back to the land of your ancestors.
Transliteration: vayomer yisherael el-yvosef hineh anokhiy met vehayah Elohim imakhem veheshiyv etekhem el-erets avoteykhem

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י נָתַ֧תִּֽי לְךָ֛ שְׁכֶ֥ם אַחַ֖ד עַל־אַחֶ֑יךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר לָקַ֙חְתִּי֙ מִיַּ֣ד הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י בְּחַרְבִּ֖י וּבְקַשְׁתִּֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: And now, I assign to you one portion more than to your brothers, which I wrested from the Amorites with my sword and bow.”
Transliteration: vaaniy natatiy lekha shekhem achad al-acheykha asher lakachetiy miyad haemoriy vechareviy uvekashetiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶל־בָּנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ וְאַגִּ֣ידָה לָכֶ֔ם אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרָ֥א אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: And Jacob called his sons and said, “Come together that I may tell you what is to befall you in days to come.
Transliteration: vayikera yaakov el-vanayv vayomer heasefu veagiydah lakhem et asher-yikera etekhem veachariyt hayamiym

Hebrew: הִקָּבְצ֥וּ וְשִׁמְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְשִׁמְע֖וּ אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אֲבִיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Assemble and hearken, O sons of Jacob;
Hearken to Israel your father:
Transliteration: hikavetsu veshimeu veney yaakov veshimeu el-yisherael aviykhem

Hebrew: רְאוּבֵן֙ בְּכֹ֣רִי אַ֔תָּה כֹּחִ֖י וְרֵאשִׁ֣ית אוֹנִ֑י יֶ֥תֶר שְׂאֵ֖ת וְיֶ֥תֶר עָֽז׃
Translated:
Reuben, you are my first-born,
My might and first fruit of my vigor,
Exceeding in rank
And exceeding in honor.
Transliteration: reuven vekhoriy atah khochiy vereshiyt voniy yeter sheet veyeter az

Hebrew: פַּ֤חַז כַּמַּ֙יִם֙ אַל־תּוֹתַ֔ר כִּ֥י עָלִ֖יתָ מִשְׁכְּבֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ אָ֥ז חִלַּ֖לְתָּ יְצוּעִ֥י עָלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Unstable as water, you shall excel no longer;
For when you mounted your father’s bed,
You brought disgrace—my couch he mounted!
Transliteration: fachaz khamayiim al-tvotar khiy aliyta mishekhevey aviykha az chilaleta yetsuiy alah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וֹן וְלֵוִ֖י אַחִ֑ים כְּלֵ֥י חָמָ֖ס מְכֵרֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Simeon and Levi are a pair;
Their weapons are tools of lawlessness.
Transliteration: shimevon veleviy achiym kheley chamas mekheroteyhem

Hebrew: בְּסֹדָם֙ אַל־תָּבֹ֣א נַפְשִׁ֔י בִּקְהָלָ֖ם אַל־תֵּחַ֣ד כְּבֹדִ֑י כִּ֤י בְאַפָּם֙ הָ֣רְגוּ אִ֔ישׁ וּבִרְצֹנָ֖ם עִקְּרוּ־שֽׁוֹר׃
Translated:
Let not my person be included in their council,
Let not my being be counted in their assembly.
For when angry they slay a man,
And when pleased they maim an ox.
Transliteration: vesodam al-tavo nafeshiy vikehalam al-techad khevodiy khiy veafam haregu iysh uviretsonam ikeru-shvor

Hebrew: אָר֤וּר אַפָּם֙ כִּ֣י עָ֔ז וְעֶבְרָתָ֖ם כִּ֣י קָשָׁ֑תָה אֲחַלְּקֵ֣ם בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב וַאֲפִיצֵ֖ם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
Cursed be their anger so fierce,
And their wrath so relentless.
I will divide them in Jacob,
Scatter them in Israel.
Transliteration: arur afam khiy az veeveratam khiy kashatah achalekem veyaakov vaafiytsem veyisherael {f}

Hebrew: יְהוּדָ֗ה אַתָּה֙ יוֹד֣וּךָ אַחֶ֔יךָ יָדְךָ֖ בְּעֹ֣רֶף אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ יִשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּנֵ֥י אָבִֽיךָ׃
Translated:
You, O Judah, your brothers shall praise;
Your hand shall be on the nape of your foes;
Your father’s sons shall bow low to you.
Transliteration: yehudah atah yvodukha acheykha yadekha veoref oyeveykha yishetachavu lekha veney aviykha

Hebrew: גּ֤וּר אַרְיֵה֙ יְהוּדָ֔ה מִטֶּ֖רֶף בְּנִ֣י עָלִ֑יתָ כָּרַ֨ע רָבַ֧ץ כְּאַרְיֵ֛ה וּכְלָבִ֖יא מִ֥י יְקִימֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Judah is a lion’s whelp;
On prey, my son, have you grown.
He crouches, lies down like a lion,
Like a lioness —who dare rouse him?
Transliteration: gur areeih yehudah miteref veniy aliyta khara ravats kheareeih ukhelaviy miy yekiymenu

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָס֥וּר שֵׁ֙בֶט֙ מִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וּמְחֹקֵ֖ק מִבֵּ֣ין רַגְלָ֑יו עַ֚ד כִּֽי־יָבֹ֣א שִׁילֹ֔ה וְל֖וֹ יִקְּהַ֥ת עַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
The scepter shall not depart from Judah,
Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet;
So that tribute shall come to him
And the homage of peoples be his.
Transliteration: lo-yasur shevet miyhudah umechokek miveyn ragelayv ad khiy-yavo shiyloh velvo yikehat amiym

Hebrew: אֹסְרִ֤י לַגֶּ֙פֶן֙ עִירֹ֔ה וְלַשֹּׂרֵקָ֖ה בְּנִ֣י אֲתֹנ֑וֹ כִּבֵּ֤ס בַּיַּ֙יִן֙ לְבֻשׁ֔וֹ וּבְדַם־עֲנָבִ֖ים סוּתֹֽה׃
Translated:
He tethers his ass to a vine,
His ass’s foal to a choice vine;
He washes his garment in wine,
His robe in blood of grapes.
Transliteration: oseriy lagefen iyroh velashorekah veniy atonvo khives vayayiin levushvo uvedam-anaviym sutoh

Hebrew: חַכְלִילִ֥י עֵינַ֖יִם מִיָּ֑יִן וּלְבֶן־שִׁנַּ֖יִם מֵחָלָֽב׃ {פ}
Translated:
His eyes are darker than wine;
His teeth are whiter than milk.
Transliteration: chakheliyliy eynayiim miyayiin uleven-shinayiim mechalav {f}

Hebrew: זְבוּלֻ֕ן לְח֥וֹף יַמִּ֖ים יִשְׁכֹּ֑ן וְהוּא֙ לְח֣וֹף אֳנִיֹּ֔ת וְיַרְכָת֖וֹ עַל־צִידֹֽן׃ {פ}
Translated:
Zebulun shall dwell by the seashore;
He shall be a haven for ships,
And his flank shall rest on Sidon.
Transliteration: zevulun lechvof yamiym yishekhon vehu lechvof oniyot veyarekhatvo al-tsiydon {f}

Hebrew: יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר חֲמֹ֣ר גָּ֑רֶם רֹבֵ֖ץ בֵּ֥ין הַֽמִּשְׁפְּתָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Issachar is a strong-boned ass,
Crouching among the sheepfolds.
Transliteration: yishashkhar chamor garem rovets veyn hamishefetayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא מְנֻחָה֙ כִּ֣י ט֔וֹב וְאֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ כִּ֣י נָעֵ֑מָה וַיֵּ֤ט שִׁכְמוֹ֙ לִסְבֹּ֔ל וַיְהִ֖י לְמַס־עֹבֵֽד׃ {ס}
Translated:
When he saw how good was security,
And how pleasant was the country,
He bent his shoulder to the burden,
And became a toiling serf.
Transliteration: vayare menuchah khiy tvov veet-haarets khiy naemah vayet shikhemvo lisevol vayehiy lemas-oved {s}

Hebrew: דָּ֖ן יָדִ֣ין עַמּ֑וֹ כְּאַחַ֖ד שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Dan shall govern his people,
As one of the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: dan yadiyn amvo kheachad shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: יְהִי־דָן֙ נָחָ֣שׁ עֲלֵי־דֶ֔רֶךְ שְׁפִיפֹ֖ן עֲלֵי־אֹ֑רַח הַנֹּשֵׁךְ֙ עִקְּבֵי־ס֔וּס וַיִּפֹּ֥ל רֹכְב֖וֹ אָחֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Dan shall be a serpent by the road,
A viper by the path,
That bites the horse’s heels
So that his rider is thrown backward.
Transliteration: yehiy-dan nachash aley-derekhe shefiyfon aley-orach hanoshekhe ikevey-sus vayifol rokhevvo achvor

Hebrew: לִישׁוּעָֽתְךָ֖ קִוִּ֥יתִי יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: I wait for Your deliverance, O יהוה !
Transliteration: liyshuatekha kiviytiy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: גָּ֖ד גְּד֣וּד יְגוּדֶ֑נּוּ וְה֖וּא יָגֻ֥ד עָקֵֽב׃ {ס}
Translated:
Gad shall be raided by raiders,
But he shall raid at their heels.
Transliteration: gad gedud yegudenu vehu yagud akev {s}

Hebrew: מֵאָשֵׁ֖ר שְׁמֵנָ֣ה לַחְמ֑וֹ וְה֥וּא יִתֵּ֖ן מַֽעֲדַנֵּי־מֶֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
Asher’s bread shall be rich,
And he shall yield royal dainties.
Transliteration: measher shemenah lachemvo vehu yiten maadaney-melekhe {s}

Hebrew: נַפְתָּלִ֖י אַיָּלָ֣ה שְׁלֻחָ֑ה הַנֹּתֵ֖ן אִמְרֵי־שָֽׁפֶר׃ {ס}
Translated:
Naphtali is a hind let loose,
Which yields lovely fawns.
Transliteration: nafetaliy ayalah sheluchah hanoten imerey-shafer {s}

Hebrew: בֵּ֤ן פֹּרָת֙ יוֹסֵ֔ף בֵּ֥ן פֹּרָ֖ת עֲלֵי־עָ֑יִן בָּנ֕וֹת צָעֲדָ֖ה עֲלֵי־שֽׁוּר׃
Translated:
Joseph is a wild ass,
A wild ass by a spring
—Wild colts on a hillside.
Transliteration: ven forat yvosef ven forat aley-ayiin vanvot tsaadah aley-shur

Hebrew: וַֽיְמָרְרֻ֖הוּ וָרֹ֑בּוּ וַֽיִּשְׂטְמֻ֖הוּ בַּעֲלֵ֥י חִצִּֽים׃
Translated:
Archers bitterly assailed him;
They shot at him and harried him.
Transliteration: vayemareruhu varovu vayishetemuhu vaaley chitsiym

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤שֶׁב בְּאֵיתָן֙ קַשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיָּפֹ֖זּוּ זְרֹעֵ֣י יָדָ֑יו מִידֵי֙ אֲבִ֣יר יַעֲקֹ֔ב מִשָּׁ֥ם רֹעֶ֖ה אֶ֥בֶן יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Yet his bow stayed taut,
And his arms were made firm
By the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob—
There, the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel—
Transliteration: vateshev veeytan kashetvo vayafozu zeroey yadayv miydey aviyr yaakov misham roeh even yisherael

Hebrew: מֵאֵ֨ל אָבִ֜יךָ וְיַעְזְרֶ֗ךָּ וְאֵ֤ת שַׁדַּי֙ וִיבָ֣רְכֶ֔ךָּ בִּרְכֹ֤ת שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מֵעָ֔ל בִּרְכֹ֥ת תְּה֖וֹם רֹבֶ֣צֶת תָּ֑חַת בִּרְכֹ֥ת שָׁדַ֖יִם וָרָֽחַם׃
Translated:
The God of your father’s [house], who helps you,
And Shaddai who blesses you
With blessings of heaven above,
Blessings of the deep that couches below,
Blessings of the breast and womb.
Transliteration: meel aviykha veyaezerekha veet shaday viyvarekhekha virekhot shamayiim meal virekhot tehvom rovetset tachat virekhot shadayiim varacham

Hebrew: בִּרְכֹ֣ת אָבִ֗יךָ גָּֽבְרוּ֙ עַל־בִּרְכֹ֣ת הוֹרַ֔י עַֽד־תַּאֲוַ֖ת גִּבְעֹ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם תִּֽהְיֶ֙יןָ֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ יוֹסֵ֔ף וּלְקׇדְקֹ֖ד נְזִ֥יר אֶחָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated:
The blessings of your father
Surpass the blessings of my ancestors,
To the utmost bounds of the eternal hills.
May they rest on the head of Joseph,
On the brow of the elect of his brothers.
Transliteration: virekhot aviykha gaveru al-virekhot hvoray ad-taavat giveot volam tiheyeyna lerosh yvosef ulekׇdekod neziyr echayv {f}

Hebrew: בִּנְיָמִין֙ זְאֵ֣ב יִטְרָ֔ף בַּבֹּ֖קֶר יֹ֣אכַל עַ֑ד וְלָעֶ֖רֶב יְחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁלָֽל׃
Translated:
Benjamin is a ravenous wolf;
In the morning he consumes the foe,
And in the evening he divides the spoil.”
Transliteration: vineyamiyn zeev yiteraf vavoker yokhal ad velaerev yechalek shalal

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֛לֶּה שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֑ר וְ֠זֹ֠את אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֨ר לָהֶ֤ם אֲבִיהֶם֙ וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אוֹתָ֔ם אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כְּבִרְכָת֖וֹ בֵּרַ֥ךְ אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: All these were the tribes of Israel, twelve in number, and this is what their father said to them as he bade them farewell, addressing to each a parting word appropriate to him.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh shivetey yisherael sheneym ashar vezot asher-diver lahem aviyhem vayevarekhe votam iysh asher khevirekhatvo verakhe otam

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו אוֹתָ֗ם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ אֲנִי֙ נֶאֱסָ֣ף אֶל־עַמִּ֔י קִבְר֥וּ אֹתִ֖י אֶל־אֲבֹתָ֑י אֶ֨ל־הַמְּעָרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּשְׂדֵ֖ה עֶפְר֥וֹן הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
Translated: Then he instructed them, saying to them, “I am about to be gathered to my kin. Bury me with my ancestors in the cave which is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
Transliteration: vayetsav votam vayomer alehem aniy neesaf el-amiy kiveru otiy el-avotay el-hamearah asher vishedeh efervon hachitiy

Hebrew: בַּמְּעָרָ֞ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בִּשְׂדֵ֧ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־פְּנֵי־מַמְרֵ֖א בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ קָנָ֨ה אַבְרָהָ֜ם אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה מֵאֵ֛ת עֶפְרֹ֥ן הַחִתִּ֖י לַאֲחֻזַּת־קָֽבֶר׃
Translated: the cave which is in the field of Machpelah, facing Mamre, in the land of Canaan, the field that Abraham bought from Ephron the Hittite for a burial site—
Transliteration: vamearah asher vishedeh hamakhefelah asher al-feney-mamere veerets khenaan asher kanah averaham et-hashadeh meet eferon hachitiy laachuzat-kaver

Hebrew: שָׁ֣מָּה קָֽבְר֞וּ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֗ם וְאֵת֙ שָׂרָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ שָׁ֚מָּה קָבְר֣וּ אֶת־יִצְחָ֔ק וְאֵ֖ת רִבְקָ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְשָׁ֥מָּה קָבַ֖רְתִּי אֶת־לֵאָֽה׃
Translated: there Abraham and his wife Sarah were buried; there Isaac and his wife Rebekah were buried; and there I buried Leah—
Transliteration: shamah kaveru et-averaham veet sharah ishetvo shamah kaveru et-yitsechak veet rivekah ishetvo veshamah kavaretiy et-leah

Hebrew: מִקְנֵ֧ה הַשָּׂדֶ֛ה וְהַמְּעָרָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ מֵאֵ֥ת בְּנֵי־חֵֽת׃
Translated: the field and the cave in it, bought from the Hittites.”
Transliteration: mikeneh hashadeh vehamearah asher-vvo meet veney-chet

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֤ל יַעֲקֹב֙ לְצַוֺּ֣ת אֶת־בָּנָ֔יו וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף רַגְלָ֖יו אֶל־הַמִּטָּ֑ה וַיִּגְוַ֖ע וַיֵּאָ֥סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
Translated: When Jacob finished his instructions to his sons, he drew his feet into the bed and, breathing his last, he was gathered to his kin.
Transliteration: vayekhal yaakov letsavot et-vanayv vayeesof ragelayv el-hamitah vayigeva vayeasef el-amayv

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל יוֹסֵ֖ף עַל־פְּנֵ֣י אָבִ֑יו וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ עָלָ֖יו וַיִּשַּׁק־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Joseph flung himself upon his father’s face and wept over him and kissed him.
Transliteration: vayifol yvosef al-feney aviyv vayevekhe alayv vayishak-lvo

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ו יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶת־עֲבָדָיו֙ אֶת־הָרֹ֣פְאִ֔ים לַחֲנֹ֖ט אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וַיַּחַנְט֥וּ הָרֹפְאִ֖ים אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then Joseph ordered the physicians in his service to embalm his father, and the physicians embalmed Israel.
Transliteration: vayetsav yvosef et-avadayv et-harofeiym lachanot et-aviyv vayachanetu harofeiym et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלְאוּ־לוֹ֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם כִּ֛י כֵּ֥ן יִמְלְא֖וּ יְמֵ֣י הַחֲנֻטִ֑ים וַיִּבְכּ֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ מִצְרַ֖יִם שִׁבְעִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃
Translated: It required forty days, for such is the full period of embalming. The Egyptians bewailed him seventy days;
Transliteration: vayimeleu-lvo arevaiym yvom khiy khen yimeleu yemey hachanutiym vayivekhu otvo mitserayiim shiveiym yvom

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעַבְרוּ֙ יְמֵ֣י בְכִית֔וֹ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יוֹסֵ֔ף אֶל־בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־נָ֨א מָצָ֤אתִי חֵן֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם דַּבְּרוּ־נָ֕א בְּאׇזְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: and when the wailing period was over, Joseph spoke to Pharaoh’s court, saying, “Do me this favor, and lay this appeal before Pharaoh:
