Transliteration: vayaaveru yemey vekhiytvo vayedaver yvosef el-veyt fareoh lemor im-na matsatiy chen veeyneykhem daveru-na veׇzeney fareoh lemor

Hebrew: אָבִ֞י הִשְׁבִּיעַ֣נִי לֵאמֹ֗ר הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִי֮ מֵת֒ בְּקִבְרִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר כָּרִ֤יתִי לִי֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן שָׁ֖מָּה תִּקְבְּרֵ֑נִי וְעַתָּ֗ה אֶֽעֱלֶה־נָּ֛א וְאֶקְבְּרָ֥ה אֶת־אָבִ֖י וְאָשֽׁוּבָה׃
Translated: ‘My father made me swear, saying, “I am about to die. Be sure to bury me in the grave which I made ready for myself in the land of Canaan.” Now, therefore, let me go up and bury my father; then I shall return.’”
Transliteration: aviy hisheviyaniy lemor hineh anokhiy met vekiveriy asher khariytiy liy veerets khenaan shamah tikevereniy veatah eeleh-na veekeverah et-aviy veashuvah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֑ה עֲלֵ֛ה וּקְבֹ֥ר אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁבִּיעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And Pharaoh said, “Go up and bury your father, as he made you promise on oath.”
Transliteration: vayomer fareoh aleh ukevor et-aviykha khaasher hisheviyekha

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַל יוֹסֵ֖ף לִקְבֹּ֣ר אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וַיַּֽעֲל֨וּ אִתּ֜וֹ כׇּל־עַבְדֵ֤י פַרְעֹה֙ זִקְנֵ֣י בֵית֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל זִקְנֵ֥י אֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: So Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the officials of Pharaoh, the senior members of his court, and all of Egypt’s dignitaries,
Transliteration: vayaal yvosef likevor et-aviyv vayaalu itvo khׇl-avedey fareoh zikeney veytvo vekhol zikeney erets-mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֔ף וְאֶחָ֖יו וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יו רַ֗ק טַפָּם֙ וְצֹאנָ֣ם וּבְקָרָ֔ם עָזְב֖וּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
Translated: together with all of Joseph’s household, his brothers, and his father’s household; only their children, their flocks, and their herds were left in the region of Goshen.
Transliteration: vekhol veyt yvosef veechayv uveyt aviyv rak tafam vetsonam uvekaram azevu veerets goshen

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל עִמּ֔וֹ גַּם־רֶ֖כֶב גַּם־פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וַיְהִ֥י הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה כָּבֵ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Chariots, too, and horsemen went up with him; it was a very large troop.
Transliteration: vayaal imvo gam-rekhev gam-farashiym vayehiy hamachaneh khaved meod

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ עַד־גֹּ֣רֶן הָאָטָ֗ד אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיִּ֨סְפְּדוּ־שָׁ֔ם מִסְפֵּ֛ד גָּד֥וֹל וְכָבֵ֖ד מְאֹ֑ד וַיַּ֧עַשׂ לְאָבִ֛יו אֵ֖בֶל שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: When they came to Goren ha-Atad, which is beyond the Jordan, they held there a very great and solemn lamentation; and he observed a mourning period of seven days for his father.
Transliteration: vayavou ad-goren haatad asher veever hayareden vayisefedu-sham misefed gadvol vekhaved meod vayaash leaviyv evel shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֡רְא יוֹשֵׁב֩ הָאָ֨רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֜י אֶת־הָאֵ֗בֶל בְּגֹ֙רֶן֙ הָֽאָטָ֔ד וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵֽבֶל־כָּבֵ֥ד זֶ֖ה לְמִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־כֵּ֞ן קָרָ֤א שְׁמָהּ֙ אָבֵ֣ל מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: And when the Canaanite inhabitants of the land saw the mourning at Goren ha-Atad, they said, “This is a solemn mourning on the part of the Egyptians.” That is why it was named Abel-mizraim, which is beyond the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayare yvoshev haarets hakhenaaniy et-haevel vegoren haatad vayomeru evel-khaved zeh lemitserayiim al-khen kara shemah avel mitserayiim asher veever hayareden

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ בָנָ֖יו ל֑וֹ כֵּ֖ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽם׃
Translated: Thus his sons did for him as he had instructed them.
Transliteration: vayaashu vanayv lvo khen khaasher tsivam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ בָנָיו֙ אַ֣רְצָה כְּנַ֔עַן וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ בִּמְעָרַ֖ת שְׂדֵ֣ה הַמַּכְפֵּלָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָנָה֩ אַבְרָהָ֨ם אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה לַאֲחֻזַּת־קֶ֗בֶר מֵאֵ֛ת עֶפְרֹ֥ן הַחִתִּ֖י עַל־פְּנֵ֥י מַמְרֵֽא׃
Translated: His sons carried him to the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, the field near Mamre, which Abraham had bought for a burial site from Ephron the Hittite.
Transliteration: vayisheu otvo vanayv aretsah khenaan vayikeveru otvo vimearat shedeh hamakhefelah asher kanah averaham et-hashadeh laachuzat-kever meet eferon hachitiy al-feney mamere

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨שׇׁב יוֹסֵ֤ף מִצְרַ֙יְמָה֙ ה֣וּא וְאֶחָ֔יו וְכׇל־הָעֹלִ֥ים אִתּ֖וֹ לִקְבֹּ֣ר אֶת־אָבִ֑יו אַחֲרֵ֖י קׇבְר֥וֹ אֶת־אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: After burying his father, Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brothers and all who had gone up with him to bury his father.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yvosef mitserayemah hu veechayv vekhׇl-haoliym itvo likevor et-aviyv acharey kׇvervo et-aviyv

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֤וּ אֲחֵֽי־יוֹסֵף֙ כִּי־מֵ֣ת אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ ל֥וּ יִשְׂטְמֵ֖נוּ יוֹסֵ֑ף וְהָשֵׁ֤ב יָשִׁיב֙ לָ֔נוּ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּמַ֖לְנוּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father was dead, they said, “What if Joseph still bears a grudge against us and pays us back for all the wrong that we did him!”
Transliteration: vayireu achey-yvosef khiy-met aviyhem vayomeru lu yishetemenu yvosef vehashev yashiyv lanu et khׇl-haraah asher gamalenu otvo

Hebrew: וַיְצַוּ֕וּ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר אָבִ֣יךָ צִוָּ֔ה לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹת֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: So they sent this message to Joseph, “Before his death your father left this instruction:
Transliteration: vayetsauu el-yvosef lemor aviykha tsivah lifeney mvotvo lemor

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־תֹאמְר֣וּ לְיוֹסֵ֗ף אָ֣נָּ֡א שָׂ֣א נָ֠א פֶּ֣שַׁע אַחֶ֤יךָ וְחַטָּאתָם֙ כִּי־רָעָ֣ה גְמָל֔וּךָ וְעַתָּה֙ שָׂ֣א נָ֔א לְפֶ֥שַׁע עַבְדֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ יוֹסֵ֖ף בְּדַבְּרָ֥ם אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: So shall you say to Joseph, ‘Forgive, I urge you, the offense and guilt of your brothers who treated you so harshly.’ Therefore, please forgive the offense of the servants of the God of your father’s [house].” And Joseph was in tears as they spoke to him.
Transliteration: khoh-tomeru leyvosef ana sha na fesha acheykha vechatatam khiy-raah gemalukha veatah sha na lefesha avedey elohey aviykha vayevekhe yvosef vedaveram elayv

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ֙ גַּם־אֶחָ֔יו וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ לְפָנָ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ הִנֶּ֥נּֽוּ לְךָ֖ לַעֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: His brothers went to him themselves, flung themselves before him, and said, “We are prepared to be your slaves.”
Transliteration: vayelekhu gam-echayv vayifelu lefanayv vayomeru hinenu lekha laavadiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֛ם יוֹסֵ֖ף אַל־תִּירָ֑אוּ כִּ֛י הֲתַ֥חַת אֱלֹהִ֖ים אָֽנִי׃
Translated: But Joseph said to them, “Have no fear! Am I a substitute for God?
Transliteration: vayomer alehem yvosef al-tiyrau khiy hatachat Elohim aniy

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֕ם חֲשַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָלַ֖י רָעָ֑ה אֱלֹהִים֙ חֲשָׁבָ֣הּ לְטֹבָ֔ה לְמַ֗עַן עֲשֹׂ֛ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לְהַחֲיֹ֥ת עַם־רָֽב׃
Translated: Besides, although you intended me harm, God intended it for good, so as to bring about the present result—the survival of many people.
Transliteration: veatem chashavetem alay raah Elohim chashavah letovah lemaan ashoh khayyvom hazeh lehachayot am-rav

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ אַל־תִּירָ֔אוּ אָנֹכִ֛י אֲכַלְכֵּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֖ם וְאֶֽת־טַפְּכֶ֑ם וַיְנַחֵ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר עַל־לִבָּֽם׃
Translated: And so, fear not. I will sustain you and your dependents.” Thus he reassured them, speaking kindly to them.
Transliteration: veatah al-tiyrau anokhiy akhalekhel etekhem veet-tafekhem vayenachem votam vayedaver al-livam

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב יוֹסֵף֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם ה֖וּא וּבֵ֣ית אָבִ֑יו וַיְחִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: So Joseph and his father’s household remained in Egypt. Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.
Transliteration: vayeshev yvosef vemitserayiim hu uveyt aviyv vayechiy yvosef meah vaesher shaniym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא יוֹסֵף֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם בְּנֵ֖י שִׁלֵּשִׁ֑ים גַּ֗ם בְּנֵ֤י מָכִיר֙ בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה יֻלְּד֖וּ עַל־בִּרְכֵּ֥י יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: Joseph lived to see children of the third generation of Ephraim; the children of Machir son of Manasseh were likewise born upon Joseph’s knees.
Transliteration: vayare yvosef leeferayiim veney shileshiym gam veney makhiyr ven-menasheh yuledu al-virekhey yvosef

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־אֶחָ֔יו אָנֹכִ֖י מֵ֑ת וֵֽאלֹהִ֞ים פָּקֹ֧ד יִפְקֹ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֗ם וְהֶעֱלָ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ מִן־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֛ע לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: At length, Joseph said to his brothers, “I am about to die. God will surely take notice of you and bring you up from this land to the land promised on oath to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.”
Transliteration: vayomer yvosef el-echayv anokhiy met velohiym fakod yifekod etekhem veheelah etekhem min-haarets hazot el-haarets asher nisheva leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁבַּ֣ע יוֹסֵ֔ף אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִתֶ֥ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֖י מִזֶּֽה׃
Translated: So Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, saying, “When God has taken notice of you, you shall carry up my bones from here.”
Transliteration: vayasheva yvosef et-veney yisherael lemor fakod yifekod Elohim etekhem vehaalitem et-atsemotay mizeh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת יוֹסֵ֔ף בֶּן־מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִ֑ים וַיַּחַנְט֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וַיִּ֥ישֶׂם בָּאָר֖וֹן בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Joseph died at the age of one hundred and ten years; and he was embalmed and placed in a coffin in Egypt.
Transliteration: vayamׇt yvosef ven-meah vaesher shaniym vayachanetu otvo vayiyshem vaarvon vemitserayiim
